Title: Security revoked - Remote Signon
Description: CP0020 When Corporate is signing on to a location and they exceeded their attempts they will get the message "SECURITY REVOKED":
Solution:
"1. Have the remote location assign a new temporary password
2. Have Corporate sign back on."

Title: Maxpeed Terminal Locked
Description:
CP0030 "Maxpeed Terminal Locked.
Caps Lock and Num Lock keys are not responding."
Solution:
"Unplug the power cord from the maxpeed base.  Unplug the keyboard from the maxpeed base.
Plug the keyboard cable back into the maxpeed base.  Plug the power cord back into the maxpeed base.
(901 short code)"

Title: Apply Credit Balance lines
Description: CP0101 Have a credit balance line on an A/R account.  How do I apply it.
Solution:
"- From the Mastercheck or Cash/Check Receipt screen, press enter.  The cursor goes to the line # field.
- Type in the line number with the credit balance and press F2(pay by line).  This will bring the line to a zero balance and the amount will move to the App ".  Now find the line you want to pay with this amount and enter in the line number and pay amount.

Title: Layaway Account - Final Payment
Description: CP0103 Cust has a layaway account and has come in to make his final payment.  How do I bill the merchandise and clear the a/r account?
Solution:
"This process takes 3 steps
Step 1
- From the A/R Menu, choose the A/R Payment option.
- Issue a cash/check receipt on the A/R account for the amount of the credit balance.  On the cash receipt screen enter a negative cash amount and a negative payment amount.  Press enter.  Will get message "Correction has been processed".
- Press F7 save/print

Step 2
- Pull up the account again on the A/R payment screen and press enter. The unapplied money will go to APP. Find the line we created on the last  transaction. will show inv 000000.  Enter the line# and F2 pay by line. Will clear the App Amt & the line to 0
- Press F7 save/print

Step 3
- Go to Point of Sale and issue a cash sale invoice.  Bill the customer for the merchandise.  On document total the amount that was in layaway should be entered into the cash field.  The remainder the customer owes should go into the appropriate field (cash or check)."

Title: CAS Warranty check
Description: CP0104 Company Owned Outlet received a check from CAS warranty.  How do they apply the check.
Solution:
"This happens when a company owned outlet performs warranty service work that was originally performed at an independent dealer.

Issue an A/R cash/check receipt for the amount of the check to account #59.  Goodyear will clear at end of month.  There will be no lines to apply this check to."

Title: CAS Warranty - write off
Description: CP0105 Company Owned Outlet has an old invoice showing as an open item on Account 59, what can they do to clear the document.
Solution:
"The location needs to contact CAS and verify the original document with them.
If CAS can not locate the information then the store can write off the amount of the document by issuing an A/R Journal Ticket.

- From the A/R Menu choose A/R Options.
- Type in Emp#, option for journal ticket, and acct# 59.  Press enter.
- Choose Normal A/R Journal Ticket.
- Type in the reason for issuance.
- Type a credit $$ amount.  (Code = 100)
  Press enter.
- Type in code 463 and enter a debit $$ amount for the offset.
- Press F7 to print.

The Journal Ticket balance will be zero and the AR Account balance will be reduced by the amount of the credit."

Title: COO - Transfer Payment
Description: CP0106 Customer making a payment and the account is at another company owned location.
Solution:
"- From the GBMS Main Menu
- Choose Option 2 Cash Receipt
- Choose the option for Transfer Payment.
- The location must enter in a Tradestyle or name, address, city, state and zip, account #, Class Of Business, Terr# where the account is located, the am"

Title: A/R account deletion - Dealer
Description: CP0107 Dealer wants to delete an A/R account.
Solution:
- From the A/R Main Menu choose A/R Options.
- From the A/R Options Menu enter your employee number and choose Administrative Option.
- From the Administrative Menu choose Account Deletion.
- Type in the account # you wish to delete.  The message ""Are you sure you want to delete account".  Answer appropriately and will have you void again.
If the account has had any movement on it within the last 60 days, will NOT be able to delete the account till after that 60 days.
If the location is insistant on it not being an AR account, then they can go to AR OPT to ADM  and change the account from AR to cash as long as the account is at a 0 balance.

Title: 1 check pays 2 accounts
Description: CP0111 Have a check that pays on two accounts.  What is the procedure.
Solution:
"From A/R payments issue a cash/check receipt to the first account.
- Type in the check # in the ""check no"" field.
-  Enter only the amount to be applied to this account in the Check amt & "payment amt"" fields and press enter.
- Apply the money to the correct line.
- Print the cash receipt.  F7

From the A/R Payments screen issue a cash/check receipt to the second account.
- Enter in the same check number and the amount to be applied to this account in the check amount and ""payment amt"" fields.  Press enter.
- Apply the money to the correct line.
- Print the cash receipt." F7

The two check amounts should = the one check amount that was received.

Title: Direct Deposit Payment
Description: CP0112 Received a direct deposit payment to the bank from the credit card company and need to apply it to the A/R account.
Solution:
"From the A/R Payment Menu choose Direct Deposit.
- Enter in the account number
- Enter the credit card type
- Enter in the NET amount of the check in the ""Direct Amt"" field and press enter.
- Apply the money to the appropriate lines.
- There is a collection fee on the statement they receive.  After applying the check 1 line should still have a balance of the amount of the collection fee.
- Enter in the line number,  the collection fee in the ""adj amt"" field and an  "A"  in the ""Code"" field and press enter. The ""A""  $ amount will go to account code 34400.
- Print the receipt."

Title: ROC Issue Check
Description: CP0113 Customer would like a refund for an overpayment
Solution:
"ROC Issue Check
If the a/r account has a credit balance:
- From the A/R Menu choose A/R Options.
- From A/R Options choose A/R Journal Ticket.
- From the A/R Journal Ticket Menu choose ""ROC Issue Check"".
- Enter in the Account number and press enter.
- Press F7 to print.

If the A/R account does not have a credit balance and just need to credit back a portion of the unapplied:
- From the A/R Menu choose A/R Options.
- From A/R Options choose A/R Journal Ticket.
- From the A/R Journal Ticket Menu choose ""Normal A/R JT"".
- Enter in the Account number, reason for issuance and the amount to be debited(positive amt) to the account.  Press enter.
- Enter code 205 (ROC Issue Check) and credit the amount.  Press enter.
- Should have a debit and credit side
- Press F7 to print.

Title: Payoff A/R Acct with Credit Card-ASC
Description: CP0114 Company Owned location customer wants to payoff their A/R account with a credit card.
Solution: Company Owned locations are not allowed to payoff A/R accounts with a credit card per Retail Stores.

Title: Payoff A/R Acct with Credit Card-Dealer
Description: CP0115 Dealer has a customer that wants to payoff their A/R Account with a credit card.
Solution:
"We have pursued this with all Major Credit Card Companies (Mastercard, VISA, Discover, Diners Club, American Express, Goodyear and Carte Blanche) and they prohibit transferring debit balances to their Bank Card.  We are not to give Dealers instructions for these major cards.
However, if the Dealer has a local credit card company and they give them the approval to transfer a balance from their books to the Credit Card Company, they can use these steps:
Step 1
- Issue a credit invoice to the A/R Acct for the amount of the payment.
- Use code 017 (gasoline) with a description of ""Credit Card Payment"".
- in the reason field, reference your credit card charge invoice#.

Step 2
- Issue an invoice to the credit card account for the payment amount.
- Use code 017 with a description of ""Credit Card Payment"".
- Be sure to write the credit memo document number on the invoice."

Title: DMS - Missing Transfer Sale Option
Description: CP0143  Missing the TRANSFER option on POS menu.
Solution:
"Dealers must go into their A/R Profile and set the ""Intracompany Transfer"" field to a ""Y"" and the A/R Control Location should be their Corporate Terr#.  Some other parameters that need to be set on the A/R Profile screen are:
    Credit Line Mandatory
    Credit Auth Required
    Stop Sale if over Limit
    Stop Sale if Past Due"

Title: Sonsio-Dealer
Description: CP0166 Dlr using Sonsio or an other private company for their road hazard adjustment and needs to bill the customer for the services, tax and any percent of wear and the Road hazard Company for the adjusted tire.
Solution:
"1. Set up the Road Hazard Company as an A/R Account.
2. Bill the Replacement Tire for the full value to the Road Hazard Company on the A/R account.
3.  Enter the customer name in the ""SHIP-TO INFO"" (F3 from the alternate  set of function keys off POS Customer Work Order) section of the  invoice.
4.  Include any services (Balancing, Valves, Tire Fees, etc) on the invoice and allow sales tax to generate.  The customer is obligated to pay any adjusted replacement price, services and taxes.
5.  Depending on the customers method of payment:
     - If cash/check enter the amount as a down payment on the invoice which  leaves the remainder of the adjustable tire price to the Road Hazard Company.
     - If credit card or A/R Account the location will have to enter a credit on the invoice using a code such as 046504 for this amount which leaves the remainder of the adjustable tire price to the Road Hazard Company.  The location must then issue an invoice using the 046504 to the appropriate option (credit card or a/r charge)."

Title: Receipt a Will Call Tire Shipment
Description: CP0186 Need to receipt tires from a Goodyear Will Call shipment.
Solution: Use option 1 from the Receipt of Mdse menu "Manual for Goodyear and Payable Vendors".  Use Vendor #1 for Goodyear Tire Shipments.

Title: Shock & Strut Warranty (Monroe, Trust, Goodyear)
Description: CP0192 Shock/Strut Warranty Procedures for Monroe, Trust and/or Goodyear
Solution:
"Shocks & Struts are not covered under CAS Warranty.

Refer the Company Owned Location to the ""Monroe Shocks & Strut"" Black Book labeled ""The Best Ride Together"" page 13 under the Procedures & Forms tab.  There are 3 different procedures depending on the brand (Monroe, Trust, Goodyear)."

Title: RETREAD CODES MUST ENTER C/O FIELD
Description: CP0235 RETREAD CODES ARE PROMPTING FOR A "C" OR "N" FOR THE C/O FIELD.
Solution:
"ON MDSE VERIFY THE SYSTEM WILL PROMPT FOR A ""C"" OR ""N"" WHEN SELLING A 9 DIGIT RETREAD CODE.
C = CUSTOMER OWNED
N = NON - CUSTOMER OWNED."

Title: SAME DAY INSTALLATION OF TRIAD CD
Description: CP0237 LOCATION NEEDS TO LOAD TRIAD CD NOW.
Solution:
"1. Have location return all terminals / sessions to ""login"" or GBMS except
Terminal 1 Session 1.
2. From T1S1 on Main Menu type in the SCID,  ""TINCD"" , Press enter.
3. The CHANGE TRIAD CD Screen will appear.
NOTE:  IF any sessions are active, they will be displayed on the screen, advise location to return them to GBMS.
4. From the CHANGE TRIAD CD screen,
advise the location when changing any CD you MUST be on this screen. Take out the OLD TRIAD CD, install the NEW TRIAD CD.
5. Press F1 to install the NEW TRIAD CD.  The message Reading CD should display on the screen and they change to Updating CD please wait.
6. Upon completion of the Triad CD. all terminals and sessions will return to ""login""."

Title: Change Printer Assignment
Description: CP0243 Changing printer assignment from POS, DR, etc.
Solution: Hold down the SHIFT KEY & F10 key. This will display the instructions on the screen.  To change the printer number keep pressing the F10 key until the printer number you want is showing inside the instruction box. After you have the correct number displayed in the box, press enter.  This terminal is now assigned to another printer.

Title: Write off A/R Acct
Description: CP0260 Dealer wants to write off an A/R Account.
Solution:
"Process an A/R (Accounts Receivable)
Journal Ticket.
1) From Main Menu select Accounts Receivable (Option 10) or type in SCID- AROPT.
2) From A/R menu select A/R Options (Option 2)
3) From A/R Options, key your emp #, tab, key in 7 (Journal Tickets), tab, key in the account number and press enter.
4) The account number 10100 will generate in the code field (this is accounting code for accounts receivable). Key in the reason for issuing the journal ticket, press tab.
5) Enter a credit amount for the balance on this account. (ex: -100.00) press enter.
6) Key in the acct # 53800 (if NO Bad Debt Reserve Setup) OR acct # 10400 (if Bad Debt Reserve IS Setup) tab to the amount and make the debit entry for the same amount.
7) Press F7 to print the journal ticket.
8) Location will have to go into A/R Cash Receipts and select the account and apply the unapplied to complete the process."

Title: Canada Zip Code Invalid
Description:
CP0263 "Canada customer - Zip code is invalid, format is 5-9 numeric digits.
The format is ANANAN for Canada's zip codes and that is what is being entered."
Solution: The incorrect state code is being entered on the document.  For Canada the correct state code in GBMS is CD.

Title: Display Audit Trail
Description: CP0269 How do I display the audit trail on my screen?
Solution:
"From the Main Menu type in scid DAT and press enter. The daily audit trail will display on the screen.
OR
From Main Menu type in the option for End of Day, press enter.
Choose the option to Display Audit Trail and press enter. The Audit Trail displays.

F-6 = Display Pending
F-7 = Change DBS Seq (allows you to
         view previous days Audit Trail)."

Title: Clear small credit bal on A/R Acct
Description: CP0272 Dealer wants to clear a small credit balance on an A/R Account.
Solution:
"Process an A/R (Accounts Receivable) Journal Ticket.
1) From Main Menu select Accounts Receivable (Option 10) or type in scid - AROPT.
2) From A/R menu select A/R Options (Option 2)
3) From A/R Options, key your emp #, tab, key in 7 (Journal Tickets), tab, key in the account number and press enter.
4) The account number 10100 will generate in the code field (this is the accounting code for accounts receivable). Key in the reason for issuing the journal ticket, press tab.
5) Enter a debit amount for the balance on this account. (ex: .05) press enter.
6) Key in the acct # 44800 (Other Misc Income), tab to the amount and make the credit entry for the same amount.
7) Press F7 to print the journal ticket.
8) Location will have to go into A/R Cash Receipts and select the account and apply the unapplied to complete the process."

Title: Clear Late Charges on an A/R Account
Description: CP0273 Dealer wants to clear a Late Charge on an A/R account.
Solution:
"Process an Accounts Receivable Cash Receipt.
1) From Main Menu select Accounts Receivable (Option 10) or type in scid - ARPAY.
2) From the A/R Menu, select A/R Payments (Option 1), press enter.
3) Type in your emp #, tab, type in option 2 (cash/check receipt), tab to Last Name, type in the last name or type in the Account # and press enter.
4) The cursor  is in the check # field, press enter.
5) The cursor drops to the line # at the bottom of the screen, type in the line # of the line you want to deduct the late charges from, tab to the Adjustment Amount, type in the amount of the late charge, tab to the Code and type in W and press enter.
6) Press the F7 key (Save/Print).
That line is reduced by the late charge amount."

Title: Send a Check to A/R Customer
Description: CP0284 Dealer wants to send an A/R customer a check for the credit balance on his account?
Solution:
"The location has 2 choices.
1) Process a Quick Check to the A/R customer. From Main Menu select the option for Vendor Payables.
2) Select the option for Quick Check.
3) Use the accounting code of 50800 (Misc Sales & Office) for the amount of the credit balance on the A/R Account.
4) Print the Quick Check.
5) Process an A/R Journal Ticket to the A/R account.  Debit code 10100 (Accts Rec) and Credit code 50800 (Misc Sales & Office) for the account balance on the account.
6) To complete the process, advise to go into A/R Payments and bring up the A/R account and press enter, apply the unapplied money and print the cash receipt.

                      OR
1) The location may hand write a 'manual check' to the customer. DO NOT ENTER  THIS MANUAL CHECK INTO THE GBMS SYSTEM.
2) Process an A/R Journal Ticket to the account. Debit account code 10100 (Accounts Receivable) and Credit account code 10000 (Cash).
3) To complete the process, advise to go back into the account and apply the unapplied money and print the cash receipt."

Title: Sales Tax Report
Description: CP0300 Dealer requesting help with or needs copy of Month End Sales Tax Report.
Solution:
1)  Needs help finding/printing Sales Tax Sumary from GBMS.

2)  Fax G-1093 Report to store.

Title: Dealer cannot transfer a payment
Description: CP1003 Dealer doesn't have the option on the CR screen to transfer a payment to another one of their locations.(search: ar transfer, AR transfer payment ,  AR TRANSFER PAYMENT)
Solution:
"TO ACTIVATE THE OPTION FOR CASH RCPT TO DISPLAY ""TRANSFER"":
1) SELECT ADMINISTRATION(5) OPTION FROM MAIN MENU
2) SELECT A/R PROF OPTION(10)
3) TAB TO THE INTRACOMPANY TRANSFER FIELD & TYPE ""Y"", THEN PRESS ENTER.
4) BACK OUT OF CASH RECEIPTS AND RETURN TO ""GBMS""
5) SELECT CASH RECEIPT (9) FROM MAIN MENU
6) TRANSFER PAY OPTION APPEARS AS OPT#2"

Title: Access to Goodyear Casing Exchange Internet Site
Description: CP1012 How can I access the Goodyear Casing Exchange Internet Site?
Solution:
"Info -> Links -> Goodyear Casing Exchange Internet Site.
   Userid = Nonsig# for Retrd Plant
   Password = Casings
Mike Gilchrist is in charge of this site.  Contact Mike at 796-6543 or GTN 446-6543."

Title: ACCOUNTING CODES
Description: CP1018 Needs to know what codes to use for issuing correcting Journal Tickets, paid outs, Quick Checks, etc. for booking/correcting  the General Ledger.
Solution: Determine what the dealer is attempting to correct and suggest appropriate accounting codes and offsets to use for  booking/changing General Ledger account balances.

Title: Transferred to/from Suspense
Description:
CP1027  Dealer was "TRANSFER TO SUSPENSE" but now has been "REMOVED FROM SUSPENSE" and needs access to TireHQ.

(for a username and password for Tire-HQ - none ever issued - use CP1080)
(for user names that were deleted - use CP911)
Solution: If dealer has been "REMOVED FROM SUSPENSE" & their nonsig shows as ACTIVE status in WAD and "Y" in Customer Database ---->   Check to see if the NonSig is in Tire-HQ Users.  If the NonSig is not there, then the dealer will need to re -enroll.

Title: Account 15400-Inventory Adjs.
Description: CP1032 What gets booked to this G/L account?
Solution: Physical inventory adjustments get booked to this account at the end of the month in which it is finalized (Akron Jt 9010 - cycle A and Jt 9011 - cycle B.)  The following month, these differences are automatically moved to cost-of-sales accounts 42700 (9011) and 42800 (9010) to book against the P or L.  Any balance that stays in this account for more than 60 days will be something the dealer manually entered and will stay there until he manually moves it.

Title: Selling Company VEHICLE/ASSETS
Description: CP1035 How to account for selling a vehicle or company asset?
Solution: Issue Std Jt crediting Asset account 15600 for the ORIGINAL value of the asset.  Debit 15800, Depreciation for the cumulative amount depreciated since the asset was purchased.  The difference is called the Book Value of the asset.  If it is sold above the Book Value, complete the jt by debiting cash account 10000  for the amount paid and credit 44800, Other Misc Income for the excess profit above Book Value.  If sold below Book Value, Debit 44800 as a LOSS.

Title: Bartering for Service Performed
Description: CP1042 A/R customer performed service for dealer and wants to trade cost of his service for balance owed on his store A/R account.
Solution:
"1)  Issue A/R JT to the customer's accont, credit 10100 and debit the appropriate expense code for service performed.

2)  In the case of a payable vendor, issue the A/R jt but debit a misc. asset code (17100 or 17200, etc.)  Then process a negative payable input register for the vendor against the missc. asset cde to wash out."

Title: ACCTG FLOW Workshop
Description: CP1064 Wants to attend Akron Acctg Class
Solution: Faxed copy of Acctg Flow Seminar registration to store to complete and return to GBMS for scheduling in future class.

Title: DLR - How to Process Payable Check
Description: CP1069 DLR - What is the process for processing payable checks?
Solution:
"Select Payables Check (option 8) on the Vendor Payable menu,
Select Invoices for Payment (option 1) on the Payables Check menu, enter the due date and tab down to the VENDOR entry field and enter the vendor(s) to be paid.
Follow the prompt and press F4 to Begin Selection, waiting until all invoices have been selected for all chosen vendors.  Press F6 and enter (T) to print a pre-check register.
Review to be sure all invoices and dollar amounts are correct for each vendor. The systerm assumes checks are computer unless indicated manually.
Change Check Type and Modify Payament for ALL selected vendors before pressing the F5, Print check.
Computer checks will print and request a Final register print out.  In the case of manual checks, system will only print a check register."

Title: Government billing corrections
Description: CP1072 Government Billing:  How do I reverse a government invoice, Billing Code G with GS number that charged Federal Excise Tax? (Probably answered "No" to 'exemption certificate on file?' question at document total).
Solution:
"Process a credit invoice as follows:
1. Bill out invoice with exactly the same information as before on tire line but as a credit with credit quantity TAB TO EXCISE TAX FIELD AND TYPE THE AMOUNT OF FET FOR EACH TIRE, press Enter.
2. Go to document total screen, type minus quantity on payment line, reference document number, reference date, press F5 print."

Title: Need Username and Password for Xplor
Description:
CP1080 Need a username and password for Tire-HQ (none ever issued)
(for user names that were deleted - use CP911)
(for associate enrollment - use CP1027)
(for remove from suspense - use CP1027)

Modified 02/11/2009 - MEP
Solution:
"Advise the location that the User Administrator sets up Usernames & maintains passwords at their location.  If they are not enrolled, have them enroll in Tire-HQ.

Ask them if they are the User Administrator ?

No- Have them get with the User Administrator to assist/add user.  If they do not know who the Administrator is ... access User Reg (see steps below) & advise them. (If more than one User Admin, give them the UA that shares the same Head Office as them) If this is a Car Dealership, there is no User Admin, just one username.  (Channel 09)

Yes - Access User Reg to confirm UA & email address is correct/listed. If no email address avail, or  If they have an new email address to give you, ... for security purposes, call the location back using the phone number listed in WAD.  Once verified, update User Reg with this correct email address, then have user attempt Reset password again.  If no UA exists, get First, Last name, and email address, then transfer to Level 2 HD.
All  Retail Store Tire-HQ UA's are GSRxxxx (xxxx = Terr #). If a store manager wants to set themself up they must sign on Tire-HQ with their gsr # and go to register new user

How to locate User Admin:
1. Locate Common Ownership in WAD
2. Go to User Registration database (Lotus Notes), select View by Dealers by Common Owner/Customer
3. Type in Common Ownership (this example 0311), then ""enter"" (if no common owner, type in their nonsig # using 9 numbers .. ex. 000900559)
4. Advise caller to contact that person to have them modify/provide access to Tire-HQ.
If the User Administrator is not listed, that means that their record was deleted due to inactivity (12 months), and a new record will need to be setup by Level 2 support."

Title: AVG COST/STD COST
Description: CP1095 Standard Cost on tires received at sub location.
Solution:
"1) Average cost was not established in the Akron Stock Ledger at time tires were xferred,
2) Cost defaults to Std Cost...25% below B-300, and books in at that level at the sub location,
3) the original recieving point gains the entire profit between Std and the revised Avg cost at month end via 9009 avg cost Jt.  Part or all of it belongs to the sub location.

In order for the sub location to resolve this is to
1) process Book and Screen inventory correction removing the tires at the Std cost, re-entering them at the correct Avg cost, and
2) issuing a Std jt crediting cost of sales (40900, 41000, 41100, etc.) of the sub location, charging (debiting) the cost of salesof the shipping location"

Title: POSTCARDS - Veh Inspection
Description: CP1119 How to generate postcards for vehicle inspection
Solution:
"1.  Setup a postcard message that reads something  to this effect:  Your last vehicle inspection performed (the date will show on the postcard) shows on this card and your next inspection will be due soon.  They can add any additional information they want but should make them aware that the card does show the date of the last inspection and another is due next month.  The interval months should be 11 and the print times can be whatever they want it to be, recommend 2 .

2.  Setup the vehicle inspection code used on your invoices in
prod/service associated with message option in customer service follow up option.

3.  Go into option 5 print monthly postcards and use f6 to create postcards during maintenance.

4.  The next date after creating at night you can not print the postcards."

Title: NSF Fee payment prior to Bad Debt account establis
Description: CP1123 How to take payment for an NSF check if the account for the bad debt has not been setup by Credit Center as yet?
Solution:
Have the location use the "Layaway" option on Cash Receipt option to setup an account and post the payment.
Then when the Bad Debt account is established, they may perform a minus (-) A/R cash receipt to the Layaway account, to remove the cash, and in turn make another A/R cash receipt to the Bad Debt account.
Often, they are required to pay an NSF fee in the amount of $10. Split the payment amount that is due the Bad debt account from the $10 fee, which is posted via the NSF Fee option on Cash Receipt option.

Title: M/E Dealer Sales Tax Report G1093
Description: CP1127 Where do I find my Month End Sales Tax report?
Solution: It is under ADM to PRINT AKRON REPORTS to SECURITY REPORTS.  Look for G1093

Title: Training.goodyear.com
Description: CP1130  Trying to access training.goodyear.com, and it is asking for a username and password.
Solution:
"the username is ""nonsig""
the password is ""xplor"""

Title: Cancel a Tire Order
Description: CP1132 Need to cancel a tire order I submitted.
Solution:
"Call InfoLink at 1-800-755-2772 .... (once an order is placed in Tire-HQ .... it cannot be deleted through Tire-HQ.)

CANADA LOCATIONS:

West Region calls:  800-665-4812
East Region calls:  800-361-3317"

Title: Retail Store Manager Change
Description:
CP1134 New Store Manager is calling for access to Tire-HQ.

Modified 10/17/2007"
Solution: All  Retail Store Tire-HQ UA's are GSRxxxx (xxxx = Terr #). If a store manager wants to set themself up they must sign on Tire-HQ with their gsr # and go to register new user

Title: Run Flat Tire Adjustment
Description: CP1147 How do I handle repairs or adjustments for the Run Flat tires?
Solution:
Replacement ...  tire tread is within the range for no charge replacement  (12 mos / 2/32), process an adjustment doc. (Until the service request is completed to allow this adjustment on the PAC's screen the adjustment must be done on the merchandise verify screen.)
Repair ... done at No-charge to the customer, In order to get reimbursed for the no-charge tire repair made for the customer, the location will be required to fax a copy of the POS Adjustment showing the repair cost up to $50 to Customer Assistance/Product Service 330-796-6829.  Additional questions by the caller should be directed to 800-321-2136 Product Service / Customer Supp

Title: Adjustment Tires Lost by Freight Carrier
Description: CP1222 Adjustment tires being shipped to Central Inspection Depot were lost by the Freight Carrier
Solution:
"1.  The shipping Dealer or Company Owned Outlet should file a claim with the Freight Carrier.  They can use their Adjustment Manifest along with any other paperwork needed for proof of merchandise value.

2.  The location should send a copy of the claim paperwork to the Central Inspection Depot.

3.  Upon receipt of a copy of the claim against the carrier, the Central Inspection Depot will process the adjustments.

Reference: Memo from Fred Pfeiffer, Operations Administrator Product Service, dated 11/28/94"

Title: Memo Adjustment
Description: CP1223 How do I process a Memo Adjustment?
Solution:
"1)  On the Product Adjustment screen Tab to the Correction field and type a ""M"".  (memo)
2)  Tab to the adjustment type and type a ""B"".
3)  Type the product code of the tire being adjusted.
4)  TAB to the tread depth and enter 0.
5)  TAB to purchase date and type the date and Press ENTER.
A Memo Adjustment will not generate a replacement tire.
This is the only merchandise that can be entered on this document. Will receive ""invalid merchandise for memo adjustment"" if you enter any other code on this document.
FYI- STORES - CID will approve or deny on Product / Excise Tax Suspense Report.
FYI- DEALERS - CID will approve or deny on a K-Document.
ALL MEMO ADJUSTMENT TIRES MUST BE SENT BACK TO CID."

Title: Legal Adjustment
Description: CP1224 How do I process a Legal Adjustment?
Solution:
?	After selecting the customer and vehicle, press F7 Adjustment.

?	On the PACS adjustment screen, enter the words ?Legal Adjustment" in the Special Info field.

?	Now enter the Drive Type (F,R,4) and tab to the Adjustment Type field and type the letter "L".

?	Tab to the Product Code field and type the code of the tire to be adjusted, then tab to the Tread Depth field and type the number zero (0).

?	Tab to the purchase date and type the date when the tire being adjusted was purchased and then press enter.

?	Tab to the Condition field and enter the words "Legal Adjustment".

?	Tab to the Installed Miles field and type the mileage of the vehicle at the time the adjusting tire was purchased.

?	Tab to the Wheel Position field and type the position the tire was on ? choices are RR, LR, RF, LF, and SP (spare).

?	Tab to the Original Equipment field and enter Y or N, and then tab to the Current Mileage/Hr/Yr field and type the current mileage.

?	Now tab to the replacement tire field and delete the generated product code and tab to the price field and delete the generated price.

?	Now press enter. You will be prompted to press enter for additional tires to be adjusted, otherwise, press F6 Mdse Verify to view the adjustment line created as a no charge item.
Latest from Product Service: Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/3EE454844C7DBBAB852578BC004EA060

TO VIEW DOCUMENTATION WITH SCREEN SHOTS: file://akrshare01/share/nat/GBMS\GBMS\DLRREL\Common%20Problems\Common%20Problem%201224%20with%20screenshots.doc

Title: Government Adjustment
Description: CP1225 How do I process a Government Adjustment?
Solution:
"1) On the product adjustment screen TAB to the Ajustment Type and type in B.
2) Tab, type the product code of the tire being adjusted.
3) Tab, type the tread depth.
4) Tab, type the purchase date and PRESS ENTER.
5) Tab back to the buying price and type in the governments buying price if necessary.
IF Tax Exempt press F1, or else Enter.
PRESS F1 ON ALL GOVT ADJS!!!.

 Click here to see screen shot: file://akrshare01/share/nat/GBMS\GBMS\DLRREL\Common%20Problems\Govt%20Adjustment.docx

6) Tab, type the condition,
7) Tab, type the miles,
8) Tab, type the wheel position,
9) Tab, type Y or N for original equip
10) Tab, type current miles.
11) Tab to replacement prod code, space out the prod code,
12) Tab to buying price and space out the buying price. PRESS ENTER.
13) Go to Mdse Verify screen and bill out the replacement tire with billing code 'G' and the GS# at the governments buying price."

Title: Adjustment -Tire Condition Field
Description: CP1228 Doing an adjustment on POS and cannot get past the condition of the tire field, what is the problem?
Solution:
User cannot get past "Condition" field on PACS screen
Press F12 - Help.
The list of all current conditions will be listed.
Choose the correct condition.
In the condition field type the 2 letter code followed by a space and then the condition of the tire being adjusted. Example: Belt separation.
Special Note: "GT" is valid for "M" adjustment types only. "GR" in invalid after the first 2/32 of wear unless there is an approval number.
"GR" is also invalid if the purchase Date of the tire being adjusted is greater than 6 months from the system date.
Please use link for documentation & screen shots:
Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/968AEC0D8903266F85256E93005C31FC

Title: Quality Plus / Mileage Adjustment
Description: CP1229 Question on procedures for Mileage adjustments.
Solution:
Procedures for Mileage adjustments (Type "M"). " Tread Depth MUST NOT BE GREATER THAN 2/32". The Original Invoice that the tire was purchased on MUST be entered as well as the Installed Miles and Current Miles.
The message CANNOT USE "M" ADJUSTMENT appears for several reasons.
1.  The MSSC in the item file for this tire is NOT in the WBB 7C table (it must in order for  the tire to qualify for M adjustment)
Link to 7C table screen Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/2EE80518937E9C2205256FD2006750E5
2.  The purchase date entered for the adjusted tire does not fall in to the  Effective From - To dates in the WBB 7C table for the tire entered.
Note: If the user enters GT as the Condition then the adjustment type MUST be "M".    Any questions concerning Mileage Adjustments should be directed to Product Service.


file://akrshare01/share/nat/GBMS\CLIENT\GBMS%20Support\DOCUMENTATION\gbms%20will%20not%20allow%20m-type%20adjustment%20on%20product%20code.doc

Title: Wrong Check Amount Entered Doc Total
Description: CP1236 Entered the check number in the check amount on Doc Total in error. Now my invoice shows me giving customer back money not due him. How to correct
Solution:
Go to main menu and type in DAT for Display Audit Trail.  Find the invoice in error.
The total should be correct ($$$$)  Cash $$$$$CR  & Check $$$$$.   Write these figures down.
Get out of DAT and start another invoice and minus the units and go to doc total.
Total should show as a minus amount.
Put in reason and then tab to cash amount and enter a positive amount of cash figure on audit trail.
Tab to the check amount and enter a minus figure for check amount and press enter. Change due customer should be 0.  Print.
We just backed out the original inv.  Rebill with correct information.

Title: Address Search
Description: CP1239 How do I select a Customer Company Name from the Address Book while I am entering a "Sales document" ?
Solution:
"Type the first few characters of the Customer Company Name in the ""Ship To"" field on the first screen.  On the next screen, click on the Drop Down arrow in the ""Ship to"" field and select the customer.

If Customer Company Name doesn't appear in the Drop Down list.  Click on <NEW ENTRY> and complete the Name, Address, City, State and the Zip code."

Title: Sales Doc entry

Title: State delivery doc entry
Description: CP1245 How to bill out a State (Government) sale.  NOTE: The solution does not apply to locations that must bill State deliveries on their local books. (ref Govm't  sales manual)
Solution:
"From the Sales menu:
1.  Click on Document Type D
2.  Type in Doc#, Date, Nonsig.
3.  In the Government Account # field enter xxxx (xxxx=# listed in GS manual).
4.  Choose Vehicle type if other than Auto.
5.  Use Standard DR(default)
6.  Click the Next button.

On the Customer Information screen
1.  In the Select Bill To Nonsig, click the down arrow and select the customer, Texas Parks and Wildlife.
2.  You will need to enter the Ship To information.
3.  Click the Next button.

From here you will need to fill out the Requirements screen.  When finished, click Next.
Enter in the Product Codes and quantities of the product you are delivering.  Click the Verify Products button.
Fill in any additional fields.
When finished, click Send & Print."

Title: EDL PRICE NOT SHOWING FOR COB 1 AND 4

"For stores, EDL prices only show on COB 2 sales.

Title: Gtracs-Workorder line deletes/changes
Description: CP1269 How do we correct a line entry prior to interfacing?
Solution: In order to change the status on a line that has been final_completed (but not interfaced), they should call up that G82/line # at the final inspection station. Once they  have selected that line, the cursor should be at the bottom where it says STATUS:COMPLETE. Press F8 for OPTIONS. Then they can arrow up/down to select from Reject, Rework, Scrap, Rar, Rerun.

Solution: TC 11's (SR 3066 released in July 1999) print the cost of the retread backwards on the second line.

Title: 4TN-How to bill 4 Tires Now - Preferred Customer
Description: CP1288 How to bill 4-tires-now on a perferred customer.
Solution:
"Effective 1/18/2006:
4 Tires Now call reports are located in Transactions>Delivery Management>Roadside service Call Reports.  Users are to start by clicking on Detail button, then filling in Roll time & date, then press start/resume button.


Old way:
You can bill 4-tires-now on Doc type A (National Accounts) or on Preferred Customers using Doc type H (Direct Dealer).

1.  Select doc type H (if not a NAcct)
2.  Select 4 Tires Now box.
3.  Ship To is customer you are billing (enter initial, or NS#)
4.  Select Vehicle Type and Standard DR.  Click Next.

Other info can be found in ""Goodyear Emergency Road Service Program 1-877-4-Tires-Now"" document."

Title: NA# 6383 - PHH Over Credit Limit
Description:
6383/6384 - 11/3/14- name changed to ELEMENT VEHICLE MGMT SVCS LLC

CP1310 NA# 6383 and 6384 - PHH: Users are getting message Invalid Data, Card Not on File -OR- Over the Limit, Credit limit of $xxx is exceeded.

<<Instruct users to click on the link ""PHH VEHICLE MANAGEMENT SVCS "" at the top of the requirements and or click on the Help button next to the requirement for desirable format.>>"
Solution:
PO/CC/COUPON/ID #:  CCR599 + 7 numbers or CCR005 + 11 numbers
REQ/AUTHORIZATION/RELEA:  ""UNDER"" ...
        IF "UNDER" does not work for sale under $100
        THEN send email to Kathy Hanlin who will check with PHH and determine if an override is needed.
        Override formats are:   AANNNNN  or NNNNNAA.
AUTH SVC $:  credit card limit or authorized service dollar amount, round up to the nearest dollar amount
Example:  Sale totals $92.40 not including tires.  Enter 93 in credit limit field.

If they see the message ""Card Not on File -OR- Over the Limit"":
1)   Make sure the AUTH SVC $ is not less than the total service dollar.
2)   If the total service dollar exceeds the credit card limit, make sure the dealer has the AUTHORIZATION number from PHH, e.g. AANNNNN or NNNNNAA.

If they see the message ""Credit limit of $xxx is exceeded"", make sure the AUTH SVC $ is not less than the total service dollar.

NA 6384
PO/CC/COUPON/ID #: CCB599 + 7 numbers or CCB005 + 11 numbers
AUTH SVC $:  credit card limit or authorized service dollar amount, round up to the nearest dollar amount
Example:  Sale totals $92.40 not including tires.  Enter 93 in credit limit field.

If they see the message ""Card Not on File -OR- Over the Limit"", first make sure the AUTH SVC $ is not less than the total service dollar.  Second, if the total service dollar exceeds the credit card limit, make sure the dealer has the AUTHORIZATION number from Ship To, e.g. AANNNNN or NNNNNAA.

If they see the message ""Credit limit of $xxx is exceeded"", make sure the AUTH SVC $ is not less than the total service dollar."

If the batch is not there , send to Development."

Title: Quick Check - Invalid Bank ID
Description: CP1351 What does the error message " Invalid Bank ID" mean when trying to enter a Quick Check?
Solution: This error message indicates that the dealer has not identified their local bank through which they handle their checking account. Have the location access the option# 15 "A/P Bank Profile" on Vendor Payables menu. Setup a new a 10000 account and type in the 3-position Alpha characters indicative of the bank they use, tab, and type the Bank full name in the appropriate fields and press enter. When the line appears above, select it and press enter to bring the line down to modify. Then press F1 Default, to set it up as the default account - it will show the Bank ID at the top now. They can now return to handle the Quick Check.

Title: Received REFUND check

Title: 999 vehicle max
Description: CP1401 My vehicles are maxed out at 999.  I deleted several vehicles, but still unable to add a vehicle.
Solution:
Please get customer number, length of time to keep the vehicle  and forward to level 2 support .  ** after hours you may try the following if you are comfortable doing so.

Customer unable to add more vehicles to a specific account.  Account is sitting at maximum allowable entries: 999. The renumbering program that runs during maintenance after vehicles are deleted will not run successfully if there are more than 800 vehicles on the account.  You can confirm this by checking logfile for the error message.

*** 1). Confirm the customer's number of vehicles is >800:
SQL> select count(*) from vhistory where vhcust ='XXXXX';     ? (where XXXXX = 5-digit customer #)

If the number returned is under 800, this may not be the problem, but complete step 2, then skip to step 4. If they still cannot add a vehicle after step 4, open a ticket to Support.

*** 2). Discuss with the caller and determine what retention period to use for this customer:
SQL> select lcvnum from loccntl;     ? (to see how long location is keeping vehicle history for all customers - display is in months)

Advise the caller of their current retention period. They can either:
1) They can set a shorter retention period for this specific customer by setting the retention period in Veh Hist Ovr (Vehicle History Override) field on the Customer/Vehicle Maintenance screen (CVMNT). The field value is # of months; see note below about Retail A/R customers.
2) Reduce their retention period for all customers on the last page of their Location Profile screen (PROF). The field value is # of months.

* They -must- do one of the preceeding two things before proceeding to step 3.

* NOTE *:  GASC/JT Retail Stores cannot change this for A/R customers.  If the customer is an A/R account, you will need to change it for them as follows:
SQL> update custmast set cmveh_ret_ovr = 'xxx' where cmcust = 'xxxxx';     ? (you must enter the leading zeros in both fields)
SQL> commit;

*** 3). Run the vehicle history deletion program:
In smenu, go to option 9 (Utilities menu), option 6 (runpgm) to run maintenance vehicle history deletion program as shown:

type: MNTVHSTD (press enter ? must be caps)
(you can use !tail /logfile in plus when completed to see deletion counts)

Check counts in plus again at this point.
SQL> select count(*) from vhistory where vhcust ='XXXXX';

So long as this number is under 800, you can move to step 3. Otherwise, you will need to change the retention period again and repeat.

*** 4). Run the vehicle renumbering program:
In smenu, go to option 9 Utilities Menu, option 6 to run maintenance vehicle history deletion program as shown:

type: MNTVRNUM (press enter ? must be caps)

Once this renumbering completes, sign back into plus to check customer veh count in custmast and vhistory:

SQL> select count(*) from vhistory where vhcust ='XXXXX';     ? This shows the # of vehicles.
SQL> select cmvehs from custmast where cmcust ='XXXXX';     ? This shows the highest numbered vehicle.
(The count and number from the above queries should match.)

Inform user and have them access account to make sure they are now able to add vehicles/ history.  If there is still trouble, update report with steps taken/write-up referenced and forward to Support.

Title: Correction documents
Description: CP1408 There is an error in the delivery receipt or sales document submitted to Goodyear on Tire-HQ.  How do I fix it?  (Customer Accounting Claim, or Correction or Return document)
Solution:
1. If the delivery receipt was submitted on the same day the error was discovered:

Have the user put the delivery receipt on hold from the Deliveries Sent page ? Use CP 3303.


2.  If an invoice HAS been issued, follow the steps according to the appropriate scenario below:

2.1 If the dealer billed at an incorrect price or quantity, or a requirement, nonsig, or product code was incorrect or omitted:
*) If the user account has more than one nonsig/location, have them go to Account > Change Customer, then click the nonsig for which the claim will be made.
a) Go to Financial > Customer Accounting > Customer Accounting Claim form.
b) Click the "New Claim" link. (Users may return to this page to check the claim status.)
c) Have the user confirm the phone number at the top; billing may use it to contact them.
d) Have the user answer the "Is this claim for a National Account ?" question by clicking the radio button.
e) Enter the Source Document (DR #) and/or Goodyear Invoice Number and Invoice Date (Month & Year Only).
f) Select a reason code from the list box.
g) Explain in full the situation and indicate exactly what needs to be done, providing all info, including product codes, descriptions, quantities, and prices.

2.2 If the dealer billed the wrong account:
*) If the user account has more than one nonsig/location, have them go to Account > Change Customer, then click the nonsig for which the claim will be made.
a) Go to Financial > Customer Accounting > Customer Accounting Claim form.
b) Click the "New Claim" link. (Users may return to this page to check the claim status.)
c) Have the user confirm the phone number at the top, billing may use it to contact them.
d) Have the user answer the "Is this claim for a National Account ?" question by clicking the radio button.
e) Enter the Source Document (DR #) and/or Goodyear Invoice Number and Invoice Date (Month & Year Only).
f) Select a reason code from the list box.
g) Explain in full the situation and request the invoice be canceled, indicate a new DR will be created for the correct account.
h) Create a new Standard DR for the correct account using a new document number.


3. If the document was submitted prior to the day the error was discovered AND an invoice has NOT been issued:

3.1 Go to Financial > Reports and check if there is any G86 reports:
a) If there is a G86 report, contact the person listed in the report and provide the information requested. (Use the "Response" button in the G86.)
b) If there is no G86 report, follow the steps according to the appropriate scenario below.

3.2 If the dealer billed at an incorrect *price or quantity*, or there was a missing requirement, or used a wrong nonsig:
a) Fill out a Customer Accounting Claim form ? See 2.1 above. Provide the Source Document (DR) number.  Type in a detailed and complete explanation in the area provided.

3.3 If the dealer omitted a Product or Service code:
a) Create a new document with a new document number.
b) On the document information screen, choose "Correction" by clicking on the radio button.
c) In the Prompt requesting Return Reference Doc #, enter the source doc # of the original document done in error.
d) In the Prompt requesting Reference Doc Date, enter the document date of the original document done in error.
e) In the Prompt requesting the reason for issuance, explain the reason for issuance.
f) Complete all requirements as before.
g) Add the item(s) omitted.

3.4 If the dealer billed a wrong Product or Service code:
a) Create a new document with a new document number.
b) On the document information screen, choose "Correction" by clicking on the radio button.
c) In the Prompt requesting Return Reference Doc #, enter the source doc # of the original document done in error.
d) In the Prompt requesting Reference Doc Date, enter the document date of the original document done in error.
e) In the Prompt requesting the reason for issuance, explain the reason for issuance.
f) Complete all requirements as before.
g) Debit the correct item(s).
h) Credit the wrong item(s) by putting a minus sign(-) in front of the quantity (fill in the price field if applicable).

*** NOTE: Never put a minus sign in the quantity field on the first line for a correction document!

3.5 If the dealer billed the wrong account:
a) Create a "Return document" with a new document number.
b) Create another Standard DR document with a new document number.

Title: TREAD RUBBER ITEMFILE
Description: CP1421 WHO UPDATES THE TREAD RUBBER ITEM FILES
Solution: Updates go out every monday night automatically. They should have a form to fill out and they can fax it to Brad Smith and he will make sure that if it is a new code or tread size that it gets loaded. If they don't know what form I am talkingabout, they can just write on a sheet of paper the following information: tire size, tread design, tread size and mold code (if applicable). They can either fax to Brad (fax # is 330-796-6066 (gtn 446-6066) or email to brad_smith@goodyear.com or call him direct 330-796-3570.

Title: A/R - adjustment error
Description: CP1423 Processed A/R payment as an A/R adjustment.
Solution:
"TO CORRECT: go back into A/R cash receipt for the specific account and press the ENTER key in the check number field to get the cursor to the bottom of the screen in the LINE NO. field.  At this point, press F4 Open/Closed Items to find the invoice(s) that were processed as ""adjustments.""

To reinstate the invoice to its original status, enter the line number and tab to the ""adjustment"" field and enter the original adjustment amount as a MINUS and ENTER.  As this will return the line to its original status, the unapplied cash can now be applied to the line item by simply entering the line number and pressing the F2 (Pay by line) function key."
