Title: Final hours and Point of Sale
Description: CP1428 Trying to finalize hours and says he cannot because he has POS up on sessions
Solution: Need to check all terminals & sessions and PC's to be sure POS is not up on any session

Title: OSI not showing tire order placed yesterday
Description: CP1429 Why is my tire order I placed yesterday not showing on OSI the next morning?
Solution: .FIRST THING TO REMEMBER, OSI IS NOT A REAL-TIME INQUIRY...IT IS STATUS ON ORDERS AS OF THE DAY BEFORE...ONLY CSSC CAN PROVIDE REAL-TIME UP-TO-THE-MOMENT STATUS ON ORDERS...NEXT THING TO REMEMBER IS THE CYCLE OF PROCESSING ORDERS FROM GBMS...USER PLACES TIRE ORDER ON GBMS, WHICH WILL COME IN WITH HIS NEXT EOD...HIS B50 IS RECEIVED, BALANCED, THEN PROCESSED TO DOWNSTREAM SYSTEMS THE NEXT MORNING...COULD BE RELATIVELY EARLY IN THE MORNING TO MID-MORNING TO NOON DEPENDING ON HOW THE DATA CENTER IS RUNNING, ETC...SO, THE ORDER THIS LOC  PLACED AT 9:26 ON MONDAY DID NOT HIT AKRON UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING...HIS OSI CANNOT SHOW THAT ORDER THE NEXT DAY YET...CSSC FINALLY SAW STATUS OF THE ORDER LATER TUESDAY MORNING WHEN THE ORDER HIT DISTRIBUTION SERVICES AND TOOK STATUS...THE USER CAN SEE IT ON HIS OSI TODAY...EVERYTHING PROCESSED PER NORMAL.

Title: AVG COST Payable Error
Description: CP1456 Entered 9 digit tire codes at wrong cost, distorting average cost in Akron Stock Ledger.
Solution: Beginning 1/1/05, it's O.K. to reverse the erroneous payable entry and re-enter correctly.  Both the negative units/cost of the reversal document and the positive units/cost of the "corrected" entry WILL be included in re-calculating average cost.  The A/P program has been changed to accommodate this process.

Title: R3 - Order restrictions
Description: CP1487 Why am I having problems ordering certain brand of tires?
Solution: Changes have been implemented by Goodyear to modify what products can be ordered by your location. If indicators show the location is denied order processing for a certain products, they are to contact their District or Region office for inquiry to change the permissions. Please update the report in Work History details, such as the brand ,style, size of tire.

Title: R3 - SAI restrictions
Description: CP1489 Why am I having problems viewing some warehouses' stock?
Solution: Changes have been implemented by Goodyear to modify what products can be viewed by your location. If indicators show the location is denied view for a some warehouses, they are to contact their District or Region office for inquiry to change the permissions. Please update the report in Work History details, such as the warehouse location.

Title: R3 - Government billing restrictions
Description: CP1492  R3 - Why am I having problems billing certain product codes on a billing code "G" document?
Solution:
"Changes have been implemented by Goodyear to modify what products can be delivered by your location to accounts for Goodyear,including local,State or Federal government agencies. If indicators show the location is denied billing   processing for a certain products to various locations, such as State, Federal or local government agencies, they are to handwrite the document for now. Please update the report in Work History details, such as the brand ,style, size of tire,billing code and deliver-to location type an send to Support for tracking.
***UPDATE***  12/4/00 09:45 AM
The problem has been found and a fix will be sent later this morning to correct. A message will print when the fix is received by each location. The location must exit back to login to enable the fix and then re-attempt document entry."

Title: Reprint Invoices
Description:
CP1515 "How do I reprint invoices?  I need to reprint the invoices I tried to print today.

Modified 11/15/2007"
Solution:
"Online Training is available for this.  Show them.
1.  Go to Financial > Invoices
2.  Click on Search link
3.  Click on the calendar in the ""Print Date (from) area
4.  Select the proper date (today's date if they attempted to print the invoices today)
5.  Click in the (To) area (date automatically fills in)
6.  Click the Search button (the results will display)
7.  Click the Queue for Print button (bottom of results)
8.  Click the Print link (to start the print process ... Adobe will launch)
9.  Click on the printer icon located in the upper left corner of the Adobe screen, then select OK to send document(s) to your printer."

Title: TPP - Error Dataset Already Active
Description: CP1539 TPP - Upload or Download gets Error Dataset Already Active, A download is currently being run by user: username.
Solution: The user must go to Dataset Status and put a check mark in the Mark Cancelled box of the dataset that is showing Active, then press the Process Updates button. Now they can retry the upload or download.

Title: TPP - How to do a Daily Download
Description: CP1540 TPP - How to do a Daily Download
Solution:
"1. Go to FInancial > TPP from the menu tabs
2. Click the Download Datasets link.
3. Click the Daily Updates link. (The TPP java applet will launch.)
4. The path and file name will appear in the box. If the user wants to change the location where the file is saved, they can click the ""Save As"" button. Otherwise, they just need to click the ""Download"" button.
5. Once the download is finished this file is ready to be            processed in their TPP system."

Title: TPP - How to Upload Datasets
Description:
CP1541 TPP - How to Upload Datasets

For more information see: Weekly TireHQ Problems & Fixes 10/03/2008
Solution:
"1. Go to Financial > TPP from the menu tabs.
2. Select the Upload Datasets link.
3. Click on the ""Select File"" button. (A box will appear for the user to select which file they want to upload.)
4. Once they have picked the correct file, click on the ""Upload"" button
5. One the upload is finished the documents are on hold in Sales or if they pass the edit checks they are sent to goodyear."

If the dealer is trying to do a TPP upload and it's taking longer than 15 minutes. Have the dealer stop the TPP upload and retry it.  TPP uploads, on average, upload with in 5 minutes or less.  If the dealer retries and it still does not upload, have the dealer e-mail the file to tirehq.helpdesk@goodyear.com and we will take a look at it.

Title: TPP Error - No data to download
Description: CP1542 TPP Error - No data to download. No file created on your system.
Solution: Send report to level 2

Title: ASC - Corp Vendor STOP PMT.
Description: CP1543 ASC - Company store STOP Payment or Correction to payable vendor.
Solution: Call (330) 796-1937 for Vendor Payable corrections or for vendors payable check STOPPED.

Title: Part value changing to $0.00 - core
Description:
CP1545 "Part value changing to $0.00 - core
Why is the part entered changing value to $0.00?"
Solution: The location is entering a part description that includes the word "core" and the parts programs are designed to look for the core value, which in this case had none, therefore changes the value to $0.00. The fix is to change the word "core" to "element", and it will then retain the $$$ value posted.

Title: DR Charge Back
Description: CP1547 DR charged back and woc says to reenter.  How to enter and how will it affect my inventory?
Solution:
When a chargeback occurs, the wholesale operations center will automatically cancel the problem document.
In order to receive the credit a new document needs to be issued referencing the original ship date.  To facilitate this entry, a new field has been added to the D/R document information screen entitled ?ORGINAL SHIP DATE (       )? the original document ship date should be entered in the field. No entry of the original document number will be needed. If the original Document number is needed by the national account then it can be written on the hard copy.


TO CORRECT INVENTORY:
Yes, if woc says they need you to reenter a DR,  you must also adjust your inventory.   The new DR will also effect inventory.
Stores:    do an inventory adjustment
Dealers:  do an inventory 'screen only' adjustment
Dealer Stock Ledger will be corrected by Akron, if they never received credit against the chargeback."

Title: E-Mail on work order
Description: CP1554 What is the new field on pos called e-mail ?
Solution: This  is to be able to enter the customers e-mail address for future marketing  programs.

Title: How to Reprint Remittance
Description: CP1574 How do I reprint my remittance?
Solution:
1.  Access A/P Remittance from the Financial dropdown menu.
2.  Select Queue for Print under the Customer number you would like to Queue last Remit for:
3.  The system will ask which documents you wish to queue.
4.  Select the documents and click the submit button.
5.  Once documents have been queued, click the print link on left side of screen
6.  Documents will be sent to adobe where you will be able to print.

Title: Maxpeed Out problem
Description:
CP1603  Why can`t I login at the login prompt or screen is blank or black?
Defect #142"
Solution:
"There is a problem at secondary workstations by which the keyboard and/or mouse is not responding, typically at the login prompt, but also when the screen display is blank or black.
There are a few steps that need checked before sending the problem the Level 2 Support desk for analysis or subsequent referral to Level 3 Development:

1) Check the maxpeed cable connections and unplug/replug the power cord, power  maxspeed back on - be advised that if they touch the mouse or keyboard before the maxpeed is reset, you will need to repeat this process as it will still disable these devices.
2) Ask if this workstation as ever functioned - sometimes the setup may be incorrect and this will need configured as an active workstation.
3) Check for litghts activity on the base unit. Green power light should be solidly lit and the activity should be flashing off and on somewhat rhythmically.
If none of these correct the problem, refer your call open to  HW/COMM."

Title: Can`t minimize or select option from Task bar
Description:
CP1606  Why can't I select the option from Task bar that's already open, nor can I click to enter the panel open on the display?
"There is a problem where the user cannot select open options from the Task bar nor can they click an activated window of the GBMS options.

 Check for the lights at the top right of the keyboard(Num loc,Caps lock or Scroll lock) - if any of them are lit, remove them and this will allow for minimizing and selection of active panels."
Solution: Check for the lights at the top right of the keyboard(Num loc,Caps lock or Scroll lock) - if any of them are lit, remove them and this will allow for minimizing and selection of active panels.

Title: Doc in use (POS)
Description:
CP1607 "Why is the system saying ""Document in use"" when I try to select from pending or by document #?

Keywords: UNLOCK    document point of sale
Solution:
If the location is a Goodyear Auto Service Center - On Homepage - Click on System Admin - Unlock Vehicle Tire Inspection Docs.   (Have them unlock any documents listed on this screen (It may not be the document # that shows as locked but it may be the same Sequence # of the document that is showing as locked)  After they unlock any documents on this screen have them try to recall the document again - if it is still locked procede with the following instructions.

"There is a known problem where the record is locked and needs to be corrected before user can access it.

Before unlocking the doc check logfile to see if there are any errors.

Telnet onto the location
From the # sign type view /logfile
Shift :q to go to the bottom of the file then page up a to see if you see any error.   If any errors send to level 2 and if not unlock the document.
From  the SQL> type  @ulock and follow the  process .
stay on the line with the user to see if they can access and complete the invoice.

If it doesn`t correct the problem, send the report to Level 2 for referral to Development for correction and advice to user."

Title: Socket Connect problem
Description:
CP1608  Why doesn`t the option I open bring up the application? - just goes blank , then clears.
Socket error"
Solution:
"There is a known problem where the user selects a GBMS option from the Homepage and begins to start the panel, but then goes blank or black, then disappears.

Have the location try logging out to the login prompt, then restart the terminal.

If still a problem signon to the location and do the following:
at the # view /logfile  press enter  (shift G to go to the bottom, and :q + enter to exit logfile)  If you see the socket error connection then have the location take all options out of the task bar on all terminals.
When all sessions are out of the task bar from the # do a sysipl.  When system comes up they should now be able to login and use the system.."

Title: TPP needs G08's or 810's
Description: CP1615 User needs to know what date to put in the field on the selective download screen for a specific invoice.
Solution:
"Go To Financials>TPP>Download Datasets ...
Have User type in the invoice number in the ""Enter Invoice # :"" then press ""Search"" .... have them do a ""Selective Download"" using the date(s) supplied.  Mark the proper field required (G08, and/or 810) and process the selective Download.
Any problems ... please transfer this report to XPLOR (level 2)"

Title: Apply unapplied cash
Description: CP1628 How to apply unapplied cash?
Solution:
From the GBMS Main Menu, select A/R option, 10
From the A/R Menu, choose A/R Payment option, 01
From the A/R Payment screen choose Cash/Check Receipt.
On the Cash/Check Receipt screen press enter.
The unapplied amount moves into the App Amt field and the cursor moves to the line number field.
With the cursor in the line field, type the line # to pay, tab to the amount field and type the amount to pay and press enter, or,  type the line # and press F2 to Pay by Line, if the amount in the App Amt field is equal to or greater than the amount of the line to pay.  Press F7 Print
(updated 10/18/11)

Title: NA#6383/6384 - Invalid PO/CC & Authorized by
Description: CP1629 NA#6383/6384 - ELEMENT Invalid PO/CC & Authorized by on TC 75
Solution:
6383/6384 - 11/3/14- name changed to ELEMENT VEHICLE MGMT SVCS LLC

CP1310 NA# 6383 and 6384 -   Users are getting message Invalid Data, Card Not on File -OR- Over the Limit, Credit limit of $xxx is exceeded.

<<Instruct users to click on the link ""ELEMENT VEHICLE MANAGEMENT SVCS "" at the top of the requirements and or click on the Help button next to the requirement for desirable format.>>"

Ask the location what color credit card the customer is using for the purchase.  (Red or Blue) CARDS ARE ONLY 10 DIGITS IN LENGTH
See procedures Manual  Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/55A08CF6F50D13FC852570580061E1CE

RED CREDIT CARD:
1.  Bill under NA# 6383
2.  Enter CCR plus the credit card number in the PO/CC/ID field
3.  Enter the additional authorization in the REQ/AUTHORIZATION/RELEASE # field
      NOTE:  There are various card limits (i.e., $50, $100, $200) that will force correct entry to this field.
      The # given by PH&H must match the total dollar value of parts and labor within 10% of the actual total.
      PH&H Auth Svc $$ ... ENTER THE TOTAL DOLLAR AMOUNT ROUNDED OFF I.E. 252.79 = ROUNDED OFF ENTRY = 253
      TOTAL INCLUDES ALL THE PARTS AND SERVICE ON THE D/R. (NO TIRES, TUBES, BATTERIES, RETREADS OR RETREAD REPAIRS)
      If under the service credit limit, then enter the word UNDER

BLUE CREDIT CARD:
1.  Bill under NA# 6384
2.  Enter CCB plus the credit card number in the PO/CC/ID Field
3.  No Additional PO# is required

Both Red and Blue card:   Authorized by field = first initial (space) last name

If ...... the card number and the expiration date are valid & current but an error message is being received that the card is invalid,
Then... an email needs to be sent to National Acounts to verify with ELEMENT it is a valid card.

Title: DR License Plate Number field invalid
Description: CP1631 On the DR Requirement screen with message "Highlighted Fields in Error" and the highlighted field is D/R License Plate Number.
Solution: The format for the D/R License Plate number is License#, a space and then the 2 digit state abbreviation.

Title: NA #2807 Enterprise Rent-A-Car
Description:
CP1634  NA#2807 Enterprise - Compare edit
Receives the message, Highlighted fields are in error at the bottom of the screen and the word, compare is displayed next to the credit card #."
or not accepting VIN #
Solution:
"The program is designed to compare the last 6 digits of the credit card # to the Veh/Fleet/Trlr/Unit #. They MUST match exactly.
1) Have the location blank out the     Veh/Fleet/Trlr/Unit # and press enter.
The cursor will return to the Veh/Fleet/Trlr/Unit #.
2) Enter the last 6 digits of the credit card # and press enter.
3) Press the F-key to print the final document."


7/14/15 -- Vin number will now be the last 10 digits.  - There is no longer an 8 digit vin

Title: NA#5290 Map Inc - PO/CC/ID#
Description: CP1636 NA#5290 Map Inc - PO/CC/ID# = Highlighted field in error.
Solution:
If the PO/CC/ID# starts with the letter 'W', it must be billed under NA#5290:
PO #  will begin with W033 or W040 (+ seven numeric for total of 11 digits)
CC #  will begin with client # W077 (plus 4 5 or 6 alphanumeric digits)
ID # (Coupon) will begin with client # W777 (+ alpha and 5 numeric digits)

If PO/CC/Coupon begins with a T033,T077 or T777 - Bill thru TC 73- GA #9321- for State of Michigan vehicles

See NA requirements for additional billing instructions.
ADDITIONAL INSTRUCTIONS AS OF JANUARY 2010, use the listing below.

If the PO number starts with W777 use this number in the coupon field.
If the PO number starts with W077 use this number in the coupon field.
If the PO number starts with W033 use N/A in the coupon field.
If the PO number starts with W040 use N/A in the coupon field.

Title: D/R - Tire Adjustment
Description:
CP1640 D/R - Tire Adjustment N/A & TC 71
How do I process a delivery receipt adjustment on GBMS?"
Solution:
See added information for TC 71 direct bill at the bottom

"National Accounts does not have an adjustment screen like the POS option.
1) After typing the employee # and the transaction code press enter.
2) Answer the Tirenet question (Y or N) and press enter.
3) Type in the customer/territory # and TAB to the Adjustment field and type in 'Y'.  Press the F9 key.
4) Procede filling out the customer information in the normal manner.
5) Procede to the Mdse Verify screen. Type in the product code of the tire being adjusted, the quantity, the (PCT Wear) percent of wear, which is a two digit number. The Adjust Type will be a 'B', 'Q', or 'M'.
NOTE: IF the replacement tire is the same, it is a one line entry.
IF the replacement tire is different, then a second and third line will be required.
The second line will be the SAME product code as the first line with minus units.
The third line will be the replacement tire product code with positive units.
Continue the document in the normal manner.
Location must also submit a manual claim form to get CID to accept it and to receive credit (Form # G-346)."

TC 71 process
Per Dave, Since this was a TC 71 and tires were transferred to the direct dealer, and the direct dealer resells those tires to someone else, it is now the problem of the direct dealer to issue the adjustment, either by gbms, tire hq (doc type S) or by form G346 which is a hand written form sent to CID for credit.

Title: D/R - Service Correction
Description: CP1641 How do I correct service work on a completed Delivery Receipt?  (use for all 6 digit prod codes)
Solution:
"1) From the delivery receipt screen type in your emp # and the appropriate TC code.
2) Tab to the Correction field and enter a 'S' for service. Press enter.
3) On the Send Service Correction screen type the original document #,tab, type the document date, tab, type the Na#/Ga#.
IF credit has been received, enter the K-Doc or WDR # and tab.
4) Type in the message field the changes you want WOC to make to this document. Tab.
5) Type your name in the Submitted by field. Press enter.
6) Press F1 to Send/Print the message."

NOTE:  IF WOC ADVISES LOC TRANSACTION IS A CHARGEBACK ... USE CP 1547 INSTEAD

Title: D/R - Merchandise Correction
Description: CP1642 How do I correct a del/rec that was billed out using the wrong 9 digit tire product code?  (use for tires only)
Solution:
***REMEMBER MERCHANDISE CORRECTION IS FOR TIRES AND BATTERIES ONLY***
THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE SERVICE REPAIR PARTS, WIPER BLADES, WASHER FLUIDS, ETC.  ALL OTHER CORRECTIONS USER SERVICE CORRECTION CP# 1641

"1) From Main Menu select option for Del Receipts.
2) Type your emp#, tab and type the appropriate TC #.
3) Tab to Correction field and type a 'M'
and press enter.
4) Type the N/A # in Customer/Territory field and Tab to REF Doc # / Date field
5) Type the original doc # and date of the document you are correcting. Tab.
6) Type the reason for issuance, press enter. Fill in the rest of the delivery receipt as normal.
7) On mdse verify screen type in MINUS units for the wrong product code and press enter. Type in the correct product code with regular units.
This is the only way to correct your 9 digit inventory on sales aid."

NOTE:  IF WOC ADVISES LOC TRANSACTION IS A CHARGEBACK ... USE CP 1547 INSTEAD

Title: National Account overrides
Description:
CP1644 National Account overrides
Over-ride structure to escape requirement problem: (only given out when there is no other recourse or all requirements are correctly entered, per Level 2)"

DO NOT OVER-RIDE TIREHQ DOCUMENTS.  Please send these reports to LEVEL 2.
DO NOT OVER-RIDE TIREHQ DOCUMENTS.  Please send these reports to LEVEL 2.
DO NOT OVER-RIDE TIREHQ DOCUMENTS.  Please send these reports to LEVEL 2.
DO NOT OVER-RIDE TIREHQ DOCUMENTS.  Please send these reports to LEVEL 2.
Solution:
DO NOT OVER-RIDE TIREHQ DOCUMENTS.  Please send these reports to LEVEL 2.

FOR GBMS ONLY:
"The format of the escape code is as follows:  N(1) A(1) N(2) N(3)
N(1) = Last digit of the year
A (1) = Alpha character associated with day of the week:
Monday = R
Tuesday = Q
Wednesday = M
Thursday = E
Friday = N
Saturday = T
Sunday = S
N(2) = Last Digit of document number
If no document number digit is 0.
N(3) = Last digit of day
User is to enter this code in brackets
on line that has asterisks and number
four, right above first requirement on requirments screen, then print."

DO NOT OVER-RIDE TIREHQ DOCUMENTS.  Please send these reports to LEVEL 2.

Title: National Accounts - Credit/quantity limit exceeded
Description:
CP1645 "National Accounts - Credit/quantity limit exceeded
""Credit/quantity limit exceeded, call Support"" message coming up trying to bill out National account"
Solution: From the requirement screen press F2 F3 F3 and then you are on doc info screen.  Type "N" in the box where is says Is this sale authorized by a credit card?

Title: TC 71- COO to Gdyr Dealer
Description: CP1650  COO transfer tires to Gdyr Dealer
Solution:
"The COO(company owned outlet) processes a TC 71.
Add the Dealer Non-Sig to DRCUS under Bill to.
Enter the Dealer N/S in Customer/Territory
The Goodyear Dealer must add the tires to his inventory via ROM (receipt of mdse) Option 4, Misc transfer.
Akron will issue the Goodyear Dealer a K-Document to effect his Book Inventory.
If freight charges need to be billed they can use prod code 046150."

Title: TC 71- Gdyr Dealer to COO
Description: CP1651  Gdyr Dealer transfer tires to COO)company owned outlet)
Solution:
"The COO (company owned outlet) processes a minus TC 71.
The Goodyear Dealer must minus the tires out of his inventory via ROM (receipt of mdse) Option 4, Misc. Transfer.  Akron will issue the Goodyear Dealer a K-Document to effect his Book Inventory."

Title: TC 71 - Bill To Non Sigs retention
Description: CP1652  How do I retain the Bill To Non-Sig # for TC 71's?
Solution:
"To retain the Bill To Non-Sig # for TC 71's they must be entered in the DR Administration.
1) From main menu select the  Administration option then D/R Adminstration(or scid=DRADM) and press enter.
2) From this menu select the option Delivery Receipt Customer Info (scid=DRCUS) and press enter.
3) From the update screen press the F-3 Key (Add Bill To)
4) The system generates a field to enter the Non-Sig number, enter the Non-Sig # and press enter.
5) Type the Name, Address, City, State and Zip Code and press enter. The message Update Complete generates at the bottom of the screen.
6) Press F-7 Key to Delete or Press F-8 Key to save the Non Sig Bill To."

Title: TC 71 Non-sig is invalid
Description: CP1653  Trying to process a TC 71 and receiving message Non-sig # is invalid.
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select option for Administration.
2) From Administration select option for  D/R Administration.
3) From D/R Administration select option for Delivery Receipt Customer Information.
4) Press the F3 key to add bill to
5) Type in the non-sig #, press enter.
6) Type in the Address, City, State and Zip Code and press enter.
7) Return to the Delivery Receipt screen to process the TC 71. The non-sig # will work now."

Title: TC 71 Gdyr Dealer to Gdyr Dealer
Description: CP1654  Gdyr Dealer sells tires to Gdyr Dealer.
Solution:
"Goodyear Dealer sells tires to another Goodyear Dealer (both non-stocking locations) IF credit approval has been given by their credit rep. they will do a TC 71.  IF NO credit approval, the sale has to be done on the dealers books.
If they need to charge for freight charges they can use prod code 046150."

Title: TC 11 - Invalid Territory
Description: CP1656  Why is my other location territory # invalid when trying to transfer stock?  TC11 or TC12
Solution:
"The peer location they are trying to transfer stock to is not listed in their Transfer Territory Update File ( SCID ""TTUP"").

1) Have the location that is not able to transfer stock access the Administration screen option #6 Transfer Territory Update File ( SCID ""TTUP"").
2) Select option# 1, to Update the file.
3) Type the territory #(xxxx) and press enter.
4) Tab past the Modem # file, unless they are able to do Remote Signon to the other location. If they are, type the phone # for the modem & press TAB.
5) Tab past the Timeout limit period.
6) Post the other locations address,TAB,city,TAB,state,TAB and zip code. After the last digit of the zip is entered, THEN PRESS ENTER. Update Complete will appear as message at the bottom.
7) Now they should be able to process a stock transfer tc/11 or TC 12

Note:  Both the location doing the transfer and the location receiving the merchandise must be in the TTUP at BOTH locations.
If ...  a WTC transfers tires to the receiving location successfully ... & the receiving location needs to return the tires
Then ...  the WTC must be in the sending stores TTUP file (transfer territory update).  At the GBMS main menu option/scid line, type: TTUP and choose Update Multi-location Transfer File to add the receiving location.

Title: TC 71 Mass merchandiser delivery / Sears
Description:
CP1658  TC 71 - How do I process a Mass Merchandiser Delivery?
i.e. Sears
Solution:
Procedure for TC71 Mass-Merchant Transaction

 1.  On Delivery Receipt Screen, type Employe number;  press TAB key
 2.  Type TC "71", press Enter.
 3.  Type "N" for 4-Tires-Now; press Enter.
 4.  Type "Y" for Mass Merchant, press Enter.
 5.  Cursor goes to Customer/Territory field.  Press F1 Cust Help
       Result:  a list of Mass Merchant Customers displays (Sears is the only account listed)
 6.  Type the Line Number, press Enter.
 7.  Type Store number (4 digits) which can be found in the .xls file below.  Press Enter.
 8.  Other fields requiring entries:
       P. O. Number
      Credit Approval #  =  "B96"
       Press Enter.   Result:   Validation is Complete.
 9.   Press F7 Customer Information.
       Result:  Bill To and Ship To information are automatically generated.
       Enter the driver information (driver name and phone are required fields).
10.  Press F6 Mdse Verify ... then key in the tire product code(s)
11.  F4 Print Final

Note:  The system will force you to the Requirements screen if all requirements are not completed.

IF YOU ARE NOT AUTHORIZED TO DELIVER TO MERCHANDISER OR MERCHANDISE IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR DELIVERY,
YOU WILL RECEIVE A MESSAGE ON YOUR SCREEN."

Title: TC 72 Dealership search - DRDS
Description:
CP1659  TC 72 Dealership search - DRDS
TC 72 ... I am processing a TC72 and I do not know the Dealership Number of the P&R Account."
Solution:
"1.  Type DRDS on Menu SCID line and press Enter OR Type (Administration) on Main Menu, press Enter;   Type 7 (D/R Administration), press Enter;  Type 5 (D/R Dealership Search), press Enter.
2.  Type the Ship-To Nonsig Number assigned originally by Goodyear and press Enter.
3.  The Dealership Number to use on the TC 72 will appear on the screen."

Title: EOD- Mastercheck/ Direct Deposit
Description:
CP1660  EOD message = Mastercheck/Direct Deposit  Must Be Printed.
I am doing the End of Day Cutoff and the system keeps generating the message  Master check or Direct Deposit must be printed. What do I do?"
Solution:
"The Master Check / Direct Deposit  MUST BE PRINTED from the Terminal that it was entered on.
1) Press the the enter key to void the End of Day process.

2) The screen returns to the End of Day Menu. Go to the terminal the mastercheck or direct deposit was started on and go to AR Payment or Direct Deposit choose the option needed and enter. It will bring up a blank screen. Press F7 to Print Mastercheck/Direct Deposit.  It will ask do you want to print the Mastercheck or Direct Deposit?  answer Y & enter.

3) After Master check prints, Press the F-8 key (Void/End).

4) The display returns to the End of Day Menu.  You can complete the End of Day Cutoff now.

5)  If the mastercheck did not print, go to each terminal and repeat the process. If still not printing, make sure the printer they are printing to is online.

Title: End of Day/Audit Tr Reprint
Description: CP1661  How do I reprint the End of Day Audit Trail and Summary?
Solution:
"Type in the scid of EODRP from main menu and press enter.
OR
From Main Menu type the option for End of Day, press enter
Type the option for EOD/Audit Trail Reprint. press enter.
1)Type the 3 digit Summary Sequence Number,
2)Tab to Reprint Summary and type Y or N
3)Tab to Reprint Audit Trail and type Y or N.
4)Press Enter.
5)The Summary/Audit Trail will reprint."

Locations can reprint EOD's up to 5 days prior.  If they need to print a B50 from within the last 5 days you can have them go
 in and attempt to print it.   If it doesn't print it is no longer on their system and there is no need for you to enter an incident
report because if it does not print then it is not there.

Title: EOD - Paid Outs must be printed
Description: CP1662  EOD message = Paid Outs must be printed.
Solution:
"Press the enter key to void the End of Day process.
If the screen returned to Main Menu, select the option for Paid Outs.

For Co-Owned Locs
Select the appropriate option (1)Non parts 2) Parts), press enter.
to the right of the option it will have Print Y or N.  If Y then need to choose that option
and the paid out will print. If both are no, then choose your option and enter.
Press F5 key to print the Paid Out.
Now will get message No valid entries for document, document cancelled.
should be able to run EOD now

Dealers
If trying to run EOD and getting paid outs must be printed get out of EOD and
go to Paidouts.
Choose option 1 to print paid out and enter
Press F5 print. If it prints the paid out then can run the eod. If it does NOT, should
get a message saying No valid entries for document, document cancelled.

Return to the End of Day Menu to continue the End of Day Cutoff."

Title: Exit Time Clock
Description: CP1666 How to EXIT Time Clock
Solution: Press F2 - F8 - F8

Title: Cannot clock in/out.
Description: CP1668 Trying to clock in an employee and get message "Current Weeks time records not available", "Cannot locate time records" or "prior week's time not finalized" hours are being proccessed .
Solution:
"Exit out of time clock (F2, F8, F8).
Go into actual hours (ACTHR) enter in ss# and then press F8 to exit.
Go back in to Timeclock (ATC) and clock in."

Title: Clocked in wrong
Description: CP1669 Employee clocked in wrong (late/early).
Solution:
"Exit out of timeclock (F2, F8, F8)
Go into actual hours (ACTHR) for that employee and day, tab to Exception field and enter ""LC"" (late clock) or ""EC"" (early clock) and the hours in 15 minute increments (ex.  LC 3.25).  After making all corrections exit out of actual hours (F8) and then go back into timeclock (ATC)."

Title: Forgot to clock in
Description: CP1670 Employee forgot to clock in.
Solution:
"Employee must clock in.
Exit timeclock.  (F2, F8, F8)
Go into Actual Hours (ACTHR)  for that employee and day, tab to Exception field and enter ""LC"" (late clock) hours in 15 minute increments (ex.  LC 3.25).  After making all corrections exit out of actual hours (F8) and then go back into timeclock (ATC)."

Title: How to Exit or Unexit Employee
Description: CP1672 How do I exit an employee now that the Exit Employee option on blue screen is gone?
Solution:
"TO EXIT AN EMPLOYEE IN GBMS.

GBMS Homepage
HR
Employee Maintenance
Employee Details
Enter Deletion Date at the bottom
Save Changes

Title: Approval # is invalid for new hire
Description: CP1673 Why is the approval # coming up as invalid when hiring a new employee?
Solution:
"Advise the location they will have to call their:
HRM ( Human Resources Mgr) OR
HRA (Human Resources Administrator) to verify the approval number. Have the location verify they gave the HRM/HRA the correct SSN number of the emp you are entering.  The Approval number MUST be entered in the GBMS System the SAME day they received it."

Title: How to REPRINT Hours worked,
Description: CP1675 How do I reprint Final Hours or Hours Corrections or Employee Audit report?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select Personnel option.
2) From Personnel Menu select option for Hours Reprint.
3) Type the week ending date for the reprint, press enter.
4) Press F2 for Reprint Final Hours,
Press F3 for Reprint Hours Corrections.
Press F6 for Reprint Employee Audit."

Title: SSN invalid entering a new employee
Description:
CP1676 Update
1.  Why is the SS# invalid error message appearing when trying to enter a new employee?
2.  What if the SS# is entered wrong.  How to correct?"
Solution:
"1) Main Menu - pick Personnel, press enter.
2) From Personnel Menu - pick Print Employee List, press enter
In most cases the SSN is on this list already.

IF ...  SSN IS ON THE LIST WITH EXIT DATE
1)  Personnel Menu pick Exit Employee, press Enter.
2) Type YOUR employee #, tab, enter the employee # of the exited employee and press Enter.
3) Type in 6 zero's, Enter.  Verify by typing 6 zeros again, Enter.  This will UNEXIT employee.  Validation is complete displays on the screen.
Press F1 to return to the personnel menu.
IF ...  THE EMPLOYEE NUMBER IS ENTERED WRONG:
1)  If need to use the same emp number, change emp to a different number then exit that new number.  This will leave the original number available to use.
b)  Enter employee in again as new employee with the correct SS number."

Note:  SS #s are entered without dashes between numbers (nnnnnnnnn)

Title: Want to change week ending date for Service Collec
Description: CP1677 How do I change the week ending date or the service collection period for employee service display?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select option for Personnel.
2) From Personnel select option for Serv Collection Profile.
3) Press F1 to change collection periods, tab to appropriate option and type a 'X' press enter.  OR
Press F2 to change end day.
4) Type the new end day number (1-7 and Sunday = 1) press enter.
5) The system will generate the next ending dates in the period you choose.
6) Type a 'X' in the week ending of your choice. Press enter.
NOTE:When this message displays
""NEW END DATE XX/XX/XX CAN'T BE LESS THAN CURRENT END DATE XX/XX/XX"" on the screen while you are trying to change the end day/collection period, advised location they will have to wait until the CURRENT end date to make any changes."

Title: New Manager Change
Description: CP1678 How to change STORE or SERVICE managers in your location where original manager is exiting, and new manager is hired.
Solution:
"CP1678
01. On Personnel screen go to Display existing emp and bring up the old mgr #2 or #50 - change the job desc to other than a mgr type - press enter to update. Have them void any documents started as emp # to be exited.
02. Transfer the original manager to an unused employe number.
03. Exit original manager using the new employee number.
04. Hire new manager as employe 3 Transfer if a mgr from another Goodyear ASC. Use options # 6 or 7 if new hire to Goodyear as well as new mgr."

Title: Cannot access hours - hung working
Description: CP1679 Cannot access Hours - hung working
Solution: Location needs to exit Timeclock ( F2, F8, F8) then Hours will come up

Title: DMS - ADV/EDL price changes
Description: CP1685 How do I change/delete prices on various codes that I have ADV/EDL prices already setup?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select option for Product Administration.
2) From Product Administration select option for ADV/EDL.
3) From the ADV/EDL screen press F4  update/inquire.
4) Type in the product code you want to change/delete and press enter.
5) Tab to the field to the left of the product code and type a 'C' (to change) or a 'D"" (to delete) and press enter.
6) Tab to the price field and type the new price, space out extra numbers and press enter.
NOTE: If this is a multi location dealer, they will not be able to revise or delete any codes that have a 'C' under the SRCE column,the 'C' means Corporate has set this price up and they cannot change it,  they can only change 'L' (local) ADV's or EDL's."

Title: Message Product Code Generation
Description: CP1686 How do I set up various product codes to generate with tire sales?generation
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select Product Administration.
2) From Product Administration select Message/ PC generation.
3) From Message Product Code Generation select option 1 (generation on tire sales) press enter.
4) Type the product code you want to generate, tab
5) Type the Class of Business (1,2,3,4 or A for all) tab.
6) Type a Y or N in the quantity indicator, tab.
7) Type a Y or N in the document indicator, press enter."

Title: Message generation on pos documents
Description: CP1687 How do I create a message to generate on my POS documents?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select Product Administration.
2) From Product Administration select Message/PC generation.
3) From Message/PC generation select option 4, Message generation.
4) Type the message you want to generate on your documents. Tab.
NOTE: You can only create a maximun of 3 messages in all.
5) Type a Y or N in the next four fields. Tab.
NOTE: You must indicate a Y in either Work order OR Final Total OR both, one HAS to have a Y.  You must indicate a Y in either Service Sales OR Tire Sales OR both, one has to have a Y.
6) Type in the class of business or A for all, press enter."

Title: Message/PC Generation - Deletions
Description: CP1688 How do I stop service or product codes from generating on Point of sale invoices?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu, select the option for Product Administration.
2) Select the option for Message/PC Generation.
3) Select the appropriate file that is generating the product or service code in error.
4) In that file, select the line # to delete and press enter, to bring down the line data.
5) Press the F7 Delete key.
6) Press F7 again to confirm and delete the line, or press F8 to exit & not delete the line."

Title: Change triad labor rate
Description: CP1689 How do we change triad labor guide rate?
Solution:
"1.From Main Menu select the option for Product Administration.
2.From Product Administration select the option for Triad Maintenance.
3.From Triad Maintenance select the option for Labor Guide Constants  Setup.
4.Tab to Host Down or Standalone Default Labor Rate.: and enter the new labor rate per hour.
5.Press F7 Change
6.Press Esc twice.
7.Type a ""Y"" and press enter to message Do you want to back up your labor constants file to Akron? (Y/N)
8.Press F8 to end.
9.Exit to login and log back in to activate the change."

****YOU SHOULD ADVISE LOCATION HOUR LABOR RATE NEEDS TO BE CHANGED IN LOCATION PROF (PROF) AS WELL.  IF THE LOCATION IS USING PARTS LABOR VERIFY IN TRIAD TO ESTABLISH LABOR IN POS, POS WILL USE THE HOUR LABOR RATE SET IN TRIAD MAINTENANCE.  THIS CAN CAUSE TECHNICIANS ESD AND ESU'S TO BE INCORRECTLY PAID.  ALSO IF LOCATION PROF AND TMNTE ARE NOT IN SYNC THE SYSTEM WILL SYNC THEM DURING MAINTENANCE TO WHAT IS IN LOCATION PROFILE****

Title: Dealer product file additions
Description: CP1690 Adding Dealer product codes to product administration gets " FUNCTION KEY INVALID" when we press F3 to add DPF.
Solution:
"DPF can only be added from the CORP store.
If this is a remote store , have them call Corporate office to add the code."

Title: Paid Out - deletion
Description: CP1691 How do I delete a Paid Out?
Solution:
"1) Enter the Line # you want to delete and tab to next field and type D and press enter. This will change the line to VOIDED.
2) You will have to PRINT this even if the only line showing is voided."

Title: Paid Out - Revision must be completed
Description: CP1692 Why am I getting "revision must be completed" trying to delete a line item on paid outs?
Solution:
"1) Have the location RE-ENTER the line they are trying to delete as it shows above.  They need to re-enter the code,
qty (if entered), amount, invoice # (if entered), vendor and B1/RBL (if entered).  Press ENTER.
2) Type the Line # of the line that needs deleted and TAB to Qty and type D and press ENTER.  The line will show ""VOIDED ITEM""
The problem is they brought the line down and entered a D in the Qty field, spaced out the rest of the information,  pressed enter and received the message."

Title: Amount Invalid on Paid Out
Description: CP1694 AMOUNT IS INVALID message coming up doing a paid out for a check after typing N for CASH
Solution:
"PAID OUTS are for paying CASH out of the drawer or taking CASH or CHECK in for returned merchandise.
Do a QUICK CHECK to pay for merchandise by a check."

Title: How to Void a Parts Paid Out
Description: CP1695 Posted Parts bill in Paidouts instead of Vendor Payables. How do I delete this invoice from pending Parts Paidouts?
Solution: Go to Paid Outs then select Parts Paid Out & Enter.  Find the invoice to delete and enter a V in select column and press enter. It will ask if you are sure you want to delete?  Answer Y and enter.

Title: Report Retention
Description: CP1697 Print Akron Report Retention
Solution:
"The guide lines for reports being deleted from the system is:
   7 DAYS FOR PRINTED REPORTS
 37 DAYS FOR UNPRINTED REPORTS

The guidelines for security reports being deleted from the system is:
    37 DAYS

** Company Owned Outlets needing copies of reports:
Have the location call 796-2121 and ask for Dave Sitko in Retail Operations.

** Dealers needing copies of reports should contact 1-800-943-4267 Dealer Accounting.

** Brad Ragan locations needing copies of reports should contact the Charlotte Office."

Title: How to retain history on National Accounts
Description: CP1698 How do I retain history on National Accounts?
Solution:
"The first step is to go into Delivery Receipt Administration Menu and choose option 1 D/R History Admin.
Once on the screen verify the parameters and make any changes then press enter to activate history and then F8 to end.
At this point in time you can either add customers through the normal d/r process or through D/R Customer/Vehicle Management on the D/R Administration Option 2."

Title: ROM - Reason Codes
Description:
CP1701 "Need Reason Codes for ROM
Quantity received does not match the quantity shipped, lost shipment, merchandise damaged, etc."
Solution:
"Use the Help Screen by placing the cursor in the RSN field then press F12.
The Reason Codes are:
   A - Shortage on Delivery - B/L signed short
   B - Shortage on Delivery - B/L not signed short
   C - Offsetting Shipping Error
   D - Damaged on Delivery - B/L noted
   E - Concealed Damage
   F - Billing Error
   G - Lost Shipment
   O - Other"

Title: Received Tires not on Packing List
Description: CP1702 Received tires and they are not on the packing list.  How do I bring these tires in to my inventory.
Solution:
"Depending on the senario of problem if a location receives additional or different tires than originally ordered:
On Receipt of Merchandise, Display Pend`g lines press F6 Write-ins and type the correct product code in + quantity received. If offsetting shipment (Reason code ""C"") is used."

Title: Receipt Shipment not on Pending List
Description: CP1703 Need to receipt tire shipment that is not on pending shipment list.
Solution:
"Use option 1 from the Receipt of Mdse menu ""Manual for Goodyear and Payable Vendors"".  Use Vendor #1 for Goodyear Tire Shipments.

If the pending shipment appears on the Pending Shipment screen it will clear on its own within 2 weeks or the location can process the receipt with zeros in Qty of all tires manually receipted.

Title: DMS - Receipting Mdse from another Dealer
Description: CP1704 Dealer receipting merchandise received from one of their other locations (TC 11) or another Goodyear Dealer/Store (TC 71).
Solution: Use option 4 Miscellaneous (Transfers, etc).  The location must know the 4 digit Terr# of the location the merchandise has been received from.

Title: COO - Receipting Mdse from another COO
Description: CP1705 Company Owned Outlet receipting merchandise received from another Company Owned Outlet (TC 11).
Solution: Use option 4 Miscellaneous (Transfers, etc).  The location must know the 4 digit Terr# of the location the merchandise has been received from.

Title: Dealer Freight Claim Processing
Description: CP1706 Need to issue a Freight Claim the Freight Company lost the tire shipment for a dealer.Logistics
Solution:
"Before utilizing this option the location must have:
RECEIPT THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT AS CORRECT
01. Type drcus (from the Main Menu)
02. Press F3 (to add ""Bill To"")
03. Type the following information in:
Customer /Terr  194980
Credit Auth# B-96
PO# Znnnnnn103196 (""Z"", plus 6 digit number, on space, then a 6 digit date ...NO DASHSor SLASHES)
Bill to:
Logistics Concepts
2210 Front St
Cuyahoga Falls, Oh  44221
Ship To:
same as above.
04. Fax or mail a copy of the freight bill/delivery receipt, packing list showing the number of pieces etc.  Fax number = 330-945-4547."

Title: Reprint of ROM
Description: CP1707 How do I reprint the (ROM) Receipt of Merchandise document?
Solution:
"1) Do you know the receipt number?
  If no, from Main Menu type in scid of
DAT and find the document #.
  Name is Inv Mgt - Reciept Mdse
2) From Main Menu select Inventory Administration.
3) From Inventory Administration select Receipt of Merchandise option, press ENTER.
4) Type your employee #, tab, type the option # to reprint document, press ENTER.
5) Type in the Receipt # and press ENTER.  The receipt prints."
6) Can be reprinted same day only....

Title: PROM- negative quantity adjustment
Description: CP1708 How do I correct my negative quantity on hand parts report?
Solution:
"To correct negative quantities you can do one of the following:
A) Receipt pending parts in PROM / Process Vendor payment. OR
B) Adjust inventory quantity on hand to current quantity. OR
C) Adjust inventory quantity on hand to zero (0)."

Title: Inventory corrections
Description: CP1710 Inventory corrections
Solution:
"Stores:
1) Go to Inventory Administration and select Receipt of Merchandise option.
2) Select Option # 6 for inventory adjustments
3) Enter the difference quantity to change the unit count currently on Salesaid to meet the expected units on hand.

Dealer:
1) Go to Inventory Administration and select option for Inventory Corrections.
2) Select option for Screen only
3) Enter the difference quantity to change the unit count currently on Salesaid to meet the expected units on hand."

Title: Finalize physical inventory
Description: CP1711 How to finalize the physical inventory
Solution:
"From the main menu select the option for Inventory administration then
Select the option for Physical Inventory
Select the option for Physical preprint entry.
Hit the F2 totals key.
Hit the F6 final key (the system prints the inventory adjustment report which is the adjustments made to your screen from your count).
Then the screen asks ""Have you entered all the preprinted write ins an pending adjusments Y/N.  If you answer Y then another message appears ""To update sales aid now press F1 to update after end of day press enter""
They probably want to press enter or the system will be unusable for a period of time.  The phy inventory is now finalized"

Title: Set Phy Inventory indicators & print pads
Description: CP1712 Wants to take a month end physical inventory and print pads.
Solution:
"Advised go to inventory administration then to pysical inventory then to physical control and answer 'y' to the question do you want to take a month end inventory hit enter
Answer  Cycle A for tires B for parts or both hit enter and system should say phy  inventory indicators set.

Select option ""physical print pads"" option and select desired option.  On the cycle ""A"" enter page 1 thru 99.  System will print only the number of pages loaded in the customer file.  Print one ""write in"" page and one ""adjustment to pyhsical count page."

Title: Physical Inventory Entry
Description: CP1713 How do I enter my inventory?
Solution:
"Post the inventory count to the preprinted pads then enter the count into the system.
Go to inventory administration,
Choose the option physical inv
then choose phy preprint entry and it asks cycle A or B(Dealer) or Cycle 1,2,3(Store).
Choose a cycle (a tires or b parts) and the screen pops up that is in the same format as the preprint pads.
Start entering the units - only put unit cost in when they want to change the average cost.  What they put in as a unit cost will be the new average cost.   If they dont put in a cost the system will put the existing average cost in.
Next enter write ins that are prod codes not on the preprinted pads, enter these units on the write in entry pages
Enter any adjustments to the inventory on the adjustment pages"

Title: Physical write-ins and adjustment corrections
Description: CP1714 How do I correct a mis-entered write-in or adjustment line?
Solution:
"1) Determine the line # that needs corrected.
2) Enter the line #, then press tab twice.
3) Type the correct quantity - if they wish to clear the line and create a new one, enter zero, then tab.
4) Type the cost as it appears on the line you are correcting. Press enter.

This will update the units correctly for a Quantity error. If they mis-entered the prod code or the cost, they must zero the line, per above, and re-enter as a new line entry."

Title: Physical adjustments entry
Description: CP1715 How do I know whether to enter the adjustment as a positive or a negative quantity?
Solution:
"All adjustments will affect only the ""book"" for a product - it never affects the final sales aid units total on screen.

Here`s how to know if minus or plus is to be entered:
1) Received the merchandise before cutoff, and did not clear the WDR (weekly document register) or Kdoc = MINUS units.
2) Cleared the WDR or Kdoc, and had not received the merchandise = PLUS units.

If your inquiry is beyond these procedures, indicate you reviewed this & update the report, then send to Support."

Title: Retail Store - Freight Claim Processing-Retail - L
Description: CP1716 Need to issue a Freight Claim the Freight Company lost the tire shipment for a Retail store.Logistics
Solution:
"Ref retail letter 97-20
Before utilizing this option the location must have:
**  Zeroed out the tires under option 2 Automatic Goodyear Shipment using reason code ""A"".
01. Type drcus (from the Main Menu)
02. Press F3 (to add ""Bill To"")
03. Type the following information in:
Customer /Terr  194980
Credit Auth# B-96
PO# nnnnnnnnnn  (from Invoice/AN Number column on WDR)
Bill to:
Logistics Concepts
2210 Front St
Cuyahoga Falls, Oh  44221
Ship To:
same as above.
02. Fax or mail a copy of the freight bill/Bill of Lading (Packing Slip) showing # of pieces and merch shipped and a copy of the TC71.  Fax number = 330-945-4547.

After these two steps have been completed the location can then go into option 7 Freight Claims from the ROM menu, verify their Stock Control Point, type in the shipment number and the invoice # of the Freight Claim Invoice.
The system will display all lines from the requested shipment number.  Have the location enter in the quantity that was billed on the Freight Claim Invoice on any line that applies and print the Freight Claim.  This document will update the locations Sales Aid screen appropriately.

NOTE:  This option is used to update the locations Sales Aid screen by increasing the quantity on hand due to the issuance of the Freight Claim Invoice (Point of Sale) that reduced the quantity on hand."

Title: Parts price corrections
Description: CP1717 How to change from one price  to another , when parts prices change.
Solution:
"Have the location pull all freon off of invoices/DR's, paid outs and Vendor Payables.
01. Print the parts Aid for MFC = .FR (from POS) F9
02. Type PROM from the MMenu
03. Type 1 (List Pending Receipts) press enter
04. Press F9 (List Line Detail)
05. Type AAAD (vendor # 7XXX)
06. Press F9 (Line Detail)
07. Type CORRECTION (in SHIP #), press enter
08. Tab to ""QTY""
09. Type the negative qty , press tab
10. Type .FR (in MFC field), press tab
11. Type in the part # needing to change,(per Parts Aid Print), press enter (to display the line)
12. Type the positive qty , press tab
13. Type .FR (in MFC), press tab
14. Type in the part # needing to change,(per Parts Aid Print),
15. Tab to PGROUP
16. Type FREON , press tab twice
17. Type new list price, press tab
18. Type new cost, press enter
This will display a second line, reposting stock at correct cost/price.
19. Press F6 (FINAL), press enter
20. Type P (PRINT/FINAL), press enter
[end]"

Title: Physical Inventory - no entry screens
Description: CP1718 Why are the physical entry screens not showing when selected?
Solution: If the location has not printed the Physical pads, they are not displayed, as they create the screens of entry to match the pads. Have the location select the Physical Print Pads opt #2 & select #1, print all pads. If no Service parts pad prints, then also select opt 4 to print them as well. Opt #5 thru #8 also must be printed to create the "open" write-ins and adjustments screens.

Title: Inventory - "Sales B50 not complete"
Description: CP1719 Why is the system stopping me from entering my physical counts to the pre-printed screens, with the error message "Sales B50 not complete"?  Stores only not dealers
Solution: This error message indicates they have not finalized the Physical Cutoff" End of Day. As they attempt to complete the End of Day, the system will ask " Is this your Physical Inventory cutoff? They must answer yes to this question to "freeze" the sales aid screens to allow posting into the preprinted entry screens. Secondarily, they may ask if this cutoff finalizes the inventory, and the answer is no, it only fereezes screen counts so comparison can be made for the physical count they are taking onto the pads. If the location answered "no" to the physical cutoff, they must run another "Zero" eodco, that will require it to cutoff for physical count.

Title: Reprint Parts Manifest
Description: CP1723 How do I reprint the Vendor Payable Parts Payment Manifest?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select the option for Vendor/Payables or scid VENPA and press ENTER.
2) Select option 3 for Vendor Payments or scid PRVPA, press ENTER.
3) Type the Emp #, TAB, type option 3 Parts Payment, press ENTER.
4) A question will display ""Reprint Parts Register Y/N?""  Type 'Y',  press ENTER.
5) A request to ""Enter Sequence Number to be Reprinted"" will appear. Type the 3 digit DBS sequence # and press ENTER. The Manifest will print.
If they do not know the DBS SEQ #, from Main Menu advise to select the option to Display Audit Trail or scid is DAT press ENTER.
The DBS Seq # displays on the top line of the screen, it is a 3 digit #."

Title: Received credit from Parts Vendor
Description: CP1724 I received a credit from a Parts Vendor, how do I process this credit?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select option for Vendor/Payables or scid VENPA, press ENTER.
2) From Vendor/Payables menu select option for Vendor Payments or scid PRVPA, press ENTER.
3) Type Emp #, TAB, type option 2, press ENTER.
4) Press F9 (line detail) type the Vendor #, press ENTER.
5) Press F9 (line detail) type the invoice #, TAB, type inv date, TAB, type due date, TAB. type minus (-) dollar amount, press ENTER.
6) Tab to Qty, type minus (-) Qty, TAB, type MFC, TAB, type PART #, TAB, type PCOST, TAB, type LIST, TAB, type ""0"" in CV field, TAB to PGRP and type the pgroup, TAB, type the DESC. and press ENTER.
7) Press F7 to SAVE, type 'S', press ENTER.
The credit has been entered and can be selected to process when the debit entries for the vendor are greater than the credit."

Title: Change vendor type
Description: CP1725 Error message "Cannot change payable vendor, because vendor has a history".
Solution:
"YOU CANNOT CHANGE A PAYABLE VENDOR TO A NON-PAYABLE VENDOR AS LONG AS THERE IS HISTORY OUT THERE FOR THAT VENDOR.  IF THEY RECONCILE CHECKS,  WHICH,  IF THEY DO, WILL SHOW A ""Y"" ON LOC PROFILE UNDER CHECK REC, THEY WILL HAVE TO RECONCILE THE CHECKS FOR THAT VENDOR .  LOC PROFILE ALSO SHOWS CHECK HISTORY AND THEY PROBABLY HAVE A ""12"" (FOR 12 MONTHIS HISTORY).   THEY PROBABLY HAVE 12 MONTHS  SHOWING ON VENDOR MAINT FOR THAT VENDOR ALSO.
THEY WILL HAVE TO GO INTO VENDOR MAINT FOR THAT PARTICULAR VENDOR AND...
A.  PUT A ""1"" IN THE CHECK HISTORY FIELD (FOR  1 MONTH).
THEY HAVE TO DO THREE MORE THINGS:
1.   RECONCILE THEIR CHECKS (IF THEY HAVE REC CHECKS AS A"" Y"" ON LOC PROFILE).
2.   CHANGE HISTORY ON VENDOR MAINTANCE SCREEN TO ""1"".
3.  LET MAINT RUN  AFTER MAKING THOSE CHANGES. THE HISTORY WILL BE GONE.  THEY CAN NOW CHANGE THE VENDOR TO A ""NON-PAYABLE VENDOR"

Title: FET charges on Vendor invoice
Description:
CP1727 FET charges on Vendor invoice
Federal Excise Tax: How do you bill excise tax on a quick or payables check?"
Solution: Bill Excise Tax on a separate line using code 15000 and the total FET dollar amount.

Title: Payables invoice doubled
Description: CP1728 Why has the bill entered into Vendor Payables doubled in amount?
Solution:
Chances are the user has inadvertently entered the bill twice under the same invoice #.
To correct they must enter a reverse (credit or debit) invoice using the same invoice # and same due date as the original bill.
Be careful - if this entry was for a parts purchase, using accounting code 11900 or prod dept 219, do exactly as stated above.

However, if the entry is for a local tire purchase, they would need to using accounting code 40900 for the total reversal amt  using the same invoice # and same due date as the original bill.
Then to correct the quantity of tires, use inventory corrections, book & screen, if tire units cost entry was affected.

Title: Payables Checks - Manual or Computer print
Description: CP1729 When trying to final print a Payables checks run, what does it mean by " All checks are not manual - Continue?"
Solution:
The user has created a batch of bills to pay various vendors and has modified them for manual check information posting, as they likely are writing checks manually, not printing them via the GBMS computer check print program.

In this process they have not updated all of the vendors selected with this manual data and need to review all vendors that were selected for this run of checks.
On Modify Pay/Change Check Type option, select vendor and press F2 change type to post the missing manual info.

Title: Quick Check - Invalid Bank ID
Description: CP1731 What does the error message " Invalid Bank ID" mean when trying to enter a Quick Check?
Solution:
This error message indicates that the dealer has not identified their local bank through which they handle their checking account.
 Have the location access the option# 15 "A/P Bank Profile" on Vendor Payables menu.
Setup a new a 10000 account and type in the 3-position Alpha characters indicative of the bank they use, tab, and type the Bank full name in the appropriate fields and press enter.
When the line appears above, select it and press enter to bring the line down to modify.
Then press F1 Default, to set it up as the default account - it will show the Bank ID at the top now.
They can now return to handle the Quick Check.

Title: Print Direct Deposit/Mastercheck or Reprint
Description: CP1739 How to print a direct deposit or master check and also how to reprint
Solution:
To print the Direct Deposit or Mastercheck that was never printed"
From Main Menu, select Accounts Receivable, 10
Then select AR Payments, 01
Select the option (Direct Dep or Mastercheck) and press enter.
When the Direct Deposit or Mastercheck screen displays, Press F7 print.
You will be prompted to answer the question "Do you want to print the Direct Deposit or Mastercheck?". Answer Y and press enter.

To reprint a Direct Deposit or Mastercheck that has already been printed:
Goto AR Payment screen,
Enter your employee #,
Select the document type to reprint and press F7 Reprint.
You will be prompted to type the document # (888xxx-Direct Deposit #, or 999xxx-Mastercheck #, where xxx = the Daily Business Sequence #, both found in the current Daily Audit Trail) and press enter to execute the reprint
(Updated 10/18/11)

Title: Class of Business chgs on existing A/R accts (COO)
Description: CP1740 How do I have the Class of Business changed if incorrect on an existing A/R account?
Solution: Store locations are under Akron Credit Controls and these updates must be applied by the Dunn & Bradstreet Co(1-877-567-2067) and the changes are updated by the host through maintenance and transmissions to correct their accounts (generally 2-3 days after the change has been made). (Updated 10/18/11)

Title: Mastercheck-Wrong check amount entered
Description: CP1741 Example:  Was in Mastercheck and entered in the check amount without a decimal. Should have been $31.80 and entered as$3180.00.  Now showing I must give customer back $3148.20.  How to correct? I also paid off line for $31.80.  ($3180.00 minus $31.80 = the difference $3148.20
Solution:
The difference (3148.20) is the amount left in unapplied after paying off the line.
Pull up Mastercheck again and enter in same check number and tab to the check amount and enter in the difference as a negative amount ($-3148.20).
Tab to the payment amount and enter in same  minus amount again. Press enter.  you will receive the message "Correction has been processed".
Press F1 Next Account and pull up the same account and you will have a positive line item of $3148.20, and an unapplied amount of $3148.20.  Press enter.
The Unapplied money will move to APP Amt field.
Cursor will go to the line item field. Enter that line we created and press F2 pay by line. It should clear the line to 0 and the APP to 0.  Press F7 Save/Print.
(Updated 10/18/11)

Title: Direct Dep processed as Cash Rec or Master Check
Description: CP1742 Processed a cash receipt or master check that should have been a direct deposit
Solution:
Dealer processed a Mastercheck or a Cash/Check Receipt that should have been processed as a Direct Deposit.
This creates a shortage on the End of Day Cutoff because they do not have a check to deposit.
The solution is to do the End of Day Cutoff and accept the loss, which creates an automatic accounting entry debiting 50800 and crediting 10000.
This is easily corrected by issuing a Standard Journal Ticket, crediting 50800 and debiting 10000 for the same amount that was a "loss".
They should make a notation on the End of Day that was short as to what happened and attach a copy of the Standard Journal Ticket to that End of Day Cutoff.
(Updated 10/18/11)

Title: Alternate session error
Description:
CP1744  Why is the system giving me an error message ""ORA-00100 CONFIG login error - vtxx""?   -  OR -
NNNN/Home/GBMS/$  on blank screen
(NNNN = terr # of locn)"
Solution: User inadvertently pressed Ctrl + Alt + F2 ... or F3 on the keyboard.                                                                               IF MAXPEED:  press Ctrl +  Alt + H to return to active session.  IF CPU:   press Ctrl +  Alt + F1.

Title: Tire adjustment on mdse verify
Description: CP1748 Why does the system give the error message " must adjust on merchandise verify" when trying to adjust certain tires on product adjustment screen and how is this done?
Solution:
?	Some tires may have not been setup in the itemfile to allow adjustment credit to be issued through the PACS screens and the message "adjust on merchandise verify" directs you to perform it on merchandise verify, such as certain EMT Run-Flat tires that are ineligible for PACS or new market tires that have not yet been added to the table.

?	These adjustments may be handled as follows:

?	 You must delete the entry in the Tread Depth field on PACS, and then press F6 Mdse Verify.

?	Type the product code, the positive quantity of tires to be adjusted, the adjusted price in Parts Price field based upon the percentage of tread-wear, (i.e., 5/32 remaining from original tread depth 11/32 = 45%), and BC "B".

?	Tab to the "SD/GS/AN" field and type the G-346 claim form number, and press enter.

?	The system will anticipate the same tire in replacement, and will automatically select it from stocked inventory and "buries" it in the line item just entered.

?	If the customer prefers another tire for replacement, you must enter a second line for the same product code with minus quantity, Billing Code "X", at full value to return the automatically mis-selected tire back to stocked inventory and, then, on a 3rd line, enter the preferred replacement product code and quantity, generating Billing Code "R" on it?s own. Any difference in price is the customer?s responsibility.

?	The G-346 manual claim form must be completed & returned with the tire to CID for credit to be issued. scrape

Screen Shots: file://akrshare01/share/nat/GBMS\GBMS\DLRREL\Common%20Problems\Common%20Problem%201748%20with%20screenshots.doc

Title: Dunlop pricing
Description: CP1754 Being billed invoice from Dunlop for tires at $53.371 each.   He is unable to bring in pricing with more than 2 digits after the decimal point.  If he increases or decreases the price by a penny per tire, it is not matching the invoice.  How does he receipt in the Dunlop tires?
Solution:
"Per Pat Snethan:
Enter thru Quick Check and enter the price WITHOUT the third figure after the decimal point (ie one line had 8 @ 53.371..enter as 53.37) then on the last entry of the quick check enter account code 40900 with the monetary difference, in this case it is only   .94."

Title: No Invoices this morning
Description:
CP1764 "Users didn't get Invoices today. (They normally receive them)

Modified 10/08/2013
Solution:
If today is Monday, then no Invoices were scheduled to get loaded today in Tire-HQ.  If not a Monday ... Invoices didn't get loaded on Tire-HQ early this morning.  Please advise users that  Invoices should be back on Tire-HQ sometime this am.  When we are in the process of loading them, we will "Disable" the Invoice feature.

Disabling the invoice feature will cause printing DR problems.  Please advise locations to print their delivery receipts when the invoice function has been enabled again.

Title: How to turn triad off/on
Description: CP1784 How do I turn triad off/on? and why?
Solution:
"If a dealer says he should have triad and it is not on, need to first check with Mike Gron in Dlr Relations to confirm whether or not user is truly signed up.  Once confirmed, follow the instructions below to turn triad off/on:

1.  Telnet onto the location
2.  From the # prompt type:   plus    (enter)
3.  From the > sign type :  @utriad  (enter)

Screen will show the following:
DOC> Enter I(ntegrated), S(tand-alone) or B(lank) to set      triad indicator.
DOC>*/TRIAD indicator:
(enter  ""I"" if on PIMS, ""S"" if it is a dealer NOT on PIMS, or ""B"" if not on Triad at all.

If turning off triad (entered ""B"" in triad indicator field), you will see a display on the screen showing what location's indicator was previously and what it is after your change:

LCTRIAD before = I    LCPARTS before = Y
PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.
Commit complete.
press enter to continue....
LCTRIAD after = I    LCPARTS after = Y
4.  Sign off of the location and triad should be off/on.
Advise user accordingly, may need to logout/ login GBMS sessions to see change.

****Also, send a note via email or via EA report to NETWORK to ensure the proper indicators are marked on the Mainframe for location re: triad usage.****"

Title: Doc in use (DR)
Description: CP1794  Error "Document in use" when I try to select from pending or by document #?
Solution:
"There is a known problem where the record is locked and needs to be corrected before user can access it.

Before unlocking the dr check logfile to see if there are any errors.
From the # sign type view /logfile
Shift :q to go to the bottom of the file then page up a to see if you see any error.   If any errors send to level 2 and if not unlock the dr
From  the SQL> type  @ulock and follow the  process .
stay on the line with the user to see if they can access and complete the dr

If it doesn`t correct the problem, send the report to Level 2 for referral to Development for correction and advice to user."

Title: Printer will not print
Description: CP1795  Why will my printer not print ?
Solution:
Check printer # assigned for the workstation to determine if caller is sending print to the correct printer?
1)  Select Admin from the Homepage.
2)  Go to Printer Functions and select 'Set GBMS Printer' to verify caller is actually using the printer shown.

If location needs to change the default printer:
1)  Use the drop down and select the required default printer.
2)  Exit out of all gbms functions ... then access them again so the newly selected printer is recognized as the default printer.

If a laser is still not printing:
1)  Walk the caller through accessing Admin from the Homepage.
2)  Select 'Printer Functions.'
3)  Select 'Reset Print Server.'
Result:  The printer should start printing if there are jobs waiting in the queue.

If a printer is still not printing:
1)  Telnet onto location.
2)  From Support Main Menu, Select Option 9 -  Utilities Menu.
3)  Select Option 13 - Printer Menu.
4)  Select Option 2 - Reset Printer Services.
5)  Answer 'Y'.
Result:  The printer should start printing if there are jobs waiting in the queue.

If printer still not printing, check to see if the printer is disabled.
1)  Telnet into the location.
2)  From Support Main Menu, Select Option 9 -  Utilities Menu.
3)  Select Option 13 - Printer Menu.
4)  Select Option 3 - Enable Printer.
5)  Key in the name of the printer to enable, i.e. laser5
Result:  The printer should start printing if there are jobs waiting in the queue.

If still not printing, try the following:
1)  Telnet into the location.
2)  From Support Main Menu, Select Option 9 -  Utilities Menu.
3)  Select Option 13 - Printer Menu.
4)  Select Option 4 -  Disable Printer.
5)  Now location needs to:   power the printer off, reseat the network cable in the printer, power the printer back on.
6)  Select Option 3 - Enable Printer.
7)  Select Option 2 - Reset Printer Services.  Answer 'Y'.
Result:  The printer should start printing if there are jobs waiting in the queue.

If printer(s) still not printing, send report to HW/Comm.

Title: Account being updated on another terminal
Description: CP1797 Why does system say "Account being updated on another terminal" or "Account in use on another screen try again later"?
Solution:
Make sure location is not using A/R options.

1. Log onto the Smenu

2. Select Option 2-Work with database (plus)  - press enter

3.  Select option 2- Run plus - press enter

4.  From the SQL> prompt, type: @sdocq - press enter..if documents are backed up waiting to complete,then...

5. From the SQL> prompt, type:  !loadcomp and press enter

6. From the SQL> prompt, type: @sdocq - press enter..if documents are still not clearing out, then forward the problem to Level 3 for resolution. If they are clearing out, then...

7.  From the SQL> prompt, type:  select * from arlocklg;    - press enter (if the account is locked it will show the account #)

8.  From the SQL> prompt, type:  !rtsoradyn ARCNCL2 (the ARCNCL2 must be in caps) - press enter

9.  From # prompt type:  exit

10.  Log out of the location.

11.  Call the location and advise them that the account is unlocked now.  Also, advise them that a printout indicating the account was NOT updated will print.  Advise the location to check the balance of the account that was being updated.  The location will likely have to re-enter the previously attempted payment as normal. (Updated 07/18/14)

Title: Statements in Tire-HQ
Description:

Modified 11/15/2007 dm"

Advise user that the training viewlet should be reviewed prior to attempting this new function in Tire-HQ.  Assist user in viewing, saving, and/or printing their statement(s). NOTE: GBMS3 users will only have the capibility to view their statement."

Solution: You can not longer use dept 666 and 667 (dunlop) on ROM .  You must use dept 26x or 29x codes.    You can only use dept 666 and 667 on pos.
