Title: Can't remember security password
Description: CP1816  Employee 2 (store manager COO only) (Emp 3 -Just Tires) can't remember their password setup for security reports.
Solution:
"When an employee calls to request what the password is or if they max out their attempts (5 tries), sign on and turn off security.

Telnet onto the location.
From the $ prompt type plus (enter)
From the > type @usecure (enter)
Follow the prompts on the screen by putting in N to turn security off.
Have them logout out of all options in task bar and security will be turned off.
 Have the employee access Security, ASSIGN PASSWORDS, then DEFINE EMPLOYEE ACCESS (enter all A's on MAIN MENU), then  turn security back on."

Title: Plant Code Invalid Message
Description: CP1818 Why, when trying to validate registration numbers for Foreign Brand Tire adjustments, including Ameraan, am I getting plant code invalid?
Solution: Due to changes made, it is now trying to validate all Plant codes. Not all are entered in file.   Per Useability, a send will be going down in a few days to eliminate the system checking plant codes for Foreign Brand tires. It will just let them go thru. Pilots first, then will be released.  Work around is just to Fudge the plant code with a valid plant code(everyone should have the list in lotus) and then hand write the correct registration on all copies of inv.

Title: Goodyear Card customer payment deduction
Description: CP1819 How to enter Direct Deposit deduction for in-store customer payments on the Goodyear credit card?
Solution:
Enter the NEGATIVE direct deposit amount and press ENTER.
The msg "Correction has processed" will appear on the screen.
Press F7 to Save/Print.
This will create a DEBIT line item on the credit card file.
Secondly, go back into the Direct Deposit option for the Goodyear Card and press ENTER  to get the cursor to the "line" field at the bottom of the screen.
Identify the customer payment credit line(s) being deducted, enter the line number and press F2 (Pay By Line) placing the amount in Unapplied Cash.
Then select the DEBIT line created by the negative direct deposit entry and press F2 to pay off line which will show the line as 0 and the unapplied will be reduced by that amount.
Press F7 Save/Print.

Title: Login Serious Error
Description:
CP1822 "User getting message "Serious Error" ""Login error using customer: 00xxxxxxxx !(xxx=nonsig#)   Please go Back and Try Again!""

Modified 10/16/2007"
Solution:
Dealer's nonsig might be ""Inactive"" now. Check the Nonsig in LN Customers database.

Verify the comments on WAD page and act accordingly. (Credit Hold = Credit Rep, Legal Hold = Legal Dept., Closure or Sale = Goodyear Rep, etc.)

If location is ""Inactive"", advise them to contact their Goodyear Rep for answers.
If the nonsig is active ... verify the common owner is the same common owner listed in User reg & XPLORUsers DBase.
If the common owner has changed, update the XPLORUsers & User Registration

Modified
03/02/2011 - MEP

Title: New Defective Adjustment
Description: CP1823  How do I process a New Defective Tire Adjustment?
Solution:
"1)  Start an invoice from the Point of Sale menu using Emp #1, the stores name / address as the customer, and COB 2.

2)  Select the F-key for the Adjustment screen.

3)  On the adjustment screen tab to the ""Special Info"" field and type in ""New Defective"" .

4)  TAB to the adjustment type and type ""B"".

5)  TAB to the product code field and type in the product code of the tire being adjusted.

6)  Tab to the tread depth and enter the full tread depth of the tire.

7)  Tab to the purchase date and enter todays date and Press ENTER.

8)  Tab to the Condition Field (GI) and enter the condition of the tire. Fill out the rest of the fields and Press ENTER.

FYI: Do NOT space out the replacement product code as this is what takes the new defective tire out of their inventory.

9.)  If the tire tax is charging at doc total:  Press F4 and change the Tax Status Field to a 3 and when the exemption screen comes up you must choose opt 1 for resale.    This will take off the tire tax if it is charging it on doc total."

Title: Payment Applied to Wrong Account
Description:
CP1824  Payment Applied to Wrong Account

Payment applied to the wrong a/r account.  Need to apply to the correct account."
Solution:
There are 3 steps to this process.
If you need to give the customer a receipt or the customer originally paid with cash use the Cash/Check Receipt option. If you do not need a receipt and the customer paid by check in the mail, use the Mastercheck option.

1. On the payment screen for the A/R account the money was originally applied to, type in a negative check or cash amount (depending on how the customer originally paid) as entered on the original cash receipt.
Type in a negative payment amount as entered on the original cash receipt. Press enter.
A message ""Correction has been processed"" will display. Press F7 Save/Print.
This creates a positive line item on the account.

2. Now you need to clear the line item you just created.
Go back into the same A/R account. On the payment screen, press enter and the cursor goes to line# field.
Find the line the money was originally applied to.
The line will most likely be in closed items (F4) or on the current open item screen. It could also be in the App Amt field, if the original payment was never applied to a line item (If this is true just enter the line # created by step 1 and press F2 Pay by Line. Then print the receipt and go to step 3).
Type in the line number and a negative amount (original receipt amount) to bring the line items back to the original balance.  Press enter.
This will put the amount in the App Amt field. Do this to all lines that were paid in error. The amount in APP Amt should match the line we created on the negative doc.
Find the line item created by step 1 above.  Type in the line number and press F2 Pay by Line.
This line should now show a zero balance. Press F7 Save/Print.

3. Now bring up the account the payment should have been applied to and process a normal payment receipt.
NOTE: If a closed item was opened up in step 2 it will not show as an open item until the receipt is printed or saved and the account is accessed again.
(SC Updated 10/18/11)

Title: Quick/Easy Inventory Entry - DEALERS
Description: CP1827  How to  enter tires with cost that are purchased from wholesale dealers on the WD purchase plan.
Solution:
"1) Process a Book & Screen inventory correction entering product code, number of units and the EACH cost.  This will create an accounting entry, debiting inventory and crediting Mdse Over/short code 42800, which will reflect as a profit to the P or L.
2) Issue a std Jt. debiting 42800 (eliminating the false profit) and moving it via offsetting credit to liability account 25400, Account Payable Other.
3) When the bill comes due, simply issue a QUICK CHECK to 25400 for the amount to be paid, taking into consideration any cash discount being taken."

CP1866  Parts pads in use

Why does the Parts Stocking Level pad or Parts Order pad say "" pad in use"" when I try to bring it up?"

Title: USPS VIP Program
Description: CP1872 User needs to know how to enroll in USPS program, or check updates in that program.
Solution: USPS program can be accessed by clicking on Dealer Programs>USPS EMPLOYEE VIP PROGRAM

Title: Time is invalid
Description: CP1879  How do I correct the time on my workstation?
Solution: Customer can move to time in lower right corner of screen and left mouse click to correct the time at each workstation.

Title: G3 EXPRESS Gdyr statement credits
Description: CP1884 Where does the Goodyear statement credit, issued from the Corp credit department, book in GBMS and how do I get it applied to my WD vendor?
Solution: The Corp credit memo credits Accts Pay Gdyr, 25000 and debits Misc Sales/Office Exp, 50800.  Process an A/P input (invoice short form or deduct from invoice) credit coded to 50800.  This will credit the expense and debit Accts Payable Other, 25400, increasing P or L profit and reducing the payable liability to the WD vendor.

Title: Dial Password Icon on Homepage.
Description: CP1892  What is the new icon on my screen "Dial password expired click to reset"
Solution: This icon is used by Dealer Corp locations to create dialup passwords each month to be used to dial into remote locations GBMS system.  It will appear on the screen at all remote locations on the 20th of the month and will disappear when Corporate creates the new diskette for the following month.

Title: Dial Peer & PC Dial-in Problem
Description: CP1893  It is the first week of a new month and I cannot acess my locations via PC Dial-in or Common Owner Remote access (via modem)..
Solution:
"Steps for Creating Monthly Passwords: (This procedure can only be performed at the CORPORATE location)

1. Click ""System Admin"" from the top menu of GBMS 3 Home Page.
2. Click on ""Set Passwords"".
3. Click the ""Select all"" button. Legend: will indicate a box check.
4. Click the ""Continue"" button.
5. If your locations dial into each other - Click the ""Check this box to distribute passwords to all ALLOWED locations.
6. Click on one of the following two buttons:
    A. ""Create New Info Only"" - if you sign into the other     location GBMS to GBMS via modem and no one signs in     through a Personal Computer.
    B. ""Create New Info and Write Diskette"" - if anyone signs     in through a Personal Computer or a combination of PC and     dial peer and GBMS to GBMS via modem you need to use     this option and put a diskette in the diskette drive on the     GBMS 3 server.

7. The two bottom buttons can be used for the following:
    A.  ""Copy existing Info to Diskette"" - this button would be     used to create an additional diskette or if you chose the     ""Create New Info Only"" and created the passwords and     then remembered you need the passwords on a diskette for     someone with a Personal Computer.
     B.  ""Resend Existing Info to Other Locations"" - This button      would be used if  there was a communication problem      when you created new passwords and the passwords      needed to be resent."

Title: Adjustment Correction
Description: CP1895  How do I correct adjustment that was entered wrong?
Solution:
1) Start a new document on the POS screen for the customer.

2) Go to the Customer workorder screen and press F7 Adjustment

3) Type the drive type; Tab to the Correction field type a "Y"; Tab to the Orig Invoice field and type the Original Invoice Number; press Enter.

4) Complete the Product Adjustment screen exactly as you processed the original document.

5) Print the final document.

6) Start a second document on the POS screen.

7) Go to Cusotmer Work Order screen and press F7 Adjustment.

8) Type the drive type; Tab to the Correction field and type "C"; Tab to the Orig Invoice field and type the SAME Original Invoice Number; press Enter.

9) Complete the adjustment screen with the correct information and finalize the document.

Note:  Verify correction has been made through Product Adjustment Manifest (PAM) option.  The "SND" field will display a "C" indicating that the tires(s) has been corrected by another invoice along with the new invoice number.

Title: Missing category in Triad Mnt
Description: CP1912  A/C SERVICE IS NOT SHOWING UP AS TRIAD CATEGORY - IT WAS THERE BEFORE.   This is due to triad maintenance - someone has gotten in there and deleted this category.
Solution: This is due to triad maintenance - someone has gotten in there and deleted this category.  For future use, user must get out of triad in all terminals.   go to prod admin > triad maint> category/group maint:  arrow down to the line on the list where the category should be.  F6 ADD, type the name of the category,  hit F_ PRIMARY GROUPS, hit F_ PARTS - select all lines that need to be applied to the category.   do same for LABOR,   ESC to exit,   answer Y to save to Akron.   GBMS3 does the rest.  no need to notify netops.

Title: G3 Express/WD Vendor Credits
Description: CP1935 How to handle credits from WD suppliers on the new G3 Express program.
Solution: Process a credit payable input to the WD's vendor file against accounting code 27400 (Anticipated WD Credit).  If there is a tire price discrepancy (actual buying price vs average cost in GBMS), book the difference to 40900.  Book Advertising credits to code 50600 (Advertising) and any WD bonuses to code 40700.

Title: Eod will not complete
Description: CP1936  During the eod process it will say processing summary files.  It should not take very long for the eod to run.  If they call because it has been an  extremely long time for the eod to finish  you can check the folloiwng .
Solution:
"Telnet onto the location and see what they have in pgmfile.
From the # sign type :  plus  (enter)
From the > sign type:  @spgm (enter)
If it shows other programs besides eod have them try and get out of all the other sessions.  If they cannot do that then  from the # sign type : sysipl  (This will reset the system and when the system comes back up it will say eod is being completed now or it may also say that  todays business will be combined with tomorrows business.   If it says  eod is now being completed  then it should complete.    If it says it will be combined with tomorrows business they can try and do another eod and if it does not complete you can telnet onto them again and  from the # sign type :  loadcomp  (enter)
If the eod then  completes  fine,  if not then send  report to support.
If  they call and say eod is running and they think it is not  do the following:
From the # sign type:  plus (enter)
From the > sign type :  @sdocq (enter)  if b50 does not show in  docq  then do the following :
From the > sign type:  select lcspm from loccntl;   If it shows a 1 do the following:
From the > sign type:  update loccntl set lcspm = '0';   (enter)  then exit to commit it.
Have then try eod again if still a problem send to support."

Title: Term Changes not calculating properly
Description: CP1940  Document has not aged properly. Not showing on the right schedule and/or calculating incentives improperly.
Solution:
"Problem has been identified and an s/r created where term changes are coming down and not aging properly.

The fix has been documented in the procedures manual
Usability > Remittance.  Basically we must reset abpast to a blank and abfutmos to 0 and then run mntbil2 to correct the problem.  Mntbil2 will reage the payables."

Title: Alert Message
Description: CP1955 User is getting an "Alert Message" when they are attempting to process a sales document that is not current.
Solution:
"Advise user to process the document still, but the message is to advise them that Goodyear has a new policy in place that doesn't allow locations to submit sales older than 30 days. Below is the note:
Completed Delivery Receipts must be received by Goodyear within 30 days of the actual date of delivery.
Delivery receipts received with a delivery date greater than 30 days of the actual delivery date will be returned to
the location without credit and delivery commission. No exceptions.
Completed Delivery Receipts must be received by Goodyear within 8 calendar days of the
actual date of delivery for accounts we have announced as filing bankruptcy, placed on credit hold,
or have debtor in possession accounts. In the event the delivery receipt has been voided or the
invoice has been cancelled requesting additional information and you have exceeded the 8 calendar
day window for electronic processing, you must resubmit to National Account Billing for processing.(#)"

"Have location close out of home page (local or remote) by clicking 'X' in the top right corner.
Advise them when exiting from GBMS remotely to click 'local' to return to local home page and they will not have this problem in the future."

Title: Satellite Peer Problem

Solution: The display resolution is not correct.  Need to go into my computer, Control Panel, Display and change the screen area to 1024x768.

Title: Dial Peer Fast Path Problem

Solution: Reload Home Page by clicking on the X in the right corner or by clicking on Reload at the top of the home page.

Title: Dial Peer Problem
Description: CP1968  Getting "Invalid Password" when attempting to connect to a location via Dial Peer.

SEE COMMON PROBLEM #1893 FOR HELP CREATING PASSWORDS."

Title: Dial Peer Print Problem
Description: CP1970  Unable to print when dial peer'd into a location.
Solution:
"1. Sign into both corporate and remote loc and type the following commands.
cd /etc/lp/printers/printer1
cat users.allow
Screen should display ""all!all.  If it does not you need to run setup to configure the printers.
2.  If above step is ok do the following
At # type ""lpstat -t"" - if prtrr1 shows as NAK'D and has print jobs waiting to print - send the report to COMMUNICATIONS."

Title: PC Dial-in Print Problem
Description: CP1971  Printer is not printing in correct format when dialed in remotely through my PC.
Solution:
"From remote home page have them go into set printer and chose:
prtrd1 if they are printing on a dot matrix printer or
laserd1 if they are printing on a printer other than a dot matrix."

Title: PC Dial-in Print Problems
Description: CP1972  Unable to print when dialed in remotely from my PC.
Solution:
"1. Wrong printer may be selected in Set Printer option on  Home Page.  Need to chose prtrd1 for dot matrix printer or laserd1 for printers other than dot matrix.
2. Computer name and printer name may not have been entered.  On home page click on System Admin - choose setup GBMS remote printer.  They need to type in their PC computer name and Shared printer name and click on continue and finish.  (There is a help button on that screen that will show them how to obtain this info on their PC.)
3. Sign into the location they are dialing into and stop and start print services.  /usr/lib/lpshut (to stop print services) & /usr/lib/lpsched (to start print services)
4. If the above steps do not solve the problem send the report to REMOTE DIAL with the info as to what you have done."

Title: 9009 Avg Cost JT
Description: CP1980 Gross profit on tires changed between S & E and Preliminary Operating Statement
Solution: This is due to only 1 thing: the 9009 average cost adjustment that occurs from re-calculation of average cost at month end.  It is the last step in producing the Prelim Op Stmt.  Causes: "M"anually costing tires which is different from calculated average cost, A/P input errors, difference for tires costed at the 'default' Std Cost (B-300 less 25%) that the purchase doc caused avg cost revision at month end calculation.

Title: New Car Tire Changeover
Description: CP1984  New Car Tire Changeover
Solution:
Procedure

Complete details here:

file://akrshare01/share/nat/GBMS\CLIENT\GBMS%20Support\DOCUMENTATION\Employee%20New%20Vehicle%20Tire%20Changeovers.pdf

Eligibility
Goodyear employees, retirees, and their eligible dependents are all eligible for Employee changeovers. Eligible dependents are defined as family members who qualify as dependents under the Medical Benefit program.

Process
All changeover tires will be brought into inventory as code 669?950?950.
The work order is constructed the same way as you would normally generate one. However, on the ?Merchandise Verify? screen, the tire quantity of the tires you are bringing into inventory will be a minus (-), enter an E in the Billing Code field, and use product code 669?950?950. Change the selling price to equal the price of the outgoing tire. For example:
Product Code 	Bill Code 	QTY. 		Description 							Amount
413-111-111 		R 						4 			P205/65R15 Comfortred 		$100.00
669-950-950 		E 						(4) 		Changeover 							($100.00)

***Important Note***
On the DSA the loss on the Employee Changeover tire will be offset by the gain of the replacement Goodyear tire. This is now an automated process; no additional actions are required by the store associate.

Selling Changeovers
All changeovers (code 669?950-950) are costed at $10.00 per tire with a default selling price of $12.50.
Best practice would be to change the selling price to a higher amount. The higher the selling price, the more gross margin dollars a store can make.
Example:
If a store sells a set of changeovers for $75.00 per tire, they would make $260.00 in gross margin plus any tire related services.

***Approval numbers are NOT needed***
**Since the changeover code is quite generic, it is recommended that stores keep a sheet with the changeover detail near the register. This list would show the sizes and brands in inventory.

revised 5/23/13

Title: EOD/PARTS ORDER

Title: PC Dial-in or Dial Peer Problem
Description: CP1991  Error 678 - "Dial up Networking was unable to complete the connection"
Solution:
"Problem is with modem at location they are signing into.
1. Verify modem is plugged into com port A and has AA, TR, CS lights lit.
2.  Verify phone cord is plugged into port closest to outside edge of modem.
3. Call modem phone # to see if you get a good modem tone.
If not a good tone have location plug a single line phone into the jack to check for a dial tone.  If no dial tone location needs to have phone company check out phone line.
4.  After all steps above are complete if location is still getting same error message - send the report to REMOTE DIAL."

Title: How to add a Web Link
Description: CP2008  How do I add an internet "Link" to my GBMS system ?
Solution:
"To add a Local Link  ( CORPORATE OFFICE ONLY when in a Common Owner)
1.HomePage> Links > Add/Edit Links.
2. Click on "Add New Link"
3. Tab to the ""Description"" field.
5. Type a description for the internet site. (eg. All Data)
6. Tab to the ""URL"" field.
7. Type the internet address/URL for the internet site (eg. WWW.ALLDATA.COM for example).
8. Tab to the ""Secure Site"" field.
9. Type Y ( ONLY  if URL begins with https).
10. Click Submit
 Info ..
The Corporate location will enter  the approved sites for all locations within the Common ownership. Internet links entered by the corporate  location will be automatically transmitted to the other locations.

Title: 1532Dealer Internet site access
Description: CP2015 Dealers are receiving Websense error message .."Access to this web page is restricted at this time (URL is listed)".
Solution:
"Dealers are receiving this error message because they:
a.  Typed in the approved web address wrong .. or
b.  Typed in a web site that hasn't been approved yet (use CP 2005) ... or
c.   Selected an ILINK site that was created with incorrect URL information or security type.

1. Get the exact URL (address) from the Websense error message ... note in EA report
2. Have user locate the URL in the ""List of Approved Dealer Internet Sites"" to verify URL is on the list.

If it's NOT on the list, indicate the complete URL in the EA report & assign it to Brian Sickle.  All requests for retail stores need approved by Mike Kirkpatrick, but Brian will followup w/Kirkpatrick.

3. Click on the URL ... this should take them to the web site (agent duplicates the process)
4. If this completes, the URL was setup incorrectly in ILINK.
5. Type ILINK in scid field in GBMS.
6. Verify the web address is typed in exactly how it appears on the Approved list (eg. WWW.ALLDATA.COM).
7. Verify the correct value is in the ""Secure Site"" field.  (Y if https://)
8. Help user Edit the line in question.
9. Press F4 to complete Update (if changes were made)

If the above steps do not resolve their problem .... transfer the ""detailed"" EA report to SUPPORT"

Title: Retail User changed locations
Description:
CP2051 I just transferred from another Goodyear store.  How can I change my nonsig from one to another?

Modified 10/16/2007"
Solution:
"1. The user needs to be deleted from original location.  They need to contact their old location and have the old store manager do the following:
1a. Logon to Tire-HQ Home Page, choose User Administration on the left.
1b. Click on ""View -or- Update an existing user"".
1c. Click on the username.
1d. Click on ""Delete User"".  Now, the old username is removed.
2. Next, talk to the new store manager and have him/her logon to Tire-HQ Home Page, choose User Administration on the left.
2a. Choose ""Register A New User"".
2b. Complete all the necessary information and click Add User at the bottom of the screen."

Title: LOCAL "G" billing shows "R" billing on Sales/Gross
Description: CP2057  Local invoice entered as a "G" billing at Point of Sale is displaying as an "R" billing on the Sales & Gross Profit report with very little gross profit.
Solution: Goodyear supports local "government" sales only when the sales price is BELOW the average cost in the Akron stock ledger.  If the sales price is ABOVE the average cost, GBMS Accounting converts the "G" to an "R" and allows the "true" gross profit to book to the P or L.

Title: Getting ready for Tire-HQ
Description: CP2059 Do I need to do anything to get ready for Tire-HQ ? Such as Downloading a current Browser.
Solution:
"(Check by clicking on ""Are you ready for Tire-HQ"" doc in Help desk Info)
There are two things you can do to get ready for Tire-HQ:
1) install a current browser on your pc and
2) set up bookmarks to the new site.
Current browser downloads can be downloaded from the Tire-HQ login page (at the bottom)

1. Tire-HQ is built to utilize features available in current browsers. If you continue using Netscape 4.x on Tire-HQ, you will be missing out: the website will look just like XPLOR does currently. Using a current browser gets you access to all the enhanced features of Tire-HQ. This also means that because of the current configuration of GBMS, those users will only see the site as it is today.

      A current browser means you are using Netscape version 7.01 or higher, or Internet Explorer version 5.5 service pack 2 or higher. You can view information and instructions on a current version of Internet Explorer at www.microsoft.com/ie. Using Internet Explorer means you don't need to download a new version of Netscape, but if you wish to continue using Netscape, you can find the newest version at www.netscape.com/browsers. Netscape 7 should not be installed to the same directory as Netscape 4. This will allow you to continue using Netscape 4.x to access XPLOR until Tire-HQ is available for you to use in April.
(To find out the version of Microsoft Internet Explorer ... launch IE, click on ""Help"", then about Internet Explorer)

2. You should create a new bookmark to Tire-HQ. Use http://www.tire-hq.com as the url. While you are in your bookmarks, make sure that your bookmark for XPLOR is set to http://xplor.goodyear.com. Make sure you bookmark for XPLOR is no longer than that, as having extra words in the bookmark will cause a problem for getting to the new Tire-HQ website."

Title: Site Certificate
Description:
CP2062 On December 20 after 6pm Eastern, a new digital certificate will be installed for the apps.tire-hq.com domain.  This certificate is a renewal for an expiring certificate.  HP is fully engaged, and the development team will test the changes prior to acceptance.

After the change, Tire-HQ users may receive a message asking them to accept the new certificate.  If calls are received, please advise users to accept the new certificate.  The certificate  is necessary in order to ensure secure communications between their site and Tire-HQ computers.

The change also affects Sam's Club and Fedex/Aeroxchange.  Since these are machine to machine connections, the technical teams from both customers have been engaged and will install the new certificate in conjunction with the tire-hq change.  No calls are anticipated regarding these two customers.  Any security issues reported from Fedex/Aeroxchange or Sam's Club should be escalated immediately.
Solution:
On December 20 after 6pm Eastern, a new digital certificate will be installed for the apps.tire-hq.com domain.  This certificate is a renewal for an expiring certificate.  HP is fully engaged, and the development team will test the changes prior to acceptance.

After the change, Tire-HQ users may receive a message asking them to accept the new certificate.  If calls are received, please advise users to accept the new certificate.  The certificate  is necessary in order to ensure secure communications between their site and Tire-HQ computers.

The change also affects Sam's Club and Fedex/Aeroxchange.  Since these are machine to machine connections, the technical teams from both customers have been engaged and will install the new certificate in conjunction with the tire-hq change.  No calls are anticipated regarding these two customers.  Any security issues reported from Fedex/Aeroxchange or Sam's Club should be escalated immediately.

Title: Set Tire-HQ as my home page

5. Type  Type  www.tire-hq.com

**Netscape 7-

Title: Netscape Remembers data
Description: CP2064 How do I configure my netscape browser so I am not always reminded if I want the browser to remember data?
Solution:
"1. Go to your Edit menu and click on Preferences.
2. In the Preferences Window double click on Privacy & Security on the left hand side of the window.
3. Under Privacy & Security there should be some new options. Click on Forms.
4. Uncheck the Save form data from web pages when completing forms checkbox.
5. Back on the left hand side of the screen select Passwords.
6. Uncheck the Remember passwords for sites that require me to log in checkbox.
7. Select the Advanced tab on the left hand side of the screen and then select Cache.
8. Select the Compare the page in the cache to the page on the network option to Every time I view the page.
9. Press OK.
How to accept certificates in Netscape:
1. When prompted by Netscape that there is a problem with a certificate identified as tire-hq.com select the Remember this certificate permanently checkbox and then press Continue.
**This new documentation for configuring browsers is found in Help->Tire-HQ Help Desk Info**"

Title: IE Remembers data
Description: CP1968  How do I configure my IE browser so I am not always reminded if I want the browser to remember data?
Solution:
"1. Go to your Tools menu and click on Internet Options...
2. In the Temporary Internet files area, click on the Settings button.
3. Set the Check for newer versions of stored pages option to Every visit to the page and click OK.
4. Click OK.
How to accept certificates in Internet Explorer:
1. When prompted by Internet Explorer with a window that says Security Alert and you are asked how you want to proceed, click View Certificate.
2. The next screen will give some Certificate Information, at this point click Install Certificate.
3. Internet Explorer will then bring up a Certificate Import Wizard, click Next to proceed.
4. On the next screen make sure the Automatically select the certificate store based on the type of certificate option is selected and click Next.
5. The following screen will say Completing the Certificate Import Wizard, click Finish to continue.
6. Internet Explorer will then pop up a window asking if you want to ADD the following certificate to the Root Store. Click Yes.
7. Click OK when prompted that the import was successful.
8. Click OK to close the Certificate Information window.
9. Click Yes on the Security Alert screen to continue browsing.
**This new documentation for configuring browsers is found in Help->Tire-HQ Help Desk Info**"

Title: No Pending Shipments for Tires Received
Description: CP2092  Shipments have not shown up in (R)eceipt (O)f (M)erchandise?  Why?
Solution:
Check to make sure they are not behind in maintenance.

From the # prompt, type:
1. cd /u/dsxvol (enter)  type l (to list)
You should see a display of the following files:
BKUPRECV
TRANRECV
loadpromo.log
testfile

So long as there are NO files starting with "H", loc is more or less current on maintenance (otherwise, skip to #2).
If they are behind, work to resolve problem by completing maintenance on the system (SMENU, opt 9 - Utilities Menu, opt 7 - run a utility/ mnt pgm, type: mntupdt. Confirm all "H" files have cleared from dsxvol and have user check again in ROM).  If still not there, continue to #2.

2. The location needs to call INFOLINK @ 1-800-755-2772. They need to ask:
     a) When the order was reported shipped.
          - If the date/time is later in the day, shipments will appear in pending after maintenance runs the following night.
          - If Infolink says it was NEVER reported shipped and it has been more than 2-3 days since they physically received the order, then get the order date and ship date off the packing slip or from Infolink and put in IM report stating that order number(s) were NEVER reported by the warehouse and forward to Level 3.

Title: N/A CAS Warranty w/orig recpt-REVISED
Description: CP2095  How to process a N/A CAS/Sonsio warranty where the location calling did the original work?
Solution:
"A ""No Fault""  factor - original stores will not be charged back for warranty work done at other stores or dealers
One Process for handling Auto Service Warranty claims, Stores and Dealers
Simplified Accounting
Stores receive payment (checks) direct from Sonsio for completed work
Elimination of the $10 administration fees for chargebacks or checks cut by Sonsio


PROCEDURES
1.An invoice is created at Point of Sale for warranty work only using option 6, GEMINI WARRANTY. This creates a line entry for the invoice in Account 59.
2.Store obtains authorization/approval number from Sonsio for all warranty work required prior to service being performed - NO CHANGE
3.If Required by Sonsio - Stores performing warranty work will be instructed to send/fax a copy of original invoice and completed warranty invoice for review- REVISED
4.Sonsio will send payment for warranty service performed directly to outlet performing warranty service after their review of documentation.
5.Store applies warranty check to AR account #59, (GEMINI WARRANTY). REVISED

SONSIO CONTACT NUMBERS
Authorization	800-426-0733 option 2
Fax		303-421-4259
Mailing Address	Sonsio
		PO BOX 17659
		Golden, CO. 80402"

Title: Tire Rebate Questions
Description:
CP2099 "Questions you may be asked concerning the tire
rebates at the Tent sale."
Solution:
"During the tent sale, associates who present their rebate
coupons when buying tires, will be given the rebate off their
tire purchase during the sale.
1. Stores will be using code 011 -used auto tires and will enter
 negative units and the $$discount amount when giving the rebate.
2. Invoices will have a special stamp signifying that the tires were
bought at the Tent sale. Coupons will be attached to the store
invoice and then turned in after the sale to get their money back.
3. If customers do NOT have their coupons, they will NOT get
the instant rebate but will have to mail it in.
4. The store number for the gbms computer across the street
is X529.
5.  For the other two PROMO's, Purchase On Gdyr Credit Card Promo &
Smell the Savings -Purchase a specific set of 4 Goodyear Tires Rebate.
The Smell the Savings Promo is only on specific tires as indicated on the
front of the flyer.  When you go to sales aid off GBMS Inquire and
enter in the size and submit request, it will bring up a tire package. Only
the tire packages in yellow are eligible.  When you click on Package, it
will list the tire package and have the promo's listed below.  Then click
on Promo Detail and it will bring up the promo coupon and they can print
it out on a Laser printer only."

Title: Tire Orders not showing at Infolink
Description: CP2103  Why doesn't INFOLINK show my tire orders I completed and finalized the day before?
Solution: TIME AND TIME AGAIN, INFOLINK FAILS TO UNDERSTAND THAT ORDERS FROM GBMS DO NOT START POSTING IN DISTRIBUTION SERVICES UNTIL MID-MORNING. SOMETIMES THEY POST A LITTLE EARLIER; SOMETIMES A LITTLE LATER. GENERALLY SPEAKING, THEY ARE POSTED BY 11:00 A.M, the next day.

Title: Webtop for GBMS
Description: CP2106  Error " webtop for gbms or gtracs is already in use by another remote or dial location. The last access for this location was from location dial in user please try again later" when I try to sign into GBMS from my PC? (killwtop)
Solution:
"User did not exit out of GBMS gracefully the last time they were logged in.

1. Telnet into the location

2. At the # sign type: !killwtop (enter)

Now have the user try to log in."

Title: OKLAHOMA SALES TAX
Description:
CP2109  Notice of change in reporting Sales Tax paid to the state of Oklahoma, July 15, 2003..
Effective October 1, 2003, sales tax must be paid to the state of Oklahoma twice a month. Currently this is paid once a month. GBMS issue a monthly Sales Tax Report for the monthly total."
Solution:
"GBMS will list the total amount of tax collected on the Daily Sales and Gross Profit report.
Bottom of the 2nd page will list the M-T-D Sales TAX total.

EOD M-T-D Summary also list the total Sales Tax collected during the month.

Utilized solution until futher notice."

Title: Cancel Tire Orders Processed thru GBMS
Description: CP2113  Company owned or Dealer location and have finalized my tire order thru the GBMS system today.  I want to cancel it.  I called Infolink and they do not see it.  WHY?
Solution: Any tire orders done thru GBMS need to come through the system when they run their EOD and we pull that EOD.  The information is processed and Infolink will receive the information the next day around 11am.  The location can call Infolink or the Warehouse where the order was placed  the next day around 11am and they should see the order on their system, and then it can  be cancelled at that time.

Title: TC 71 Logistics Concepts
Description: CP2128  Location trying to enter TC71 for Logistics Concepts and getting invalid entry on the PO#.
Solution: The format of this number was changed back in february of 2003. It's 10 numeric characters and the last 4 s/b in MMYY format.

Title: VSAT to VSAT
Description: CP2130  Terr A is unable to bring up Terr B - starts to load the GBMS screen and blows down. GBMS4
Solution:
Telnet on to Terr B and run sethttpd . Have terr A try it again. If it still blows down - send it to HW/COMM with the terrs A & B listed. Also get the workstation
that Terr A is working from.

Note: killwtop does not work in GBMS4. Open ticket to HW/Comm.

Title: Preprinted Entry Parts
Description: CP2131  I am a Company owned store and I have already entered my cycle 1, 2, 3 tire inventory  and now I want to enter my parts, but when I choose Opt 2 preprinted cycle 4 , I get message "No preprinted pages available?"
Solution: They should be using Opt 3 Preprinted Service Parts.

Title: TC 73 & TC 74 tire eligibility
Description: CP2139  I am trying to bill tires to a TC 73/TC 74 government account DR and getting message Customer not authorized to purchase product.  Sale may be done on local books.
Solution:
"Per Govt Sales, TC 73 & TC 74 transactions are only eligible for 1st line Goodyear Tires.
ONLY TC 75 NA DR billings are eligible for Republic tires, Kelly (must be on sidewall), and first line Gdyr tires."

Title: Mandantory Tire Fee
Description: CP2140  State mandated tire fees must be paid semi-monthly.
Solution:
"Advise location the total amount of tire fees collected, will appear on the following reports.
Daily, END OF DAY, Daily Business Summary, bottom of the page.
M-T-D Sales Summary will show the total amount collected every day on the last page of the EOD
Final M-T-D Sales and Expense report, last page listed under
Waste Tax."

Title: Credit Card Exception Report
Description: CP2145  I received a Credit Card Exception Report with my overnight reports.  Why did this print?
Solution:
"YOU DO NOT NEED THE LOCATION TO FAX A COPY OF THE REPORT!
The exception report prints with the overnight reports when there are Credit Card sales or payments that the system could not send through to ADS at end of day.  If this report prints for more than 2 nights:
1.  Telnet into location.
2.  Type Smenu at # prompt
3.  Choose option - 10 SPSLINK /swipe menu
4. Choose -  7 STATBAL display
5.  Type the 3 digit # at the end of the line with the date in question.
6.  Do a shift+g to go to bottom of file then page up to the totals for the statbal.  Continue to page up so you can see the lines above the ""balancing data 50:...
7.  You should see 3 lines similar to the example below:
FORCE/RETURN FAIL. B50: 214 09/12/05 05:44 PM  STATUS: G
PAYMENT  DOCUMENT: 005881 CARD: 7753010067466352           AMOUNT: 001177.51
 MESSAGE: Cannot Connect--please retry

In the case above the system just was not able to sync up with ADS to send the Transacation thru for processing.  Tell the location it should be sent thru with the next End Of Day and they will see it on their batch report from the next EOD.  If they do not they need to call us back.

For the 2 examples below and other errors similar in nature, cut and paste the 3 line error (as noted in step 7) into the report and send to Support or follow the procedures in the Level 3 database - "Voice Auth Credit Card Transaction Report keeps printing"

 MESSAGE: The Auth Number Field Must Have a Value
 MESSAGE: This Card has Expired"

Title: Dealer Cost  Password Invalid
Description: CP2146  When trying to go into terr search or salesaid to check for dealer cost they are getting msg dealer cost pasword invalid, why ?
Solution: New option in prod admin  called  dealer cost profile.   Corp offiice only can  indicate whether they  want remotes to see the cost.  They have to go into that screen and hit enter to activate the y's that are already in the options and they can also change the dc used to see the cost to different alpha characters. For furhter explanation see mfst 835

Title: ASC - Visa/MC Merchant #
Description: CP2154  ASC only - What is my Visa/MC Merchant # so I can get voice authorization?
Solution:
"There are 2 different phone #'s the ASC can call for Voice Authorization on Visa/MC.
1-800-884-1167 - Merchant # will be 2007X (X being the first digit of their Store # - EX: 1267 would use a 1)
1-800-896-7157 - Merchant # can be found on TPX.  Go to IAG, choose option 1 - Store File, choose option 5 - display store, choose option 5 - store banking,  type in store #,  merchant # is found under ""MC/VISA MERCHANT NO"".  (This number is loaded by Team Retail - if there is nothing in this field Store will need to call GY-Fixes - option 3 (store support)

Title: Msg when billing 254 code
Description: CP2156  When billing out a 254 retread code, I am getting message Sum of 256XXXXXX qty must be >=   254XXXXXX stock retread qty sum?
Solution: The dealer is usually attached to a retread/Gtracs shop and is requiring information for this N/A customer. Loc needs to either put a "3" after the retread 254 prod code or a "C" in the C/O field at the bottom of the screen to identify the casing as customer owned so that GBMS will not expect a 256 casing prod code charge.  Once casing identified as customer owned, another screen pop us to require customer casing info be keyed in. (NOTE: the 040 field bottom left side of this screen is for casings REPAIRED only.) Once info keyed in, press F5 and system tkes you back to merchandise screen and the retread tire prod code is a the top of the mdse screen.

Title: GS/G Approval Numbers on Tire-HQ
Description:
CP2157 Error message "Invalid Data" or "Expired GS#" entering the GS approval number for a government delivery.
-or-
User does not know how to find a GS approval number on Tire-HQ.
Solution:
"Confirm Doc Date !! Confirm Doc Type !! (Not type C)
* * * NOTE: GS Approval numbers are only used on document type B (Local Government Invoices), D (State Government - Goodyear Billed), or E (Federal Government - Goodyear Billed)
* * * GS NUMBERS ARE VALIDATED AGAINST THE DOCUMENT DATE. For instance, if a GS number is good from 1/1/04 - 12/31/04, any Ship Date outside this range would result in ""Expired GS#"" error.

To locate the correct GS number, walk the user through these steps:
1.  Go to Financial > Government Sales
2.  Click on the state or federal location
3.  Click on Print Current Page link (if a copy is required) or locate the GS number required.

* * * The format for GS numbers on Tire-HQ is "G" + 7 digits....example - G0000005"

Title: Walk Out Demand (WOD)
Description: CP2159  I show a (W)alk (O)ut (D)emand on my pending audit trail with an old date. How do I get rid of it?
Solution:
"Telnet into location and run script to make sure the date in the system is older than the current date.  go to Plus and enter
sql>select dmsysdt,dmb50d from dcmstview where dmtype='WOD';
This will list the system date and b50 date
DMSYSD DMB50D
------ ------
060903 060903

If it truly is an old date then run script
sql>delete dcmstwod where dmsysdt='XXXXXX'; (X = date WOD done)"

Title: Account Does Not Exist
Description:
CP2160  There are several reasons why the account does not exist.
1) Account was transferred from a close store.
2) Account was changed from A/R to cash at the current store.
3) Account was transferred from POS PLUS"
Solution:
Send reports to DEV for resolutions.
Be sure to enter in the account number, customer/business name in the report

Title: Why don't I see price in Tire-HQ?
Description:
CP2168 User sees ""N/A"" in Est. Dealer Price for all tires on Tire-HQ.

* * and/or * *

User cannot find the G3 Quarterly Price Schedule for a particular product line in Tire-HQ"
Solution:
"G3Xpress dealers cannot see price in Tire-HQ. Effective 12/1/03, G3 Quarterly Price schedules were removed from Tire-HQ for G3X dealers.

* * *  TO CHECK IF THIS DEALER IS A G3XPRESS DEALER, CHECK WAD SCREEN 50. If the user has an ""X"" in any of the bottom items (G3 XPRS GD, G3 XPRS KL, G3 XPRS DN, G3 XPRS RT), the user IS a G3X dealer. * * *

1) If YES, advise dealer that Goodyear does not know the price they pay for tires from their Wholesale Distributor. User should contact their WD for a price list.

2) If NO, obtain the username and forward report to LVL 2"

Title: Stores - NA - DR Battery Adjustment
Description: CP2174  Adjusting a battery for a NA on a DR?
Solution:
"On a NA, do NOT select 'Y' for adjustment on the first screen because this forces a % of wear or tread depth.
Batteries have a 12-mo free replacement warranty.  After 12 months, the replacement price will be prorated as follows:
Replacement price=original selling price, divided by the number of months warranted, times the number of months in service.
Example:  A 75-75B sold for 101.95.  After 14 mo in service, the battery needs adjusted. 101.95 /75=$1.36.  $1.36 x 14= $19.03.  Customer usage charge is $19.03.  The adjusted credit will be $101.95-19.03=$82.92 and will be billed as follows.
Prod code    BC  QTY  Description  Core Parts  Lbr/Ex Total
034201          R    1     New Battery         101.95          101.95
75-75B                 1     75 Mo Wet Bat
034001          R   -1    Warr/Prorate adj cr  82.92         -82.92"

Title: GBMS user cannot access THQ
Description: CP2176 GBMS user is calling because they cannot access Tire-HQ web site from their GBMS terminal.
Solution:
"1. Verify TireHQ is not having problems at this time.  Can user access  ANY  web site - mitchell, yahoo, etc.???  ( If user cannot access any Web Site, and we can ping them OK .. have them go through an IPL to resolve problem.)
2.  Is there an error msg?  or gray clocking screen?   If error message .. when does it appear (eg. after clicking on THQ link, and before Username & password etc).  post this info into EA.
3. Is this GBMS terminal or PC?    post in EA
4.  Confirm with user that credit card sales are working ok.
5.  Ping server.   confirm good,  (see Lotus Notes Procedures for the detail).   post results in EA report.    if ping fails, proceed with IDU testing.  send to HW/COMM
6.  If user cannot access THQ from just one terminal ... have them logout of Terminal... then back in.
7.  If user still cannot access Tire-HQ, after covering all of the above steps .... transfer report to XPLOR."

Title: Triad -Current vehicles
Description: CP2186  When will all the current year's vehicles be loaded in triad?
Solution: Current year vehicles are generally not available until march/april  (regardless of the fact that they have been on the road for 6-8 months)      The vehicle is updated by vehicles in triad.  Triad is a replacement parts business.  Generally there are no replacement parts sold for vehicles the first 1-2 years due to warranties, etc.      Goodyear has no control over this process, in fact,  Goodyear doesn't supply triad with tires for these vehicles until same time - EVEN THOUGH WE COULD  BE SELLING MORE TIRES AS CHANGEOVERS IF WE KNEW WHICH TIRE WAS RECOMMENDED.

Title: Not able to use Internet
Description: CP2194  If user cannot connect to the internet or Tire  HQ:
Solution: 8/28/08 - Per larry beck - problem is with the prysm boxes.  He has a ticket open with spacenet.  Close report do not send to hw/comm

Title: Reprint of G82
Description: CP2196  How can I reprint a G82?
Solution:
"You will only be able to reprint current day plus one day prior.
1. Print the audit trail to obtain the seq #'s of the G82's to be reprinted.  Do not display the audit trail as that will give you a different seq # but not the one you need.
2. Go into Inventory administration, G82 Retread Production Menu, G82 Reprint, and enter the Seq # from the audit trail.  You can only print one seq # at a time."

Title: Invalid Product Code
Description: CP2207 Invalid Product Code?
Solution:
"The two main reasons:
1. A dealer product code has been created using this product code and Goodyear has discontinued the code.
2. The WAD screen in TPX does not have this code marked for GBMS use.
Go to WAD screen 74, field 745 should be populated with a ""1"" to be able to use it in GBMS.
If ...  there is not a ""1"" in this field:
1) So as to not have several people sending emails to wholesale - The level 1 agent needs to put all the info in this report and send the report to the Support Bucket.
2)  When the the product code can be used (generally within two days of the field population) the Level 2 agent will be responsible for calling the location back.

Title: Mitchell website password invalid
Description: CP2210 - Why is it saying my password is invalid when trying to access the Mitchell website?
Solution:
"On Wednesday, March 17, 2004, the Mitchell website   www.ondemand5direct.com  will require the entry of a password.
Company Owned location password for everyone:  goodyear

For Dealers:
Dealers will have unique passwords assigned to them when they sign-up with Mitchell.
UPDATE:  Mitchell is giving dealers passwords based on use of Mitchell on either GBMS workstation or PC.  (Different passwords currently required for each type of access.  Error recd if PC password used on GBMS workstation:  UNMATCHED DIVISION DETECTED.  PLEASE CONTACT YOUR SYSTEM ADMIN OR MITCHELL TECH SUPPORT.  Lee Wood is checking on why 2 sets of passwords required.)"

Title: Cannot install Activant CD's
Description: CP2213   Getting errors when installing new Triad CD set.
Solution:
"Ensure user removes cd from the cdrom drive.  If they cannot, use Opt. 7 (Mount/ Unmount) under the Opt. 9 Utilities Menu to unmount the cd.  Instruct user to try again to remove cd.)   If user still experiences difficulty removing the cd, have them manually remove, using pinhole on cdrom drive drawer.

Have user 1) inspect CD set for any blemishes, scratches or smudges that do not wipe off, 2) blow the dust out of the CDROM.

If CD set needs replaced, be sure to get replacement sent to location via appropriate method (see step 10), then continue with steps 1-7, noting report accordingly and advising user to expect new set.  Otherwise, continue on beyond step 7.

1. SMENU, Opt. 8 (Log File Mneu), Opt. 2 (Logfile)

2. Shift + g (to go to the bottom of the logfile)

3. type: ?MONCTL
(use the 'N' key to move to next instance)
This will take you to the last instance in logfile where triad was being installed.  Make a note of any errors you see (if you do not understand them, ask for assistance in interpreting what you should see).  Ultimately, if all is well, you will see in information logged re: start of triad installation, files that were read from the discs, and reboot of server.

Sometimes the problem is as simple as the server not rebooting after a good installation. In which case, just need to ipl system to complete the process. Otherwise, continue to step 4.

4. :q (enter)  to get back to menu

5. SMENU, Opt. 1 (exit), Opt. 9 (Utilities menu), Opt. 16 (remove file)
Need to ensure install indicator is removed as well as partial load of triad from last attempt.

6. At prompt for filename & path type: /u/bin/type_installcd (enter)
(If indicator, msg will confirm file removed.  If not there, msg will display:
/u/bin/type_installcd does not exist.

7. Opt. 16 (remove file) and type at prompt: /tmp/DATA
This is to remove partial loaded triad information.

8. VNC onto T1 (to watch).  CRITICAL POINT:  Make sure user follows your instructions step by step and does not get ahead of you).
     - Main menu
     - type: TINCD (enter)
     - insert cd Vol I into drive, close drawer and wait.
This is where you want to ensure the cd is mounted and able to be read by the cdrom drive.  Go to step 9.

9. SMENU, Opt. 9 (Utilities Menu), Opt. 15 (setup), Opt. 5 (cdrom test)
It will instruct you on what files you should see once you hit enter.  If all four designated files appear, the cd is mounted and you can hit F1 to begin installation.  If not, go back to menu  to mount cd (Opt. 99 - (exit), enter, Opt. 7 (Mount/ Unmount)).  Then have user try again by pressing F1 to begin installation.

Once installation takes off, watch with user to ensure they complete to the end and system reboots as it should once complete.

10. If problem still persists:
     - Replace CD set if the drive IS reading and copying some         portion of the data (send email to Scott Jaenke for stores.
Dealers email jridge@epicor.com putting the store territory and store name and address in the email and message "Please overnight a replacement CD to the following location"


Any other issue outside of these noted above, forward report to SUPPORT 2 for review."

Title: Gdyr Credit Card Number Invalid
Description: CP2214  When I get  a Goodyear Credit Card number for a customer beginning with 60353651 or 60355100 it is coming up invalid card number.
Solution: Goodyear cards will begin with 6035 and the 5th thru 8th digits will be 5101 - 5109.  5100 is for Kelly Card.

Title: GCC Application - Incorrect Data
Description:
CP2217  GCC App error ( Patriot Act )
Why when I process a Goodyear Credit card application with a PO Box for the address it comes back with error message ""Currently we are experiencing data transmission problems to the credit card application.  The application is receiving incorrect data from your location. Please contact GBMS Support in Akron, Ohio."
Solution:
"This is due to the Patriot Act which will not allow just a PO Box for the address.
In order to address the PO BOX problem, and similar problems related to street address, the programmer of the GCC APP data validation process recommended we instruct our users to enter RURAL ROUTE BOX 1234 instead of PO BOX 1234."

Title: Sonsio direct payment application (Dealer)
Description:
CP2220  Sonsio direct payment application (Dealer)
How do I apply payment to the Sonsio account that was direct deposited to the bank?
Solution:
"1) From Main menu, go to the Accounts Receivable option
2) Access A/R Options and select journal ticket and access account #00068.
3) Type in the reason for issuance - (application of Sonsio deposit, for example) and tab to the amount field next to generated acct#10100 - type in minus the amount deposited as a credit and press enter.
4) next acct# is 10000 and the amount entry posted as a debit and press enter.
5) press F7 Print/end - system will prompt for a mm/yy entry - ignore it and press F7 again and it will default to current month and year.
6) Then customer can apply the credit line in the account created by the jt to the debit line that is already there and clear the account of the open item(s)."

Link to Procedures Manual   Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/6A7436495B46434685256DBF00524CCC

Description: CP2222  Unable to access NetMail.

Log out of the GBMS windows and power off/on  the thin client to resolve the problem.

If power cycling the maxspeed does not work, telnet into the location.
Access the Utilities Menu.
Select 'Sendmail - RESET'

Title: Setting up Consumer Leads
Description: CP2224 Location would like info on, or assistance in setting up "On line Ordering" (Consumer Lead generation) for Dunlop, or Goodyear tires.
Solution:
"Advise location to first go to Training>OnLine Training> then click on each viewlet in the ""Marketing"" area.  These viewlets should cover every aspect of setting up & maintaining ""Lead Generation"" they require.  After reviewing  all 5 viewlets, and if they still have questions ... have them call us back, or send us an email at:
xplor_helpdesk@goodyear.com"

Title: Can't print Statement
Description: CP2225 User is getting an error message after attempting to view/print their statement in Adobe.  Error mentions about a "block" or something being "embedded" that it can't print.
Solution:
"Printing the statements through Tire-HQ, as well as other financial items ... requires Adobe Acrobat 4.0 of higher.  Check their current version, by clicking on ""HELP"" in Adobe, then click on ""About Adobe"".  Anything less than 5.0 should be updated.  An updated version of Adobe can be downloaded (free) from Tire-HQ by going to:
Help (in Tire-HQ menu bar)
Download files
Adobe Reader Program
SAVE the file to DESKTOP.  Once download is complete, OPEN the file (or click on the icon on your Desktop) to install.
Once the file is installed, and system restated ... the Statement should print OK."

Title: Reset GBMS Password - Desktop PC
Description: CP2227  Unable to log into GBMS from retail PC.  Getting msg:  employee password is invalid ... when logging in with system password - goodyr, for employee 1, and employee password - goodyear.
Solution:
"To reset password to ""Goodyear"" in order to access GBMS from the desktop pc:
Telnet into location.
Type:  plus  ,   press Enter
Type:  select esemp, espass from emplsec;   press Enter
You will see  ESE    EMPASS
                     001     Goodyear
Example:      002     Matt
Note:  If another employee # / password are listed, use that employee's password to access security & reset password for employee 1.  Otherwise you will need to turn security off before proceeding.
At SQL prompt type:  exit      press Enter
At # type:  loadlog       press Enter twice
On option line at GBMS Main Menu type:  SEC     press Enter
Select option 2 - assign passwords
Type in employee ""2"" and password ""matt""    press Enter
The employee ID  001 (tab)  type:  goodyear     press Enter
Message returned indicating processing is complete.
Exit out of GBMS
To verify password set up ... at prompt type:  plus
Type:  select esemp, espass from emplsec;   press Enter
IF... you had to turn security off to reset the password, then you will need to turn it on at this point.
After reviewing info, exit from customers system."

Title: "Unauthorized Merchandise"
Description:
CP2228 Unauthorized merchandise for a National Account.
(If they think they are authorized to deliver this brand of merchandise ... they are to call their CAM)
Solution: This is informing them that this product is not a valid product to deliver to this National Account.  When ever this occurs ... the user will need to either deliver the customer a different tire ... or bill them locally.  To verify the product code restriction for the National Account ... go to WAZ (M screen) for the National Account in question.

Title: Gdyr Credit Card Application Probs
Description: CP2229  Why do I keep getting an error when processing a Goodyear Credit Card Application?
Solution:
"We need to ask and get this information and put in EA report:

1.  What is the error message? (word for word)

2.  Where in process does the error show up?  (Ex: after re- entering the SS# again, or on the application?)

3.  When was the last time he did a GCC application where it dialed out and came back for approval? Was it successful or not?

4..  Do they see any results in status inquiry?  (If results received, need to get acct # & $$ amount approved and time so we can forward examples to ADS so  IPS & CITI  can investigate.)

5.a.  What terminal were they accessing the GCC function from?  (T1, T2, T3 etc).

  b.  Is it always from the same terminal?

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
After problem determined not to be a GBMS issue the Lvl 2 agent needs to open a report with the Hearland Paymt Systems help desk - their phone # is 800-995-9370.  Get a problem Ticket # from them so we can check on status."

Title: Cannot find Dealership
Description: CP2232 "I went to Goodyear or Dunlop website, typed in my zip code and wasn't listed in the search results"
Solution: Direct user to Dealer Website Maintenance. If everything is correct Direct user to call their Goodyear Reps

Title: Need help in Consumer Leads
Description:
CP2234 "1. ""Enroll in the Consumer Online Ordering.""

2. ""Need help to set up Consumer Online Ordering."""
Solution:
"1. Dealers DO NOT have to enroll in the Consumer Leads/Online Ordering.

If they have a Tire-HQ account, they are ready to use the Consumer Leads, which is listed in the Marketing tab.

If they have a Tire-HQ account, and don't see Consumer Leads in the meun tab.
---> Check the User Registration in the Lotus Notes database.

2. Dealers are strongly suggested to view the online training before they start to use Consumer Leads."

Title: Error 500 Cannot login to Tire-HQ
Description: CP2236  Error 500 (or 505, or 400, etc) when trying to login to Tire-Hq.
Solution:
"Not a Tire-HQ error but is a communication error.  Generally, the user can get out of this condition by using refresh/reload option.  With the new browser, there is not actually a button that says RELOAD.  The user must then use the ""left curve arrow"" to reload.  If this doesn't work, the last resort would be have the user log out/log in.
MAKE SURE THEY ARE ACCESSING www.tire-hq.com and not anything else (check Home page , bookmarks, favorites etc)
Please emphasize logging out of all applications (GBMS, Tire-Hq, etc) every night ... and logging in fresh every morning.  It helps.  (Per Brian Sickle 4/28/04)"

Title: G3-Links-TireHQ - no cursor on applications
Description:
CP2237  Why can't I get my cursor in the field on Tire HQ Availability, or possibly other applications?
MINIMIZE OR MAXIMIZE problem"
Solution: USER NEEDS TO MINIMIZE OR MAXIMIZE (whichever they are not in when the screen opens)  THE THQ SCREEN to get the cursor in the box.

Title: Pricing Differences
Description: CP2238 Why is my pricing different in Availability vs tire catalogs.
Solution: The price Book download doesn't include their "Earned Volume Price", where as the "Availability" calculates it.

Title: TC 71 Billing Monro Mufflers
Description: CP2249  TC 71 Billing Monro Muffler?
Solution: TC 71 & answer (N) to Mass Merchant.  Enter in the Monro N/S and bill accordingly.

Title: Where is my Credit ??
Description: CP2250 I sent a sales document in a while ago ... and I havn't received my credit yet .... where is my credit?
Solution:
"There are 5 scenarios for this question:

A.  The document might be ""Pending"" in WOC.
Check WAC screen 6 (pending).  Type in the doc #, and nonsig it was issued against.  If it is listed there ... advise user what the ""pending number"" is, then transfer them to 6.6640 if they would like to speak to WOC team.<end>

B. The document is still ""On Hold"" in Tire-HQ.
User never sent the document in .... needs to go to ""On Hold"" in Financial>Sales ... click on the doc number (to resume it) then complete it <end>

C.  A G86 was issued
Have user check Financial>Reports for any G86's that need printed & dealt with.  Have user print & follow the directions listed on G86 to get their credit from WOC.<end>

D. The document was never entered into Tire-HQ
If the location has sent the document in ... in the last 30 days ... it will be in the ""Sent"" area.  To check ... click on search, type in the Doc#, then hit search

E. An Invoice has been issued and was queued to print at one time.
If an Invoice has been issued ... and is NOT listed in ""Unprinted"" Invoices ... click on Search in Financials>Invoices> .. then type in the source document in the ""Doc#"" field ... then click on Search button.  Queue to print again <eom>"

Title: W Adj use onlyGB,GC, GL, GS
Description: CP2256  Why as of 5/24/04 when trying to process a Sonsio road hazard adjustment type 'W' and 'T', it will no longer let you use condition code GH Road Hazard or GN Non Adjustable.  Can only use GB Bead Area, GC Crown Area, GL Inner Liner Area, GS Sidewall Area?
Solution:
Before:

Manifest 865 was sent to COO locations 5/24/04.  GH Road Hazard is only suppose to be used for customers that did NOT purchase a road hazard from Sonsio and Gdyr would possibly adjust the tire.  If Sonsio is involved, then they are only to use Conditions GB, GC, GL or GS. This was changed because of the requirements of the Early Warning Reporting System (EWRS) which was created from the Tread Act.

After:

As of 5/24/04, when Manifest # 865 was sent to all GBMS users, the Condition Codes GH and GN are to be used for customers that did NOT purchase road hazard coverage through Sonsio, yet Goodyear may adjust the tire anyway, often requiring a concession approval # from Product Service for pricing allowance. If Sonsio is involved, you are to use condition codes GB, GC, GL or GS.

Title: Delivery Note prices
Description: CP2263 Location received a shipment of tires and would like to print off the Delivery Note.
Solution:
"Delivery Notes are located in Order status.
1.  Click on Order>Order Status
2.  Click on View Report (for All Orders)
3.  Click on the order in question
4.  Click on the ""Detail"" button beside one of the ""Shipped"" (S) items.
5.  Click on the Print at the bottom of the page"

Title: Credit card times out at doc total
Description: CP2272  My terminal is locked up trying to get a credit card approval.  How do I get out of it?
Solution:
Get the terminal and session number from the location.
Telnet in and go to smenu.  Opt 6. Opt 3.
Find the session by pressing space bar (example pts/14 is Session 14. Find the session with LOGCNTL at the end and then go all the way to the left and write down the PID.)
By this time the screen has timed out and they just need to swipe the card and process it and it will go right thru.  If not proceed.
Press space bar till it says end, then press enter until the menu comes back up.  Press opt 1 to end then 3 to end the process.
Type in the PID you wrote down earlier & enter.
Type 1 to exit and Opt 2 to unlock the doc.  When they pull it back up, they will be able to process it right thru

Title: Not discounting off the higher price
Description: CP2289  When I raise parts & service on an item and try and discount, why does it discount off the item file price?
Solution: If they enter prices HIGHER than the item file price and then discount, the discount will be off of the item file; at this time there are no plans to change this.

Title: GCC 6 mo/12 mo Same as cash
Description: CP2291  Wants to know why he does not have 6 mo or 12 mo no interest on Goodyear Credit Card sale? (GDYR CC)
Solution:
"Since he is a multi loc location, the corp has to go in and enter the location and a y under 6 mo and or 12 mo sac. It needs to come into Akron and then back out to loc. If done today should have on Monday.
Single locations can change thru Administration then Goodyear/Kelly Credit Card Profile screen."
Dealers will only have the 12 mo no interest when corp stores have a sale. When the sale is over, the 12 mo no interest is turned off for everyone, and dealers if they choose can go out and answer Y to 12 mo, but they will NOT have the no interest feature. They will pay regular monthly rates

Title: GSA/Voyager #49999 invalid POS
Description: CP2293  Why am I getting account invalid when trying to bill out account 49999 GSA/Voyager account on POS?  (Goodyear owned locations only use account 49999 - dealers set up their own A/R account.)
Solution:
Update 4/3/09
We have blocked company owned locations from completing sales to Voyager Account #49999 per Retail.
If they have the Voyager National account bill through the National account program.
If they have a government account they should be billing through Wright Express on local books.

Title: Invoices not totaling correctly
Description:
CP2294  We have a problem that occurs in the field where the document does NOT always add up correctly. It does not happen all the time but there is a specific set of steps that occur which cause the problem. As of yet we have not been able to re-create the problem. So if a location call's in reporting this problem PLEASE have the support agent get the following information which we hope will assist us in pinpointing the cause.
We know that we will not be able to get answers to all the questions but every little bit helps.  Please forward reports with information to USEABILITY."
Solution:
"1. What terminal was inv started on - Main, Maxspeed terminal
2. How was the document Started?   Cash, Charge, Quote,     Manual, Credit Card, etc.
3. What was the original merchandise on the document?
4. If tires are involved were they selected from Sales Aid,     Merch Verify  or Cust W/O and was Road Hazard     attached?
5. Were lines voided? (if possible, how many?)
6. Were lines revised?...(We need codes, prices, quantities,     discounts)
7. Were lines added after work order printed or document     recalled?
8. Were any line items quoted off the document? (Q1, Q2)
9. Was document recalled, saved or completed on the same     terminal or different terminal?
10. Document number"

Title: Error 500/Blank screen etc
Description: CP2301 Users are getting errors or just getting blank pages (when opening documents) .. on Tire-HQ. (serious)
Solution:
"The address for Tire-HQ is:
http://www.tire-hq.com
Chances are the address they are using to access Tire-HQ is incorrect.  If they have this loaded in Bookmarks/Favorites/Home page .... confirm that the address is correct. (per instructions)"

Title: Good pings - store NOT transmitting
Description: CP2303  Store/Dealer are unable to successfully process credit cards, access links (web sites), or process check verification. Pings check out good on both the IDU and G . But unable to telnet to the store.
Solution:
"CHANGE 12-19-06
Customer needs to:
1)  Power off the IDU for 15 sec's.
2)  Turn the IDU back on.
      Note:  IDU should be operational within 15 mins.
***IF SKYEDGE - SHOULD BE BACK LESS THEM 5 MINS***
**(ALSO WHEN PINGING IDUXXXX (X=TERR#) - IF IT STARTS OUT WITH 10.9 AND PINGING - THEY ARE A HYBRID SITE - THEN MOVE TO PINGING PRYXXX TO SEE IF TIMING OUT OR NOT*****
3) In 20 mins, ping the idu and g.
     If both successful, telnet into location.
     If successful, call customer & advise satellite responding.
4)  Update the report with this info.
If any problems, send the report to HW/COMM."

Title: Slowness on web sites ( tire HQ, Mitchell, etc )
Description: CP2304  Store/Dealer has slowness on Tire HQ , Mitchell, ETC. web sites from the GBMS3 system.
Solution:
"CHANGE (effective 02/23/05)
Telnet to the store
At the # Type : (checkconnect)
At the end of the script will be a time for DIRECT & PROXY .
This time for normal responce should be around 5 to 6 sec's or less.
Ex:
DIRECT time=4.2700
PROXY  time=5.7100
If it is greater then normal, send the report to HW/COMM
****Do not power off the IDU.****  Send the report to HW/COMM who will call Spacenet for special diagnostics to determine root cause."

Title: POS/AR Voyager approval invalid
Description: CP2307  Why am I getting approval invalid on work order screen when trying to process my first POS AR account for Voyager Card?
Solution:
"On the initial invoice, you must enter GOVT in the approval field. When you get to doc total, you enter in the approval number they gave you.  Any invoices after this, it will let you enter in the approval number on the work order screen.
.......................................................................................
The approval numbers Voyager is giving our are 8-9 digits long.  Just use the last 6 number."

*****ALSO 	Have user go back to Work Order screen and make sure the account has not been changed to C.O.D.****

Title: Ultimate Vendor Cert
Description:
CP2311 "Users are wanting to know what to do about the message stating:
- they don't have a Ultimate Vendor cert on FIle, or
- it will expire by xx/xx/xx, or
- they faxed it in, but message still appears."
Solution:
"All locations are required periodicaly to fill out the ""Ultimate Vendor Cert"" and fax it to Pam Bender at 330-796-2452.  If their's is about to expire ... they will need to click on the link ""Click Here for more details"" on the Sales screen.  This will give them access to both the Vedor and Purchaser certs.
If the location has faxed in the certificate ... check WAD screen 1 (-VFC- VEN FET CERT) for a future date listed.  If it is not current, please send an email to ""Pam Dawson-Bender/NA/GDYR"""

Title: New/In Process Consumer Leads

Solution:
"Users need to broden their search:
1. Click on the drop down button in ""Show""
2. Click on ALL
3. Open the calendar beside ""Between"" text frame
4. Page back to Jan 04 (or whatever date to get all of the orders)
5. Click on Jan 1
6. Click on the Retrieve Button."

Title: Requested Ship Date
Description: CP2323 Users are asked to supply a Requested Ship Date for Order: ... in the Tire Dolly.
Solution: Encourage users to click on the calendar Icon (next to the Requested Ship date) to create a date in that field.  If the User has several line items on their order that they require separate Ship dates ... have them click on the link "Enter Line Item Ship Dates" after they type in their requested Ship Date.  New fields will appear next to each line item in their dolly.  Click on the respective calendar next to the line item to select the proper ship date. (if the "Enter Line Item Ship Dates " link is selected ... the primary Ship date at the top of the screen will not display.  To remove the line item ship dates ... click on the link "Remove Line Item Ship Dates"

"Refer caller to Tires-HQ memo
Close reports"

Title: Wright Express
Description:
CP2345  I called Voyager to get an approval number and they gave me an 8 digit number beginning with an Alpha character and my field will only take 6 digits?




2.  Voyager called the location to tell them they do not recognize the vehicle for a particular invoice loc submitted.   Loc did not put a ship to client in because the did not see anywhere on the work order screen to enter it."
Solution:
"1.  Enter the last 6 digits of the approval number only. ( If this is the first Voyager they have put thru, they must enter GOVT on work order screen to get to the doc total to enter the approval)

2.  Per Dave Johnson, this was not a requirement they needed when the program was set up.  Advise location they can enter their ship to agency on work order screen if they press F8 alt keys then F3 add ship to.    This should provide the location and Voyager with the agency name to eliminate these calls."

Title: Max Term - Can't Open GBMS application box
Description: CP2346  Max Term - GBMS application boxes will not open on any of my terminals.
Solution:
"If ... Main terminal is on home page:
- press scroll lock key twice
- then press arrow down key (this gets you back to the CPU screen).
If ... system is rebooting or sitting at press enter to continue:
- you will not be able to log into GBMS applications until the system has finished the reboot and you have pressed enter and verified the date/time question.
- When screen comes to loggin you need to press scroll lock twice and the arrow down key to get back to the home page.  Now you can access the GBMS Application boxes. However ...
IF ... that does not fix the problem, Mike F. advises the following:  When the system is up ... when user has home page & can open GBMS Plus items but not GBMS blue screen ... and no error message appears after trying to open GBMS blue screen ... it is almost always a bad permissions on /logfile.  There will be a fix to keep this from happening."

Title: PRTRD1 no print in remote dial
Description: CP2349  Why will my local printer not print when I am remote dialed into another location printer checks or statements?
Solution:
"Telnet into location.  Answer 'yes' to run smenu.
Select Option 2 - Work with database (plus).   Then 2 again - Run plus.

At >, type:  !lpstat -t, and check status of  prtrd1.
Example:   disabled since Mon Jan 24 16:16:21 EST 2005. available. Special-Forms.
Use !enable prtrd1.  Printer is now enabled and printing.
CAUSE:
Loc is not completing the step of pressing ENTER when done taking out the special forms and putting in plain paper.  When the statements or checks get done printing the system tells them to remove the special forms. At this time the system DISABLES the printer so no one can print to it.   After they change out the paper, they must press enter to ENABLE the printer."

Title: Workstation Froze
Description: CP2352  Max Term Workstation is froze.
Solution: Need the terminal number or IP address on the home page if your able to see it. Telnet on to the store and type ( checkthin) . This will give you a list of thin clients that show on line. If it is on line, send the report to HW/COMM. If it does not show on line, hold the power button in till the thin client powers off. Keep it off for 15 sec's and power it back on. The thin client will boot back up and the home page should load back up. If there is still a problem with the w/s , send the report to HW/COMM.

Title: "Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise
Description: CP2360 Users are getting the message "Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise" when entering a product code on Tire-HQ.
Solution:
"""Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise"" is just that ... they are not authorized by Goodyear to deliver this brand/service (per -BAK- BRD AUT KEY  listed on screen 49).
In all cases they are to get with their area managers to either confirm that they are authorized to deliver that product/service, (and the CAB key needs changed), or the CAB key is correct and they are NOT authorized by Goodyear to deliver that product/service.  In the later case ... they would bill on their books. If they need a contact at the Region level ... direct them to Info>Region News>Contact list."

( sethttpd  )

Description: CP2374 Users need access to GBS-Advertising Catalog, or have problems placing orders to GBS.
Solution:
"GBS is option 8 on our phone menu.  For now.. contact GBS 1-866-370-4271 (open from 7:30 A.M.- 7:00 P.M EST)

(Effective 3/21/2005 ... POS and Marketing materials are ordered thru GBS.)
In addition to the Internet, you can place orders by one of the following ways:
