Title: Electronic Deposits for A/R accounts
Description:
CP2380 DEALERS ONLY
Electonics bank deposit for A/R accounts"
Solution:
"Step 1
Issue an A/R Journal Ticket.
Reason for Issuance - Electonic Deposit
Credit the A/R account using generated code 10100
Debit the Cash account using 100xx
Press F7 you will be promted to enter a due date, press F7 again to print the journal ticket

Step 2
Issue a A/R Cash Receipt
Apply the credit line item to an open invoice(s)"

Title: Thin Client Time is incorrect
Description: CP2386  The Bottom Right Corner of my Thin Client has the wrong time.
Solution:
"**** UPDATE 11-04-08 *****

IF ONLY THE TIME OR DATE IS WRONG - CHANGE IT FROM THE HOME PAGE
Have the user left-click the mouse on the time in the bottom right hand corner of the screen. Then click on "Change date and time settings ...".
This will display the Date/Time panel.

IF THE TIME ZONE IS OFF IN ANY WAY - YOU WILL NEED TO GO INTO SETUP AND CHANGE IT THERE
The time should sync up correctly after this.

Title: How does a mechanic get compensation for warranty
Description: CP2387  Loc has redone service work performed by another Allied loc .  One repair was for a timing belt replacement that took his mechanic four hours to fix.  How does his mechanic get compensated for this work.
Solution: Per M. Kirkpatrick......Issue an Invoice with the service work discounted to NO CHARGE and select Warranty as the reason. If the tech performing the warranty work is the same one that did the work under the Allied name then they use that tech. If it's not then they use employee number 1 as the tech and the tech gets no credit....but they also do not get penalized the credit amount...please note this is only for work that was done as Allied...please create a hot news for this for future reference

Title: Forbidden
Description: CP2390  Forbidden msg on the home page
Solution: Telnet on to the store - get the terminal number . Type this command in  ( sethttpd x )  x = the terminal number. Click on logoff off and click logoff again. This will refresh the screen to the correct homepage.

Title: SESSION IN USE
Description: CP2391  Error - SESSION IN USE, OPTION IN USE or All GBMS applications exceeded ...when nothing is in the task bar.  (This error can also occur when remotely signed on to loc.)
Solution:
Have the user go to T1 on the home page .
Click on Sys Admin
Click on reset terminal
select the terminal that needs to be reset .

* If going to terminal 1 and clicking the reset terminal option does not fix the issue open a ticket for Level 3.

If REMOTE dial situation:
session in use on remote dial ...
Remote into the remote loc, go into plus (Opt. 2, opt. 2)
Do: > @spgm
verify a 'dial' or 'remote' session is listed, if so:
'dial': at > type:  delete from pgmfile where pgtrue='dial';  (press ENTER)
OR
'remote': at > type:  delete from pgmfile where pgtrue='remote';  (press ENTER)
(should get 1 row updated)
at > type: commit;  (press ENTER)
(loc should now be able to access application they were in earlier.)

Title: ROM -Shipment in use on another terminal
Description: CP2392  Why am I getting Shipment in use on another terminal when trying to select a shipment off of ROM?  I have checked the other terminals and there is no shipment on any of the screens.
Solution:
"Known problem - Telnet into location and at the # prompt type plus.  it will go to a > prompt.  type  >@unlockship............or > @unlockship2 & enter.
This will clear and commit and location should be able to access the shipment now."

Title: T1 screen sitting at Console Login
Description: CP2394 Screen on T1 is sitting at "gXXXX LOGIN" (XXXX = Territory)
Solution: If they see "gXXXX login" (XXXX = Territory) on their screen at T1 they need to press the scroll lock key twice to change the workstation over to the Thinclient side to see the home page.

Title: Replacement Maxterms
Description:
CP2397  Replacement Maxterms - How to install. GBMS3 & GBMS4

OR  If location tried to enter information themselves and entered the wrong information and getting message Page Cannot be displayed."
Solution:
GBMS4
Hold the shift key down and click on start and click the arrow to the right of Shutdown and click on restart
keep the shift key held in until you get 3 options on the screen.  Let go of the shift and Choose the 3rd option
It may take a minute or so for the setup script to come up.  Continue as on GBMS3 to fill in the information and click ok



"Swap out the deffective maxterm withthe replacement maxterm.
Turn it on and it will stop on the setup script.
1) enter the terr # ( ex: 2349 )
2) Terminal ID = is the terminal number ( ex: 1 )
3) IP address = IP address of the CPU ( ping the gxxxx to get the IP address)
4) Make sure the date , time , and time zone are correct at the bootum of the setup page.
5) click OK and the maxterm will reboot to the home page.

If customer is getting Page cannot be displayed because he entered the wrong information:
1) Have them hold the shift key down and press Start, then Log out, and are you sure you want to log out (Y)es?  Let go of shift key.
2) this will take them to the administrator screen.  Have them blank out GBMS and enter Setup and it will take them back to the setup screen.  Start at beginning of this common problem to help them enter data correctly."

Title: Code is invalid
Description: CP2399  Why does it say " code is invalid " on an accounting code entry on non-parts paid outs?
Solution:
"There is a program error in GBMS that doesn`t recognize valid accounting codes on initial entry -
the workaround is to have the user log out of GBMS, REFRESH the screen then return and retry, which generally corrects the problem."

Title: Screen Blank on the Maxterms
Description:
CP2405  1. Blue on the Maxterm   2. Screen is Blank
***Thin Client Issue***

Serial Number:
Ping Times:
Is there a report open already?
Details of Issue:
Troubleshooting:
Solution:
1.  If the screen is blue, click on start and logoff and answer 'Y' to are you sure.  Homepage should refresh itself.

2.  Blank screen -  Verify Monitor has a light, if not troubleshoot the monitor.
		Telnet onto location and run checkthin to see if maxterm is online.  If maxterm showing offline VNC in because if updates
			have recently been sent to the maxterm it could show offline in error.

		Power off maxterm and if a dot matrix printer is hooked to terminal 1 power the printer off also.

		Unplug the power cord from the back of the maxterm for 5 seconds.  Plug power cord back in and turn on the maxterm.

		If it still comes back to blank screen unplug the power cord from the electric outlet and leave unplugged until the power light
			on the power pack goes out.  Then plug back in and turn maxterm on.

		Turn dot matrix printer on.

	IF SCREEN STILL DOES NOT COME UP SEND REPORT TO HARDWARE COMM.

Title: A/R Recoveries
Description: CP2413  Dealer receives a check for A/R account written off.
Solution:
"Issue a minus Paid Out, code the check 54200.
Change the CASH field on the screen - y/n to 'N'
Deposit the check and count with nightly EOD deposits."

Title: Clearing sessions in use on Thin Clients
Description: CP2414  Why can't I reset my terminal since I am on thin clients?
Solution:
"Locations that are on thin clients now have the ability to reset screens and clear sessions in use
Have them go to the CONSOLE (T1) terminal and go to the homepage and click on System Administration and Reset Terminal.  Choose the terminal where the sessions are locked and reset the terminal(s).  They should be able to access applications now"

Title: Clear Windows print queue
Description: CP2415  How can we cancel or clear WINDOWS laser print queues not in lpstat?
Solution:
"Correcting printing to laser that is loaded into the Windows print queue, where lpstat does not display the print items requested.

GO TO THE W/S WHICH INITIATED THE DOCUMENT AND FOLLOW THE PROCEDURE TO FIX:

FIX - LOC MUST CLOSE ALL APPLICATIONS EXCEPT HOMEPAGE THEN AGENT DIALS INTO THEM THRU THE VNC ADDRESS, LOGS THE SCREEN OUT, THEN HOLDS SHIFT KEY WHEN LOGOFF IS CLICKED, ALLOWING FOR ADMINISTATOR ACCESS, administrator/ GoodYear44316 -
ONCE THE BROWSER COMES UP, CLICK START AND LAUNCH INTERNET EXPLORER , THEN HOLD CTRL AND PRESS P - THEN CLICK ON THE PRINTER ICON, BOTTOM RIGHT OF SCREEN, WHICH WILL LIST THE PRINT JOBS QUEUED - CLICK THE FILE DROP AND CANCEL ANY OR ALL JOBS TO CLEAR THE QUEUE."

Title: Print not defaulting to correct printer
Description: CP2420  Why is it that when I print, the print is no longer defaulting to the correct printer?
Solution: Log out of any open GBMS applications (ex. POS, DR). From the homepage, click Admin and go to Printer Functions then click on Set GBMS Printer.  Click on the drop down of all printers.  Highlight the printer he wants to print to, and submit. Any application he brings up now will default to that printer.

Title: Tire Rebate refund
Description: CP2422  Who do I call to inquire about my tire rebate check that I have NOT yet received?
Solution: You can call the rebate number 800-356-4484 and follow the prompts for the rebate check or call direct 1-877-777-9937

Title: How to unlock my own document
Description: CP2427  I understand there is a new option off the homepage in System Administration that will allow me to unlock a doc in use doc?  It is called Unlock Document.
Solution:
"1. System Administration on homepage now has Unlock Document on terminal #1
2. POS and DR sessions on ALL terminals must be closed to use this function. If any session is open, a screen will come up that lists the terminal with POS or DR still active.
3. Once all POS/DR apps are closed, a window will display with POS, DR, Acct Payable & Other Vendor Payable
4.  Select the type of doc and it will bring up an unlock doc screen which lists the seq #.  Enter the seq number and submit.
5.  Doc is now unlocked.

If this does not work,  agent can telnet in and unlock doc
1. Choose smenu option, option 2 work with database,
2. Type @ulock,
3. Type doc, type inv, dr, ap, or ven depending on doc type that is locked.
4. Find the doc or seq number and type in the 4 digits sequence numhber (left column) & enter,
5. Then  type commit; and enter
Exit from > and loc should be able to pull up document."

ALSO might look for the doc by clicking on  Admin > Unlock Vehicle/Tire Inspection Docs from the GBMS homepage.  If the doc is listed, put checkmark in box to left of the doc and click on Unlock button.  Then loc should be able to recall the doc.

Title: Turn off Tech Assist
Description: CP2429  How can I turn off the Tech Assist Information that is printing out on my workorders and/or invoices?
Solution:
"1)  Go to the homepage
2)  Access GBMS Plus and scroll down and click on PROFILE.
3)  Click on the block that says Tech Assist.
4)  Input ""N"" on the option you do not want it to print.
5)  Click on ""Update Profile.""
6)  Exit out of POS ... and back in.
Tech assist information should NOT print anymore for the option(s) you entered ""N""."

Title: GCC Application error
Description: CP2431  Why when I try to process a Gdyr Credit Card Application from  main menu I keep getting error when trying to process?
Solution: Thin Client locations no longer use the option off Main Menu to process Gdyr Credit Card Applications.  The process is now done thru GBMS Plus off the homepage.  It now wants you to add the customer to your data base if they are not in there, then you go back into GBMS Plus to opt 2 Credit Card Application and select customer then will take you to the information screen to provide the customers information. When you submit the information it will have you verify the SS# as before and then will go out and get the approval.  Any errors should be reported to GBMS support

Title: Code 304 System Error
Description: CP2434  Code 304 System Error (Page cannot be displayed was first error msg)
Solution:
"Pressed scroll lock twice on T1 and received 304 system error.  KVM switch light goes back and forth when scroll lock is pressed (which it should).
If all connections to KVM switch were tight:
1)  Unplug all the connections to the KVM switch (kybd, mouse, thin client, server, display).
2)  Plug the connections back into the KVM switch (does not matter which order)."

Title: Needs Tire Registration set to N (no)
Description: CP2435  Tire Registration field in Location Profile needs changed to N (no) but there are no brackets around the field to indicate a change is allowed.
Solution:
"CHANGE IS FOR DEALERS ONLY:
1)  Telnet into location and at the $ prompt, type:  plus  (enter)
2)  Type @ sql> update loccntl set lctirrg='N';  (enter)
3)  At the sql> prompt, type:  exit  (enter)
Location needs to log out of POS and back in to affect change."

Title: PPRS is in use/ PPR Locked
Description: CP2436  Why when I try to bring up my PROM and pull a vendor get "PPR is in use" or "PPR locked" message.
Solution:
"Go into plus and run the following script:

SQL>@/u/sql/lockppr.sql (enter)

Everything you need to answer the questions is displayed:
vendor number (enter)
ppr # (enter)
version # (always 0) (enter)

Should get a message indicating the effort was successful.

SQL> commit;

SQL> exit

Advise user they are okay to pull up the document."

Title: TIORD can't be found on THQ
Description: CP2440 Why can't I see my Tire order, placed in GBMS via TIORD, in Order Status (in THQ)"?
Solution: Tire orders placed via TIORD will not show up in Order status, or SAP until @ 10:00 the following day.  Infolink will not even be able to see the order.  Advise user to check Order Status in Tire-HQ after 10:00 (EST) the day after the order was placed.  This is due to the TIORD being included in the B50 EOD batch.  (The Tire order piece is given to SAP in the am)

Title: Internet site removal
Description: CP2442  Why am I unable to access some Internet sites, such as Yahoo,etc....?
Solution: In order to improve site performance on GBMS VSAT functions, many sites have been deleted and will not be added back to the access list. If the site the user is requesting is not on the list, they may continue to use the Usage Instructions button to request them. For the time being, users will not be able to access Yahoo Mail. If a dealer wants to discuss further, please refer the caller to Dealer Relations.

Title: T1 flipping back & forth from CPU to Maxterm
Description: CP2443  T1 flipping back & forth from CPU to Maxterm
Solution: Just hit the space bar one time and that will unlock the back & forth issue.

Title: Dealer tax changes
Description: CP2444  How do I change Tax Rates?
Solution: Dealers are permitted to update city, county and transit files locally.  Have the user access location profile under the Admin. Program and tab to the field that needs changed.  Type the changed percentage, blank out the remainder in the field and press enter.

Title: Power Loss
Description: CP2445  Power loss or system down procedures ( Blank Black or Blue screens )
Solution:
Location called for assistance with bringing the system back up after a power outage.

1. Ping Satelite & Server - ping IDUXXXX -t ( XXXX is the location number)
2. Have POC go to T1 and press scroll lock twice and verify if the server is rebooting.
3. Remote into the server to see if the unit came back up properly and to unlock documents as needed.
4. Check the thin clients for Blank powerterm sessions with flashing cursor on screen.
     - If blank sessions exist then remote to the terminal and left click on the computer in the upper left hand corner and close the session.
     - If homepage is missing or has error page cannot be displayed refresh page or if page missing click on start then internet explorer.

Title: computer has been locked - call administrator
Description: CP2447  Why does my system show this message " computer has been locked - call administrator " ?
Solution: Someone has pressed Ctrl-Alt-Delete - have user repeat that keystroke and press enter at the password request field, no entry - should correct the problem.

Title: ASC GBMS Security program
Description: CP2451  How do I setup security programs at this ASC location?
Solution:
"Have the location print the Letter # RSD 05-118 and read thoroughly first. If the program is currently enabled, we need to disable it, as in CP#953. Then they need to update per the letter and complete the setup, then enable again.
Remind them that each emp must exit out of their session to the big letters GBMS to drop their access for then next employee to use his own emp/pswd access.

Use this SQL> select espass,esemp from emplsec;
this will show who has emp# access and their pswd and emp#"

to turn on/off security from smenu enter: @usecure
then answer yes (on) or no (off)
then enter

Description: CP2455  TRIAD lookup problems after a Reload, i.e. not finding parts set up for selection.
Solution:
"The reload system has the wrong sys.dat file and Terri is working with Development to correct for any further reloads.
If you encounter one now , send report to Development to fix."

Title: Windows cannot start/file missing
Description: CP2458  Windows cannot start / file is missing or corrupt ... error message on thin client workstation
Solution:
"Thin client error message -- Windows cannot start because the following file is missing or corrupt   windows/system32/config/system.
power off/on thin client. If it does not fix the problem
THEN ...
1 - Get the serial number (bar code) for the EA report.
2 - Send the EA report to Shipping to replace the thin client.
3 - Explain the setup script to them and give the IP address to be entered in for the maxterm."

Title: Compiln: Update Pendposh ORA-00100
Description: CP2459  COMPILN: UPDATE PENDPOSH ORA-00100:  no data found
Solution:
"This error usually appears as a resault of the user deleting pending web orders before the document gets completed thru compdoc.
1.  At #, type:  plus      press enter
2.  At >, type:  @sdocq        press enter
     (write down the 4 digit docs number from first doc)
3.  At >, type:  select dl_gtracs_seq from dclininv where dlseq=' XXXX ';         press enter
4.  At >, type:  update dclininv set dl_gtracs_seq= '   ' where dlseq= ' XXXX ';      press enter
5.  At >, type:  commit;      press enter
6.  type:  !loadcomp        press enter
7.  At >, type:  @sdocq       press enter
8.  At sql >, type:   /        press enter  (repeat this step until all docs cleared)"

Title: Email Confirmation for Tire-HQ tire order is blank
Description: CP2463 Why is my email confirmation (tire order) blank?
Solution:
"In the mean time, there are alternatives of confirming the tire order.  Please advise users that they could check order status by logging on to Tire-HQ and click on Order from the top menu and then select Order Status.

/* Brian said it should be fixed hopefully 11/28/05, latest 11/29/05 */"

Title: Black or Hung screen with icon in upper left corne
Description: CP2469  How to close my black screen, or screen (POS, DR, etc) that is just hung up, unable to move cursor, or save doc, etc..  My task bar on the black screen shows it is POS, DR, or some other application.
Solution: Right click the tab in the taskbar at the bottom of the screen and select CLOSE.  It will close the screen. Then try to load the page again. If the message appears about session already in use. Have caller go to T1, then click Admin on the Homepage and go to Reset Terminals. Click reset for the terminal having the issue.

Title: How to print Rebate forms
Description: CP2474  Why is the rebate form not printing for the current sale event?
Solution:
To see if the Tire Qualifies for the rebate.  Sign into the location and at the plus prompt type:  Select * from rebate.  This will list the Tire Brands and dates of the rebate.

Sale must be for a minimum Qty of 4 tires on any qualified tire.  Cannot be COB 1.

On Home Page Click on Sales>Sales aid > search for tire.   Put a check in the Tire Line you want to choose and click on the Tire Product Code.  This will take you to the Tire Package screen.  Click on Details next to the Rebate message in Green.  Another window will open with the rebate info.  Print the rebate offer.

Title: Invoice search-over 90 days old
Description:
CP2475 How to print invoices that are greater than 90 days old, or ones that were deleted from Tire-HQ?


Modified 11/15/2007"
Solution:
"For Invoices older than 90 days:

1.  Go to Financial > Invoices
2.  Click on Search link
3.  Click on radio button ""Search for specific Invoice greater than 90 days old""
4.  Click on the drop down menu in ""Customer#"" field, and select the non-sig number the Invoice was issued against.
5.  Type in the Invoice number OR Source Document number
6.  Click on the Drop down menu in ""Invoice Date MONTH"" field, and select the month issued.
7.  Click on the Drop down menu in ""Invoice Date YEAR"" field, and select the year issued.
8.  Click the Search button (the results will display)
9.  Click the Invoice number (Adobe will launch)
10.  Click on the printer icon located in the upper left corner of the Adobe screen, then select OK to send document(s) to your printer."

Title: Roadside assistance Q's
Description: CP2478 Users need assistance in processing Roadside service calls (4 Tires-Now) thru the New Call process.
Solution:
"Encourage users to first view the On-Line viewlet located in the ""New"" link in the Roadside Service Call Reports sub menu.  It is also located in Commercial>Commercial Help.
Advise users that they can quickly access the New call reports Transactions>Roadside Service Call  Reports on Tire-HQ home page.
If you are able to resolve their problem , close the EA report after detailed info is supplied.
**If you are unable to resolve the issue, please update the EA report with detailed information, then transfer to XPLOR."

Title: 4TN-Invalid Call number
Description: CP2484 User is attempting to process a road service (breakdown) call and are getting the message "Invalid Call Number" when creating a document through Sales.
Solution:
"Have the user click on Commercial.Roadside Service calls.  If they locate the call there, have them select it & finish it.  If the call is not listed there ...
Need to ask the following question:
""Did Interstar call your location to service this breakdown?""
NO - If the answer is no (meaning the driver called them direct, or their company did), they DO NOT mark this call as a 4 Tires Now call.  There will not be a Roll time, date or call # associated with this.
YES - If Interstar called them, gave them a call# ect ... see if this user can access every nonsig in their common ownership.  If they can, send the report back to XPLOR to analyze.  If not, have the UA sign on & see if they can see the call.  Send back to Xplor if the UA cannot locate the call."

Title: GS Credit Card Approvals invalid
Description: CP2490   Why is my GS approval number for credit card sales  coming up invalid on POS for my Govt local billing?
Solution: Per Debbie Freer in Govt accounts, All GS credit card approvals were removed from all States as of Feb 1, 2006.  The commission has been increased slightly to accomodate this change.

Title: G874 Corrections
Description: CP2498  How do I handle corrections after Physical Inventory is finalized? G874
Solution:
"Company owned locations must use the G874 Corrections option to make adjustments to screen and/or book.
Advise the user to review the G874 letter in RIC (Retail operation center) thoroughly first, available via retail stores info area (Semi Annual Physical Inventory-G874 corrections).
If their issue is still unresolved, get as much as possible regarding the product code or part # entries on all segments of the original postings to inventory and refer call to Support Level 2 for assistance."

Title: Replace User Admin at Dlr
Description:
CP2499 The current User Administrator is no longer working for this dealership, or needs to be replaced by someone else. (If this is a company owned location, use CP1080)

Existing Username for new admin:
New User Admin's
	first & last name (confirm spelling):
	email address:
	phone number:

Owners name & number OR Goodyear Rep's name, User ID (A#, can be found on the phone book on GO), and phone number
Solution:
"1. Get information from the caller requested in the Description:
2.  Advise caller that this request will be initiated.
3.  Transfer the ticket to Tire-HQ advising other details if given.

Lvl2:
1. Contact the Owner listed in WAD screen 2 using the number listed on screen 1 of WAD (Or manager of the location if it's a large corporation.) and confirm that this is the name/number supplied above.
2. Confirm the # of customers (nonsigs) user will need access to
3. Inform the owner/manager that they will be setup & emailed their username & password
4. Send out email notification
5. If the prior User Administrator is to be deleted ... then delete them at this time.

Title: GEO Code Requirement
Description: CP2508 Problem- I have a  new field to fill out when I click Delivery out of State (City, or County )- Yes.  How do I get the GEO code for the city's GEO Code?"
Solution:
"A GEO Code will now be required for all deliveries made out of state for some, and for others, a GEO code will be required even if they deliver it out of their city. (This is used for Tax billing purposes) Recomend they watch the GEO training Viewlet.

First confirm that the delivery took place outside of their building.  If a customer is from Wala Wala Wa., and the service was performed INSIDE their dealership, then the question will be answered  NO.
States are broken down into two types - Origin & Destination.
For dealers residing in an Origin state, a delivery is considered ""out of state"" when it is delivered outside of their state/province.
For dealers residing in a Destination state, a delivery is considered ""out of state"" when it is delivered:
- outside of their state/province
- outside of their city
- or outside of their county
To get the GEO code for out of State/City, or county
1. Click on the Search button
2. Type in one or any of the following City/State/Zip/County (if applicable)
3. Hit Search.
4. Select the proper line, and value will be filled in automatically!"

Title: Voyager #8579
Description: CP2509 NA #8579 Voyager  (non-government billing)
Solution:
WHEN PROVIDING ESTIMATE FOR AUTHORIZATION PURPOSES USE GOODYEAR B300 PRICING.
Service Card Number(15 digit card number)
   Copy the embossed 15 digit card number exactly as it appears on the service card
Need the name and address of Client's Firm making the Purchase
You MUST obtain an Authorization Number by calling the Voyager authorization line TOLL FREE 800/987-6589

NOTE: TIRES FOR FEDERAL OR STATE/LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES CAN NOT BE BILLED OR PROCESSED THROUGH THE VOYAGER CARD.  EFFECTIVE 11/30/08, GSA NOW PROCESSES THROUGH WRIGHT EXPRESS (WEX) BILLING PROGRAM USING MASTERCARD ON POS.  SEE COMMON PROBLEM 2221.

Title: EOD IS RUNNING ... please wait
Description: CP2524  End of Day IS RUNNING ... please wait (EOD)
Solution:
"Telnet into location
Go to 'Plus' menu
choose option '9' - UTILITIES MENU
choose option '4' - SYSIPL
Location Console will show 'ok', click ok, reboot will start.

When system finishes reboot it will give them one of the following messages:
End of day processing completing
OR
End of Day did not complete - Previous day's business will be combined with today's business.

If they receive the second message, please encourage user to run their end of day right away to keep the two days of business separate.  Otherwise, they can wait until they run their next eod and combine the data.

IF THIS IS A RETAIL STORE, STRONGLY EMPHASIZE THE NEED TO RUN THEIR EODCO BEFORE DOING ANY NEW BUSINESS.  ESPECIALLY IF THIS IS A RETAIL STORE AND IT IS TIME TO FINALIZE HOURS WORKED, THAT MUST BE DONE BEFORE ANY NEW BUSINESS ON FRIDAY MORNING.

IF ... problem not resolved, send report to Level 3 bucket."

Title: Error on message file.  Notify support ... when sy
Description: CP2525  'Error on msg file - notify support' when system comes up
Solution:
"At #, type:  view /logfile    enter.

Packet writer error will resemble the following:
SELECT-PGMFILE  ORA-12571: TNS:  PACKET WRITER FAILURE

To fix the packet writer failure issue:
1.  At #, type:  sysipl    Enter.  (SYSIPL will correct the situation and refresh system.  Otherwise, the location will continue to get this error until they are unable to do much of anything.)
2.  If problem persists or repeat reports made from same locations after following #1, update report and forward to Support 2."

Title: Electronic Dep for Non CC Trans
Description: CP2529  How do I enter an Electronic deposit I got for Sonsio, since I cannot process it under AR Payments/Direct Deposit because I do NOT have a card type for Sonsio, Acct 00068?  This could possibly be for other non credit card Electronic deposits as well.
Solution:
"The location would issue an AR JT under  (ex) acct 00068 (SONSIO).  It will come up and ask reason for issuance.  They would enter electronic deposit.
The first accounting code  to come up would be 10100  They would  credit ( - ) the dollar amount they need to deposit and enter.  Then a blank acctg code field would come up.  they would enter in 10000 and tab to the amount and enter a debit  ( + ) amount to balance out the credit.  Then F7 to print. If asks for a due date, press F7 again.   This will put a credit line on the AR account.(00068)  They would go out to ARPAYMENTS, cash check receipt, enter the account (00068) then press enter.  Cursor will be on check #, press enter.  it will fill in 0's and go to the line field.  They will scroll down to look for the credit line they created via the JT.  Enter the line number and F2 and that will put that money in  APP (right side of screen) so they can apply it to their lines.   Apply to required lines and print.   JT will NOT affect the cash on their EOD."

Title: Triad Catalog Unavailable
Description: CP2532  I just successfully loaded by current Triad CD and now when I go into POS or DR, getting message "Triad Catalog Unavailable".  Why?
Solution:
"THE FIX:
 cat /u/triad/VOL.DAT   (this shows what month triad loaded)

Then do:
 cd /u/triad

then:
run_monthly

to get out of /u/triad directory:
type cd, then space and enter, then exit."

Title: TRIAD - Costing of Part
Description: CP2539  Problem costing part in TRIAD
Solution:
"Telnet into dealer location.
1)  At #, type:  loadlog   ENTER
2)  At GBMS, press ENTER
3)  From GBMS Main Menu, select Product Administration.
4)  Select TRIAD Maintenance option 7.
5)  Select the Mfg LineCode Setup.
6)  Page down to the mfg in question (i.e. AIRTEX)
7)  Type in the line # for Airtex, ENTER.
8)  Page down to the catalog for the part in question (i.e. New Water Pump).
9)  Look at the last column on that line.  If it is blank, the mfg has dropped the catalog so TRIAD did not publish it.  YOU need to contact TRIAD 1800-338-7423 ext 6411 catalog dept and report the problem.  (current contact is Doreen Slater).
10)  The Dealer will need to bill the item using the price of the part on the invoice from the parts house from which the part was obtained.  (This solution does not apply to PIMS users.)"

Title: Homepage/Reports/Export Data
Description: CP2550  I exported a customer maintenance list to Excel and want to know what the headers on the report mean?
Solution:
"Please keep for future reference
CMLPDT    =  Last Payment Date
CMLPDTN =  Last Payment Document Number (Cash Receipt)
CMLINV     =  Last Invoice Date
CMLINVN  =  Last Invoice Number
CMMTD     =  Current Month To Date Purchases
CMYTD      =  Current Year To Date Purchases
CMPYR      =  Prior Year Purchases"

Title: Month End Cutoff Prompt
Description: CP2555  If the last day of the month falls on a Sunday, will I be prompted to run my month end on Saturday?
Solution: Yes, the system will prompt you on Saturday.   It goes by how they have their scheduled times set up on PROF. If they are open on Sunday then it will not prompt them till Sunday to do month end. If the PROF shows 0 hours for Sunday, then the system will prompt for month end on Saturday.   Same if they have their AR set up for the last day of the month.

Solution:
"1st - make sure you are able to telnet to the store.
Spacenet is looking into the problem. The problem is NOT with the store but with Chicago. Tell the customer to keep trying."

Title: License  Warning Msg on  Work/Stations
Description: CP2572  You are approaching the limit of total licenses in use
Solution: All screens will have this message. It is for the New CPU's going in place right now. They are allowed 20 sessions open right now (GBMS sessions) . If they open more then this - they will get the warning. The New CPU's will shut the session down just like if POS is open more then once on a workstation. If they are still on the old server - it will not stop them from opening it up.

Title: Vendor Payables Maintenance
Description:
CP2573 Add New Vendor Retail store instruction.
Instructions for Dealers is different but explained below.
Solution:
RETAIL INSTRUCTIONS:

Vendors can only be added to the master database via the Vendor Request process.

Submitting a Vendor Request does not guarantee that the vendor will be approved and added to the master database.

Goodyear GO page using the store managers' PC
Complete New Vendor Request form located on the RIC under Inventory & Vendor Management > Vendor Database
Obtain complete W-9 from vendor

Scan and submit complete request form and W-9 to Submit the approved request form and W-9 to retail vendor request@goodyear.com.

DEALER INSTRUCTIONS:

1) NON-SERVICE
TYPE 1, Non-service, is used for all merchandise payments to vendors that are not a "SERVICE" and all services that are not performed by private individuals or Medical. Examples are general merchandise, service department parts, or utility companies.
2) MEDICAL
Type 2 is used for all "MEDICAL" related payments to vendors. Regardless of whether dealing with an individual doctor, group of doctors or an incorporation of doctors, either an Employer Identification Number (EIN) or a Social Security Number (SSN) is required.
3)SERVICE
Type 3 is for all other "SERVICES" to or for your location except medical expense.
Examples of services to or for your location that require a Social Security Number (SSN) if an individual is:
Towing, Locksmith, Window Washer, Floor Cleaners, Snow Plowing, Maintenance Service, Attorney fees, Trash removal, Tire removal, etc.

Title: Dealer Server Refresh inquiries

Title: TC 91 write - down and TC 90 write - off
Description: CP2578 TC 91 write - down and TC 90 write - off
Solution:
"Stores can only write down overage or damaged products (tires, tubes, batteries), therefore they use TC 91 and the entries are as follows:
 On the first line, type the original product code ( such as 187406016) and qty to be relieved from inventory, then press enter.
On the next line enter code 114777777 and negative qty equal to line #1, then press enter - this brings back the stock under that code automatically set to $0.01. This doesn`t appear on the d/r, but only on their m/e operating statement.
Stores no longer can actually write-off the stock, under TC 90. This doctype is set for Dealer use only and they would only type in the 114777777 as a positive qty to relieve their inventory."

Title: Mitchell on Demand Application
Description:
CP2580  Ondemand5direct.com vs ondemand5.com Access
4/1/09 - Problem getting to the web site today.  hw/comm checking into the problem.  Have loc try later.
Solution:
"Ondemand5direct.com ...  is the web site for GBMS workstation and the dealer username is:  dlrXXXX (terr#).  Allows two GBMS workstations to access Mitchell site at the same time.
Ondeman5.com  ...   is the web site for dealer PC Access and the username and password are assigned by Mitchell.  PC access allows two workstations to access Mitchell at the same time."

For Company-owned stores, the username and password for ondemand5direct.com is:   Username:  gsrXXXX (terr#)   Password: goodyear

Title: STORES - PRINT INV PADS
Description: CP2585 Why when I try to print all pads in physical inventory print pads, I get message that no pads are available?
Solution: It is because they do NOT have the Current CD loaded in their system.  Take them back to main menu and it will show on the left side what version they are using.  Once they load the Current CD, they will be able to print the pads

Title: 12 mo no interest on GDYR Card
Description:
CP2586 Why can't I bill my customer 12 months no interest
when he is purchasing over $500?  I have a flyer here stating that this promo is in effect for a specific date.
Solution:
"Retail Stores
The flyer in question was sent out by Gdyr Credit Card, NOT Retail Stores.   Goodyear Credit Card does offer the 12 months no interest,  but Retail stores decides when they want to offer a promo and will open it up on those dates only.   If the customer comes in with a flyer or promo that falls on other dates, then the store should get with their DMR.

DEALERS
Dealers have the option of going to Administration to Gdyr/Kelly Profile and signing up for 12 mo with interest.  It will not take affect till the next day.  For Multi locations,  only the corp office has access to this application."  If the customer insists on the no interest, will need to call Goodyear Credit Card to see if they will change it on their end.

Title: POS Inv not allowing negative lines
Description: CP2588  Goodyear Retail location is unable to enter a negative line item to a debit invoice.  (Company-owned locations ONLY)
Solution:
"The POS pricing / discount indicators on the third screen of the location profile are set to Y for ALL COMPANY-OWNED stores.  This means that NO NEGATIVE LINE ITEMS may be included on sale invoices with positive line entries, EXCEPT for the codes below:

092208  Free Tire Replacement Credit
020100  Service Coupon
062501  Auto Speed Guarantee
032000  Redeem Gift Certificate
011        Used Tires (also used to provide instant tire rebates                 at associate sales)
256        Casings
012        Used Truck Tires (also used to provide instant credit                card rebates at associate sales)
034001  Battery
046218  Warranty Deductible
This function is designed to BETTER MANAGE unnecessary or unauthorized discounts to customers.

Stores can refer to RSD Letter 04-49 Invoice Redesign (Discounting), contact their DMR or Region if they have questions."

Title: Invoices will not queue to print
Description: CP2589 Invoices will not print
Solution:
"When the user to print invoices, it comes back nothing queued to print.

Get the user name and forward to Xplor bucket.  This is for tracking purposes only. No one will call them back.

Tell the customer that we are working on the problem and will have a resolution shortly.  Have them try back periodically.  If they can not see the invoices in unprinted have them look in printed"

NOTE:  PER MH - THQ LVL2 - INVOICES ARE NEVER RELEASED ON MONDAYS.

Title: Changing Security for Dealers
Description: CP2591  How can I get access to a GBMS application that tells me I am not authorized to use.
Solution:
"Security at Dealer Locations:

GBMS Support Agents are NO LONGER PERMITTED to unlock GBMS security.

IF	 ... Dealer location is locked out of GBMS

THEN	... Dealer location must contact the Owner of the company (or someone he assigned) to change security / give them access.

IF	... Owner calls GBMS because he/she is locked out of security:

THEN	...Ask the owner ... Does anyone at your location have access to reset the password?

If NOT ... You may need to walk the owner through resetting his password and security  options.

IF 	... No one else has access to GBMS security:
THEN	... Print the ""GBMS Security Change Form""
               (found S:\GBMS\CLIENT\Forms and Faxes\GBMS Security Change Form.docx) and fax it to the location.  This form must be completed and faxed back before you can turn GBMS security off.

To Verify the owner of the location:
1. Go into ""WAD00000 -TIRE DIV MASTER FILE MAINT"" on your TPX menu.
2. Choose option ""1"" and press enter
3. Choose option ""G - BILLTO NONSIG INDEX "" and press enter.
4. Enter the locations Goodyear Nonsig number and press enter.
5. Find the location on the list and choose that line # and press enter.
6. Choose Option ""2""  - New Dealer Info
In the first column there is the following field:
"" DH - OWNERS NAME  PAUL ANDERSON"""

Title: Sales Stats Purged at End Of Month
Description: CP2595  Cannot get Sales Stats after month end EOD.
Solution:
"Sales stats purge from the GBMS system daily and is a critical issue at month end.

If Daily or MTD stats were not printed at month end EOD, advise user to add the figures manually from the last day's invoices to the MTD sales stats from the previous day."

Title: Satellite down due to weather
Description: CP2597  Satellite is not working.
Solution:
"Some areas are having heavy snow today and dish maybe covered with snow.
1. If not correct lights on IDU then have location power cycle it to see if it comes back.
2. If it does not and they have access to roof, they could go out and attempt to clear snow off dish.
3. If not they will have to wait until snowing stops and we can dispatch spacenet at that time but if problem is due to the snow buildup the location will be charged by spacenet.
(This is up to the Dealer whether or not they want to pay between $300 and $400 for spacenet to come out and clear snow.  Retail stores will not be dispatched, per Retail)."

Title: Appointment Schedule access gives Java error
Description:
CP2599  Accessing appointment schedule in GBMS Plus and get Java error message:

failed to connect to database (3) java.lang numberformatexception:nu"
Solution:
"SYMPTOM:
Appointment schedule screen comes up blank or not fully loaded (body of screen is white/blank)

FIX:
In plus, type the following:
SQL>@fixappt

This queries apptschd table for any record where the date field contains a null value.  If a result is found, proceed to run script below:

@fixapptrem

This script removes the null record from the the apptschd table.

Have the user get out of the appointment schedule and try again,  They should be okay now.  If trouble persists, log details of steps taken up to this point and escalate to Support 2."

Title: Error Code (500) sethttpd
Description:
CP2604 User receives the following error when trying to access functions from the GBMS Plus menu:

"The page you requested cannot be displayed.  (Code 500)" or "Action Canceled" on the left side of the homepage or the entire homepage.

The GBMS system encountered a fatal error and could not complete the requested operation.  Please try the request again.  If it continues to fail, please contact the GBMS Support Desk to assist with problem resolution."  Sethttpd
Solution:
"The error msg can appear in the main body of the screen or on the left pane.

In 99.9% of cases, restarting the apache webserver connection corrects this problem.

From the Utilities option, select:
1. sethttpd (enter)

You should see the following result:
apachectl restart: httpd restarted

2.  Go to homepage and refresh page (button at top of screen with two green arrows) and have user try again.

If problem persists after taking the steps noted above, annotate in detail any error msg given (even if the same as described in this report) as well as any additional steps taken and forward to Support 2."

Title: System Running in Mnt Mode
Description:
CP2608 When I try to login to my terminal, I get message:  "System is Running in maintenance Mode"
******NOTE UPDATE TO THIS CP BELOW******
Solution:
1. Telnet into location

2. SMENU, Opt. 2, type: !lpstat -t
(to be sure print services have not stopped. If they have, then just run /usr/lib/lpsched. This should enable print services if maintenance if stopped at mntakrp, 2380 ready)

3. SMENU, Opt. 9, Opt. 10 to run MNTREST (enter)

Location should be able to login ok.  Make a note in work history that your ran mntrest.

******IF THE ISSUE PLAGUING THE USER IS SIMPLY B50 LEFT RUNNING, REQUIRING SYSIPL TO GET THEM GOING AGAIN, SIMPLY ADVISE USER TO COMPLETE THEIR EOD BEFORE STARTING NEW BUSINESS AND CLOSE REPORT******

IF PRB DUE TO ARCHIVE (VIEW LOGFILE FOR ERROR), THEN  LOG THIS ISSUE UNDER CP 3083 AND SEND THE REPORT TO LEVEL 3 FOR REVIEW/ CORRECTION AFTER RUNNING MNTREST TO ALLOW THE USER BACK ON THE SYSTEM.

FOR ALL OTHER ERROR MSGS FOUND IN LOGFILE OUTSIDE OF THE ABOVE NOTED:  COPY THE ERROR MSG FROM THE LOGFILE AND FORWARD REPORT TO LEVEL 3 FOR REVIEW/ RESOLUTION.

Title: Penske adj-Warrantable or Non-Warrantable
Description:
CP2611 What are the warantable and non-warrantable conditions used on Penske for tires?
NA #6581 and #6582 (Foreign)
Solution:
"***Adjustment Process ? Do NOT select the "Adjustment" button on the sales screen. This process is unique to Penske. When asked if the tire is Adjustable, enter "Y" for yes, or "N" for no on the requirements screen. If the tire is not warrantable, include the 'Non-warrantable condition' code. If the tire is warrantable, provide the Penske pre-printed claim#, and the 'Warrantable condition' code. Finalize the replacement sales transaction. Next, send the warranty tire and the completed PENSKE claim form to Product Services for Penske adjustment credit. Please reference Product Service Bulletin PSB #2006-21 for further instructions.__

Warrantable conditions__
W01-Belt/Tread separation_
W02-Sidewall separation_
W03-Liner separation_
W04-Open tread splice_
W05-Repair failure_
W06-Other warrantable_


Non-warrantable conditions__
NR1-Sidewall injury_
NR2-Impact break_
NR3-Ran over foreign object_
NR4-Brake skid_
NR5-Chain damage_
NR6-Theft_
NR7-Run flat to destruction_

NM1-Misalignment_
NM2-Nail hole in tread_
NM3-Low 32nds - PM_
NM4-Recap - non adjustable_
NM5-Stock tires

Title: No kdocs received in new month
Description: CP2614 Dealers Only - Why am  I into the new month already and have NOT received any Kdocs (gdyr invoices)?"
Solution: The reason is that Wholesale Billing cuts off the 2nd work  day of the new month .  Then it takes at least two days after that before locations will be receiving any kdocs.

Title: How to change Password
Description: CP2619 How do I change my password on Tire-HQ?
Solution:
1.  In TireHQ, go to Account > Change password
2.  Enter a New Password that is at least 7 characters, containing at least 1 number.
3.  Press the tab key.
4.  Re-type your New Password.
5.  Click Apply Change
6.  Click OK to confirm the change
7.  Advise location not to log out or back in for 10 minutes.

If the browser saves passwords confirm to save the password.

The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company does NOT recommend that passwords get saved.

Title: EOD OOB
Description: CP2621 User reports calls from DMR regarding stats not being received or EODs not clearing/ running.
Solution:
"Location could be in an out of balance condition.  There are several things to check before escalating the report.

1. From plus, check to see that all B50 sequences in dcmstview are completed.
     - SMENU, Opt. 2
     - select * from dcmstview where dmtype ='B5';

NOTE:  Normally, there will only be one B50 sequence showing, unless backed up due to an out of balance condition or other issue.  In which case, you may see several sequences still there (status being blank or 7 or otherwise).

2. Log onto TPX (mainframe) to see where this loc stands on the processing of their EODs
     - RSY (GBMS B50 Processing Status)
     - type 1 (B50 Status Inquiry)

 A.  If an out of balance condition exists, data will display as follows with any B50 completed thereafter as "pended":
 		8952 183 070207 OUT-BAL  00000 00       N        N NOT-PROC  N   N   N   N  N
 		8952 184 070307 PENDED   00000 00       N        N NOT-PROC  N   N   N   N  N

		Inform the user that these issues are checked daily and corrected by host programming.  If the condition occurs over a weekend or holiday, it 		is corrected the next business day.  *****Annotate the report with details and close.*****

B.  If the display on TPX (mainframe) shows only "pended" status for the completed B50 listed as shown below:
	 	8952 184 070307 PENDED   00000 00       N        N NOT-PROC  N   N   N   N  N
 		8952 185 070307 PENDED   00000 00       N        N NOT-PROC  N   N   N   N  N
 		8952 186 070307 PENDED   00000 00       N        N NOT-PROC  N   N   N   N  N

		Annotate the report accordingly and forward to Level 3.

FYI:  Reports are received in Network each morning regarding any OOB conditions (see A above)...these are then communicated to Manish Gupta (GBMS Pgmg) and/ or Bob Hohenadel (GBMS Host pgmg) to correct the OOB condition depending on the cause.  If the B50s are simply "pended" and building up (see B above), the condition does not automatically alert anyone, therefore, need report to Level 3 to review/ resolve or escalate further if necessary.

Title: How to reprint G82s (GTRACS)
Description: CP2624 User user reports all g82s did not print when the interface was completed.  How do I reprint them?
Solution:
"Support agent will need to log onto the location and take a look at the ""Completed Document Totals"" screen of the audit trail.  These documents appear as INV MGT type, named RETREAD PROD on the audit trail.  Make a note of the document number for each and do the following to get the four digit sequence numbers for each:

1. From SMENU, Opt. 2 - Plus, enter PR# (enter)

2. At the prompt, type:  select * from dcmstview where dmtype ='IA'; (enter)
Get the corresponding four-digit sequence number for each document number noted from audit trail.

3. Give user the sequence numbers then advise of the following steps to reprint (may want to VNC onto user's term to watch as they follow your instructions):

     - Main Menu

     - Opt. 9  Inventory Admin

     - Opt. 5  G82 Retread Prod Menu

     - Opt. 2  G82 Reprint
Here is where they will enter each of the four digit sequence numbers in order to reprint them.  ***NOTE: User can only reprint them one at a time, no way to do them simultaneously.

Annotate EA report with appropriate details.  If all steps here followed successfully, note in WORK HISTORY that prb resolved via steps contained in this common problem and close.  If there is still an issue, forward to Support 2 with detailed account of remaining issue in WORK HISTORY."

Title: DCMSTWRK ORA-00100 No Data Found
Description: CP2678 User calls in reporting the following error msg:  DCMSTWRK ORA-00100 No Data Found
Solution:
"The only solution is to delete the sequence number and have the user start a new document.

To correct, do the following:
1.  From SMENU, Opt. 2, type EA PR# (enter)

2.  From the prompt,
SQL> select * from dcmstview where dmseq ='XXXX'; (enter)
(where XXXX is the sequence #)

3. SQL> select * from dcmstwrk where wkseq ='XXXX'; (enter)
There will be no record in this table for the sequence

4. SQL> delete dcmstinv where dmseq ='XXXX'; (enter)

****Note:  If the document happens to have line items on it (DMNOITM), then you will also need to delete the sequence from table dclininv also. (delete dclininv where dlseq ='xxxx';)

Can advise user to start new document and that the bad sequence has been cleared from their system."

Title: Not able to change TTax field
Description: CP2688   ASC - I cannot change the Ttax field on a workorder.
Solution:
"The following change was requested by the Tax Department because locations were not charging tire tax when they should have been.   Even if it is a Government account they need to check their states tax rules.  (EX: Kentucky charges tire tax on all sales except when selling a tire for resale.

Manifest #993 7/16/07 -
Point Of Sale:
  At the direction of the Tax Department you will no longer be able to change the TTAX indicator on the W/O screen from its generated default value, IF that generated default value is ""Y"".  If the generated default is ""N"" then it can be changed to ""Y"" but NOT back to ""N""."

....NOTE..... Dealers are able to change the field by going to work order screen and answering N in TTAX field

what app the user was trying to use
the terminal the were on
and the session id that was listied at the end of the error message"

Title: (DCPH) COMPDRV :INSERT-DOCIMAGE: ORA-00001: unique
Description:
CP2697 (DCPH)  COMPDRV (COMPCST) :INSERT-DOCIMAGE: ORA-00001: unique constraint

*****Check logfile to verify this error appears.  Do not log against this CP for any other DCPH instance other than error noted above*****"
Solution:
"These errors invariably prove to be D/R OR INVOICE transactions completed from one terminal, but recalled and/ or  left up on another terminal and finalized again or saved to pending from the second terminal.

Until we get this problem permanently resolved, the workaround is this:

1. SMENU, Opt 2 - Plus, enter EA # (enter)

2. @sdocq
To get seq # of doc at top of list (should be a DR)
Do a !loadcomp at this point, view logfile and copy error into EA report to confirm it applies to this CP.  Proceed to step 3.

3. Type: select dmtc,dmdoc,dmseq,dmb50 from dcmstdr where dmseq='nnnn';

Take note of the doc transaction (TC) , doc number, doc sequence, B50 number  and request fax of document from user.  Record this in the EA report and forward on to Support 2 for resolution (along with the fax)."

Title: ORA-00913
Description: CP2698  Failed to connect to database.  DB1  Java Sql ORA-00913 too many values insert into customer master value 7683
Solution:
"1. SMENU

2. Opt. 2 (plus)

3.  Type: !loadlog (enter)

4.  (enter) and type: CVMNT
(you are in the customer/ vehicle maintenance screen)

5. Opt. 1 - Add/ Revise Cust Info (tab)

6.  Type customer name or first few letters thereof to choose from list.
At this point, you can see the customer name with any special characters that may be causing the problem.  Commas and quotes may simply be removed, while ampersand (&) signs can be replaced by the word and .

7.  Tab to name field to make appropriate changes.

8.  (enter) to finalize changes.

9.  F1, F8, F8

Have user attempt their task again, it should complete successfully now.

If there is still difficulty after following the steps above, document the report with full detail of steps taken and any resulting errors before forwarding to Support for further troubleshooting."

Title: I did not receive nightly reports
Description:
CP2702 Location did not receive overnight reports or DMR has not received the store's stats. (see solution)

* Communications Down or Unstable: CP3923
Solution:
1.  Is location on the R7954000 GBMS Daily Transmission Report? Is the location on the Out Of Balance Conditions notification?
If yes to either, and the caller is looking for overnight reports, note report accordingly and forward to Interface. Otherwise, if yes, advise that stats will be updated upon the next successful transmission processing and proceed to troubleshoot overnight communications issues if present. If no, proceed to step 2A for missing stats and 2B for overnight reports.

*** INTERFACE: Send down transmission and proceed from step 3.

2.  SMENU, Opt. 5 - List /u/dsxvol
* A (missing stats): Take note of the time indicated next to the BKUP file from yesterday's day. Go into plus and use command "@seeb50". Check the list of recent cutoffs and make sure one was created yesterday. If the time of yesterday's B50 cutoff is later than the BKUP file time, then they did not perform the cutoff in time for data to be received. System pulls data about one hour after the closing time for that day according to the location's profile (PROF) screen. Changes to location profile will not take effect for transmissions until the day after the next successful B50/EODCO and transmission. Note what happened, advise the caller, and close report.

* B (overnight reports): If there are files present there with the suffix .GZ, go to step 3.
If no files listed there, they may be queued to print and held, or were printed and lost. Check the printer settings for overnight printing on the homepage, make sure it is enabled. If the printer is not working, check the queue of the printer set for overnight printing (SMENU, Opt 7, Opt. 3). If held print jobs are not found, check Akron Reports in the Reports menu on the homepage to reprint. If still not found, or if this is a persistent issue, note the issue and forward to Support.

3.  Opt. 9 - Utilities Menu, Opt. 11 Mntunzip
This will uncompress the files in dsxvol with the suffix .GZ

4.  Opt 6 - Run a utility/ mnt program (runpgm) and type: mntupdt
You will see mnt programs running across the screen.  Once complete, hit enter.

5.  Opt. 6 - Run a utility/ mnt program (runpgm) and type: mntakrp
This job runs nightly reports and send them to printer 1.  When msg ""MNTAKRP ended....press enter to continue"" displays, do so.

6.  Opt. 1 - Exit, Opt. 1 Exit.

Title: DCPH
Description: CP2703 I am getting DCPH message on my system.   Document Completion Halted - Call Support - Continue to use system
Solution:
"1. SMENU, Opt. 2 - Plus

2. Type:  @sdocq
Make a note of the document sequence and document type as well as the date.

3. Type: !loadcomp
This restarts the document completion process.  If all docs are clearing through compdoc okay, then note report accordingly advising user all documents have completed and their stats are updated.  If documents are not clearing, view logfile to see the error message being given as noted in step 4 below.

4. Type: !tail /logfile
Copy and paste error message into work history of the EA report.  Based on error rec'd, check GBMS 3 problem guide for the appropriate steps to clear problem or how/ where to escalate.

Some example error messages that may be received are:
-UTADJPIN: (UTADJPIN,  09) SIZE ERROR ON ID-QOH - escalate to Support 2
-COMPILN :UPDATE PENDPOSH ORA-00100: no data found - escalate to support
-UTADJPIN: INVALID COST IND - escalate to Support 2

These are just a few possible examples of errors that can be the causing the problem, again, refer to GBMS 3 problem guide for details depending on the error."

Title: TPMS Vehicle
Description: CP2704  How do I activate TPMS Vehicle/or why is my invoices printing "TPMS STATUS UNKNOWN."
Solution:
"TPMS PROMPTS IN GBMS FOR LOCATIONS WITH TRIAD:
Please be advised that the following changes SHOULD be on your GBMS System effective 09/27/07:

  For locations on TRIAD:
In Point Of Sale, Delivery Receipt & Customer Vehicle Management we have added TPMS Vehicle reference when a vehicle is selected that is equipped with a ""Tire Pressure
Monitoring System (TPMS)"". After selecting a vehicle you will receive ""pop-up""  notification informing you that the vehicle is TPMS equipped or the TPMS Status for this vehicle is unknown. This is so that you and the Technician working on the vehicle are aware that a special tool may be required when dismounting/mounting tires from this vehicle. A printed notice will also appear on the work orders for both D/R and POS but ONLY for those vehicles equipped with TPMS.

  To activate the TPMS function you need to update the TPMS indicator in your location profile.   There is a new indicator on the second screen entitled TPMS. This will initially be set to ""N"". If you choose to use the TPMS notification simply change this indicator to ""Y"" and then activate TPMS in TRIAD via the steps outlined below.

  You must follow the steps below in order for TPMS to be read properly. If you do not activate TPMS in TRIAD any vehicle selected will display TPMS STATUS UNKNOWN.

To Activate TPMS in TRIAD:
  From the Main Menu:
1. Access Product Administration.
2. From the Product Administration menu select Triad Maintenance.
3. From the Triad Maintenance screen select option 2 Manufacturer Line Code Setup.
4. Select line 1 Activant Information (press Enter).
5. Page down until Tire Pressure Monitoring System is displayed. Should be line 36.
6. Type in that line in the Coverage field, press tab to Your Line field and type TPM.
7. Press F6 Add.
8. Pres ESC /ESC twice until the prompt Save Your Changes Y/N appears. Answer Y.
    System will return back to the Triad Maintenance screen.
9. Answer Y  to the prompt ""Do You Want to Backup Your Manufacturer Setup File To
    Akron"".
10. Exit Point Of Sale, Delivery Receipts and Triad from ALL terminals. Then when you
   access these programs again TPMS will print the correct message based on TRIAD
   information.

  If you choose not to activate TPMS you will not see any change in the way your vehicle
is currently validated.

GBMS Support Team
09/22/07"

Title: TC 56 / 58 - Labor on Company Vehicle
Description:
CP2710 TC 56 / 58 need to do some labor on my company vehicle and get error:  mdse ineligible
cannot use any service codes or acct codes?
Solution:
STORES:
TC 56 = REQ COMPANY VEH (Company owned vehicle driven by field representative for Goodyear) CAN BILL TIRES ONLY on TC56.  Other services need billed on POS invoice.
TC 58 = REQ STORE USE  (Vehicle used by the store location)
You must go to the parts labor verify and pull your parts (example for 'lof', store would pull the oil and the filter and post them.)
9 digit tire prod codes can be billed to relieve inventory.
3 digit parts codes (i.e. 219, 222, etc) to relieve $$$ of inventory.  Bill using Qty + Cost (LCST) parts price field (F-6 no service)
NO labor can be billed on 56/58.

DEALERS:   Do NOT use DR but create a POS invoice instead to generate sales tax that accumulate. Also generates on Sales Stats.
Dealer creates an AR 'house' account / COB 4
Process a POS AR charge (location is the customer).
Then do a journal ticket to relieve service from 10100 as a credit ... and 52400 as a debit in the amount of the sale
(which gives the employee credit)."

Title: TPMS - not working after I followed steps to turn
Description: CP2712 TPMS - not working after I followed the steps to turn it on.
Solution:
"Here is a quick reference quide from Paul Steiner:
When TPMS is sent country wide you will more than likely receive calls. Here is a ""Support Quick Reference"" to assist you
to verify their setup
====================================================================================
Quick reference: Indicators and their effect on TPMS

-  If location has NOT activated TPMS in TRIAD and their Location Profile has TPMS set to ""N"":  *  User will receive No Pop-up message concerning TPMS will be given to the user and NO print concerning TPMS will appear on the printed W/O.

-  If location has NOT activated TPMS in TRIAD but they have set their Location Profile TPMS to ""Y""  *  User will receive pop-up message TPMS Status Unknown for any vehicle selected. However NO print concerning TPMS will appear on the printed W/O.

-  If location HAS activated TPMS in TRIAD and set their Location Profile TPMS to ""N""   *  No Pop-up message concerning TPMS will be given to the user and NO print concerning TPMS will appear on the printed W/O.

-  If location HAS activated TPMS in TRIAD and set their Location Profile TPMS to ""Y""   *  User will receive pop-up message This Vehicle Is TPMS Equipped for any vehicle selected that TRIAD data indicates is equipped with a TPMS device. This same message will appear on the printed W/O only
    *  User will receive pop-up message TPMS Status Unknown for any vehicle selected where the manufacturer has not provided the TPMS status to TRIAD. However NO print concerning TPMS will appear on the printed W/O
============================================================
Multi Location Dealers on Parts; only the Corporate office can activate TPMS in TRIAD. After they activate this it will be sent to the sub locations that night if they answered ""Y"" to Transmit to Sub locations and maintenance has run to
completion at both locations."

Title: Turn Duplex On - Off - see note below
Description:
CP3013 How to turn on/off the DUPLEX option for laser printers.  (Simplex / 1 side vs  Duplex / 2 sides)
NOTE:  THE DUPLEX OPTION HAS BEEN CHANGED FOR DEALER LOCATIONS - THEY CAN CHOOSE TO TURN IT ON OR OFF BUT THEY NEED TO KNOW THAT IF THEY HAVE IT TURNED ON WHEN THEY PRINT "CHECKS, STATEMENTS OR POST CARDS" THEY NEED TO TURN DUPLEXING OFF.
Solution:
NEW 3/09:

From the GBMS Homepage.
GBMS Plus > Profile > Laser Printer Profile...

On that screen select either Simplex (single sided print) or Duplex (Double Sided Print) for the desired Laser.  Then select the "Update Profile" button.

A Laser Printer Profile option has been added to the GBMS Plus Profiles application.
When selected, the screen will list all system laser printers.
There are two columns ...Simplex and Duplex. By default Simplex will be selected.
This means that all reports will print on one side of the paper EXCEPT those that,
by design, print on the front and back (i.e. Invoices, Veh History, DR, Tech Assist, etc).
If you choose Duplex, that will cause all reports that may normally be more than one
page to print on both the front and back of the paper. This option is not terminal specific.


OR ... to manually turn duplexing ON/OFF for all Laser types:

T522 & T630

The laser printer should be at 'Ready'.
1)  Press Menu 2 button until 'Finishing Menu' displays.
2)  Press 'Select' button twice and 'Duplex' will be displayed.
3)  Press Menu 2 to turn 'Duplexing on' (for double sided printing).
     ... Or 1 to turn 'Duplexing off' (for single sided printing)
4)  Press 'Select' button to save.
5)  Press the 'Return' button two times until 'Ready' displays."

T522 or T630 USE THIS ONLY IF MENU SHOWS DISABLED.

1.   Power off the printer.
2.   Hold in Select & Return Buttons while turning on printer and when Performing selftest
          displays, then release.
3.   When the (Config Menu Mnt Cntl Value) displays, press the #2 side of the Menu button until
         (Panel Menu) displays.
4.   Press the Select button.
5.   Press the #1 side of the Menu button till (Enable) displays
6.   Press the Select button.
7.   Power off the Printer"
Now you can change the DUPLEX setting (see steps above).

T640 & E450

1) Press the menu button
2) Arrow down to Settings and press the Check button
3) Arron down to Finishing Menu and press the check button
4) Arrow down to Duplex and press the Check button
5) Arrow to ON or OFF and press the check button.

HP3005 ? HP3505DN

1) Press the Menu Button
2) Arrow down to Configure Device and press the check button
3) Arrow down to Printing and press the check button
4) Arrow down to Duplex and press the check button.
5) Arrow to On or OFF and press the check button.

NOTE:  If duplexing keeps turning off on the laser printer, send the report to Support 2 to check the version of Tech Assist that is on the system at the location.  (from cancelled CP 2538)

Title: Overnight update failed msg
Description: CP3030 An update to your system failed, contact support?
Solution:
Overnight updates are stopping users from using the system.
1.  Have user hit "scroll lock" twice to get to server view
2.  If msg on the screen says "Mnt is complete, hit enter to continue", have the user hit enter
3.  Some data will flash quickly up the screen and then it will go black, have the user hit enter again.
At this point the screen should go to CONSOLE LOGIN.  Location should be able to access gbms functions now, just make sure they can pull up POS.

If for some reason, the msg above is not what is displayed, you need to sign on:
1. View logfile
2. Copy and paste error into IM report (get assistance from a team lead/ more experienced team member, if necessary,to identify the error)
3. Forward to Level 3 for review/ correction.
Advise the customer that it will be fixed as soon as possible.  They will be advised when ok to retry.


*******IF LEVEL 3 IS NOT AVAILABLE, TYPE:  runpush.clear (at the # prompt)********

This will get the location up and running.  Forward report to Level 3 for review/ correction.

Title: Product code invalid
Description:
CP3036 Product Code is coming up Invalid and WAD screen needs updated.
Invalid Code /  Product Code Invalid
Solution:
Check  the WAD screen for the product code.
IF     ...  you determine an indicator needs changed or corrected by Wholesale
Then ... enter the needed information  (product code, any fields that need corrected, etc) in the Service Center report and send it to Support.

Some Examples for Invalid Product Code errors:
1.  Field 745 "REPL MDSE" is not populated with a '1'  (WAD74).
2.  Field 99 "CANADA ID" is not populated with a '1'   (WAD61).
3.  Field 97 "RTL SA KEY" (Sales aid search) is incorrect  (WAD61).
4.  Field 032  (WAD63).
	  If ... "&"  = dealer ONLY code.
	  If ... "R" =  retail ONLY code.
	  If ... " - "  =  expense item.
5.  Field 013 "PRC LIST ID" will indicate either L or "blank"  (WAD63).
      If ... "blank" -  it is not a price list item.
	  If ... "L" -  it is a B502 price.
6.   Field 041 "STORE WD ID"  (WAD63).
	  If ...  "blank" = everyone can use the prod code.
	  If ...  "D" = dealer ONLY code.
7.   Field 602 "NO SLS TAX"  (WAD63).
	  If ... "blank" = code IS taxable
	  If ... "1" = no tax

Team Leads will be responsible for sending the email to the Goodyear person to corrrect.  It will also be the team leads responsibility to call the location back when the issue is resolved.
