Title: HP 3005 Laser Printer Setup
Description:
CP3039 HP 3005 Printer Set UP / Hardware Address, Cold Reset

Send the Service Center Ticket to HW/Comm after printer setup is completed.  Larry needs to check fonts, settings and make sure the printer is set to Print the Batch Report.
Solution:
Before starting, make sure to clear all jobs in the laser printer's queue.  This often helps avoid trouble entering in the hardware address.

COLD RESET
This may have to be done prior to entering UAA/Hardware Address when setting up printer for the first time.
1.  Turn the printer off for @ 10 secs.
2.  Turn the Laser on - watch for memory counting up and, once this comes up, hold the CHECK BUTTON DOWN.
3.  All 3 light's (READY, DATA and ATTENTION) should come solid.
     If the lights do not come on solid within 15 secondss - start over.
4. Release the Check button.  Should see SELECT LANGUAGE in window.
5.  Press the Down-Arrow two times to COLD RESET and press the CHECK button.
6.  When the printer displays "TO RETURN TO READY, press  STOP.  Give the printer a good minute and 15 seconds before entering the UAA address in System Administration.

GBMS Printer setup:
1. HIT MENU BUTTON
2. ARROW DOWN UNTIL YOU SEE INFORMATION > PRESS CHECK BUTTON
3. ARROW DOWN UNTIL YOU SEE "PRINT CONFIGURATION" >  PRESS CHECK BUTTON
4. PRINTER PRINTS OUT 3 PAGES.  2ND PAGE WILL HAVE THE "HARDWARE ADDRESS" ON THE LEFT SIDE COLUMN NEAR THE TOP.
5. FROM GBMS HOMEPAGE,  GO TO SYSTEM ADMIN > PRINTER FUNCTIONS > SETUP LASER PRINTER > SELECT LASER 1
    Select Laser Printer 1 if this is their first laser printer.   Select Laser Printer 2 if it is their second laser printer.
6. ENTER IN UAA/HARDWARE ADDRESS (2 digits per box).
7. PRESS  OK.   Should get "printer setup complete".  Once completed, send report to Hardware/Comm to check fonts & settings of the Laser.

Send the Service Center Ticket to HW/Comm after printer setup is completed.  Larry needs to check fonts, settings and make sure the printer is set to Print the Batch Report.

Title: ?Merchandise is invalid? or ?Service not ava
Description: CP3040 Trying to use a service code and system is telling me that ?Merchandise is invalid? or ?Service not available for this location.?
Solution:
What this means is that the CORP site has not setup this service code to be used in SERVICE LOOKUP.

To check this there are a few places to look.
Go to GBMS PLUS at the site calling in and go to SERVICE CODES.
Either search by dept or select from Generic Services list to see if the code is active on their system and whether it can be used for Retail, Nat?l Account or Both.
Next, log in to the CORP site and go to 13. PROD ADMIN>10 PART ADMINISTRATION>2 SERVICE CODE MAINT.
Use F9 to search for the code in question and check the field for ?REMOVE SERVICE CODE FROM USE? to see if it is set to ?Y?, which would remove the code from service lookup, or ?N?, which would add it to service lookup.
If CORP said this code is ok for use, then change the field to an ?N? and overnight the file will update and allow the code to be selected from service lookup.
If user needs to complete the sale now, have them use an 046 100 or 046 200 code and change the description. **Note all Nat?l Account codes should be active and set to an ?N?.

Title: Zero Values Found in List and/or Cost Fields.
Description: CP3041 Zero Values Found in List and/or Cost Fields.
Solution:
Error means that there is not a price associated with a specific part on the P/L VERIFY screen.
Go to F10 P/L VERIFY and use F3 and F4 to scan through codes.
Find the service code giving the error and check the part lines to see which one is at $0.00.
Select line # and press enter.
Tab to Price field and put in a price for the part.
This should allow user to get to doc total.
These will happen when CATALOG has no price designation for part selected. ***NOTE -- If no pricing is showing on any code selected, go to PROF 3rd screen and make sure field for PREFERRED SELL PRICE METHOD  is set to "C" for triad catalog pricing and then "S" for standard cost table  pricing.

Title: Can?t Change Price on MERCH VERIFY Screen
Description: CP3042  Can?t Change Price on MERCH VERIFY Screen
Solution: If you look on the MERCH VERIFY screen and the line in question has a ?C? after parts price or ?F? after labor price, these prices must be changed on the P/L Verify screen. These service codes have pricing that is setup in CATALOG and cannot be changed from MERCH VERIFY. Only service codes setup with an ADV/EDL can have price changed from Merch Verify screen.

Title: Fluid or non- CATALOG part not generating with spe
Description: CP3043 Fluid or non- CATALOG part not generating with specific service code. ex. Engine Oil not generating when oil change selected on P/L VERIFY screen)
Solution:
Certain service codes require parts to generate that are not listed in CATALOG.
Therefore, user must go to PARTS GENERATION (PGEN), type in service code and press enter.
If no lines display then code is not setup to generate anything.
User will need to create a line starting at the
1.) Quantity they want to generate per service code.
2.) Manufacturer (MFC), which can be searched with F10.
3.) Part No., which will be located on box part came in or they can make one up. (**Note- If they type in the wrong part # then they will be creating a separate part. This will relieve inventory they don?t have and not sell the part that is stocked on shelves).
4.) Parts Group (PGROUP) which can be searched with F10.
5.) User will need to know if it is for Retail, Nat?l Account or Both. You will know this if you look at the top of PGEN screen and see MIN/MAX total for both Retail and Nat?l Account or by going to GBMS PLUS>SERVICE CODES and searching there by service code or dept.
6.) Description, which is just a basic description of the part.
7.) List Price, user should know this.
8.) Cost, user should know this.
9.) CORE, does this part have core value (ex. Alternator or starter). Fluids do not have core value.
10.) Print (PRT) which asks if they want the part to print on a document. Once all fields are satisfied, press enter and it should create a line item.
Log out of POS and back in and parts should generate with specific service codes. Repeat as necessary per code.

Title: MFC (Manufacturer Code) is Invalid
Description: CP3044 MFC (Manufacturer Code) is Invalid
Solution:
If user gets this error it means that the 3 Alpha characters in MFC field used to create the part line do not exist in MFC table in GBMS.

To check,
 go to 13 PROD ADMIN
10 PARTS ADMIN
1 MANUFACTURER MAINT (MFC)
and search using the F3 key for the manufacturer.

If it is not listed then the part line will not be able to be created in PGEN. MFC can be added by typing in 3 Alpha Characters followed by the manufacturer?s name, IF this is the CORP site. If not, the sub location must contact CORP and have it added. MFC will download overnight and be in use the following day.

Title: How do I create a Manufacturer code in GBMS?
Description: CP3045 How do I create a Manufacturer code in GBMS?
Solution: MFC can be added by typing in 3 Alpha Characters followed by the manufacturer?s name, IF this is the CORP site. If not, the sub location must contact CORP and have it added. MFC will download overnight and be in use the following day.

Title: What is a SKU?
Description: CP3046 What is a SKU?
Solution: SKU is a Stock Keeping Unit. An SKU means that the part is defined in GBMS by a Manufacturer code and Part # so the system will keep track of the movement of the part when placed on an invoice and sold.

Title: Could not Validate SKU, Accept (Y/N)?
Description: CP3047 Could not Validate SKU, Accept (Y/N)?
Solution: System will pose this question when writing in parts on P/L VERIFY screen. It is simply asking the user to recognize that this is a new part being created and making sure the user wants to keep track of this new part. (**Note- If they type in the wrong part # then they will be creating a separate part. This will relieve inventory they don?t have and not sell the part that is stocked on shelves. Be sure to have the correct part #).

Title: How do I process a POS document using the new PIMS
Description: CP3048 ow do I process a POS document using the new PIMS process?
Solution:
User must first select a customer and a vehicle. Then user should go to SERVICE LOOKUP to find service code needed. Then to P/L VERIFY screen to choose parts and labor per code selected. Once all lines are satisfied, user will be able to get to doc total to complete sale.

If user is having trouble finding code through SERVICE LOOKUP then they can user INVAPOST.

INVAPOST is how user can go straight to CATALOG and select a part without having a service code previously selected. User will select code from CATALOG and then press ESC 2x. This will bring them to a SERVICE SALES SELECTION SCREEN. On this screen user will place an ?S? by part and labor line selected and system will generate the service codes that work with these parts and labor. User can select service code from this screen and continue document as normal. This allows user a 2nd way to create documents without knowing or having to search for the service code 1st.

Title: What is INVAPOST?
Description: CP3049 What is INVAPOST?
Solution: If user is having trouble finding code through SERVICE LOOKUP then they can user INVAPOST. INVAPOST is how user can go straight to CATALOG and select a part without having a service code previously selected. User will select code from CATALOG and then press ESC 2x. This will bring them to a SERVICE SALES SELECTION SCREEN. On this screen user will place an ?S? by part and labor line selected and system will generate the service codes that work with these parts and labor. User can select service code from this screen and continue document as normal. This allows user a 2nd way to create documents without knowing or having to search for the service code 1st.

Title: Unable to post NON-part data.
Description: CP3050 Unable to post NON-part data.
Solution:
This means that the manufacturer selected is not setup in the Integrated CATALOG with a Y, N or S preference. In order for a user to post parts from the CATALOG for a specific manufacturer, the preference must be set for Primary (Y1-Y9), Secondary (N1-N9) or All Groups (S1-S9). To set these preferences, user must be CORP site or contact CORP. CORP site would go to 13 PROD ADMIN>7 TRIAD MAINT>2 MFC LINE CODE SETUP.

User will use the ?U? option to update, press enter, and then select the line # of the location they want to update, press enter. This will bring them into the Integrated CATALOG. User can type in first 3 letters of MFC and press PAGE DOWN or PAGE UP on keyboard to go directly to manufacturer. Type in line # and press enter. The 3rd column will should show a preference for this MFC, whether it be a Y, N or S. If none is shown then one will need to be added. In coverage field, user can select a specific line or type in ?ALL? for all lines, tab to YOUR LINE field and type in MCL code listed in 2nd column, and finally tab to PREFERRED LINE field and type in preference selected, Primary (Y1-Y9), Secondary (N1-N9) or All Groups (S1-S9). To make change use F7 as enter has no function in CATALOG. **NOTE Different manufacturers can have the same preference and they will be listed in alphabetical order in CATALOG view.

Title: Cannot Select Part, MFC (xxx) Not on File. (?xxx
Description: CP3051 cannot Select Part, MFC (xxx) Not on File. (?xxx? being manufacturer code).
Solution: This error will occur when user is trying to post a part from CATALOG that has been changed or updated but has not gone through nightly maintenance. User will not be able to post part until it goes through maintenance. ***NOTE ? if user needs to complete doc they can use 046 100 or 046 200. As a last resort, maintenance can be run manually. Send to PIMS lvl 2.

Title: Why am I getting White boxes with MIN/MAX errors o
Description: CP3052 Why am I getting White boxes with MIN/MAX errors on P/L VERIFY screen?
Solution:
These white boxes mean that for this specific service code, the proper MIN/MAX levels have not been satisfied, whether that be for # of lines or # of parts. Each service code is setup with a minimum # of lines that should be on the P/L VERIFY screen when that service code is used. So if the minimum is set to 2 lines, than system will not let user off screen until there are two lines associated with this code. Part lines are setup the same way.

For example, 077 205 is for an oil change and is setup for a MIN of 2 lines and a MIN/MAX of 6 part lines. User must select at least 2 lines, 1st for a Filter and the 2nd
for engine oil. The parts must fall between the MIN/MAX levels set so there will be 1 part for the filter and up to 5 for the individual quarts of oil, making a total of six.

NOTE** User can go to top right of screen use BYPASS REQ?S field to skip this page is PIMS is set to soft indicator under GBMS PLUS>PROFILE>PIMS INDICATOR>PROFILE. This is also CORP controlled.

**2nd NOTE If user encounters situation where they have all parts needed but system is still calling to satisfy a number of lines, user can create another line that matches the one on the screen, and separate the quantities to create another line. Then they should contact CORP and advised them to change the MIN/MAX levels for a specific service code.

Title: This service code does not allow labor lines.
Description: CP3053 This service code does not allow labor lines.
Solution: If user gets this error it means that the code is not setup to go to CATALOG to pull labor. To check this you must log into CORP site and go to 13 PROD ADMIN>10 PARTS ADMIN>2 SERVICE CODE MAINT. Use F9 to search for the code and check the field for LABOR REQUIRED. If this is set to an ?N? then the user will not be able to post labor from the CATALOG, also could mean that the service code is setup with an ADV/EDL and labor price would already be defined. If labor does need to be posted to the service code have CORP site change the field to a ?Y? and it will update overnight. NOTE** If they need to get labor on doc they can use miscellaneous code 046 100 and change description until code update.

Title: This service code does not allow part lines.
Description: CP3054 This service code does not allow part lines.
Solution: If user gets this error it means that this code is just setup to accept labor lines on P/L VERIFY. So user will need to go to CATALOG and bypass parts and select labor only and post to document using F12. User should be able to see whether code is for Parts, Labor or both on SERVICE LOOKUP screen. If a CML and F/R is listed it is for parts and labors. If one is listed, then the other is not needed. **NOTE CML is catalog pricing for parts, F/R is flat rate for labor.

Title: How do I setup Partial PIMS for a sub location?
Description: CP3055 How do I setup Partial PIMS for a sub location?
Solution:
First have the user at CORP site go to GBMS PLUS>PROFILE>PIMS INDICATOR PROFILE and push button at the top to activate Partial Parts. This will take you to a second screen that will ask which terr#?s you want to activate and if they want a soft/hard indicator. Once user has selected which territory, which option they want and placed a check in update box, hit the Update Partial Parts button. It will take 48 hours to activate at sub locations after running EOD at CORP.

Second step is to go to PROD ADMIN>TRIAD MAINT>MANUFACTURER LINE CODE SETUP. User wants to select F5 UPDATE DISTRIBUTION. On the next screen select the line for the terr# that should be updated and put CORP terr# in MCL ZONE field, press enter. Press F8 to get back to MANUFACTURER LINE CODE SETUP page. User wants to select ?T? for transmit and select the line for the CORP territory to transmit the MCL file from CATALOG to all locations. NOTE** If this step is not done, user will not be able to post some parts from the CATALOG because the MCL file in CATALOG will not match the MFC table in GBMS.

Title: How do I set LABOR for no price on P/L Verify scre
Description: CP3056 How do I set LABOR for no price on P/L Verify screen?
Solution: User needs to put the word ?LABOR? in as part # and then tab over to price and enter in ?NC? for no charge. This will put LABOR price in as $0.00.

Title: WEBSITE Troubleshooting
Description: CP3062 User is unable to access a website.
Solution:
1.	Make sure that the URL is spelled correctly.

2.	Ping satellite and or Prysm to make sure that there is communications going out and coming in.

3.	Check to see if site is on the ?YES? list.

4.	Recently requested websites are not always on the ?YES? list.    If you don?t see the website on the list, check with HW/Comm.  It may be on the Master List not yet sent out.

5.	If it is on the ?YES? list, check to see if you are able to get to the site on your pc.   (remember your pc has a different set of rules from the terminals in the stores and dealers (maxterms) and does not go off the rules of the ?YES? list so there are instances were you will be able to get to the website and they are not.)

6.	VNC into their system or go to a workstation here in gbms and see if you are able to get to the website that they are trying to access.

7.	If you meet all the criteria in the above steps, and there is still an issue, send the report to HW/Comm.

Title: TC 79 Canadian NA Merchandise / Service Correction
Description: CP3063 How do I correct a TC79 del/rec that was billed out using the wrong product codes?  (both merchandise and service) ion for Del Receipts.
Solution:
1)  From the delivery receipt screen type in your emp # and the appropriate TC code.
2) Tab to Correction field and type a 'M' and press Enter.
     Note:  on a TC79  BOTH Merchandise and Service are done on "M" for Canadian NA.  (No "S" type correction for Canadian NA.)
3) Type the N/A # in Customer/Territory field and Tab to REF Doc # / Date field
4) Type the original doc # and date of the document you are correcting. Tab.
6) Type the reason for issuance, press enter. Fill in the rest of the delivery receipt as normal.
7) On mdse verify screen type in MINUS units for the wrong product code(s) (both merchandise and service) and press enter.
Type in the correct product code with regular units.  This is the only way to correct your inventory on sales aid.

Title: Error (33)java.lang.NullPointerException
Description: CP3064 Location reporting a problem running a search on tires from sales aid in GBMS plus resulting in the following:  Error. (33)java.lang.NullPointerException.
Solution:
***NOTE:  DEVELOPMENT HAS CORRECTED THE BUG THAT CAUSED THIS PROBLEM.  It is currently in Usability for testing and will be released countrywide soon.

In the meantime, please take user into Plus > Profile > Tire Pkg Profile and click on 'Update Profile' so long as there are no errors to correct with the current entries shown.  Have the user try again, they should be okay.

IF the location is NOT okay and still experiencing problems, update report with the following information and escalate to Level 3:

1.  What search criteria was used?  (Fore example:  size - 1955516, product code - xxx-xxx-xxx, etc)

2.  What kind of search were they conducting?  (local search of their own system, surrounding territory search of specific locations - note the lcoations, primary or secondary surrounding territory search)

3.  When did the problem start?

Title: Links in Sales Aid from GBMS Plus are not "clickab
Description: CP3065 User reports tire sizes/ descriptions and product codes in sales aid surrounding territory search conducted in GBMS Plus are no longer "clickable".
Solution:
Here is the latest on the changes that have taken place with sales aid and the surrounding territory search:

Apparently a change that was implemented for Sales Aid is not understood by the users and is causing confusion.  Refer to article "SLSAID" for further details and illustrations.

1)  When running search for current location, all 3 remain clickable (the product code, product description, and package prices)

2)  When running search remotely for a single remote location, the the product code and description are clickable but the package price is NOT.

3)  When running search for a group of remote locations (user has selected 'Primary' or 'Secondary' from the dropdown), the the current location remains clickable but the remote locations are NOT.

A procedure is being worked out to effectively communicate this to our users.  In the meantime, please log all instances of this error with regard to the sales aid search to this common problem and close the report if no further attention is needed.

Otherwise, update the report (with detail) and forward to Level 3 for review.

Solution: Misc - Install TRIAD CD

Solution: This is a known problem and Useability has a Work Request in place to fix it.  No ETA.

Title: Time Wrong on Associate Time Clock
Description: CP3072 Time Wrong on Associate Time Clock (Dealers ONLY)
Solution:
Telnet into location
Do you want to run smenu (Y/N) :  'Y'
enter option:

2) Work with database (plus)
2) Run plus

type the following
SQL> !date mmddttttyy

Result:  the system will display Month/Day/time/year ...
                                                                                   MMDDTTTTYY    T=military time
Note:  date = MMDDTTTTYY

Title: Maxspeed at T1
Description: CP3074 T1 not booting up, the display has yellow power light, and maxterm has a green power light
Solution:
Here are the steps to get the maxterm back on line ( Do Not Swap Maxterms Around )
1)  Power the printer 1 off.
2)  Pull the power cord out on the Thin Client for 1 minute
3)  Plug back in the thin client and hit the power button on the maxterm - after it starts booting back up  - power the printer 1 back on.

Title: "in use" error on the A/P Invoice Entry Short Form
Description: CP3080 Getting "in use" error on the A/P Invoice Entry Short Form screen
Solution:
There is a known problem where the record is locked and needs to be corrected before user can access it.
Telnet onto the location
From the # sign type view /logfile
Shift :q to go to the bottom of the file then page up a to see if you see any error.   If any errors send to level 2.
IF NO errors, unlock the document using the steps below:

From  the SQL> type  @ulock      (enter)
choices displayed are inv, dr, ap, ven;  type:   ven        (enter)
The sequence numbers will display.  Enter the locked sequence number at the prompt.
Stay on the line with the user to see if they can access and complete the A/P Invoice Entry Short Form.
If it doesn`t correct the problem, send the report to Level 2 for referral to Development for correction and advice to user.

Title: Access Denied using URL on Approved Access List
Description: CP3082 Access Denied error when trying to access an approved site on the "Links" Approved Access List from the GBMS Homepage
Solution: Power cycle the Prysm unit.

Title: MKARCHIV: INS ARCHIVEP 0000000 ORA-01653: unable t
Description:
CP3083 System running in maintenance mode.  User not able to access GBMS functions and the error in logfile is as follows:

MMDD  HHMM  MKARCHIV:INS ARCHIVEP 0000000 00029 ORA-01653: unable to extend table
Solution:
System running in maintenance mode.

First, verify existence of this error in logfile

From a # prompt:
 view /logfile

Once in the logfile, hold down the shift key + g and this will take you to the bottom of the logfile.  Then reverse search for the error by typing:

? MKARCH

When you find the error, cut and paste the entire line into incident report then run mntrest so that the user can access the system and get to work:

 # mntrest

This will get the user back on the system.  Forward the report to Level 3 to clean-up their archive so that this is not a problem again the next day.

Title: Dealer billed incorrectly and the document has bee
Description:
CP3087 Dealer billed incorrectly and the document has been sent.

For more information See: Weekly TireHQ Problem and Fixes 09/26/2008

Title: GBMS Plus Sales Aid Search Running Slow
Description: CP3088 GBMS Plus Sales Aid Search Running Slow / Timing Out.
Solution:
This common problem is going to be used for GASC / Company Owned Outlets who call in stating that their Sales Aid search is running slow or timing out.  We will start tracking these calls for various Reasons.

Here are some options that can be done.

1. Reset SETHTTP's at the location - Then log off GBMS and refresh the homepage.  Re-run Sales Aid see if it is better
2. Look at the location profile in GBMS plus and review each of the locations in his Profile.  If a location is running sales aid and they have a VSAT location in his profile, the VSAT location will cause Sales Aid to slow or even time out.  Have the location move all VSAT location(s) to the end of their Profile or move them to the Secondary List of locations, while moving all DSL/Broadband locations to the beginning of their searches.  DSL location should come up first when performing a Sales Aid Search in Plus.

If after this has been done, and the location is still running slow or timing out (page cannot be displayed), open ticket and send to Level 3.

Title: How To Process Manual Ticket At Doc Total
Description: CP3090 How To Process Manual Ticket At Doc Total (Manual Doc)
Solution: At POS, must enter "M" along with the Credit Card type into the Doc Type Field.  Example:  If customer has a Goodyear card the document type must be PM.  If it is a Mastercard, Document type must be MM - "M" for mastercard and "M" for Manual.

Title: How to Bill GSA - Voyager #49999
Description:
CP3091 What You Need to Do Now:

Attached below, is the GSA announcement letter and Voyager information for you to sign up for the Voyager Teletrans process. Sign up with Voyager by signing and returning the Voyager Teletrans Participation Agreement. One Voyager Participation Agreement is needed for each Goodyear Dealership. If you have multiple locations, please list the individual stores on a separate sheet and return to Voyager with your Participation Agreement.

How This Will Work:

1. All transactions will be billed on a local Accounts Receivable (A/R account) at your location.

2. For transactions with SERVICE WORK UNDER $100 AND NO TIRES, call Voyager Teletrans at 1-800-987-6589 to report transaction amount.

3. For transactions WITH ANY TIRES, BATTERIES OR TOTAL AMOUNT $100 AND OVER, call the GSA Maintenance Control Center (MCC) at 1-888-622-6344 to receive authorization.

4. Complete the invoice for the authorized amount on your local A/R account. Use GS0830001 for the GS approval number if tires are involved.

5. After providing authorization, Voyager will send a check to your location within 3 business days. Please note that this check will be for the amount of the authorization less the 3.5% Voyager administration fee.

If you have any questions regarding the program, how it works or how to sign up, please call Voyager at 1-866-842-5608.

Please note that the Voyager National Account (NA# 8579) is still available for use for commercial fleets using the Voyager card. Only GSA transactions should be processed per the above instructions. (Tires for any Government Account should never be processed through NA# 8579.)

Thank you for continuing to service the GSA and their fleet customers, they are an important part of all of our business.
Solution:
THE GSA APPROVAL NUMBER CHANGES EVERY YEAR.  PLEASE MAKE SURE THAT YOU SUPPLY THE DEALER WITH THE CORRECT GSA APPROVAL NUMBER.

What You Need to Do Now:

Attached below, is the GSA announcement letter and Voyager information for you to sign up for the Voyager Teletrans process. Sign up with Voyager by signing and returning the Voyager Teletrans Participation Agreement. One Voyager Participation Agreement is needed for each Goodyear Dealership. If you have multiple locations, please list the individual stores on a separate sheet and return to Voyager with your Participation Agreement.

How This Will Work:

1. All transactions will be billed on a local Accounts Receivable (A/R account) at your location.

2. For transactions with SERVICE WORK UNDER $100 AND NO TIRES, call Voyager Teletrans at 1-800-987-6589 to report transaction amount.

3. For transactions WITH ANY TIRES, BATTERIES OR TOTAL AMOUNT $100 AND OVER, call the GSA Maintenance Control Center (MCC) at 1-888-622-6344 to receive authorization.

4. Complete the invoice for the authorized amount on your local A/R account. Use GS0830001 for the GS approval number if tires are involved.

5. After providing authorization, Voyager will send a check to your location within 3 business days. Please note that this check will be for the amount of the authorization less the 3.5% Voyager administration fee.

If you have any questions regarding the program, how it works or how to sign up, please call Voyager at 1-866-842-5608.

Please note that the Voyager National Account (NA# 8579) is still available for use for commercial fleets using the Voyager card. Only GSA transactions should be processed per the above instructions. (Tires for any Government Account should never be processed through NA# 8579.)

Thank you for continuing to service the GSA and their fleet customers, they are an important part of all of our business.

Title: TAX HOLIDAY
Description: CP3092 TAX HOLIDAY
Solution:
PER NOTE FROM USEABILITY:

GBMS ENTRY:

To make documents State Tax Exempt only:

On each qualifying customer invoice, change the Tax Status to ?3?, Exempt.
At the Work Order screen, tab to the Tax Status field and enter ?3?,
or at Document Total, press the F4 Change Option key, then enter ?3? in Tax Status field.

When the Sales tax Exceptions screen is displayed, select Type of Sale ?5?
TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY FOR RENT/LEASE. Complete the document.
 No State Sales Tax will be charged and all local taxes will apply.

GBMS Support Team
07/31/08

Title: Unexpected error with Appointment Schedule
Description: CP3098 Appointment Schedule -- unexpected error ... call GBMS
Solution:
Location should access GBMS Plus:
Click on Profile
Click on Appointment Schedule Profile
Verify the fields are correct, press UPDATE


This will correct the problem

Try accessing the Appointment Schedule again.

Title: ORDER GBMS EQUIPTMENT - PRINTERS, MONITORS, ETC
Description: CP3100 HOW DO I ORDER GBMS EQUIPMENT - PRINTERS, MONITORS, ETC.
Solution:
Have the dealer go to GBMS Homepage and click on Links, then Local Links and then click on Order GBMS Equipment.  That will take them to the site where they can order the GBMS equipment.

The current laser printer offerings are:
HP M3035xs - This multi-function printer is our most recent offering.  This printer offers you the ability to scan, fax, and copy all from the same device.

HP P3015dn - This is our base model laser, and replaces the HP 3005dn.

HP CP3525dn - This is our color laser offering.  It is not recommended to be used as your main printer.

HP P4015x - This printer is for high-volume printing needs.  It prints 62 pages per minute.

* Dealer may purchase a one, three, or five year extended warranty on these printers.

**If it's a monitor the Dealer needs,  Flat panel monitors have a 3 yr warranty.

The Dealer will be able to see the pricing on the  printers and/or monitors  in the Order GBMS Equipment site.  If the Dealer doesn't want to mess with the Order GBMS Equipment link and has other questions about the printers he can call SWC Technology Partners @ 630-572-0240, or he/she  may be transferred to Customer Relations at Dealer's request.


**

Title: Finalize Inventory error
Description: CP3101 After pressing F6 to finalize inventory, location receives error message:  Entered physical is more / less than frozen total - continue  Yes or No
Solution:
Location needs to review the totals entered in the inventory against the 'Adjustment Report' and decide if they want to accept the entries.  There may have been a typo on the quantities entered.  If satisfied with entered totals, continue with the inventory. The adustment report prints immediately after pressing F6 Final.

If location needs to reprint the 'Adjustment Report', Return to the Physical Inventory option, select the Preprinted Entry Option, F6 Summary Totals, and F5 Reprint Adjustment.

Title: Shutting down for Hurricane
Description:
CP3103 Location closing due to Hurricane   **** ASSIGN TO NAUSAK_GBMS_INTERFACE ****

B50 Sequence #:

IMPORTANT: Instruct the caller NOT to shutdown or disconnect the server until advised to do so.

If a location calls in to let us know they are evacuating their building due to a Hurricane:
1.  Have them run the End Of Day Cutoff (Enter "EODCO" at blue screen main menu) and give you the B50 Sequence #.
2.  Send a report and notify Interface directly to have them pull the End of Day in immediately.
Interface Contacts: Robert Fisher (6-2675), Janetta Williams (6-0161)
Solution: Interface: Poll data from location, confirm receipt and forward ticket to HW/Comm to notify the location to power off and move their CPU to a safe location.

Title: Kronos time incorrect because thinclient time inco
Description: CP3104 Will Kronos time reporting be affected if the time is incorrect on the Thinclient?
Solution:
Yes.

The Thinclient time is fixed at follows:
To access Thinclient Setup Screen, as the terminal is logging off, have the caller press the shift keys in a drumroll pattern (going back and forth between both shift keys).
a)	This will bring up a screen wtih three buttons, click Setup. The password is setup.
b)	This will take you to Thinclient Setup screen. Click the Check Box on the left side of the time to revise the time if it is incorrect.  Click on the Hrs, Mins, and AM/PM to set time.
c)	Verify the Time Zone is correct.
d)	Click OK when finished and the thinclient will reboot.

IF, however, the Thinclient time is correct ... and the server time is correct** ... BUT the KRONOS time is wrong, then location needs to call their District Manager and report the problem.

**To fix the server time:
1)  Telnet into the location and access Plus
2) at the > prompt, type:  !date mmddttttyy
                               for example:  1028085708  (month, day, time, year)

Title: Page cannot be displayed on workstations  4-25-14
Description: CP3127 Page Cannot be Displayed for the HOME PAGE ON THE THINCLIENTS
Solution:
CP3127 Page Cannot be Displayed for the HOME PAGE ON THE THINCLIENTS.

If PAGE CANNOT BE DISPLAYED (ON ALL WORK STATIONS)

1)	 See if you are able to sign on to the CPU, if not, go to the server side to see what is on the screen (should be at gXXXX login)

2)	Are you able to ping the IDU, PRY and G

3)	If this is a VSAT only dealer and the IDU is not pinging, have the dealer reboot the IDU.  Open ticket and send to HW/COMM that you have had the location reboot the IDU and have HW monitor the connection. END

4)	If this location is a HYBRID location and their PRYSM is not talking, power off the DSL modem for 10 seconds, power it back on  - then reboot the PRYSM by holding in the power button.  ***We no long power those down by pulling the power***.  PRYSM should take about 90 second to reconfigure.  Ping the PRYSM (PRY) during the reboot and watch for connectivity.  If it reconnects and shows broadband ping times, ping the server (G) and maxspeeds to make sure they are on the network.  If the PRYSM does not show broadband ping times upon reboot, open a ticket and send to HW/COMM.

5)	 Send to HW/COMM if a PRYSM/IDU issue or for further diagnostics only if you have done the above.

                           -- OR --

If  PAGE CANNOT BE DISPLAYED ON ONE WORKSTATION

1)	Sign into the location and run Checkthin to verify which workstation is receiving this error.

2)	Check the cable on both ends and to see if there is a light on at the switch.  If there is a light and still no connection, change the port that the cable is plugged into (an individual port can go bad), and refresh the homepage.

3)	If still no connection may need to reboot the Netgear Hub (flat blue box that says ?Netgear? on the top.

4)	If this is a new/replacement thinclient, there is a possibility that the setup info on it is wrong (i.e. the terminal number was duplicated on a thin client 'setup' screen).

The location can get to the 'setup' by:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                a)  holding down the shift key while clicking on 'Start' button
b)  continue to hold the shift key and select 'logoff' ... click on 'logoff' again.
c) mouse click on username field and delete GBMS and key in:  setup  then click on 'ok'.
d)  verify the entries are correct.  (i.e. check for two terminals with same terminal number, verify the server ip address is    correct (matches 	The 10.n.nn.n  that you get when doing a ping g at the dos prompt), etc.
e)  after changes made, click on ok."

Terminal should reboot and come up to the homepage.

                            OR

If the terminals says ?Page Can?t Be Displayed? or ?Action Canceled? on the homepage or on the left side of the homepage.

Ping the IDU, Server, PRYSM & Thinclients (or all applicable HW).  Reset the HTTP?s by logging into the location and going into SMENU and using Option 9, Option 8 and then answer Y to reset HTTP?s.  Once this is done, click on start at the lower left and log off on the terminal.  The homepage should return back to normal.  Advise the location to log off on their remaining terminals.

If it was not, when it is pulled in,  records will be passed to kronos that night and should be avail for store mgr to approve in Kronos the next day.

If Store location is having 'Kronos' issues, an email can be sent to:  kronos_support@goodyear.com

Title: E-mailed password will not allow user to login.
Description: CP3148 User was e-mailed a password.  The user can not log into TireHQ using the passord
Solution:
There are a couple things that cause this:

1) Both the lower case letter L and the number 1 are used.  Please make sure that the user is using the correct letter or number.
2) User reset the password more than one time.  The user will need to wait for the last e-mail to come in and use the password contained in that e-mail.
3) Multiple users are using the same login and more than one person did the password reset.  The users is going to have to wait for the last e-mail to come in and use the password that was contained in that e-mail.

If a location bills out a call without indicating the call was a 4Tires Now call and they want to rebill it the correct way- they will need to call Fleet HQ to advise whether this will be an option or not.
1. Fleet HQ will contact us to remove the call and FleetHQ will resend it.
2. We do not have the authority to remove calls without Fleet HQ advising us.

Title: COMPFIN: Error 800 Checkpointing Tranrecv, RC=10
Description: CP3165 - COMPFIN: Error 800 Checkpointing TRANRECV RC=10
Solution:
Confirm the error in logfile:
	Opt. 8 - Log file Menu
	Opt. 2 - Log file
	Shft + g (to get to the bottom of the log file)


Use the page up and page down buttons to navigate til you find the error message.  Once located, copy the line and paste into the problem ticket.
	:q (to exit log file)
	Opt. 1 - Exit Menu


Then view dsxvol:
	Opt. 5 - List /u/dsxvol


Note the size of TRANRECV and follow options 1 or 2 below.

	1.  Have Interface group pull in TRANRECV from this location.

The location will be able to complete documents as normal thereafter, establishing a new TRANRECV file automatically.  If the Interface group is not available to pull this data, follow option 2 below.

	2.  Issue the commands below to rename TRANRECV, followed by command to restart COMPDOC:

		a.  In plus, type:  !mv /u dsxvol/TRANRECV /u/dsxvol/TRANRECV.sav
		b.  In plus, type: loadcomp (restarts COMPDOC)


A new TRANRECV record will be created with the next document the user completes.  Advise the user that all documents in docqueue should be complete and stats updated.  They are free to reprint any documents they need to in order to get their final document(s).  Also advise user there will be an out-of-balance (OOB) condition at end of day (EOD).  This will clear up over the next two business days.

***Note:  This report automatically routes to Development (ATTN: Yan Chuang, Manish Gupta, Julie Bronikov) to advise of possible out-of-balance to come.

Title: User uses search function, clicks on a document an
Description:
CP3166 The user is using the Site Search function.  The dealer then clicks on an item and then ends up at the log in page of THQ.

3rd level support is currently looking into this problem.  Advise & close.
Solution:
3rd level support is currently looking into this problem.

Each user is only allowed to look at certain documents localized to their group.

IE:  Dealer are only allowed to look at dealer documents.  NA is only allowed to look at NA documents, Canadian docs are only for Canada, US for US, etc.

Also, some documents are open for every one.  IE: New products, etc.

The problem is that the site search is displaying all documents relating to the search that was preformed.  This means that US documents are being displayed to Canadian dealers, NA documents are being displayed dealers, etc.  When the user tries to go into the document, it says that they are not authorized to view the document.  This is because they are trying to click on a document that they are not supposed to be able to get in.

Until this problem is rectified, you will need to try to recreate the problem here.  Once the document opens for you, you will see if it's a document that they are supposed to get into or if it's not for them. If you look at the document and it's not obvious (US vs. Canadian document) then you can just tell them that the document is not one they are suppose to view and it wasn't suppose to display for them.  (Security permissions for the document still apply.)

Note: Canadian Document usually have Susan Whalen's name next to the document name.

Title: ESD Application Questions
Description:
CP3170 1. Service Collection document have not cleared?
2. How far back can I view ESD Collection Periods?
3.  When does the collection period end?
Solution:
1.  Service collection period has closed but Stats from last collection period still showing on my ESD screen?

Answer: When Service Collection Period ends, the ESD screen will not reset back to zero and show new week
              ending date until the first invoice of the new collection period is processed.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2.  How far back can I see ESD's on my GBMS System?

Answer:  TWO Prior Collection Periods.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3.  When I run my EOD on the Collection Ending date does my ESD's close at that time also?

Answer: NO, if you complete any invoices after the EOD has been processed on that ending date those transactions
           will show in that collection period.

Title: Non-stock Merchandise
Description: CP3174 How to purchase and sell non-stock tires not intended to be maintained in inventory and/or replenished on a regular basis.
Solution:
Departments 347 (auto), 348 (light truck) and 349 (med/comm truck) are available for use, the last three digits representing the maximum COST.  For example, the product code for an auto tire with a cost of $37.50 would be 347-000-040.

Be sure to use the same code for entering both the purchase of the tire as well as the sale on the invoice.  This will insure that the inventory balance will be 0 units @ $0.00 for any particular code.

A listing for these pre-determined codes can be secured through GBMS Accounting and can be faxed to the dealer for guidance.

Title: Incorrect caller ID
Description: CP3190 Incorrect caller ID
Solution: Granite telephone company activated caller id with the wrong telephone number. The number appearing in the LCD panel is the fax number instead of the location number. Location to contact Granite Telephone Co on 866.847.5500 for correction.

Title: Misc - T-HQ Invoice Probs/Questions
Description: CP3191 Loc looking for Invoices from Gdyr, or needs guidance/help in finding them in Tire-HQ
Solution:
Have loc click on Financial > Invoices, then click on Unprinted or Printed - if not in either one of these - click on Search and enter source doc# and click on search.

If the invoice doesn't show up there, click on Financial > Reports and look to see if loc has recvd a G86 from Gdyr for this particular doc#.

If so, follow the instructions on the G86.

If no G86,  click on Financial > Sales, then click ON HOLD to see if the doc is On Hold and never sent to Gdyr.   If that is the case, loc is to determine why the doc is on hold, correct, and send it into Gdyr.

Title: Can not search for a tire size or can not see any
Description:
CP3193 Dealer can not search for a tire size or can not see any tire line in Products > Products Lines > Auto / Light Truck ? etc.

For more information See: Weekly TireHQ Problem and Fixes 09/19/2008
Solution: User is not authorized to view those tires/tire lines.  This is because they need their cab key adjusted to view these product lines.  To verify, look in WAD screen #49. Look at the BRD AUT KEY.  Across from it, it will show you the brand that they are authorized to view.  Note:  This sometimes will not show a difference between P Metric and commercial only.  The customer will need to contact their Goodyear Rep.

Title: You are not premitted to access TireHQ with this W
Description:
CP3194 While logging in, the customer gets the following error:  "You are not permitted to access Tire-HQ with this WTC username."

For more information See: Weekly TireHQ Problem and Fixes 09/19/2008 AND/OR 09/26/2008
Solution: The user is using their WTC user name.  WTC is for www.g3tsc.com, not THQ.  To verify that the user name is a WTC user, go to UserReg > People.  If there's something in the WTC field (farthest to the right), then the user name is for www.g3tsc.com.  Once the error has come up on the screen, the user will need to shut down the browser and re-open it to log in correctly.

Title: User Admin or WD was called to change the password
Description:
CP3195 User can not log into THQ or G3TSC.  User Admin or WD was called to change the password, but the user still can't log in.

For more information See: Weekly TireHQ Problem and Fixes 09/19/2008
Solution:
Check to see what the exact error is on screen.   If a user is locked, the user name is put into a Security database.  In order to be unlocked, the user will need to click on Forgot Password and enter in their user name.  This is the only way to remove them from the Security database and unlock the user name. Just because the User Admin or the WD reset the password, doesn't fix it if they were locked out due to too many incorrect password tries.  A Reset Password will still need to be done.

For G3TSC users, the customers will still need to click Reset Password and reset their password.  For G3TSC, the e-mail address is usually bogus and the customer will need to contact their WD to change the password after the Reset Password is done.

Title: TireHQ  Compatibility Issues
Description:
CP3197 Tire-HQ Web Browser Compatibility issues
   ****Please include the following Information****
BROWSER:
VERSION:
WHAT AREA(S) THEY ARE EXPERIENCING ISSUES:
IS THIS  INTERMITTANT (does this happen all the time or occasionally):
USERNAME:
Solution:
Tire-HQ is currently compatible with Internet Explorer version 8 and Firefox.

1.	Determine what browser is being used, including version.
2.	If an older browser, (IE8 or earlier), advise them to upgrade to IE9 or Firefox.
3.	If a newer browser (IE9, IE10, Chrome, Safari)

a.	Advise the user that we are working on all issues
b.	Record the issue being encountered.
c. Thank the caller for bringing this to our attention and advise that the issue is being forwarded to the development and QA teams.  Open the CP ticket with all required info from the CP and send to Level 2.

   ****Please include the following Information****
BROWSER
VERSION
WHAT AREA(S) THEY ARE EXPERIENCING ISSUES
IS THIS  INTERMITTANT (does this happen all the time or occasionally)
USERNAME

If this error falls under one the  following issues below- Please open a ticket under the appropriate CP.
IE 9.0 Drop Down Issue - CP 3847
Chrome Date Format - CP 3846
Pattern NULL in Search by Size using GYW - CP 3840
IE 10 can't use menu bar - CP 3856

Title: Invalid GS number
Description: CP3198 Dealer is coming up with an invalid GS number.
Solution:
Check the following:

1) Check the date of the document.  Make sure the date of the document is valid for the time frame of the GS number.

2) Check the document type.  GS numbers are to be used on B, D & E type documents.  C type document will only take an AN number.

Title: Bad Debt Written Off
Description: CP3204 AR account went into collections and the bad debt was written off.  The Account now has a zero balance.  However, the account mailed location a check to post to their account.  How does the check get processed since the A/R account has a zero balance or has been deleted?
Solution:
Stores:
Goodyear Credit Center for Accounts Receivable indicates the contact at Goodyear for bad debt is Frank LaGarde on 6-3879 (D/689).
Frank advises the location needs to access A/R, Cash Receipts, and post the payment to the recovery account 00013.

Dealers:
If the A/R account is closed, access A/R and do a minus paid out (i.e. -$100.00) to 54200.  Deposit the check in the drawer.

Title: Unknown Transcode received in Triad
Description: CP3206 Why am I getting error "Unknown Transcode received from triad catalog - 0920 1321 INVCNTL - Call Support. I just installed my Sept 2006 CD
Solution:
Now, while the fix in Manifest 959 addresses the issue by running memdet on a nightly basis, this dosen't fix those locations that install triad during the course of the day. Also, more recently, some users have been getting the following error message after install of the CD:
"Unknown trans code received from triad catalog - 0920 1321 -INVCNTL - call Support"
Thus, it becomes necessary to look at logfile and check for the specific error noted above. If shared memory errors are present in logfile, need to run memdet as shown in the screen schot below:
6731 / # cd /u/triad
6731 /  u/triad # memdet
6731 / u/triad #
System should just come back to # prompt again as shown above. May need to have user close GBMS sessions and go back in, but they will be fine. Any message regarding the "catalog unavailable" will go away as well

Title: Lost Sales - How to Track Lost Sales in GBMS Plus
Description: CP3208 How to Track Lost Sales in GBMS Plus
Solution:
1. From GBMS Plus homepage, select Sales Aid from drop down menu.
   2. From Sales Aid Listing in Dept field, type in the dept or size to search
   3. Click on Submit Request.
   4. If product code is not listed from Sales Aid listing go to the GBMS Plus Package on the left side of screen to the Add Code box.
   5. Delete the Add Code and type in the product code of the lost sale.
   6. Delete the Quantity from the box and type in L# (L = lost, # = number of tires lost in the sale)
   7. Click on Add to Cart which adds the product code to the Lost Sales Report.

Title: Reports: How to delete lost sales from Lost Sales
Description: CP3209 Reports: How to delete lost sales from Lost Sales Report.
Solution:
1. From the GBMS Homepage, click on 'GBMS Plus.
   2. Click on Reports from the drop down menu.
   3. Click on Lost Sales.
   4. From the Lost Sales screen, click on the product code you wish to delete.
   5. Receive prompt, Are you sure you want to delete item = xxxxxxxxx ? (xxxxxxxxx = product code) (OK=Yes/ Cancel = No)
   6. Confirm deletion.

Title: Lost Sales - Access Lost Sales Report
Description: CP3210 How to Access Lost Sales Report
Solution:
1. From the GBMS Homepage.
   2. Click on Reports from the drop down menu.
   3. Click on Lost Sales.
   4. Product code will display on the Sales screen.

Title: Reports: How to activate Lost Sales Report.
Description: CP3211 Reports: How to activate Lost Sales Report.
Solution:
1. From GBMS Main Menu, select Inventory Administration.
   2. From Inventory Administration select Inventory Profile.
   3. From Inventory Profile, tab to, Track Lost Sales from POS.
   4. Set indicator to Y.
   5. Press Enter. Receive response:
   6. Your profile has been updated.

Title: Can't log in using multiple PC's
Description: CP3212 "I attempted to login to goodyearwholesale.com, and am informed that another user is currently logged in with this username, what can I do?"
Solution:
In compliance with best Business & Security practices...
***ONLY ONE PC AT A TIME CAN BE LOGGED IN WITH SAME USERNAME***OTHER USERNAMES WILL NEED TO BE CREATED***

If more than one user at your location needs access to goodyearwholesale.com, contact your WTC (Wholesale Tire Center) and request another username be setup.

Title: CPU shutdown
Description: CP3213 CPU Shutdown

2.  On T1 bring up main menu and type IPL
3.  It will then ask you to press F1
4.  When gets to system has halted and may be powered off, then power off the server

Description: CP3217 When the user fills out the selection screen, the program abends on ORA-01722 (invalid number). However, the program converts this to MM/DD/YYYY, which is incorrect and causes the abend.

Title: Cannot Use Prod Codes on Same Document

Per National Accounts: when you are doing a Lube, Oil, & Filter for a National Account, you cannot charge for topping off fluids, like Windshield Fluid.  This service is all inclusive in the LOF.

Title: CLOSED STORE
Description:
CP3229 Closed Store Pre-Close Processing ? Final B50

Instruction to close must come from Mike Gron or Carol Klinger. Indicated Final B50 must be received, in-balance, and processed (I-SER SPL val of R7505000 or I0510000).

Final B50 sequence (3 numbers):
Final B50 date:

SUPPORT: If the location ran their Final B50 TODAY, advise the location that they MUST leave the system running overnight!!!
Solution: Final B50 is received, in-balance, and processed, SPS CC's blocked, removed location from CTRY/USAX/CANX maintenance schedule, set primary modem phone to CSAT (1st ordinal must be a "C"), disabled scheduling of sends/receives, and updated IAG pending close date to final B50 date.

Title: Sonsio Road Hazard
Description: CP323 How do I bill out a new Sonsio Road Hazard for a tire I am selling?
Solution:
"1) Start document on POS as CASH, AR, or CREDIT CARD.
2) Enter new customer's name or select from customer history.
3) Select/add a vehicle on the customer workorder screen.
4) Type the product code of the tire on the workorder screen or merchandise verify screen or select the tire from Sales Aid.
5) After entering or selecting the tire product code, type the quantity and TAB to the RH FIELD and type a 'Y', press ENTER.
6) The tire line will show a Y in the RH FIELD and will automatically generate the road hazard code 092206.
The cost of the road hazrd will be 10% of the new tire, with a minimum of $7.50 for tires selling for $60 or less. This will automatically generate.
NOTE: If the product code of the tires is deleted off the screen, the road hazard code will automatically be deleted also.
7) From Mdse Verify, press F-7 tire registration and type the DOT codes of the tires, press ENTER.
8) Finalize the document in the normal manner.
9) The GBMS system will generate a road hazard warranty number next to the road hazard code on the document when it is printed.
If there are mulitple road hazards being sold; i.e. more than one tire, the system will match up the tires with the registration numbers via a small legend on the invoice.  For example: tire #1 matches with registration #1, tire #2 matches with registration #2, etc.
Normally three numbers will print out on the invice for each tire sold when it is printed: the DOT number, the Quality Plus number, and the Road Hazard Warranty number."

Title: Account 49999 has been locked. How to rebill and c
Description: CP3230 Per Terri Sampson. We have blocked company owned locations from completing  sales to Voyager Account 49999 per Retail. If they have the Voyager National account bill through the National account program. If they have a government account they should be billing through Wright Express on local books.
Solution:
The AR account 49999 has a balance. How to remove?
 1. From POS create a new customer. COB 2 (consumer) Option MC (mastercard). Can use service code 017000000 (gas) since this code does not generate a tax. Enter description for its use. Ex. To charge account 49999 to recover monies. Print.
 2.Create a normal A/R journal ticket. From AR > AR options > A/R Journal tickets
Enter the reason for the JT. Within the reason reference the invoice number created. Credit code 100 (accounts receiveable) and debit code 615 (collection & legal ex). Print
 3. From AR > AR Payments > Cash/Check Receipts pull up account 49999. There should be credit line on this account created by the journal ticket. Press enter. Enter line # for the credit and press F2 Pay by Line.

Title: AAAD
Description: CP3236 CHANGE REQUEST IN IAG
Solution: IAG HAS BEEN UPDATED

Title: Car Dealer wants to do tire adjustment
Description: CP3237 Car Dealer wants to do tire adjustment on THQ
Solution: Car dealer can not do tire adjustments on THQ. Most car dealers do not have sales. To do a tire adjustment, the car dealer will need to fill out paper forms. The car dealer can get the paper forms from the local Goodyear Rep or from GBS (866-370-4271)

Title: GBMS STATISTICS DOES NOT MATCH DMR'S SAP REPORT
Description: CP3239 User wants to know why their GBMS stats are not matching up with "Daily Sales Metric Report" the DMR is getting out of SAP.
Solution:
GBMS statistics are based on activity done during any given B50 period whereas the SAP report received by DMRs is based on invoice date, hence instantly rendering the numbers out of sync.

EX.  Territory 1234 does business two days straight before running an end of day.

	In GBMS, stats will show all business for those two days on one B50 sequence number.
	The DMR's report will break that business into two business days based on invoice dates for that period.

PLEASE DIRECT ALL INQUIRIES ON THIS SUBJECT TO DAVE SHIREY AT 6-0603 HERE AT CORP HQ.

Title: Sonsio Flat Tire Repair
Description: CP324 How do I bill out a Sonsio flat tire repair?
Solution:
"1) Customer must provide proof of Road Hazard purchase. (Certificate and original invoice)
2) Tires can be repaired as often as needed on one Road Hazard stamp until worn to 2/32nds tread depth.
3) Tires must be damaged due to Road Hazard.
4) Tire repair is free of charge.
5) Process cash invoice to customer. Select the vehicle from W/O screen.
Vehicle information MUST be complete.
6) Press F7 for the Adjustment screen.
7) Type the Drive type, TAB.
8) Type the Adjustment Type 'T', TAB.   9) Type Tread Depth, TAB.
10) Type Purchase Date, TAB.
11) Type Stamp or Road Hazard registration number, Press ENTER.
12) Flat repair code will automatically generate in the product code field.
13) If flat repair generates MORE than $10.00, you will see message at the bottom of the screen, ""ENTER FLAT REPAIR PRICE BETWEEN $0 AND $10.00!!"".  You must change it, then press ENTER.
14) A replacement price of 0.00 will generate, press ENTER.
15) Press F4 Document Total.
NOTE: If the service screen information has not been completed the system will proceed to this screen for the required information. After filling out the mechanic numbers etc, press enter and F4 again for Document Total.
16) Type the reason for issuance (i.e. Ameraan Flat Repair).
17) Document will show TOTAL DUE $0.
Customer does not have to pay sales tax. Sonsio will be billed electronically to your AR Acct # 67.
18) Finalize document."

Title: No Pricing in Goodyear Wholesale website
Description:
CP3240 Dealer says they do not have pricing in www.goodyearwholesale.com

Revised 04/22/2009 - MEP

Information you'll need:
User Name
Company name of dealer
WD's NonSig

Write it up and send it to 2nd level.

********************
For 2nd Level
********************
Get user's name.  Log in as user.  Does user have Customize at the top of the screen?  Does the user have POS Pricing in the menu?

NO - User does not get pricing in goodyearwholesale.com. User get pricing from Goodyear.

YES - User gets pricing from the WD. Look up the user's name in UserReg.  Open the UserReg form.  Look at the GBMS Account Number.  Verify with the WD that this is the correct customer number in the WD's GBMS system.  Make sure that the WD's NonSig is NOT in the Goodyear Customer # field.

Do the GBMS Customer numbers match?

NO - Have the WD fix this. Pricing should be fine after this is fixed.

YES - Go to www.goodyearwholesale.com and click on POS Pricing > Set Price > Print Preview. If the error "There are no products currently available for preview. It could be due to a lack of pricing available from the WD, but as products are added, the prices will be dynamically generated based on the setting." shows up, the WD needs to set pricing levels for the user.


2nd level: If the pricing level is set and the pricing level is valid, wait overnight to see if pricing comes up.  If it does not, delete the user from UserReg.  Login as the WTC and recreate the user. Test.

WTC - GBMS Tip:
***************************************
To see if a user is setup with Price levels, goto: GBMS > Main Menu > Administration (ADM) > Cust/Vehicle Management (CVMGT) > Cust/Vehicle Maintenance (CVMNT) > Option 1) Add/Revise Cust Information.  WD will enter in the name of the dealer.  Customer number will be in the upper left hand side. Price level will be in the center at the bottom.

WTC - GBMS Tip:
***************************************
To see what the price levels are, go to: > GBMS > Main Menu > Product Administration (PRADM) > Price Level Update (PLU) > Put in the Employee Number and choose option 1) Price Level Updates. Enter in the price level that was found in CVMNT to view that level.
Solution:
When pricing does not appear in goodyearwholesale.com, check the user name. The user name may have a nonsig associate with it.

Put that nonsig in WAD and view page 50. At the bottom of the page, you will see a GX section. If any of these are marked, then the user is a G3X and should show pricing. If none of these are marked, then the dealer is a G110.  G3X gets pricing from goodyearwholesale.com. G110 buys directly from Goodyear and gets Goodyear pricing. G110 are usually large companies that do a lot of volume.

If they are a G3X and they still do not have pricing, get the following information:
User Name for goodyearwholesale.com
Name of dealer
WD/WTC's NonSig

Write it up and send it to 2nd level.

********************
For 2nd Level
********************
Get user's name.  Log in as user.  Does user have Customize at the top of the screen?  Does the user have POS Pricing in the menu?

NO - User does not get pricing in goodyearwholesale.com. User get pricing from Goodyear.

YES - User gets pricing from the WD. Look up the user's name in UserReg.  Open the UserReg form.  Look at the GBMS Account Number.  Verify with the WD that this is the correct customer number in the WD's GBMS system.  Make sure that the WD's NonSig is NOT in the Goodyear Customer # field.

Do the GBMS Customer numbers match?

NO - Have the WD fix this. Pricing should be fine after this is fixed.

YES - Go to www.goodyearwholesale.com and click on POS Pricing > Set Price > Print Preview. If the error "There are no products currently available for preview. It could be due to a lack of pricing available from the WD, but as products are added, the prices will be dynamically generated based on the setting." shows up, the WD needs to set pricing levels for the user.


2nd level: If the pricing level is set and the pricing level is valid, wait overnight to see if pricing comes up.  If it does not, delete the user from UserReg.  Login as the WTC and recreate the user. Test.

WTC - GBMS Tip:
***************************************
To see if a user is setup with Price levels, goto: GBMS > Main Menu > Administration (ADM) > Cust/Vehicle Management (CVMGT) > Cust/Vehicle Maintenance (CVMNT) > Option 1) Add/Revise Cust Information.  WD will enter in the name of the dealer.  Customer number will be in the upper left hand side. Price level will be in the center at the bottom.

WTC - GBMS Tip:
***************************************
To see what the price levels are, go to: > GBMS > Main Menu > Product Administration (PRADM) > Price Level Update (PLU) > Put in the Employee Number and choose option 1) Price Level Updates. Enter in the price level that was found in CVMNT to view that level.

Title: PCI Compliance Shift F4
Description: CP3245  Why does the PCCA (Pending Credit Card Auth) screen display when I enter the shortcut EODCO to start my End of Day?
Solution:
Processing invoices with the WAN down will create entries in GBMS that must be processed before you are able to run EOD in GBMS.  This is done on the PCCA screen.

   1.  Type the Line # in the available field at the bottom of the screen and hit enter.
   2.  Press  F5 PROCESS
   3.  You will be prompted to enter the C.C. # and expiration date.  This is when you will
        need to use the Pending Credit Card Authorization document (with your hand-
        written C.C.# and expiration date) that prints with the invoice when the WAN is
        down.
        a.  All entries must be labeled ?C? for complete to be able to run EOD.
        b.  An ?I? in front of the entry means the transaction is incomplete.  Complete above
             steps.
    4.  EOD can now be completed.

The best practice would be to process these entries at every opportunity throughout the day after the satellite connection is restored.  From the GBMS main menu, enter the SCID: PCCA or select option EOD (07) > Pending Credit Card Auth (18).

Title: Employees Working at Multi-Locs
Description: CP3249 How to Enter an Employe in as a multi-loc employee?
Solution: Employee needs to be entered as Transfer, always using his corp store that he was transferred from. Will do this at each location he works

Title: Sonsio tire replacement - COO
Description: CP325 How do I bill an Sonsio replacement tire?** If this is a Dealer, use CP #166.**
Solution:
"1) Start document on POS as CASH, A/R or CREDIT CARD.
 2) Enter customer's name or select from customer history.
 3) From the customer workorder, select vehicle.
 4) Press F7,  Adjustment screen.
 5) Type drive type, TAB.
 6) Type Adjustment Type ""W"", TAB.
 7) Type product code, TAB.
 8) Type tread depth, TAB.
 9) Type purchase date, TAB.
10) Type stamp or road hazard registration number, ENTER.
11) Foreign brand codes are eligible for Ameraan warranty and can be billed under 347 and 348 codes but you must figure out the percent of wear and enter the buying price, the system will not generate it.
12) System will generate replacement price according to tread depth only. If less than 25% of wear, will generate ""no charge"".
13) Type condition, you do not need to use ""sampling codes"", TAB.
14) Type wheel position, TAB.
15) Type Y or N in original equipment field. Press ENTER.
16) Type ""Y"" in RH field if customer is purchasing a road hazard for the new tire, press ENTER.
17) Press F4, Document Total, screen will go to Tire Registration.
18) Type DOT numbers for tire being adjusted, press ENTER.
19) Type DOT numbers for new tires, press ENTER.
20) Press F4 for Document Total.
21) Finalize document. The finalized document will show billing to customer ONLY.  You will not see the billing to Sonsio, which is billed electronically to acct # 67 for the replacement price of the original tire.  The charge will appear on your A/R Sonsio Acct # 67."

Description: CP3266 PAGE CANNOT BE DISPLAYED from the GBMS PLUS MENUS

					Instruct user to refresh/ logoff/logon and try their task again.  They should be fine.

Title: User called in asking for NS of Bill To
Description: CP3267 User is asking about a bill to NonSig.

Title: Internal Server Error transferring customers in pl
Description: CP3269 - Internal Server Error transferring customers in plus
Solution:
The 'PLEASE WAIT' pop-up window in the transfer customer option in GBMS plus is failing.

Infrastructure has already deployed a fix to correct this situation.
If the problem persists, follow the steps outlined below to correct issue for customer.  Then note report accordingly (ex. "...steps outlined were followed and customer is okay...to level 3 for further review as instructed herein") and forward to Level 3.


The transfer does complete successfully, but the customer is not getting the proper pop-up screen (Please Wait) during execution and thus, think an error has occurred.

To confirm, instruct user to Reg. GBMS (blue screen) in POS > enter emp# > Last name > F7 - Cust History.

They should be able to see/ choose the correct customer and see all associated history.  If they find more than one record for the customer there (because they attempted the transfer multiple times), they simple need to make a note of the customer numbers for the extra records and delete the unwanted records via CVMNT > Delete Customer.

Please check this CP for updates on this issue.

Title: TC 80 tire adjustment
Description: CP327 How do I process a TC80 tire adjustment?
Solution: Advise location to fill out a manual claim form and send a copy of the claim form along with the tire to CID (Central Inspection Depot). The replacement tire is billed out on another delivery receipt, TC 80.

Title: Browser compatibility of THQ or Goodyearwholesale.
Description:
CP3270 Browser compatibility of THQ or Goodyearwholesale.com
THQ & GW.com is compatible with Microsoft IE8 and Mozilla Firefox.

Firefox can be found at www.mozilla.com
IE8 can be found at www.microsoft.com

Mozilla works in all of THQ except:
Marketing > Advertising Catalog - My GBS
Solution:
TireHQ will not be made compatible with IE7. It's an older browser. If user is on IE7, have them upgrade to IE8 or FireFox.

The following browsers are compatible with TireHQ:

IE6

IE8 (Highest level of IE without going to Windows 7)

Mozilla FireFox
Known Issues: Mozilla works in all of THQ except: Marketing > Advertising Catalog - My GBS


The following browsers are NOT compatible with TireHQ:

IE7
Known Issues: Drop down box issues - Problem started with Microsoft pushed an update of IE7.

IE9 (Standard on Windows 7 PCs)
Known Issues: Display issues and Java issues. ie: file uploads that use Java script.

IE10 (Standard on newer Windows 7 PCs or upgraded from older IE9)
Known Issues: Display issues and Java issues. ie: file uploads that use Java script.

Google Chrome
Known Issues: Date issue - Browser determines that a field is a date field and tries to put in "/" in the date, even though it's invisible to the users.)

Safari (Standard on Apple products including the Mac)
Known issues: Date issue - Browser determines that a field is a date field and tries to put in "/" in the date, even though it's invisible to the users.

Netscape Flock
Known Issues: Not supported. We do not test for compatibility.

Opera
Known Issues: Not supported. We do not test for compatibility.

Title: Maxterm Thinclient Setup Procedure
Description:
CP3272 Thinclient Setup Procedure
***Thin Client Issue***

Is there a report open already?
Terminal Number:
Details of Issue:
Solution:
Thinclient Setup Procedures


To access Thinclient Setup Screen:
As the terminal is logging off, have the caller press the shift keys in a drumroll pattern (going back and forth between both shift keys).
a)	This will bring up a screen wtih three buttons, choose Setup. The password is setup.
b)	This will take you to Thinclient Setup screen. Store Number is the territory number.
c)	Server ID is 1
d)	Terminal ID is whatever terminal it is being set up as. Use Checkthin to see which one is offline and/or which one is being added.
e)	The server IP Address (you can obtain the server IP Addr by pinging the g.   It will show the IP Addr of the server:
Example:  10.7.43.66    (this IP Addr is what you put in the 4 boxes for IP Addr, 2 nbrs per box.   You will have to click on each box to enter the 2 digit nbrs)
f)	Click the Check Box on the left side of the Date to revise the date if incorrect
g)	Click the Check Box on the left side of the time to revise the time if it is incorrect.  Click on the Hrs, Mins, and AM/PM to set time.
h)	Click on Time Zone drop down to select the correct time zone.
i)	Click OK when finished and the thinclient will reboot and hopefully come up to GBMS Homepage w/ correct settings.

Title: GoodYear Credit cards terms

Solution:
GoodYear Credit cards have several different terms available to customers.  When using a stand alone system the following codes are needed to complete the transaction:

If using GBMS, these codes will appear on the invoice after the credit card number.

Title: 30 Day Ride Guarantee Adjustment
Description:
CP3285 30 Day Ride Guarantee Adjustment - How Do I Do It
Where to find the 30-Day Test Ride Questionnaire Form
Solution:
Type B = 30 day No Obligation
Condition Code "GG" is to be used for tires replaced under the Goodyear 30-Day No Obligation Trial Period program or the Kelly 30-Day Test Drive program. When the user enters this Condition the purchase date entered MUST be no more than 30 days earlier than the current system date.If it is they will receive the error message
" TIME LIMIT FOR THE 30 DAY TEST DRIVE PROGRAM EXCEEDED". The user will have to adjust the purchase date or use another condition code.

The 30 Day Ride Questionnaire Form can be found on Tire HQ. Go to Products -> Product Service -> 30 Day Test Ride Questionnaire Form -> 30 Day Test Ride Form. The link to the actual form is at the bottom of the page.

Title: New Car Changeovers
Description: CP3302 New Car Changeovers
Solution:
Company Owned Stores

first enter the product code they are putting on the car
then enter 669950950 as the negative (-) and change the price to the same price they are selling the new code and put an E in the billing code

When the doc appears on the Daily Sales Analyzer,  they MUST  fax copy of the Daily Sales Analyzer & copy of the invoice to Brian Dougherty so he can make adjustments so they will not lose money.

Dealers
Dealers will put in the tire they are selling and then for the tire they are taking off, if gdyr, use appropriate code and negative units.  If it is a foreign brand tire they are taking off, then they will use a comparable (by price) Gdyr tire as the code.  they will then need to fill out a claim form and enter in the foreign brand tire they actually took off and send it in.

Title: How to Modify a Sent Document
Description: CP3303 User wants to know how to modify a delivery receipt that has already been sent.
Solution:
This can only be done the same day the delivery receipt was sent. If the user needs to make corrections for a DR submitted prior to the current date ? Use CP 1408.

1) Go to Transactions > Delivery Management > Deliveries Sent.
2) Select the document(s) in question by checking the box in the left column.
3) Click on the "Put Selected Documents on Hold" button at the bottom. This will take the user to the Deliveries On Hold page.
4) Click on the document number on the Deliveries On Hold page to recall the document to edit and re-send.

Title: Core Value Disappeared
Description: CP3309 - Why doesn't the core value show for this part anymore?
Solution:
Users should be advised that core values are not retained in GBMS for items receipted under NON-TRIAD mfc/ partno (s).

For example, the manufacturer or mfc ".XX" is NOT a manufacturer found in the triad parts catalog.

The user will need to make the effort to receipt in parts under the proper mfc/ partno that is contained in the triad parts catalog in order to have core values retained on parts with a quantity on hand greater than zero.

If in doubt, you can get the mfc/ partno of the part in question from the user and look it up in the triad parts catalog on the appropriate test system near your workstation.  If it is found, it is a triad part, if not, well, it is NOT a triad part.

From the main menu in regular GBMS,
	type: TPART on the scid line (enter)
	hit: F4 Part Desc
	type: partial description (ex. Brake)	
		****use up and down arrows to move from screen to screen til you see the part you're looking for****
	select: vehicle year
	select: Y or N
	select: vehicle
	select: model

You can compare against thost mfc/ partno(s) listed to see it if is a valid triad part and advise user accordingly.

Title: Tire-HQ requires users to have OWN log-in
Description: CP3310 **NEW ACTION REQUIRED**  Each user is required to have his/her OWN log-in account by November 30, 2009
Solution:
Q1.  Why is this change occurring?
A1.  This change is required due to security policy requirements and a new software upgrade on Tire-HQ.  It was a business decision.  It is mandatory to make the site a more secure site.

Q2.  We all share the same username here, now what do we do?
A2.  Have the user admin setup each person with their own username & password.   Since orders are identified by username, this could be important with identifing who is ordering tires at your location.

Q3.  What if employees come & go all the time, and setting up usernames all the time would be a hassle?
A3.  Generic usernames eg. mylocc01, mylocc02, mylocc03 can be established for several users at your location.  As employees leave, passwords will need to be modified.  Valid email addresses need to updated, so password resets can be automaticly administrated on "Reset Password" application.  We do not reccomend that this solution be used (see answer to #1)

Q4.  I don't know who the user administrator is for my location?
A4.  The user administator should be listed in the new announcement note on Tire-HQ.  If that person no longer works there, have the owner/manager call us to have this change made.  If needed, look up user administrator in User Registration database, view "Dealers by Common Owner/Customer view" (top item).

Q5.  I am the administrator.  How do I create/edit another user.
A5.  The administrator would need to go to "User Administration" located on the home page under site controls.  A pdf file is supplied below.  This file can be e-mailed to that person for instructions on setting up and editing a new or existing user.

Title: Reverse Transfer Payment
Description:
CP332  How do I reverse a transfer payment?
For incorrect account #, or amount."
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select option 2 (cash receipts) press ENTER.
2) Type Emp#, tab, select option 4 (Transfer payment) press ENTER.
3) Type Name/Tradestyle, Adress, TAB.
4) Type Accounts Receivable # (the same incorrect acct # entered on the first transfer payment) TAB.
5) Type Receiving Territory #, TAB.
6) Type Amount Paid (the same incorrect amount entered on the first transfer payment) with MINUS in front of the amount. (EX: -50.00) TAB.
7) Type the MINUS amount again in either the check or cash field. Press ENTER.
8) Press the F3 key to print the payment.
9) Follow above steps 1 - 8 again with the correct information."
