Title: CP3325 HP 3015 Laser Printer Setup
Description:
CP3325 HP 3015 Laser Printer Setup
Send the Service Center Ticket to HW/Comm after printer setup is completed.  Larry needs to check fonts, settings and make sure the printer is set to Print the Batch Report.
***Printer Problems***

Model:
Serial Number:
Is there a report open already?
Laser #:
Details of Issue:
Troubleshooting:
Recent error code(s):
Solution:
Before starting, make sure to clear all jobs in the laser printer's queue.  This often helps avoid trouble entering in the hardware address.

COLD RESET
This may have to be done prior to entering UAA/Hardware Address when setting up printer for the first time.
1.  Turn the printer off for @ 10 secs.
2.  Turn the Laser on - watch for memory counting up and, once this comes up, hold the OK BUTTON DOWN.
3.  All 3 light's (READY, DATA and ATTENTION) should come solid.
     If the lights do not come on solid within 15 seconds - start over.
4. Release the OK button.  Should see SELECT LANGUAGE in window.
5.  Press the Down-Arrow two times to COLD RESET and press the OK button.
6.  When the printer displays "TO RETURN TO READY, press  STOP.  Give the printer a good minute and 15 seconds before entering the UAA address in System Administration.

GBMS Printer setup:
1. HIT MENU BUTTON
2. ARROW DOWN UNTIL YOU SEE INFORMATION > PRESS OK BUTTON
3. ARROW DOWN UNTIL YOU SEE "PRINT CONFIGURATION" >  PRESS OK BUTTON
4. PRINTER PRINTS OUT 3 PAGES.  2ND PAGE WILL HAVE THE "HARDWARE ADDRESS" ON THE LEFT SIDE COLUMN NEAR THE TOP.
5. FROM GBMS HOMEPAGE,  GO TO SYSTEM ADMIN > PRINTER FUNCTIONS > SETUP LASER PRINTER > SELECT LASER 1
    Select Laser Printer 1 if this is their first laser printer.   Select Laser Printer 2 if it is their second laser printer.
6. ENTER IN UAA/HARDWARE ADDRESS (2 digits per box).
7. PRESS  OK.   Should get "printer setup complete".  Once completed, send report to Hardware/Comm to check fonts & settings of the Laser.

Send the Service Center Ticket to HW/Comm after printer setup is completed.  Larry needs to check fonts, settings and make sure the printer is set to Print the Batch Report.

Title: Why is my laser printer asking me to load tray 2 w
Description:
CP3328 Why is my laser asking me to load tray 2 with some paper type?  ( LOAD TRAY 2 , PLAIN LETTER , PAPER SETTINGS 	)
***Printer Problems***

Model:
Serial Number:
Is there a report open already?
Laser #:
Details of Issue:
Troubleshooting:
Recent error code(s):
Solution:
Oftentimes, the P3005DN ( THIS WILL INCLUDE ANY HP LASER ONLY )  Laser printer will change paper settings in tray 2 for reasons unknown.  In this case, it is possible for the location to change the paper type back in the menus but difficult to explain over the phone.  Instead, follow these instructions:

1. Remote into the location using PLUS.  When it asks if you want to run smenu, enter N.  At the command prompt, enter "lpstat -s" and look for the IP address of the laser which is having this problem.  Once found and copied, type exit to log out.

2. Open up your web browser and paste or type in the IP address for the printer on the URL line.

3. On the printer's main page, the paper types for tray 1 and tray 2 are listed.  Tray 1 should be any size/any type, and tray 2 should be SIZE - LETTER / TYPE - PLAIN.  If the settings are not correct, go to the Settings tab and Configure Device.

4. From this menu, click "PAPER HANDLING."

5. Tray 1 and tray 2 paper settings should be Tray 1 - any size, any type; Tray 2 - letter, plain. If they are not, make the change and click Apply.

After applying, check to make sure the change took, and then reset print services (see CP1795) or better yet have the customer do this themselves by clicking Admin -> Printer Functions -> Reset Print server and clicking the reset button.  This is a very useful function and may be used by them in the future instead of calling support each time their printer does not print.  The printer should now start printing.

If the paper settings did not change, open a ticket to HW/Comm describing the steps you took and including the serial number.  The SN can be found inside the top cover where the toner cartridge is - it always begins with the letters CN. The SN can also be found under the Event Log on the Information tab when you are logged into the printer as indicated above.

The F12 key should work to automatically login on Little Foot screen."

Title: Credit Card Tokenization not coming up
Description: CP3335 Credit Card Tokenization Will Not Come Up on the Requirements Screen.
Solution:
When a customer calls and states that the Credit Card Tokenization is not working on their PC for YRC, or any other National Account that requires Credit Card Tokenization you need to give them this information.  Typical problem is that the screen will not come up on the PC after clicking the link that says "Enter Credit Card..."  We should also have the below information in our Lotus Notes to forward to customers as well.

IF THE CUSTOMER IS NOT COMFORTABLE IN FINDING THE FIREWALL OR IN GENERAL IS NOT PC LITERATE, WE SHOULD FORWARD THEM THE EMAIL FROM HQ SUPPORT AND ADVISE THAT THEY CONTACT THEIR LOCAL IT SUPPORT OR SOMEONE COMFORTABLE WITH COMPUTERS.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Some Tire-HQ users are not able to get to the Credit Card Authorization screen.
The CC Authorization screen will either be blank below the submenu bar, or just a Cancel button will be present.

The CC Authorization screen is presented from PayMetric, not Tire-HQ.  In other words, you are temporally leaving Tire-HQ, going to PayMetric, then back into Tire-HQ once request is complete.
That said, if you have firewalls, or Anti-virus software that is blocking some traffic, you will need to "allow" PayMetric to be accessed.

Here are some items to check-
Avtivirus Software (eg. Norton) - allow https://prdapp02.xisecurenet.com/   access
Firewall - allow https://prdapp02.xisecurenet.com/   access
Clear Cache & cookies from Browser
Confirm Tire-HQ is bookmarked as www.tire-hq.com (nothing after .com)

Under IE, please go to Tools Internet Options Security and set the Internet to Medium (Not Medium-High.) Also, ensure that under Security Settings for the internet, that Scripting Active Scripting is enabled. Save and restart the browser and try again.

If after confirming/changing above mentioned items, and you still cannot access the Credit Card Authorization screen ... power OFF/ON your PC, and that might just resolve any conflicts.

If you are still encountering a problem after following the above steps, please reply to this email with the following information:
Browser & version
Firewall used? (Y/N)
Anti-Virus used? (Y - need name/N)
Has this ever worked on this PC (Y/N)
Has this worked on another PC at your facility? (Y/N)
Do you have an IT person that can be contacted? (Y/N)

Title: Order through GMBS into Tire-HQ not working
Description: CP3340 Tire Order being placed through GBMS into HQ is not going through.  Location maybe getting error that their password in HQ is not correct, but can still log into HQ.  Or it may say that they are not authorized to place an order for this location.
Solution:
The most common cause to this is that GBMS is not seeing a password for the HQ user in User Reg or the password is a system generated password and needs changed.

If you pull up the user name in User Reg. and right click the user name, then click on properties, look for the Password in the properties box.  If the password shows just exactly this " " in User Reg.
The user will need to go to HQ and click on "Change Password".
They then can input the password they ALREADY are using in both fields, and then update the password (there is no need to actually change it in this instance, all they are doing is bumping the record in HQ so that the password now appears in User Reg). Give the Password about a minute or so to update and have the user try and place the order again.

If when viewing the password and it is a system generated password with all upper cases.  The user will need to go to HQ and change their password following the steps above, but they will need to CHANGE it.  Make sure that they use the formate guidlines and use all lower case as GBMS does not recognize upper or lower cases.  (that is why the system generated passwords do not workin in GBMS).  After changing the password give the system about a minute or so to update and have the user place the order again.

If changing and updating the passwords in HQ does not work.  Send ticket to LVL 2 GBMS.

Title: Month End did not print
Description: CP3355 Loc said they ran month end on Sat, but the Summary is not showing it is month end.  Also if a location's AR cutoff is the last day of the month as well, it may not have aged the accounts.
Solution:
1.  Have them go to sales stats and check the monthly column. If it still has Data, month end did NOT run and they should run right away. Any business they have done up to now will be included in previous Month's end.
2.  The system will NOT ask again whether they are doing month end and/or AR cutoff. It will automatically do it.
3.  In their cash and checks, they will put in cash that is in the drawer(includes petty cash) and any checks they may have taken in since their last EOD.
4.  Their B50 should show final month end and if AR Cutoff, will show the AR Aging.

Title: Restore Delete Customers/Vehicles
Description: CP3357 How to restore a deleted customer/vehicle
Solution:
From the Main Menu
(1) choose opt 5 - Administration
(2) from the Administration menu choose opt 14 - Cust/Vehicle Management
(3) from the Cust/Vehicle Managemt screen choose opt 7 - Restore Deleted Cust/Veh
At the Restore Deleted Customers/Vehicles screen, either select   opt 1 "Restore Deleted Customer"  or  opt 2 "Restore Deleted Vehicle" and enter.
If a Customer is being restored select opt 1,  and enter the customer name or # to see list.  Select the line# and enter an S and enter,  and it should say***RESTORED***.
If a Vehicle is being restored, select opt 2 &  enter the customer name or #, choose desired line by tabbing and typing an S to select, then press enter.  It will then say***RESTORED***on that line that has the veh you want restored.

Title: Entering Battery Adjustments into Vendors Payable
Description: CP3363 How to enter vendor battery credits or product replacements at discounted purchase price?
Solution:
If a vendor replaces a battery at NO CHARGE:
1) enter the 9 digit battery code, the full PRICE of the battery as IF it were being purchased outright and the number of unit(s).
2) Since the battery is No Charge enter a second line but use cost-of-sales code 41500 for batteries and enter the negative dollar amount of the purchase price entered on line 1.
This retains the proper "average cost" in the stock ledger and recovers the gross profit lost at the time the battery was adjusted for $0.00 at POS.  It also zeros out the invoice entered into the vendor payable record, since it was a free replacement.

If a replacement battery is pro-rated, follow the same procedure as above but credit cost-of-sales (41500) for only the pro-rated amount of the adjustment (the difference between the original cost less the pro-rated replacement price).

If the battery vendor simply issues a dollar credit without a battery replacement, enter the entire credit amount under battery cost-of-sales code 41500.

Title: Receiving Refunds via Negative Paid Out - DEALER
Description: CP3365 How DEALERS can book a refund check through issuing a negative paid out.
Solution: If a DEALER has a refund check in hand, they can process a negative Paid Out and include the check in the EOD drawer count & normal nightly deposit .  Select the Paid Out option off the Main Menu, enter the appropriate accounting code, enter vendor name or description of the refund, enter the check amout as a NEGATIVE number, use the check number in lieu of the invoice number and BE SURE TO CHANGE THE CASH INDICATOR TO "N" before pressing ENTER.  Place the check in the cash drawer and include in the EOD Check Deposit figure.

Title: Historical Correction Deletion
Description: CP3366 Location needs to have historical correction deleted or corrected.
Solution:
This can only be done by KRONOS SUPPORT.  Previous instructions were given on how to delete historical corrections, however this was changed after the instructions were changed.

Log in to Kronos
Go to the Active Associates Time Card.  Pull up the CURRENT PAY PERIOD for that associate.
Look at the Historical Corrections Tab
Listed there should be all the historical corrections entered by the Manager or their Second user.
Delete the edits that were duplicated or delete all edits and have them redo the corrections by right clicking on the actual time.  You will then see "delete" in the box, and select delete.
After you have removed the correct Historical Corrections.  Select Save to save the record.  Inform the Store that the correction has been processed.


***Please make sure that you understand fully what needs to be deleted. ****

Title: Unlock User Account
Description: CP3367 How Do I Unlock a User Account For Kronos
Solution:
Link to instruction on Wiki (Please remind store that these instructions can be found on Pit Row and on Goodyear's own Wiki site)  They can access Wiki by typing the word "wiki" in their web browser address bar.

http://ahqna009.akr.goodyear.com/CORP/FINANCE/itwiki.nsf/pages/Kronos%20-%20Unlocking%20User%20Accounts

Who can unlock accounts?

Store Managers
Secondary License Holders
District Manager
This has to be done from the Store Manager PC and not from a GBMS Thin Client


Steps to unlock user accounts:

1. Find & highlight the associate's name within any Kronos genie
2. Click on the 'People' quick link located in the top left-hand corner of Kronos
3. Select 'User Information' from the column on the left-hand side of the screen
4. Uncheck 'Account Locked,' then place a check mark in the 'Require password change at next logon'
5. Enter a new password in the 'Password' and 'Confirm Password' boxes
6. Click 'Save'
Make the associate aware of their new password and that they will be forced to change their password the next time they clock in/out***

In order to change a password for a DMR or other associate you will need to search by their name and choose, "Time Period", "Specific Date" from below the "Name or ID" field.


*** Password Requirements ***
As of December 4, 2017

?	All passwords should be reasonably complex and difficult for unauthorized people to guess.  Associates should choose passwords that are at least fifteen characters long and must contain numbers.
?	In addition to meeting those requirements, associates must not use their User Name in their password.
?	The passwords cannot be one of your 5 previous passwords.
?	All passwords must be changed regularly, with the expiration set at 180 days.  This requirement will be enforced by the Kronos system.
?	Your first password change to the guidelines above will be required upon your first password expiration.

Title: New Hire/Re-Hire transition into Kronos
Description: CP3368 When does a New Hire / Re-Hire appear in Kronos?
Solution:
If the associate is a true new Hire, having never worked for Goodyear, the employee will appear next day. (Verify that the New Hire Packet was submitted to ESC).

If the associate is a re-hire and has ever worked for Goodyear, the process can take 2 - 4 days, depending on when the associate was entered into Kronos.

Once the associate is in Kronos, the manager and or secondary license holder can update and add hours for the associate into Kronos so that the employee receives pay for that week.  If the manager or secondary license holder has already signed off on the that pay period, they will need to do a Historical Correction to enter in the employee's hours for the pay period they need hours for.

Title: Deleted Associate is Back in Kronos WHY?
Description: CP3369 Deleted Associate is Back in Kronos WHY?   PLEASE READ   ***DO NOT CONFUSE WITH COMMON PROBLEM 3391 - WHEN A STORE IS ASKING HOW AN EXITED ASSOCIATE IS REMOVED FROM KRONOS, USE CP 3391***
Solution:
Back in February of 2010, testing was done that caused certain terminated associates to show back up in the stores Kronos.  An email was sent out explaining this to stores, who were asked to respond with any associates that need to be removed.

THIS IS TO BE DONE BY KRONOS SUPPORT ONLY.  AT THIS TIME ALL ASSOCIATES SHOULD HAVE BEEN REMOVED.  REFER ANY OTHER CALLS TO KRONOS SUPPORT.

THIS IS NOT THE SAME AS AN ASSOCIATE THAT WAS JUST RECENTLY TERMINATED/QUIT.  THEY WILL BE REMOVED AUTOMATICALLY ONCE ALL EXIT PAPERWORK IS COMPLETED BY HR AND ESC.

****PLEASE NOTE - ASSOCIATES TRANSFERRED FROM GASC'S AND JUST TIRES TO A WTC DO NOT FALL OUT OF KRONOS AUTOMATICALLY AND HAVE TO BE REMOVED BY KRONOS SUPPORT.****

Within Kronos
1. Find Associate - Ensure that the WIN ID and Name match per the request from the Store Manager
2. Highlight the name of the associate and click on people
3. On the right select General information
4. Within the body of Kronos you will see an active field.  Just below that is a blank field and you will select "Terminated", and then select the date that the termination should have taken affect.
5. To the right again select "User Information" and do the same thing in step 4.
6. Select "Save".  User is now removed from Kronos.  Advise location that the associate has been removed.

Title: ROM-new payable receiver options
Description:
CP337 "What are the 2 new options on ROM for?
Opt 6 Automatic payable receivers and
Opt 7 Display pending payable receivers."
Solution:
"If the dealer uses Invoice Entry Short Form to enter foreign brand tires, the new options DO NOT apply to them.
If the dealer uses A/P Daily Processing to enter the bills for tires not received, (opt 7 off A/P Daily Processing) the new options apply to them.
When option 7 is used to pay for inventory items that have not been physically received, a receiver record for that mdse will be created.  Once that mdse is physically received you can receive it through either one of the new options listed instead of ROM option 1, Manual for Gdyr and Payable Vendors.
Option 6 Automatic Payable Receivers will request a Vendor # and the Shipment #.  After entering this number the system will display a ROM screen and you can receipt by line or by page.
Option 7 Display Pending Payable Receivers,  when selected, the system will request the Vendor #. After entering the Vendor # the system will display any pending shipments for that Vendor. If you select a line the system will display a ROM screen and you can receipt by line or by page."

Title: Dealer wants to print a report of customer info
Description:
CP3373 Dealer is asking if it is possible to create or print a report of customer information?
Dealer may want to export data to an Excel spreadsheet.
Solution:
Steps for creating a report of customer data :
1)   From GBMS Plus >  Select "Reports" >  "Export Data" >
2)   Use the drop down and select "Customer Master"
      Result:  When data selection has completed, gbms will display a small box with a red inset.

To export the Customer Master data to the USB:
1)   Click on "Copy CUSTMAST export data to USB flash drive".
2)   Click on "OK" in pop up window showing  "Place jump/flash drive in USB port and press enter when ready."
       Result:  "copy completed" message appears & a .TXT file was created on the flash drive.
3)   Click on "OK".
4)   Remove the flash drive from the maxspeed and insert it in the PC.

To convert data to Excel format:
1)   Access Excel software > "File" > "Open" > "My Docs" >
2)   Click on the drop down and select "removable disk".
3)   Click on "Files of Type" at the bottom of the screen.
4)   Click on drop down and select "All Files".
      Result:  You will see the EXPORT.CUSTMAST.txt file listed.
5)   Select EXPORT.CUSTMAST.txt file.
      Result:  The file will display as a .txt.
6)   Click on "Delimited" and "Next" to go to the next screen.
7)   Unclick "Tab" and click on "Comma", then "Next" to go to the next screen.
      Result:  Data is now showing in columns.
8)   Click on "Finish" to create an Excel spreadsheet.

The above steps will create an Excel spreadsheet of Customer Information.  However, the steps can be used to create a report using Inventory Detail, Vehicle History, Service History, Accts Rec Master, Employee Stats, Inv Below Stocking Levels, Vendors.

If the dealer needs to create other reports, send the Service Center ticket to Customer Relations who will contact the dealer regarding Report Writer.

Title: KRONOS Person Import Process
Description: CP3386 KRONOS Person Import Process Maintenance
Solution: Kronos sends emails when a new hire is imported into Kronos and there is an error in the organizational path.  Kronos Support monitors these errors and sends to GDYR Payroll and ESC these reports to have the corrected.  The associate will not show up in Kronos until this error is corrected.  That is why it is important to process these ASAP.

Title: KRONOS - Transfer/Promotion of Store Managers
Description: CP3387 KRONOS - Transfer/Promotion of Store Managers.  What has to be done in Kronos.
Solution: The transfer or promotion of Store Managers and their level of access changing in Kronos is an automatic update.  Once HR/Payroll receives the paperwork from the DMR and all paper work is finalized and then updated in Workday, Kronos will receive the update automatically.  The paperwork process is of course manual and may take several days to process.  Until then, either the DMR or the secondary license holder at the store will have to handel all timecard and schedules within Kronos. Store managers are usually put in Kronos around the 1st and 15th.

Title: Kronos - Exited Employee Still Showing Up
Description:
CP3391 PLEASE READ THE CP BEFORE ENTERING A TICKET.  Exited employee still showing up in Kronos.  What do I need to do. Questions and information to ask.
1.  Name and WINID of the associate.
2. When was his/her's last day?
3. Was he/she transferred to a WTC? - If the associate was transferred to a WTC, the associate will need to be exited by Kronos Support
4. Were they exited in MSS? - If not, this is why the associate is still in Kronos. This needs to be done immediately.
5. Have you called ESC, and if so what was their answer.
Solution:
Questions and information to ask.
1.  Name and WINID of the associate.
2. When was his/her's last day?
3. Was he/she transferred to a WTC? - If the associate was transferred to a WTC, the associate will need to be exited by Kronos Support
4. Were they exited in MSS? - If not, this is why the associate is still in Kronos. This needs to be done immediately.
5. Have you called ESC, and if so what was their answer.

A very common question we get is "How can I remove an exited associate from my Kronos system?  Or, "a transferred associate is still in my system, how do I get them out?"

The process is this - When an associate is either terminated (regardless of the reason), is transferred or promoted, the DMR initiates a process in MSS (Managers Solution System??).  That then starts the process of whatever needs to be done to the associates record.  This goes through several channels, with each channel needing to "approve" the change.  Once HR does their part, it the flows to ESC (Employee Solutions Center).  ESC then will update the GEMS record.  GEMS will then automatically remove or change the record.  There is nothing that we SHOULD have to do to remove or change an associates record in Kronos.  This process does take several days, and at times more than a week or so.  All the store manager can do is wait for the record to fall off.  A couple of things he needs to do though:

Remove the schedule for the associate.
Make sure they have exited the associate in GBMS (This is only for GBMS purposes - Exiting an associate in GBMS does not affect Kronos at all)
Continue to sign off on the blank timecards (till the associate is removed)
And watch the process in MSS (I believe they should have access to it)
Follow up with the DMR if it's been more than a week or so to make sure that the change is flowing through the proper channels.

Title: Unique Number Will Not Work in GBMS
Description: CP3397 Unique Number Will Not Work in GBMS
Solution:
Just some advice on unique numbers.

When a store hires a new associate and they have a green flag to hire an associate, the store calls ESC.  ESC goes into the mainframe (TPX) and accesses GEMS.  GEMS will generate a Unique number using an algorithm based on the start date that the store gives ESC and also the associates social security number.  The store has 10 days to enter the new associate into GBMS under personnel.  If the store fails to enter the associate into GBMS within 10 days, GBMS will not allow the entry.  The store will need to contact ESC and have a new unique number issued with a new start date.

3 main reasons a Unique # does not work in GBMS
1. Unique Number is older than 10 days
2. The Hire date being entered into GBMS does not match the Hire Date that the unique number was generated with.  (This is the most common issue)
3. The SSN being entered into GBMS does not match the SSN the Unique # was generated with.

It is important that the store make sure that the new associate has passed all new hire requirements like the background check, drug test, etc., before they get the Unique number.  For example.  If something happens with the background check and it needs more clarification before the new hire can start, it can cause his unique number to become invalid.  Getting a Unique number should be the last thing a store manager does because hiccups in the hiring process happen all the time.

Title: Duplexing GBMS Plus Reports
Description: CP3406 How to print month end general ledgers/stock ledgers in DUPLEX
Solution: On the HOME page click GBMS Plus/Reports/Ledger-statements.  Once the screen appears with the last 4 months of both general ledgers and stock ledgers on it, select the desired report to print.  It will display in ACROBAT format and be reasdy to print.  Move the mouse arrow to the printer icon at thet upper left of the reports screen tool bar adn click on it to generate the printer pop-up box.  In the box, click on PROPERTIES (upper tight hand portion of the box).  The screen will bring up another pop-up.  On the lower left portion will be the DUPLEX area with three radio buttons.  Click on the radio button for "long edge" then OK the selction.  Back on the previous screen click on the down arrow for "page scaling" on he lower left portion of the box and selct the FIT TO PAPER.  Click on the OK button and the report will begin printing on both sides of the sheet of paper (must be printed on laser printer).

Any timepunches added to a closed pay period will not be picked up by Kronos.  To add hours to a closed pay period historical corrections have to be done.

Title: Applied payment to M/CK -cash receipt  instead of
Description: CP3409 I applied a payment to AR Mastercheck or cash receipt and should have been as a Direct Deposit and I paid some lines. How to correct?
Solution:
All we need to worry about here is the payment amount. The lines will not need to be addressed because both screens are basically the
same, except AR cash receipts or Mastercheck  affects cash and Direct Deposit does not.  Also the accounts used on this CP will be CC accts (30,51,52,53 etc).

1.  Pull up the AR Payment screen choose M/Ck or Cash Receipt option entered on prev doc and enter the credit card acct number
    (30,51,52,53 etc) tab to the check and/or cash field and enter the amount from the original payment as a (-)negative amount in one
     of the above fields and tab to the pay amount and enter (-) the same negative amount and press enter.  Will get correction has
     been processed.  F7 & print.
2.  Now bring up the Direct Deposit screen and enter in the credit card acct number (30,51,52,53 etc) in the direct amount field the
     amount they received from the bank and enter. The cursor will go down to the line field.
3.  Find the positive line we created from the cash/ck receipt.   Will probably be a 000000 inv.
4.  Input that line number and press F2 pay by line.  The line will clear and the APP on top right will clear.
5.  F7 print.
6.  Done.  All we did was take money from the AR and put in in the Direct Deposit.   When they look at their DAT it will have corrected
     the overage in the cash and/or check fields.

Title: Invalid Call Number

Call numbers will be invalid for the following reasons:

Title: Violation Error when Trying to Sign Off.
Description: CP3411 Receiving Violation Error when trying to sign off on timecard in Kronos.
Solution:
The violation errors mean that a rule is being broken when it comes to the timecards and or schedule or both.  This is what to look for.

Kronos has two sides.  The Timecard side and the Schedule side.  Both the schedule and the timecards must match or be accounted for.  If they don't you have caused a violation and at the end of the pay period you will not be able to sign off.


Here is an example of the two most common issues:
If an associate has time punches in the timecard, but no schedule, Kronos sees that as a Violation, because if an associate has time punches he MUST BE SCHEDULED TO WORK, so Kronos is basically asking why does he have time punches but no schedule.

If an associate has a schedule created, but has no time punches, the store manager must justify why there are no time punches by either entering in those time punches manually or adding paycodes like excused no pay (ENP), sick pay or whatever needs to be entered to justify why there are no time punches for a schedule day.

Title: Transfer/Promoted Associates in Kronos
Description: CP3412 Transfer/Promoted Associates in Kronos - Employee not showing up who was transferred or a store manager that was promoted or transferred is not showing the correct store when logging into Kronos.
Solution:
Answer
- The DMR submits all promotion/transfer paper work. For example a transfer of a manager to another store or a promotion from a Manager or Service Manager or even demotions
- Once the paper work is submitted it is a manual process controlled by HR and ESC.  Once they are done with all the paperwork and the approval process, Kronos is automatically updated.
- Once the update takes place the user that was promoted and transferred, once he/she logs into Kronos, they will now log in at their new store.
- There is nothing that Kronos support can do to expedite the process.
- This take 4-7 days
- If it has been longer than that, then something has been delayed in the paperwork and the person calling will have to contact ESC or HR or the DMR to see where the paper work is at in the process.

Title: Reserve for Inventory Loss & Obsolescence
Description: CP3433 Explain Accounting code 15200
Solution:
GBMS creates a monthly automated Jt 9005 which is calculated at .5% of the Sub Total Sales on the MTD Sales & Expense Ananlysis.  It books a credit to contra asset account 15200 and debits Mdse. Over/Short - cycle A account 42800.  This is done to avoid having to book a large loss at invnetory time if it results in an inventory loss.  Regardless of whether it is needed or not, a journal ticket should be issued to reverse the dollars out of the reserve account (debit 15200), booking the profit back to the P or L through the Over/Short account code 42800 with as a credit.

Since 15200 is a balance sheet account, the balance rolls over the the next month and or next year if 15200 is not reconciled annually building up to significant amounts in some cases.

Title: WTC TC 11 process change
Description: CP3434 As a WTC, why is it telling me my transaction is invalid processing TC 11 for tires to a Company Owned Retail Store?
Solution:
Subject:	TC11 Process Change Effective July 3nd


WTC Managers -

Effective July 3rd, Saturday, Transaction Code 11 will no longer process deliveries to Company Owned Retail Stores.  This is due to Retail's switch off of mainframe and onto SAP processing of back end functions (accounting, finance, etc) in July.

Transaction code 71 will process delivery receipts to Company Owned Retail Stores, effective July 3rd.

Actions Required:

Friday, July 2nd:
TC 11 pending orders to company owned retail stores must be finalized or voided by close of business
Goodyear wholesale.com orders must be finalized or voided by close of business
Orders left pending in the system past 7/2 will generate errors when attempting to finalize

Saturday, July 3rd:
Begin processing Company Owned Retail Store delivery receipts using transaction code 71
Centers will need to use nonsig instead of territory to process these orders
TC71 orders over 30 line items cannot be processed by the system.  Separate large orders over multiple documents.
WTC -> WTC deliveries will continue to use TC11, as will Store -> Store movement just as today.
WTC -> Dapper and Dapper -> Store (and vice versa) will continue to use TC71 just as today.

Call the GBMS Help Desk for further questions - 800-331-4541

Thanks,
Nick

Nicholas Fagan
Voice 330-796-1064
nicholas_fagan@goodyear.com

Title: COO Pending Shipments

Really no need to send them to me, or Level 3. We are 99% certain it is due to customer hierarchy changes in SAP that stopped the flow of the Advice of Shipment records to GBMS. SAP is looking into the effect of their changes now, but I seriously doubt that any shipments that were already reported (and downloaded to GBMS) are going to reported again.

Title: How to bill Non-Goodyear Tires on a National Accou
Description:
CP3447 How to bill non-Goodyear (foreign brand) Tires on a National Account

Note: This code is ONLY for National Account, not for Government sales!
Solution:
National Account Sales "Consumer Tires Only" - Non-Goodyear Produced Tires

Effective 5/1/2010 the following two codes can be used to bill a non-goodyear produced tire(s) meeting this criteria:

    When replacing 1 or 2 non-goodyear produced tires to match the competitive tires currently on the vehicle.
    Or, if there is no Goodyear, Dunlop, or Kelly tire fitment for a specific vehicle.
    Only in cases where Goodyear does not make a tire for the fitment of certain vehicles are 4 tires allowed to be installed.


This change should prevent the National Account customer from moving the vehicle to a competitor, or for the Goodyear outlet to bill on a separate invoice.

These codes will be assessed a 15% administration fee. No Delivery Commission

These are the only two codes that the system will allow a non-goodyear produced tire to be billed on. There will be no exceptions made if a dealers bills on a separate miscellaneous code.

046-010 - Auto
046-011 - Light Truck

THIS PROGRAM "DOES NOT" APPLY TO NON-GOODYEAR COMMERCIAL TIRES

This program will be monitored to ensure compliance with the above criteria.
Originator:	Bonnie Sampson

Last Edit: 7-21-14

046-010 - Auto
046-011 - Light Truck

These codes will not relieve inventory; therefore, an inventory correction will need to be done.
These codes will affect account code 43980 (Tire SErvice). If tires have not been put into inventory, the invoice can be coded directly to account code 43985 to offest the credit from Goodyear. If an inventory correction had to be done, a JT crediting 42800 (MDSE OV/SHRT-CYCLE A) and debiting 43980 can be done.

THIS PROGRAM DOES NOT APPLY TO NON-GOODYEAR COMMERCIAL TIRES

THIS PROGRAM WILL BE MONITORED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE ABOVE CRITERIA.
ORIGINATOR: Bonnie Sampson

Last Edit: 7-21-14

Title: Archvied Documents - Remote Printing
Description: CP3458 Location calling in regards to not being able to print Archived Documents when remoted into sub-locations.
Solution:
Inform the dealer that we are actively working on a solution for this.  We do not have an ETA at this time.

If you are unable to access our new Archived Documents application for your remote location(s), there are currently several options that you can take advantage of:

1.	Hybrid - If your corporate location is on our Hybrid Offering, you will be able to access all applications at a remote location. Hybrid also provides you with other benefits such as; remote access from a PC or Laptop, and Report Writer, credit card processing through the Internet, high-speed Internet connection at each of your GBMS terminals.
2.	VNC Access from you GBMS corporate location - If you are not on Hybrid, you can access GBMS Plus applications by going to SYSTEM ADMIN at your GBMS corporate location. Select the COMMON OWNER option, then the Common Owner VNC Access option. Select the terminal for the territory that you want to control & it will prompt you for password.  Enter "maxspeed" for password.  You will be accessing a terminal at the selected territory, & you will be able to control the mouse, or watch the location control the mouse. You can go to the Archived Documents application and perform the required tasks.   You will only be able to email the docs to your email address however.

We are in the planning stages of creating a new solution that will allow you to perform the Archived Document application without having to sign-on to a remote location.

Title: User does not have  print Invoices function or can

FF: Tools > Options > Content > Block Pop-Up Windows (make sure check mark is off.)

Title: Kronos Bank Holiday - Mandatory Saturday Sign Off
Description: CP3517 Kronos Bank Holiday - Mandatory Saturday Sign Off
Solution:
Banks will be closed in observance of Veteran?s Day next Thursday, November 11, so payday for stores will be Wednesday, November 10. To account for this, all timecards must be signed off on time this weekend.  Failure to complete this process on time presents two negative effects for stores:

?Associates may not get paid on time
?Manual checks must be created by ACS, which will result in a charge back to the store in the near future.
Please remember the importance of completing the sign-off procedure for EVERY TIMECARD on time.  Two important points:

?Sign-off must be completed for all associates assigned to the store, including any who did not log any hours that week (e.g., seasonal help, recent exits, associates on disability leave, etc.).
?If there are GBMS transmission issues, sign-off may be completed on Saturday.  This is the only acceptable reason for delaying sign-off beyond Friday.
Once sign-off is complete, managers have two options to easily confirm that transmission was completed properly:

?Review the Pay Period Genie
?Review the Approval/Sign Off tab at the bottom of each timecard.  If there is no Approval/Sign Off tab, it means the sign-off was not completed
Completing proper Kronos sign-off is critical for effective store operation.  Failing to follow the process as instructed will result in late paychecks and unnecessary charges to the store.  I know that I can count on all of you to do the right thing for your associates and that is process their payroll on time.

Kronos reference materials can be found under the Kronos tab on the Tools page on Pit Row.  If you have any questions, contact Kronos Support at kronos_support@goodyear.com or call (877) GY-FIXES, option 1.

Title: Print and Check R7952 Report for HOTB50 MSG
Description: CP3518 The report is created Monday through Saturday. Print R7952000 from AKSARCRD. This report displays Maintenance data set exceptions by GBMS locations. Problems may be the location is not running a B50 Daily, closing, on the transmit or it may be a new load or a recent reload.
Solution: Check each Node's Type, CTRY, DAILY and USAX Date Sent column for the last time the B50 was processed. If the DATE SENT is more than a month since the last B50 was processed, exception the PEP BOYS, send location the HOTB50 msg. Send Mike Gron the HOTB50 MSG list of locations via email.

Title: Print and Check R7952 Report for HotB50 MSG
Description: CP3519 The report displays Maintenance Data Set Exceptions by GBMS Location. Problems may be the location is not running the B50 Daily, Closing, On the Transmit List or it may be a New Load or a recent Reload. Date Sent is more than a month. Exception is the PEP BOYS. Do not send HOTB50 msg.
Solution: On GR003, issue the command: runpush.send hotb50 gXXXX u.  (where XXXX is the 4 position territory). The message will print to printer 1. ATTN: Store Mgr. It has been some time since your location has completed a end of day (EOD/B50). This is important in helping us to maintain and back up your current records for GBMS. We can only back your system up and process credit cards as of the last EOD completed. GBMS recommends that an EOD be run on a Daily Basis. If your business dictates differently, please try to run one weekly.

Title: HOLIDAY PAY, SCHEDULING, QUESTIONS - Kronos
Description:
CP3520 Questions relating to Holiday Pay -
What are the Paid Holidays for retail stores?
When are associates eligable for Holiday Pay?
Do Stores put the time in the Schedules for Holiday?
Solution:
Questions relating to Holiday Pay for Kronos and retail Stores

What are the Paid Holidays for retail stores?
			Answer - Retail stores get two paid holidays a year, Thanksgiving and Christmas.  These are the only two Holidays that the stores are closed.

When are associates eligable for Holiday Pay?
			Answer - 90 days from the date of employement and must be Full Time ONLY.  This is coded exactly as read, if the associate hired in 89 days before   a Holiday, the will not get paid for it.  There is nothing we can do to change that.

Do Stores put the time in the Schedules for Holiday?
			Answer - No.  Holidays are automatically imported into the schedule for those that are eligable for it.  If the 8 hours of holiday pay are not imported into the schedule, then the associate is not eligable.

If a store manager believes that the associate should be eligable for Holiday Pay and is not receiving it, they will need to contact their HR Rep or ESC as Kronos Support CANNOT change the associates profile if it has been coded incorrectly.

Title: Schedule File 338
Description: CP3541 GBMS3 ASC and Dealer Reload ...Add catchup file 338
Solution: The location will not be able to reprint old invoice right away. The reprint file will begin to be resent on all reloads on Monday night following there master load. We limit the record count released on this file to 700,000 records. I have seen for one location files upward of 2.5 million records. Our job will run through-out the week sending down the records until the master file is empty. So, if there are multiple locations on reload for this job the higher number stores will be delayed a day or more as we attempt to get this file sent. Bob H.

Title: 5th Work-Day CLOSED STORE PROCESSING
Description: CP3556 5th Work-Day CLOSED STORE PROCESSING
Solution:
Stores must be closed before the 7th work day. IMPORTANT: Z7500910 for Dealers must be run after prior day I1100000 and Z7500000 are complete, and before current day I0200000 (12:30).
1. Delete Workstation and Loop from Cluster Data Base for Closing territories.

2. Close Store on Store database. Date of Closing is always the last day of the month.
Closing Canadian Dealers: Update the Type Store, Division and District via IAG

3. Delete Node from GBMS Node Transmission Cntl.

4. Delete Node Definition  from GIX Configure Network.

5. Delete Node from GROUPS via the GIX . Subtract the number of deletions and balance to new total.

Title: Incomplete B50's from CLOSED STORES
Description: CP3557 Incomplete B50's from CLOSED STORES
Solution: From RSY00000 select Option 1 B50 Status Inquiry. Highlight Incomplete B50's from CLOSED STORES. Copy and send in email to Bob Hohenadel to clear incomplete B50s.

Title: R7952 CLOSED LOCATIONS CLEANUP
Description: CP3558 R7952 CLOSED LOCATIONS CLEANUP

Title: R7505000 Data Set Exception Report
Description: CP3559 OOB / Pend Errors. R7505000 Data Set Exception Report
Solution: Submit JCLB50 -  creates a report to 8.H queue showing nodes that has not been processed and out of balance and pending errors. This report and all out of balance reports are to be given to GBMS developers with the detailed reports so after they fix the data the reports and detail documents can be filed. This is a SOX requirement.

Title: A/R Transfers
Description: CP3560 A/R Transfers
Solution: To setup A/R Transfers run R7504800 and R7504820 with no variance. Do not run after 11 am. Send / Receives must be on before running job at new store. Old Store must be totally closed.

Title: Kronos - Store Did Not Receive B50 on Friday
Description: CP3561 B50 Indicator missing on Friday.  Store calling in stating that they can't sign off because they are missing the B50 indicator.
Solution:
This happens because the store
- Did not run a B50 on Thursday
- B50 was incomplete (Check RSY in the mainframe)
- Communication Errors
- Out of Balance

These are the most common reasons.  Advise the location to make sure that they run a complete EOD day on Friday.  The B50 Indicator should be in Kronos on Saturday and that they can sign off on Saturday.  This is a normal occurance and there is nothing to worry about unless they have communication errors beyond Friday and Saturday.
Please make sure that the location's network is up and that they will be able to process an EOD.
Also our interface team tries to ensure that they pull in hours for all locations that we did not get an EOD for.  Unless there is a major network outage, most stores will be able to process timecards on Saturday.

Title: TC 80 Veterans Canteen
Description: CP3562 How do I process a Veterans Canteen?
Solution: DR - TC 80 - acct 9493 - N/S listed in WAD opt 1 & enter 95 a space then type vet and enter. They will all come up but will NOT be any kind of order. Will just have to search for city/state

Title: Bad Check Payment
Description: CP3563 Customer is coming in to pay on his bad check that bounced. How to handle?
Solution:
Do not forget to collect the $25 NSF Fee
Go to AR Payments, cash receipts and enter in customer.
If a company owned store, receivables will have a new account set up in AR payments with the balance on a line.  Choose that account and apply the payment.  and pay off the line.
If a dealer, will need to set up a bad debt account for the customer. "1)  If an A/R customer, issue A/R Jt debiting customer's account and crediting cash (10000.)  Issue a cash receipt against the A/R account when the customer pays off the check.
Print the cash receipt.
Then go to main menu to cash receipts and choose NSF fee and enter in the $25.00 cash NSF

*Check User REG database

Title: Locked out/Reset Password
Description: CP3569 User receives message that "Your username has been locked -log in attempt limit has been reached. Please click the Reset password link."
Solution:
**Have location click on Forgot Password.  They will receive the message below.
 - Password Request -
The password change for xxxxxx was successful.
User has been successfully UNblocked
Your Password has been sent to:
xxxx@xxxxx.com

**Have them verify if email is correct.  If email is NOT correct, and they are NOT the Administrator - have them contact their UA to change email. If email is NOT correct, and they ARE the Administrator.  Write up a ticket to 2nd level with username and correct email.

**If email is correct - Tell location to look for the email with a new generated password at their email address within 5 to 15 minutes.  Advise location that Password will be in ALL CAPITAL LETTERS.

Title: User Wants to Enroll
Description: CP3570 User wants to Enroll in Tire-HQ.  How do I enroll??
Solution:
NOTE: For Goodyear Associates, they do not enroll like a dealer would.  Please follow the information provided labeled Associate Enrollment Instructions.
NOTE: Wingfoot/Goodyear Commercial Tire & Service Center employees have an associate Uder ID but do not enroll like an associate would. Please follow the information provided labeled Wingfoot/Goodyear Commercial Tire & Service Center Enrollment.


----------Dealer Enrollment----------
1.  Type in  www.tire-hq.com.
2.  Click on the ""I want to Enroll"" link on the login page of Tire-HQ.
3.  Accept the TERMS AND CONDITIONS agreement online.
4.  Complete the enrollment form and click on ""Submit"" at the bottom of the page.   Please allow approximately two business days for their account to be established.

----------Wingfoot/Goodyear Commercial Tire & Service Center Enrollment----------
Users at Wingfoot/Goodyear Commercial Tire & Service Center cannot enroll. The users will need to contact their center manager.
If caller is a new incoming center manager, they will need to contact Desiree Monts.

----------Associate Enrollment----------
Ensure associate is not a Wingfoot/Goodyear Commercial Tire & Service Center employee, if not continue with instructions below.
If the associate has access to the mainframe, then Copy/Paste info below, and send this in an Email to them.
If the associate does not have access to the mainframe, they will need to contact ther supervisor to have a NIF request done.

Access GO site
1. Type GAIMS in your browser
2. Enter your GO username and password, click Submit.
3. Click Request Access
4. Type your User ID, then click Next
5. Confirm your User ID, then click Next, again
6. Type tire-hq in the "Search for:" field, then click Search
7. Click Business Justification:, then select the appropriate reason.
8. Click Add to Cart to complete your request.  The HelpDesk will process your request, and email your Tire-HQ Username & password.
9. (Optional) Enter any other additional data if unique access is needed (eg. publish rights etc.) ... Click Add to Cart .
10. Click  Submit to continue.
11. Click OK to complete your request.
The HelpDesk will process your request, and email your Tire-HQ Username & password (once approved).

Title: Large JAVA Error Searching Foreign Brand
Description: CP3572 Location is receiving a Large Java Error when searching by an entire product line in foreign brand.
Solution: Useability Team and Developement are aware of the issue.  They are currently working on a fix.  This is affecting ALL foreign brand, brands.  A work around is to seach by size only and not the entire product line up, and to put a check in the "Show Zero" box.

Title: Mutli-page Duplexing on Ledger reports
Description: CP3573 Now that they moved the ledger reports to the print Akron reports, why can't I multipage duplex when I click the drop down and click on the printer?
Solution:
Since we moved the ledger statements to the print akron reports, it has wiped out the option to print two ledgers to a page, both sides.  Advised customer if they want to print this way, they CANNOT choose the drop down for the printer. They must click on the printer Icon or File then print and when the print screen comes up,  need to:
1.   change the scaling to none.
2.  Click on properties
3.  Click on Setup
4.  Click to Portrait, Long Edge, and 2 UP then click ok
It will now print ledger reports from the printer icon or from File/print

Title: Move Pending doc for Exiting Emp
Description: CP3574 Need to exit an employee but need to move his pending docs.
Solution:
GBMS3 -> Go to Homepage, GBMS Plus, Employee Maint and click on Move Pending Docs.  Enter the employee you are moving the docs from to the Emp or House account you are moving the docs to. Click on Move pending docs and it will ask if you are sure? After looking to be sure the from and to employees are correct,  then  answer Y

GBMS4 -> From the Homepage, HR -> Employee Maintenance, then select Move Pending Documents tab. Use the drop downs to choose the exited employee and then the employee or House Account to move those documents to.

Title: TC11 Wrong Address Being Displayed On Screen or Fi
Description: CP3586 Caller states that they see the wrong address displayed on screen or on the final printed document of a TC11.
Solution:
Here is what is happening
User starts a TC11 and accidentally enters in an incorrect territory number and sees this under the customer information screen.
User goes back to the first screen and enters in the correct Territory #.
GBMS is correcting the locations name, but it is still holding onto the INCORRECT address of the first territory used.
The only way to correct this is to void the document and start over
If the user finalizes the document the final document will print with the incorrect address, however this does not affect billing or who the TC11 goes to.
There is a work request to fix this.
Please advise caller and close ticket.

Title: Kelly Branded Tires Display No Retail Price
Description:
CP3589 Kelly Branded Tires Display No Retail Price
Dealer states that since the most recent Price Update their Kelly Pricing has fallen off the system and GBMS will not display a retail price.
Solution: Goodyear no longer publishes and establishes a MSRP for Kelly tires.  If a dealer has an EDL set up using MSRP, GBMS will no longer display a retail price.  The dealer will have remove the EDL based on MSRP and recreate and EDL based on AVG Cost.  Please be familiar with setting up EDL's.

Title: CC #'s Not Storing From Work Order Screen
Description: CP3590 Dealer and Store call in and state that when they enter in a Credit Card # from the Work Order Screen, and then go to Doc Total, GBMS is not holding the CC# and importing the CC# into Doc Total.
Solution:
A problem has been discovered with a credit card swipe and is in the field.The scenario is as follows:

1. Swipe the Credit Card on the Work Order screen (enter Y in the Credit Card Options field)
2.  Swipe the credit card.
3. Enter merchandise, or not, and print the work order.
4. Recall the document.
5. When the user gets to the Document Total screen, the Credit Card number is NOT there and it must be swiped again.

Development is aware of the problem and working on a correction. The only work around, which is not recommended because
the fee from the cc company is higher, would be to manually key in the credit card number on the W/O Screen.

Please keep in mind that with the normal processing of the credit card (at Doc Total) works just fine.

Title: Invoice print "Owned & operated by Proud Independa
Description: CP3592 Dealer Location does not want the following statement to print on his Invoices.  "Owned and Operated by a Proud Independent Goodyear Dealer."
Solution:
This was put in place at the request of the Tire & Service Network. It is suppose to print for any and all members that are a Tire
 & Service Network location.   That said....this WILL become a profiled option with WR 2011-10254534 that will allow a dealer to
print or not print but will not be in the field for a month or so. Until that time there is no way to stop the print since it's coded in
the program.

Title: Parts Paid Out for Vendor not on Vendor List #9999

Title: B Adjustment -With Concession approval
Description: CP3601 How to process a B adjustment with concession
Solution:
1. Create Work Order with customer & vehicle Information.  Press F7 Adjustment.
2. On the adjustment screen. Enter drive type, adjustment type, product code, tread depth and purchase date and press enter.This will fill in the buying price of the tire.
3.  If the customer is to pay a specific amount, then you need to back tab up to the replace price on right side of screen and enter in what the customer is suppose to pay & enter.
4.  Cursor wil move to the condition field.  If needed, help key (F12) will list conditions.
5.  Tab to the rest of the fields and fill them in, including the conc approval.
6.   If the replacement product code is different, enter the the code and price and enter. Before proceeding make sure the replacment price is correct, if not you will again need to back tab back to replace price and change it again and enter.   Once all the fields look correct, press enter.
7.  Screen will prompt for another tire. Check again to be sure nothing has changed and enter. It should then go to tire 2(upper left above the prod code) enter in tread depth and enter. Everything will remain the same except the replace price and will have to back tab back and change it and enter. It will then go to the 3rd tire. Repeat process until all 4 tires are done and says tire 5.
8.  When all tires have been entered press the Fkey for mdse verify.  Any additional services can be entered there.

Title: Kronos - Schedule a Temporary Store Transfer
Description:
CP3605 How do I do a Temporary Store Transfer? 	Or
I have an associate working at my store temporarily how do I get him in my Kronos.
Solution:
Wiki link - Please advise caller for future reference to please refer to instructions on Pit Row and Wiki.

http://ahqna009.akr.goodyear.com/CORP/FINANCE/itwiki.nsf/pages/Kronos%20-%20Schedule%20a%20Temporary%20Store%20Transfer

First, the home store must complete the temporary store transfer.  The Recieving store cannot set up a Temporary Store Transfer.

1.  In the Schedule Planner right-click the appropriate associate?s shift click Edit>Shift.
2.  Click the drop-down arrow in the Type column and select Transfer as the segment type.
3.  Click the drop-down arrow in the Transfer field. Select Search.
4.  Click the + at each level to expand and display the available entries. Click the check-box preceding the appropriate job
5.  Click OK
NOTE - Note: Repeat steps 2 through 5 to schedule a transfer for each applicable day and shift.

7.  Click Save

Title: Kronos - How to do a Historical Edit in Kronos
Description:
CP3606 How to do a Historical Edit in Kronos.
How do I correct a time card for a closed pay period?
Solution:
Wiki Link - Please advise caller for future reference to take advantage of all training and instructions on Pit Row and Kronos.

http://ahqna009.akr.goodyear.com/CORP/FINANCE/itwiki.nsf/pages/Kronos%20-%20Creating%20Historical%20Edits

1.  Double-click the appropriate associate's name in any Genie
2.  Select the appropriate sign off pay period from the Time Period field.
3.  Select Amount ->Add Historical with Retroactive Pay Calculation.
4.  Enter the missing time information for the appropriate date entering in the time punches in the "IN" and "Out" fields,  Or you can also select the appropriate Pay Code and enter the appropriate amount of hours in the Amount Field.
5.  Click on Calculate Differences
6.  Click on Save
8.  Change the Time Period field to the date range containing the effect date of the historical edit (current pay period).  Click the Historical Amounts tab to view the results.

**NOTE**  Historical Edits will be sent to payroll after the close of the pay period they are entered.  This process is manually done and can take 1-3 weeks (based on feedback from stores).  If the associate needs paid for the hours entered ASAP, the store manager will need to make a print scree of the historical amounts and then faxed or email a PDF to Payroll so that they can process a check for the associate.

Title: Missing Sequences
Description: CP3609 Why are the sequence #'s different on the DAS seq and the Terr seq?
Solution:
There are two sequence numbers on the S&E (and Daily Sales and Gross Profit) report.  One is the 'DAS Seq' which identifies how many dailies GBMS has run thru the month.  The other is a 'Terr Seq' which identifies how many days in a month a B50 has come in from a terr.  If a terr does not run a B50 every day, then the Terr Seq will start to lag behind the DAS Seq.  Within the job there is logic that tracks activity for a terr and does not transmit a S&E to the terr if there is no data to process since it would be identical to his last S&E.

We recently started running seven days a week so locations that are not open on Sundays will see  the difference in the sequence #'s.  The DAS Seq #'s will skip but their Terr Seq should not skip.  We will send them an S&E when we have updated data to send them.

Title: GASC/Just Foreign Brand Adjustment B Type
Description: CP3610 Company Owned Store Only - How do I process a B-type adjustment when a concession approval number has been issued to replace the Goodyear tire with a foreign brand tire.
Solution:
1.  Create the adjustment(s) using the Product Code of the tire coming off the vehicle as the replacement product code.
2.  When all adjustments are created, go to Merchandise Verify
3.  Using the same product code as the tire coming off the vehicle, enter the product code.
4.  Enter total negative quantity.  If 4 tires are being adjusted than then quantity is -4.
5.  Enter in the same price of the tires so that codes "wash" each other out.

Your total merchandise amount should be in the negative because you have successfully washed out the replacement code from the adjustment screen with the tires you entered in the adjustment screen.

6.  Enter in the foreign brand code. link to the foreign brand codes, listed on pit row as 668-669 Dept.

   Use this link for the correct process with screen shots -  Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/4050F3A4FB28F453852578BD005F0C31
   Pit row listing of foreign brand codes -  http://gosec.goodyear.com/departments/retail/category_management/

7.  Enter in the Quantity
8.  Enter in the Price.
9.  Hit enter.

You have now created a B-Type adjustment with a concession approval for Foriegn Brand Tires as the replacement codes.

Title: Payment applied to wrong line item

Solution:
To recover line item that should not have been selected go into A/R, A/R Payments and select account.

Money should then appear in unapplied and can be applied to a different line item.

Title: CLOSED STORE PROCESSING
Description: CP3618 Stores must be closed before the 7th Work day. Dealers close the day after Z7500910 has been transmitted
Solution:
NOTE:  CHECK RSY 'LAST B-50 PROCESSED BY STORE', MUST BE FOR MONTH CLOSED
       DO THIS THE SAME TIME YOU REQUEST I9900200
	
1. UPDATE 'CLOSESTR' IN Z002263 WORKFILE. USE I9900200 FOR CLUSTER NUMBER
2.5TH WORK DAY FOR STORES AND AFTER Z7500 910 FOR DEALERS
 IMPORTANT ____ RUN AFTER PRIOR DAY I1100 000 AND Z7500 000 ARE
                COMPLETE, AND BEFORE CURRENT DAY I0200 000. (12:30)
3. CLU AND STORE DATA BASE UPDATE ---IMS DIALOGUE
     A. DELETE WORKSTATION AND LOOP FROM CLUSTER DATA BASE FOR CLOSING TERRITORY
     B.IMS DIALOGUE
        1.SELECT 1-- RIS STORE/CLUSTER MAINTENANCE
        2.SELECT 2-- CLUSTER FILE
        3.SELECT 3--CLUSTER CONFIGURATION MAINT
        4.ENTER CLUSTER NUMBER
        5.SELECT OPTION 5 DELETE WORKSTATION
                          LINE NUMBER OF TERR BEING DELETED
        6.SELECT OPTION 4 DELETE LOOP
                          LINE NUMBER OF TERR BEING DELETED
      C.IF CONTROLLER STORE CLOSED (LOOP TYPE A) THEN PF12 KEY MUST
           BE USED TO EXIT AT COMPLETION OF THIS STEP.
4.CLOSE STORE ON STORE DATABASE. DATE OF CLOSING IS ALWAYS
        THE LAST DAY OF THE MONTH.
        IMS DIALOGUE
        1.SELECT 1--RIS STORE/CLUSTER MAINTENANCE
        2.SELECT 1--STORE FILE
        3.SELECT 6-- CLOSE STORE
          NEXT SCREEN WILL SHOW STORE ------
                                CLOSE DATE------------(YYMMDD)
          ENTER REGUIRED DATA,REPEAT FOR ALL STORES CLOSING.
        *WHEN CLOSING A CANADIAN DEALER,UPDATE THE DEALER
         SCREEN AS FOLLOWS:
                           RIS-TYPESTORE = 3 OR 4
                           RIS-DIVISION  = 9
                           RIS- DISTRICT = 99
5. SELECT RSQ00000  ( GBMS NODE TRANSMISSION CNTL )
    A. (2) NODE MAINTENANCE MENU           (RSQ01)
    B. (8) DELETE NODE                     (RSQ20)
       NODE === XXXX                (LOOK FOR C IN PHONE #)
                                     RECEIVE IND = N
                                     SEND IND    = N
    C. DEL                                 (RSQ28)
8. CHECK FOR ANY CLOSED STORES THAT ARE ON THE QU QUEUE-GBMS.SEND.
   ZAP ANY STORES WITH FILES TO SEND. USE SFT03.MQ.WORK(ZAPPP)
   LINE#000013 EMPTY QUEUE(MQS01QL.RIS00.GBMS.SEND.XXXX)...XXXX = TERR#.
9. REMOVE CLOSED STORE PROCURVE SWITCHES FROM PCM (DELETE DEVICE).

Title: Obsolete Inventory Scrap
Description: CP3619 How to set up and bill the new Obsolete Inventory Scrap cash account
Solution:
Establish new cash customer (preferably as COB 1 - This will minimize any TTAX issues) as customer Obsolete Inventory Scrap, 1144 East Market Street, Akron Ohio 44316.  This will minimize any TTAX issues)

Use billing code A for $0.00 under salesperson 001.
If prompted for a discount code use any of their choosing.
If there is TTAX due, location is to take the cash loss and they will be reimbursed from Retail.
Invoicing must be completed by Thursday, July 28.

Render each tire unusable ? Following the proper safety procedures, cut or drill a hole in the sidewall or cut the bead.  Set the tires aside for management inspection before final disposal.
Obtain signature verification of destruction from an authorized associate prior to disposal: District Manager, Field Auditor, Akron Supply Chain associate or Akron Retail Management associate.  This associate must PHYSICALLY verify that the tires have been rendered unusable before authorizing disposal via a signature on the $0.00 invoice.

Upon management approval, dispose of the scrap tires following Goodyear policies, as well as local, state and federal rules and environmental regulations.
Store all tires pending disposal approval separately, and do not count them if they are still in the store when you conduct the fall physical inventory.
Attach a copy of this email message to the invoice file copy
Scan and send a copy of the DSA to Brian Dougherty (brian_dougherty@goodyear.com)
Credit for each scrapped unit will be applied via journal ticket at the conclusion of this process.

CONTACT: (877) GY-FIXES, option 3

Title: No Bill To Address Appears
Description: CP3620 No Bill To address appears when a roadside service call is placed on hold from Transactions > Roadside Service Call Reports.
Solution:
The problem is that when the document was transfered from FleetHQ's database to the TireHQ database, the record sometimes becomes corrupt. To verify:

Go to Financial > Delivery Management > Deliveries On Hold
Please have user open the document on hold and go to first screen under their sales document where document number, date & nonsig number is filled out.  Have the user input the number 206000 in the bill to field on that first screen.  This is the default customer number for Fleet HQ.  Once this is input - have the user go to the next screen - the bill to/ship to screen - and they will see the bill to information populated.

Title: manually process CC - Ingenico Card Swipe
Description: CP3627 How do I manually process a credit card on the Ingenico system.
Solution:
Store will need:                            Procedures Manual Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/75CAD6D03FFDCED485257A60004971A3
	The credit card #
	Expriation date
	CCV #

1.  At doc total press F5 print document.
2.  GBMS Blue screen will prompt for Employee id # and Password.
3.  GBMS Blue screen will prompt "Please press function key" - PRESS F1
4.  GBMS Blue screen will prompt "Ask Customer to Swipe Credit Card Now"
5.  On the Ingenico reader screen press "enter card #".
6.  Type in Credit Card # (enter), expiration date (enter), cvv # (enter).  (they have
        40 seconds to type in the card # or reader will time out and message on blue screen
         will show "Swipe error - Should customer swipe card again( Y/N) they must press Y
7.  Screen will prompt for "credit or debit", press credit.
8.  Unit will dial out for approval.
9.  Screen will prompt for "Customer Signature" - Store personnel will need to
       write "Signature on file" sale will not complete without something written in
       this field.


FOR GOODYEAR CREDIT CARD OR GOODYEAR CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS. IN THE INGENICO CARD SWIPE  YOU NEED TO USE FOR EXP DATE 12/49  AND THE SECURITY CODE WILL BE 999.
