Title: A/R - aging date change
Description:
CP363 How can I change my A/R aging cutoff date to another day of the month?
How can I see if A/R has aged?
Solution:
A/R aging cutoff date needs changed to another day of the month:
1.  From GBMS Main Menu, select the option for Accounts Receivables.  Press enter.
2.  Select option 2, A/R options.  Press enter.
3.  Type employee #, press TAB ... and select option 8 - Administrative.  Press enter.
4.  Select option 3, Accounts Profile.  Press enter.
5.  Type in the NEW day you want Accounts Receivables to age in the "Cutoff Day" field.  Press enter.
6.  At question:  Do you want to continue Y or N.  ... type a   Y(es).  Press  enter.
      "FILE HAS BEEN UPDATED" message will display.
Result:  All reports will age on the new cutoff date when the End of Day is run.

NOTE  1:   The aging date can only be changed up to 3 days before the actual aging date.
Example:  If aging on 19th, must be changed before the 16th.
NOTE 2:    Aging date cannot be changed  in the same month aging has already occurred.
NOTE 3:    Accounts can only age once per month.

To see if A/R has aged:

1.  Telnet onto location and answer 'Y' to get to Support Main Menu.
2.  Select Option 2- Work with database (plus)  - press enter
3.  Select option 2 -  Run plus - press enter
4.  From the SQL> prompt type:  select lcarcut,lcb50d,lc19th from loccntl;   press enter

NOTE 1:    lcarcut = A/R cutoff;  lcb50d = B50 date;  lc19th = aging indicator
NOTE 2:    B50 date is usually 1 or more days before the cutoff date
NOTE 3:    Aging indicator = 0   A/R cutoff has NOT occurred
                 Aging indicator = 2   A/R cutoff has occurred and aging is completed

Rev 3/12/10

Title: Power Outage, Must use Terminal with Ingenico ...
Description:
CP3630 Getting error "Must use Terminal with Ingenico PinPad" OR "Encryption key error" when attempting to finalize a Credit Card sale on the Ingenico Card swipe or other misc errors.

***Ingenico***

Serial Number:
Have you reset it?
Details of issue:
Troubleshooting:
Solution:
Updated 5/28/2013

1. Make sure card swipe has power.
2. Have the location back out of everything but the GBMS Homepage. Click on start and go to the arrow to the right of shutdown. That will bring up another menu, then select "Restart". NOTE: You can try Logoff but if you do not get pop up windows indicating files being copied, you will have to Restart the Terminal.
Wait for the terminal to finish copying files. It will load the homepage once it's finished.
3. When the GBMS homepage is FULLY loaded. Have them bring up POS.
		Optional: Log into the location to SMENU opt 5 PINPAD - Test connectivity with Pinpad
		Type in the terminal ID that has the pinpad  T1=console, T2=paavt00, T3=pabvt00 & T4=pacvt00 etc
		Should come back and say Pinpad is online and it should be ok to use
4. If the screen still has a floating Goodyear on it - reset the cable going into the pinpad and then do steps 2 & 3 again.
5. If the device still is on the floating Goodyear - power off and unplug thin client.  After about 10 seconds, plug it back in and let it reboot.
6. If the device still is on the floating Goodyear - get the serial # and send to HW/Comm.

Title: Error on Ingenico device
Description:
CP3631 Getting error "Must use Terminal with Ingenico PinPad" after power outage OR Ingenico device has an error on the display screen (other than swipe error).  Ex: Encryption Key error, code error, script error, Pattern change detected - pinpad needs service.

***Ingenico***

Serial Number:
Have you reset it?
Details of issue: Ingenico device has an error on the display screen
Troubleshooting:
Solution:
Updated 2/24/2017

RETAIL - Power the Ingenico unit off for 10 seconds.   To accomplish this - Trace the black cable from the Ingenico unit to the power supply transformer and unplug the power cord from the transformer.  After 10 seconds plug it back in and make sure the Ingenico display comes back to the flashing advertisements or Goodyear logo screen.  If it does not reset, fill in template and open ticket to HW/Comms. NOTE: Retail stores Ingenicos start with 221xxxxxxxxxx.

DEALERS - Hold down the Clear and Minus buttons. When the unit beeps, release the buttons. Once you release the buttons DO NOT touch the screen until it has completely initialized. Log off the thinclient that the Ingenico is hooked to. Once the thinclient has finished the start up process (the homepage will automatically load) then launch POS, which should trigger the Ingenico (the display comes back to the flashing advertisements or Goodyear logo screen). If it does not reset, fill in template and open ticket to HW/Comms. NOTE: Dealer Ingenico serial numbers start with 201xxxxxxxxxx.

After power outage
1. Make sure card swipe has power.
2. Have the location back out of everything but the GBMS Homepage. Click on start and go to the arrow to the right of shutdown. That will bring up another menu, then select "Restart". NOTE: You can try Logoff but if you do not get pop up windows indicating files being copied, you will have to Restart the Terminal.
Wait for the terminal to finish copying files. It will load the homepage once it's finished.
3. When the GBMS homepage is FULLY loaded. Have them bring up POS.
		Optional: Log into the location to SMENU opt 5 PINPAD - Test connectivity with Pinpad
		Type in the terminal ID that has the pinpad  T1=console, T2=paavt00, T3=pabvt00 & T4=pacvt00 etc
		Should come back and say Pinpad is online and it should be ok to use
4. If the screen still has a floating Goodyear on it - reset the cable going into the pinpad and then do steps 2 & 3 again.
5. If the device still is on the floating Goodyear - power off and unplug thin client.  After about 10 seconds, plug it back in and let it reboot.
6. If the device still is on the floating Goodyear - get the serial # and send to HW/Comm.

Title: NO display on Ingenico pinpad
Description:
CP3632 Nothing on the Ingenico Display / green light is on or off

***Ingenico***

Serial Number:
Have you reset it?
Details of issue: Nothing on the Ingenico Display
Is the green light on or off?
Troubleshooting:
Solution:
Updated 2/24/2017

Green light is off
	Check the power pack to the outlet - move the cord to another outlet.  Check the power cord going into the power pack . Check the power pack cord going to the junction connection by the thinclient. If all cords are plugged in tight and the outlet tests good. Remove the base plate on the Ingenico and reseat the HOST port cable. If still nothing on the display, fill in template (see note below) and open ticket to HW/Comms

Green light is on
	Unplug the power cord from the cable coming off the junction cable in back of the thinclient. After reboot - it should default back to the original screens. If the Ingenico shows no boot up after plugging it back in, fill in template (see note below) and open ticket to HW/Comms.

NOTE: Dealer Ingenico serial numbers start with 201xxxxxxxxxx. Retail stores Ingenicos start with 221xxxxxxxxxx.

Title: Ingenico
Description:
CP3633 The device has a green power light but no display

***Ingenico***

Serial Number:
Have you reset it?
Details of issue: Device has a green power light but no display
Troubleshooting:
Solution: Reseat the power cord from the cable coming off the conjunction cable in back of the maxterm . If the Ingenico shows no boot up after plugging it back in - send it to HW/COMM ALONG WITH THE S/N - After reboot - it should default back to the original screens.

Title: Different tire replacement on W Adjustment
Description: CP3634 How do I bill a W Adj where replacement code needs to be different.
Solution: Location needs to bill out the same tire in replacement as the adjusted tire.   When he gets to mdse verify, he needs to do a negative on the replacement tire and then enter in the correct tire code that should be billed. This is a known problem and will be fixed in a future release

Title: Friday and Saturday  / KRONOS for RETAIL ASC
Description:
CP3636 Friday and Saturday  / KRONOS for RETAIL ASC
Weekly B50 indicator has been added to timecards for stores who successfully transmitted week ending information to GBMS Friday night. Please complete the signoff today.
Solution:
Submit HOURSW from 'SFT03.NETOPS' on Friday and Saturday. Checked store STATUS from the HOURS WORKED STATUS LOG. If Status is INCOMPLETE, do DB2ENTRY only. If status is LAST PROCESSED, data came in late dataset not processed, do not do DB2ENTRY.
On Saturday morning KRONOS Support Email Database will receive the following email "GBMS Weekly Import Add B50 Only Process Interface run Summary - (current date & time). Once we receive this email, 30 minutes later send out the email stationary in the Kronos Support Email that relate to that scenerio.

Title: Codes for Foreign Brand Tires on National Accounts
Description: CP3637 What Codes Do I use to bill Non-Goodyear/Foriegn Brand Tires on.
Solution:
National Account Sales "Consumer Tires Only" - Non-Goodyear Produced Tires

Effective 5/1/2010 the following two codes can be used to bill a non-goodyear produced tire(s) meeting this criteria:
When replacing a non-goodyear produced tire to match the competitive tires currently on the vehicle.
Or, if there is no Goodyear, Dunlop, or Kelly tire fitment for a specific vehicle.
This change should prevent the National Account customer from moving the vehicle to a competitor, or for the Goodyear outlet to bill on a separate invoice.
These codes will be assessed a 12.5% administration fee. No Delivery Commission
These are the only two codes that the system will allow a non-goodyear produced tire to be billed on. There will be no exceptions made if a dealers bills on

Miscellaneous code.

Effective 7/15/2014

046-010 - Auto
046-011 - Light Truck

THIS PROGRAM "DOES NOT" APPLY TO NON-GOODYEAR COMMERCIAL TIRES
This program will be monitored to ensure compliance with the above criteria.

Title: Passwords for Credit Card Sales
Description: CP3638 I just installed my pinpads and when processing a credit card it is asking for an emp # and password
Solution:
COMPANY OWNED STORES
Store Manager needs to go to Administration/Security/Opt 2 Assign Temp password.
Needs to set up any employee doing POS transactions with a TEMP password.
When the emp goes to process a CC the FIRST TIME and asks for emp #, enters emp # and TEMP for password then will ask him to change his password
Cannot be more than 8 digits. he will then use that new password for any CC transactions.

DEALERS
They just need to go to security, opt 2 and assign employees doing POS a password. DO NOT USE TEMP - just have them enter in password, no more than 8 digits. Must contain at least one numerical and alpha

******NEW UPDATE******
If dealers do NOT have security set up and it is asking for password, need to have them save the doc, exit out of POS and bring up a main menu.
On the main menu choose opt 16 System adm and opt 2 SPS installation.   It will show that password is required. Choose opt 1 and enter and it will change to password NOT required.  Q to quit. When they go into pos and recall doc, will not ask for password anymore.  Needs to exit out of POS on any terminal with an Ingenico pinpad.

Title: KRONOS - Removing Sign off for correcting timecard
Description:
CP3639 KRONOS SIGN OFF REMOVAL SIGN-OFF SIGNOFF

***ATTENTION - THIS COMMON PROBLEM IS ONLY DONE ON FRIDAY - DO NOT DO THIS ON SATURDAY, SUNDAY OR MONDAY - AFTER FRIDAY ADVISE LOCATION TO DO A HISTORICAL EDIT CP#3606.***

Store Manager Calling/Emailing requesting that sign off be removed because they forgot to change the timecard prior to signing off.  How do I remove the sign off.
Solution:
First Store Managers are not able to remove sign off, only Kronos Support.

1.  Log into Kronos
2.  Pull up the associate as you normally would using their WINID or their Last Name and go to their timecard.
3.  Go to the "PREVIOUS PAY PERIOD".
4.  Click on Approvals
5.  In the drop down click on "Remove Sign-Off"

Advise the store manager to click on "ACTIONS" and the in the drop down "Refresh".  This will refresh his screen so that he can see that the sign off has been removed.  Advise him to make the changes and then sign back off.

Title: Corp Issue Refund from POS
Description: CP364 Doing a Corp Issue Refund from point of sale, do I use minus units?
Solution: "Yes.  Units will always be a MINUS on a Corp Issue Refund.

Title: Battery billed on NA Delivery
Description: CP3641 How to handle a battery on a NA delivery?
Solution: The original NA delivery requires the use of service code 034201, which pulls from service parts inventory (11900); however, their battery was originally stocked in inventory under 11500. Dealer will need to do a book & screen correction to pull the battery out of inventory and then do a JT to credit the 42800 for the cost of the battery and debit 11900 to reverse the original transaction on the delivery receipt.

Title: Daily Balancing Sheet
Description: CP3642 Daily Balancing Sheet
Solution: Balancing daily sales & expense information in search of any out of balances. Any out of balances need to be addressed and corrected by month end.

Title: Pending Credit Card Transactions - Unable to Compl
Description: CP3643 Location getting message that they can't run EOD because they have pending credit card transactions. (PCCC) (EOD)
Solution:
Throughout the day the Home Page will inform you of any Pending Credit Card transactions
that have not processed successfully. Periodically you will see a message in the upper right portion of the Home Page ?Checking C/Card Completions?. If there are any that are not (due to communication problems) that message will be replaced with ?x Pending CC Completion? where ?x? represents the number of pending credit cards that need to be processed through PCCC.

To Access the list of Pending Credit Card transations:  See procedures Manual Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/D34AAA9FB388C9BC8525787F005CB65E
Access Blue Screen - End of day menu
Option 18 Pending CCard Completion (PCCC)

By each line # there will be a:

C - Completed
I - Incomplete (this is one they need to choose and choose the correct F key to complete.
E - Error in credit card # or expiration date.  (DECLINED ? EB CHECK DIGIT ERR?Press Any Key To  Continue? may appear. This indicates that the credit card number or expiration date is incorrect.)
If the above error is received you need to select the line again and press the F5 Process Line key. You will then be prompted to enter your employee number and password. Then you will be able to CORRECTLY enter the Credit Card number and expiration date and CCV number.  After doing that you can then select the line in question one more time and then press the F5 Process Line key which should successfully process the sale changing the status from "E" to "C" for complete. You can then continue with your End Of Day. PLEASE KEEP IN MIND THAT IN ORDER TO ENTER THE CCV NUMBER YOU WILL HAVE TO CONTACT THE CUSTOMER TO OBTAIN THIS INFORMATION

Title: Call is in Preferred Fleet Reports
Description: CP3662 Call is in Preferred Fleet Reports and cannot be billed.
Solution:
Get the Preferred Fleet number.
Type the guaranteeing dealer's NS into WAD and see if both the Guaranteeing dealer and the Servicing Dealer are in the same COWN. GY does not allow billing in the same COWN.

Give the location the phone number of the guaranteeing dealer and have them bill internally. (Note: This applies to buying groups even though they aren't part of the same company.)

Title: Maxspeed - Sporadic Shutdowns - P/S Pin Trick & Sw
Description:
PLEASE USE CP3930


CP3665 Caller states that a maxspeed/thinclient will shut down intermittently.
Solution:
Things we want to try.
1.  First Try the push pin trick by adjusting the tabs in the cylinder of the plug itself.
2.  Recommend swapping power supplies.  If the problem moves, it's a P/S problem.  If it stays than it might be a Maxspeed issue.
3. Check the LED light on the Power Supply to make sure that the P/S is good.  When plugged into a good outlet, the LED should light up.
4.  Try a different outlet.  OUTLETS CAN GO BAD - Even a single outlet on a multiple strip can go bad.

Try these options first and have the caller call back if the problem persists or is relevant to the options above.

Title: Management of Accounts

A sub account can be created based on a Prime account and must be different from previously used accounts.

Prime accounts 101, 105, 106, 150, 170, 250, 260, and 283 may not be expanded.

2) Management of Asset (Excluding Inventory), Liability, And Expense Accounts - These accounts can be affected same day
3) Management of Asset-Inventory Accounts - These accounts can be affected the following month
4) Management of Sales/Cost of Sales Accounts - These accounts can be affected the following month

Title: How to Clear Unapplied Cash w/no Line Item To Appl
Description: CP3673 **GASC/JUST TIRES STORES ONLY**  Retail store calling stating that they need to remove unapplied cash from an AR Account, but there is no line Item to apply the cash too.
Solution:
There are two ways to process this.  Unapplied cash is money that has not been applied to an invoice.  It is usually there because the account has OVER PAID and the remaining amount has gone into unapplied cash.  It could also be money taken in on a lay-a-way account and the customer has never came back to finish the purchase.  Unapplied cash could be money that is owed to the customer.  We cannot tell if the money is owed, that is up to the store manager to do the research and find out why the money is sitting in unapplied.

1.  If the money is owed to the customer a ROC check must be issued.  Use C/P# 0113 for those instructions.

2.  if after the store manager has researched and cannot discern if the money owed and need to clear the account here is how it is processed in GBMS.
(Per Retail - Brian Dougherty - this is the correct process and is how a Auditor would want to see this money cleared)

1. Go to AR - Then Choose Option 2 for AR Options
2. Enter Emp #, Option 6 journal tickets, Hit Enter
3. Choose A/R Journal Ticket
4. Enter in the account number
5. Nex to "REASON" type in "CLEAR AR JOURNAL TICKET"
6. In the Amount Field enter in a positive amount equal to the Unapplied Cash amount. HIT ENTER
7. You will then see a line that shows 'CODE 100     ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE   AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNT".  This is correct.
8. Go to the "CODE" field and enter code "607"
9. In the amount field now enter the same dollar amount BUT AS A NEGATIVE AMOUNT.  HIT ENTER
10. You will now see two lines that offset each other.
11. GBMS will prompt for a due date - IGNORE THIS by hitting F7
12. Hit F7 again to "FINAL PRINT"
13. Go in to AR payments and into the account.  You should then see the Journal Ticket on the customers account.
14. Follow the normal steps to apply unapplied cash found in CP# 1628

Title: Rebate form not automatically printing
Description: CP3674 Q.  Dealer/Store calls stating that the rebate form is not printing at POS for the current Goodyear Promotions.  Tags - Rebates, Rebate, forms, Form, promotion, promotions.
Solution:
Q.  Dealer/Store calls stating that the rebate form is not printing at POS for the current Goodyear Promotions.

A.  There are several items that must be checked first.  They are as follows.
1.  Look at the invoice the store has as an example of when the rebate did not print.  This can be done by looking at the invoice from Archived documents.  The first question to ask is ?Does this invoice qualify for the promotion??  You can go to www.goodyear.com and lookup the current promotions and view the rebate form itself.  Typically, most promotions require that 4 tires be on the invoice and that the invoice be at a certain dollar amount to qualify or one or the other.  The promotion will also indicate which products are eligible for the promotion.
For example; If the promotion calls for 4 tires and a sale amount of $299.99 or higher and it?s only good for Goodyear and Dunlop branded tires and NOT Kelly, and you have an invoice that is for 2 tires and is only $225.00 but has Goodyear?s on it, that sale does not qualify.  All final invoices must meet all criteria outlined by the Promotion.  Please read over the fine print, that?s why it?s there.

2.  Goodyear also stipulates many times that the Goodyear Card must be used for certain aspects of the sale to qualify.

3. You can also look at GBMS Plus Sales Aid to see if a tire qualifies for the promotion.  All Tires Eligible for the promotion will be displayed in GBMS Plus with a yellow highlight and an expiration date of the promotion period in the box that has the Product Code in it.

4.  Our Customer Relations team receives a ?Product Hierarchy? spreadsheet from marketing for each promotion.  They will be forwarding that to support agents for each promotion period.  This Hierarchy Spreadsheet will show all eligible product lines and codes.  This can serve as another source to verify eligible product against our GBMS Plus Sales Aid screen.
Summary ? before you open up a ticket be sure to confirm the following.
1.	Have the location give you an example of a qualifying sale ? Pull up the document ? Review the document to make sure that
		a.	The correct Number of Tires are on the invoice per the promotion details.
		b.	The sale amount qualifies.
		c.	Did the customer use a Goodyear Card or pay cash as that might be a qualifier.
		d.	Check the tires in GBMS Plus vs. the Product Hierarchy Spreadsheet to see if they both confirm product eligibility.

If you have exhausted all the options and verified that the sale does qualify, please send a ticket to Support.

FOR DOCUMENTATION WITH SCREEN SHOTS CLICK BELOW:
file://akrshare01/share/nat/GBMS\CLIENT\GBMS%20Support\DOCUMENTATION\Goodyear%20Rebate%20Forms%20Not%20printing.docx

Title: Physical Inventory was not set, can GBMS set after
Description: CP3675 Dealer calls in stating that they thought they were going to take a physical inventory after previous months end but have discovered that GBMS is not nor was not set to take a physical inventory.  Can GBMS be set to take a physical inventory after month end has already been ran?
Solution:
Answer is from LEVEL 3.
There is no way to force a Physical Inventory Freeze after the fact of the expected freeze date.  We cannot chase down why their system was not set either if they feel they did set it.  If their system was not set, the most likely options are;
1. They didn't set it to begin with and maybe intended to but forgot.
2. Somone went in and turned off the indicator prior to month end.
3. When month end cutoff was ran and they were asked if they were going to take a physical inventory, they answered NO.

No other reason can be given.   Do not send a ticket to support or to level three to research.

Title: Credit Card Transactions Failing and timing Out EP
Description: CP3679 Company Owned store calling stating that Credit Cards are not processing intermittenly or taking a long time to process.  Currently it appears that we are having intermittent issues with stores not getting approvals from EPX.  The system will time out and the location may call GBMS support stating that they can't process cards.  However if you ping the location, there network is up, and if test their pinpads and test EPX connection they will both be online.
Solution:
1. test the locations network ensuring that the IDU, PRYSM, Server, and FW are all talking on the network.
2. Test their EPX connection from the SMENU
3. Test the individual or All terminals and make sure the pinpads are showing to be online.  If any are not online please follow the steps to reconnect the pinpads.

If the location shows to be online and all Ingenico equiptment is online have the location again process a credit card.  If it goes through there system is up.
Please be sure to get the terminal ID that it failed on so that we can have programmers review the logs.

Please advise them that we are looking into this issue at this time.

Title: Retail Requesting Removal of Physical Inventory In
Description:
CP3684 ****TO BE PERFORMED BY LEVEL3 SUPPORT***
Corporate Retail asking that physical inventory control be turned off for a store that is set to take physical inventory.
Solution:
From Plus
SQL> select lcphysco,lcphyct,lcfnlphy from loccntl;
press enter to continue....

Results will show the following
L    LCPHYCT   LCFNLPHY
- ---------- ----------
3     111108     111110

Type:
SQL>	update loccntl set lcphysco='0' , lcphyct=0, lcfnlphy=0;  (this is changing the fields to a '0' date
press enter to continue....

L    LCPHYCT   LCFNLPHY
- ---------- ----------
0          0          0

The results show that new indicator set to '0'


SQL> commit;
Commit complete.

SQL>	exit

Title: Different GS/AN approvals on same doc
Description: CP3685 Why does my GS and/or AN number keeps changing by other line that has a different gs/an number?
Solution:
At the request of Wholesale Billing, documents (POS and DR)  with billing codes "C" or "G"
    will now allow ONLY 1 GS or AN Number per document. Documents will still accept more than
    1 valid GS/AN per document but will print and transmit ONLY the LAST valid entry.
     Example: If the user enters a valid GS number for one line then on the next line they enter
    another valid GS number the system will display the message "ALL GS/AN APPROVAL
    NUMBERS WERE CHANGED ON THIS DOCUMENT." Meaning that all approval will change to
    the last appoval entered. Must enter on separate docs
Procedures Manual:    Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/A294167F4D09CBCC852577C2004C3F28

Solution: The fax lines have been replaced with the new EFAX system.  The fax lines will be shutting down as the phone companies terminate them.  There are more details on how to use the new system on GO Retail (formerly Pit Row).

Title: POS -Network Warranty- new format(Co Owned Stores
Description: CP3689 Why when I try to use the POS Opt 6 Network Warranty, it is forcing me to use a Visa Card?
Solution:
SEE UPDATE AT BOTTOM
It is because the Account is now processing all transactions as Visa Cards.
Must call 1-800-426-0733 to get the Visa number, exp date & CVV# (3 digts on back of card)
Work Order screen will have the COB  as V for Visa. When the user gets to document total (screen 2) and they press the
F5 Print Document and or the F8,  then F1 CC Options key the current Credit Card Entry pop up screen will appear (screen 3).
If they are on the new Ingenico device they will be prompted to enter their Employee number and password. The user will have to press
the F4 Key Entry fkey and then manually (only method, NO swipe) type in the Credit Card number and expiration date. The
document can then be finalized in the normal manner.
The entry MUST be for CREDIT, NOT Debit.
The location MUST have the ingenico pin pad device.
The print of the document will print the credit card information and authorization number the same as all other credit cards
used in GBMS as well as the current Tire & Service Network verbiage. The totals will be included in the appropriate credit card
totals of the End Of Day.

*****Any checks received for payments prior to the change that were to go to acct 59, Please send to Brian Dougherty per his request*****

Title: NEW LOAD FOR DEALERS AND RETAIL STORES
Description: CP3693 NEW LOAD for Dealers and Retail Stores
Solution:
1. Add location to the GY mainframe (IAG
2. Add Location to Cluster. Cluster Sheet is located in Drawer. Folder marked NEW
3. Update RSQ. Send/Receives should be N until ready to send to Level III.
         -----STOP HERE UNLESS LOCATION IS GOING LIVE-----
4. Run user0a.sft03.xp0.rdrlib(R750000M) to setup to run R7500000. Use LIVE date in leadcard.
5. Schedule R7500000. After R75000000 run, get printout from printer KRQX
6. Run sft03.gbms2(reload01)
7. Run sft03.gbms2(ifnewstr). This prints the Newload Sheet on Netops Printer
8. Schedule Files in RSG. Use CURRENT date.
         -----If files are scheduled to build overnight, stop here.-----
9. Date file in RSQ with current date
10. Run sft03.netops(gbms3lod)
11. If drive is built in Akron run command sft03.netops(relodadd). Make sure you have received the Node name from Shipping.
11b If drive is built on site, do not use the Relodadd command.
11c Base load drive on site do not send files until drive is connected.
12. Send files and run mv Hxxxx001.GZ HINST001.GZ   NOTE: Before sending files, check node for current manifest.
13. Run sft03.netops(reloddel). This command removes location from Node so no other data goes to node.
14. Use GBMS Load (n) Newload Script and Complete Newload Checksheet
15. Catchup any manifest and transfer to Level III
16. Stores, send email to Bea Lin that the new load for the store has been completed.
17. Dealers, send email to Debbie Kadilak that the new load has been completed.
18. Add location information to SFT03.NETOPS(NEWLOC12).

Title: RELOAD
Description: CP3694 RELOAD
Solution:
1. Go to RSY00000 and write down the last good B50 and the date.
2. Go to RSQ00000 and turn off send and receives so that new ones are not generated while we are reloading
3. Make sure backups jobs, R7503000 and R7503500 are completed.
4. Make sure you have X NODE from Shipping or verify that a base loaded drive has been shipped to the site.
5. Run sft03.gbms2(reload01). This builds backup files and current CTRY, USAX and CANX
6. Run sft03.gbms2(reload04). This prints the Reload Log Sheet
7. Schedule files in RSG00000
8. Schedule R7501 series. R7501000, R7501020, R7501500, R7501900, R7501980, R7521020, R7501990, R755000A. NOTE: Jobs must run in correct sequence. R7501990 clears out from the request and R755000A creates the install file.
To pickup TRIAD files (R7910040 - only if store is using TRIAD). Run this job last after the R7501 series has completed.
9. Date sequence number in RSQ
10. Check current manifest on hard drive to be reloaded.
11. Run sft03.netops(gbms3lod)
12. Send down sequence number containing backup reload files.
12a. Move daily files to rename it to the install file. Issue command mv Hxxxxxxx.GZ HINSTxxx.GZ (mv H terr number and seq.GZ HINST seq number.GZ)
13. Advise Level III (Mike Floyd_) to patch File 417 before running maintenance.
14. Run GBMSLOAD use (r) reload script. Note: If you are reusing the original hard drive you will need to use the (t) takeover script
Remember to use reload script to catchup and patch local files. Options 8,9, and 10. To reinstall hours work, run Option 15 of reload script
and complete Reload Checklist. DO NOT TURN ON SENDS AND RECEIVES UNTIL PROCESS HAS BEEN COMPLETED.
15. Check for incomplete B50s when reload is complete. Change seq number in RSQ and email Bob Hohenadel.
16.If reloading a dealer, send email to Dealer Accounting.
17. After reload has been completed, schedule File 338 ( invoice reprints) which will build Sunday. File will be sent on Monday depending on how large the files is.
18. Send report to Level III for further review and note if report should go to Shipping or Support
NOTE: If reload is cancelled. Patch the daily file to the next current file to be sent down and change RSQ to reflect what CTRY, USAX and CANX is displayed in Plus.
Before scheduling gbms3lod check current MQ send queue for other data. Do not clear until files are built. NOTE: A change in plan as far as continuing the reload process can occur. Ex. Reload cancelled or original drive may come up.
Clear old files before scheduling compressed files. Run sft03.mq.work(zapqp). Check MQ Send queue. Should be empty.  Before submitting gbms3lod make sure you have the previous or next sequence number you are going to submit. submit the install file.
Check RSQ Maintenance sequences for dailys,  install file and catchup. Date the install file. You are patching around the install file and entering the dailys sequence file. Ex. Location  daily file seq 579, Maint install file seq number is 582, the patch around seq is 583. You will submit 579 via gbms3lod. From the GBMSLOAD Menu (r) option enter the patch around seq 583. After submitting. Check MQ send queue. Should see daily sequences and install file.

Title: TAKEOVER
Description:
CP3695 TAKEOVER NOTICE FOR 91090-XXXX - DEALER
TAKEOVER NOTIDE FOR 91091-XXXX - STORE
TAKEOVER OF LIVE LOCATION
Solution:
1. Takeover notice from Mike Gron advising that we will be calling Chicago Hub (800.994.8243) of changes. There may be a request to copy files before running clearsys and a request to run Maria's Jobs (AR Transfers).
 Note: Mike will load Maria's job (R7504800 and R7504820) before they are submitted on the system. Location that ARs are transferred from must be CLOSED. The store receiving the ARs must be opened. Do not run these jobs after 1300. Check the online schedule on the first work
day. This job runs at 1300. Schedule job in the morning. Make sure backups have completed.
If there are files to be downloaded, get a total count of how many files are going to be exported.
2. Ping server at CLOSED location.
3. Telnet on CLOSED location and change password. At prompt enter passwd. Enter GBMS3 as the new password
4. Ping server at live location. Write down the IP address. Ex 10.6.6.162
5. Ping server at CLOSED location. Write down the IP address. Ex 10.6.3.194 or take a screen shot.
6. Locate a similiar store in that area. It may be another dealer or store to use for comparison of like data. You will need this information to enter on the live location. Print all screens. The TAKEOVER process is almost the same as a NEW Load.
7. Add location to the GY Mainframe (IAG00000)
8. Add location to Cluster. Cluster Sheet is located in Drawer. Folder marked NEW
9. Update RSQ00000. Send/Receives should be N until ready to send to Level III.
10. Run user0a.sft03.xp0.rdrlib(R750000M) to setup to run R7500000. Use LIVE date in leadcard.
11. Schedule R7500000. After R7500000 run, get printout from printer KRQX
12. Run sft03.gbms2(reload01)
13. Run sft03.gbms2(ifnewstr). This prints the Newload Sheet on Netops printer
14. Schedule the files to be reloaded in RSG, copy them from RLD2 on date 123120. Change the date to the reload date and enter the territory that will receive the takeover.
14. Schedule R7501 series. R7501000, R7501020, R7501500, R7501900, R7501980, R7521020, R7501990, R755000A. NOTE: Jobs must run in correct sequence. R7501990 clears out from the request and R755000A creates the install file.
To pickup TRIAD files (R7910040 - only if store is using TRIAD). Run this job last after the R7501 series has completed.
15. Date sequence number in RSQ with current date. If files are scheduled to build overnight, Stop here.
16. Schedule Maria's Jobs. R7504800 and R7504820. Do not schedule R755000A. Check with Mike Gron to make sure he has loaded jobs.
17. Make sure you have the Node name from Shipping. Base load drive on site. Do not send files until drive is connected.
18. Check current manifest on hard drive to be reloaded.
19. Run sft03.netops(gbms3lod)
20. Telnet into CLOSED location. At prompt enter gbmsload (t) Run Options 1, 2, 3, 4 Export dealer specfic tables. Answer ALL, 5, 6 and 7.
21. At Option 7, run setup to change territory number. There is a submenu from this option titled GBMS Setup Menu
Select option 1. Change nodename and TCP/IP configuration. It will display the current configuration that the system is (which is the closed location). Compare with the printout from Step 5.
Select option P - prompt for all parameters (recommend for gbms3 vsat machines)
You will receive a response to enter new hostname. This will be the terr number of the LIVE location.  Enter IP address of the LIVE location (10.6.6.162). Press enter at Broadcast addr, Gateway, Network mask, and enter domain. System will prompt if this is OK.
22. Option 8 - Reboot the system, before sending the install file.
23. Contact Spacenet Chicago Hub on 800.994.8243 when we need them to change the site number (terr #) and or IP address for the IDU.  with the request from Mike Gron. Provide Spacenet with the following information. The store numbers are identified by 91090-xxxx for dealers 91091-xxxx for stores.
NOTE: Cant telnet into live location until Spacenet had completed their changes.
24. Telnet onto live location.
25. Send files
26. Run MV command, mv Hxxxx001.GZ  HINST001.GZ,  to move files to gbmsload:
27. Telnet back into Takeover Menu. Enter gbmsload (t) and begin at Step 9 - Modify Timezone default . At this point the takeover is now the live location.
28. Complete Step 10 - 00.
29. Transfer report to Level III for further review

NOTE: If reload is cancelled. Patch the daily file to the next current file to be sent down and change RSQ to reflect what CTRY, USAX and CANX is displayed in Plus.  Before scheduling gbms3lod check current MQ send queue to make sure that the old files has been cleared before scheduling compressed files.  Before submitting gbms3lod make sure you have the previous or next sequence number you are going to submit. DO NOT  submit the Maintenance install file. You are patching around this file and entering the next sequence file. Ex. Location  daily file seq 579, Maint install file seq number is 582, the patch around seq is 583. You will submit 579 via gbms3lod. From the GBMSLOAD Menu (r) option  will enter the patch around seq 583.

Title: RECEIVE PROCESSING ERRORS
Description:
CP3696 Receiving sequence did not make it through the system all the way or the location may have partial data in MQ .
Backups and SSends Jobs should be completed. Check MQ and CICS45B.
CICS45B will display a difference in totals in the RECV DATA PROCESSED TOTAL and RECV COMPLETE. The RECV DATA NOT PROCESS will display the number of locations not processed. MQ Send may or may not have location listed.
Solution:
NOTE: VERIFY THAT LOCATION IS NOT ON THE TRANSMIT LIST BEFORE DOING DB2ENTRY.
LOCATION NOT LISTED IN MQ SEND and CICS45B display a difference in totals in the RECV DATA PROCESSED TOTAL and RECV COMPLETE. The RECV DATA NOT PROCESS will display the number of locations not processed. Location is not on the Transmit list but is listed on the Receive Processing Errors Report. The RECV PROC SEQ column will display the sequence error the system did not receive ex. 261.  RSY00000 will display the location with an Incomplete B50. Check DSXVOL. The BKUPRECV will be high and the TRANRECV empty (1536 no new business activity). RSQ00000 datasets will display what the system has processed, the current status of the Next Convert Sequence will be the sequence number the system is waiting for ex 261 and the next B50 . To resolve:
1.in DSXVOL, issue command MV BKUPRECV RECVxxxx (xxxx terr number)
2.In RISTSO enter 3.4.  to remove. Dataset name RS0.R794xxxx. Delete the dataset and the compressed dataset that has the S261. Do this before pulling data from the Store.
3. Do DB2ENTRY
4. Run RISCICSB
5. Check CICS45B. Should see a message, Receive complete for location xxxx sequence 261
6. Check DSXVOL. BKUPRECV should display normal (1536). Good pull from Store
7. Check MQ Send queue. Should be empty
8. Check 3.4. Dataset should be uncompressed.
9. Check RSQ dataset should display S261 not processed
10.Schedule R7505000 and R7505100
11. RSQ should display the Next Convert Sequence 262.
12. RSQ should display Next B50 Sequence

Title: RECEIVE PROCESSING ERRORS
Description:
CP3697 Receiving sequence did not make it through the system all the way or the location may have partial data in MQ .
Backups and SSends Jobs should be completed. Check MQ and CICS45B.
CICS45B will display a difference in totals in the RECV DATA PROCESSED TOTAL and RECV COMPLETE. The RECV DATA NOT PROCESS will display the number of locations not processed. MQ Send may or may not have location listed.
Solution:
NOTE: VERIFY THAT LOCATION IS NOT ON THE TRANSMIT LIST BEFORE DOING DB2ENTRY.
LOCATION LISTED IN MQ SEND and CICS45B display a difference in totals in the RECV DATA PROCESSED TOTAL and RECV COMPLETE. The RECV DATA NOT PROCESS will display the number of locations not processed. Location is not on the Transmit list but is listed on the Receive Processing Errors Report. The RECV PROC SEQ column will display the sequence error the system did not receive ex. 261.  RSY00000 will display the location with an Incomplete B50. Check DSXVOL. The BKUPRECV will be high and the TRANRECV empty (1536 no new business activity). RSQ00000 datasets will display what the system has processed, the current status of the Next Convert Sequence will be the sequence number the system is waiting for ex 261 and the next B50 . To resolve:
1.in DSXVOL, issue command MV BKUPRECV RECVxxxx (xxxx terr number)

3. Do DB2ENTRY
4. Run MSGRCOVR to pull from GBMS
5. Check CICS45B. Should see a message, Receive complete for location xxxx sequence 261
6. Check DSXVOL. BKUPRECV should display normal (1536). Good pull from Store
7. Check MQ Send queue. Should be empty

9. Check RSQ dataset should display S261 not processed
10.Schedule R7505000 and R7505100

12. RSQ should display Next B50 Sequence

Title: KRONOS service manager vacation
Description: CP3717 KRONOS service manager vacation - our service managers work 48 hours but only accrue 40 hours of vacation, what code do I use for the remaining 8 hours?
Solution: The pay code in Kronos is PDV.  This will NOT show up on the manager's drop-down list of pay codes, it must be typed in manually.  The accrual for this code is separate from the normal VAC accrual, and will show up in the "Accruals" tab in the bottom half of the timecard in Kronos.

Title: goodyear rewards plus website not loading on maxsp
Description: CP3718 I'm trying to connect to gyrewardsplus.com and it says I need to update my browser.  What do I do?
Solution:
WORK AROUND - Type in User name and Password and press enter (DO NOT CLICK ON LOGON)

Unfortunately, Goodyear Rewards Plus upgraded their site sometime around 1/25/2012.  It will not load on Internet Explorer 6 which is what runs on the maxspeeds.  As we cannot upgrade the software on the maxspeeds, the only other option would be to load the site from a non-GBMS computer.

If the location has any other questions or comments, they should contact the Rewards Plus line at 1-877-777-9937.

Title: Credit Card Charge Back
Description: CP372 Credit Card company is charging the dealer back on a customer purchase, what should I do?
Solution:
"The location did not issue a credit memo for the credit card company to deduct, so the following steps need to be taken.
1) Enter the original gross amount, overstating the deposit, disregarding the charge back.
2) Issue a A/R journal ticket to credit cash (10000) and debit A/R (10100) for the credit card company to take the money back out to the bank to correct the cash account and to account for the deduction.
3) Issue a cash credit memo using code 046100 in the amount of the charge back. GBMS will treat this as money being taken out of the cash drawer.
4) Issue a cash receipt to the credit card account. GBMS will treat this as money being put back into the cash drawer. Apply this amount to the debit line created by the journal ticket."

Title: G3X is seeing $0.00 on invoices
Description:
CP3722 Currently WTCs are being converted to COWD. G3X dealers who were previously able to see the amount passed onto the WTC will now see $0.00.
Some G3X dealers will still see pricing until all the WTC are converted to COWD.
Solution:
G3X dealer's issues:
Currently WTCs are being converted to COWD. G3X dealers who were previously able to see the amount passed onto the WTC will now see $0.00.
Some G3X dealers will still see pricing until all the WTC are converted to COWD.

Background:
The conversion of WTC to COWD has started with a couple WTCs. (000904187, 000906186, 000908185)

When a G3X received their invoices on TireHQ from a WTC, the invoice would show a dollar amount and it would inform the location that the credit has been passed onto the WTC.

When a G3X received their invoice on TireHQ from a WD, the invoice would show $0.00 and it would inform the location that the credit has been passed onto the WD.

What to do with the G3X:
The G3X will need to contact the COWD for billing issues. TireHQ will show $0.00 now.

Reasoning:
G110 are customers of Goodyear and Goodyear does the billing.
G3X and Associate dealers are customers of the WTC/WD/COWD. The price of the tires for the G3X dealers are set by the WTC/WD/COWD. Some dealers may get different prices than other dealers, depending on the volume they purchase. Since the price is between the G3X and the WTC/WD/COWD and Goodyear doesn't have anything to do with the pricing, Goodyear passes $0.00 in the invoice. It is up to the WTC/WD/COWD to give the final invoice to the G3X dealers.

Solution:
************For level 2 TireHQ************

Title: Recall letters for Wrangler Silent Armor Recall
Description: CP3729 The product service bulletin for the recall (PSB 2012-04) states on page 1, last paragraph, that locations can go out and query their records for customers who purchase the tires after March 1, 2009.
Solution:
****NEW UPDATE****
Per Prod Service, Goodyear will be sending the letters out to the customers.  The stores/dealers will not be responsible for that task.

NOT totally TRUE. They can go out to GBMS PLUS/Reports/customer inquiry and put in the 9 digit code and search that way, but it will only show customers and invoices for 2012 and 2011.  2009 & 2010 will only show totals. The only way they can get the information needed is via Report Writer.
Dealers we can send report back to customer relations and have them create a report for the location.  Get a valid email so we can email it back to the location.
Stores - Trying to find out if someone in store support will be running a report writer report for the store locations.

Title: FET & TTAX on Wrangler Silent Armor Recall
Description:
CP3730 1.  If system is charging an FET on the replacement code, but NOT on the adjusted tire, how do you take it off?
2.  Does the customer pay the TTAX - No per Gary Marlin Prod Svc
Solution:
The system will generate the FET msg on the adjusted tire only if the tire is full tread depth.
Since these recalled tires are possibly several years old, they would NOT have full tread depth, therefore, not getting the message.
When they get all the tires done and go to mdse verify, it will show the amount charged of just the excise tax & TTAX.
They must use misc code 020100  negative  units and each price of excise tax, and valid desc( remove excise tax for n/c adj) to minus these off the invoice per  Gary
Marlin in product service. Need to do the Excise Tax as one misc code and valid description  - remove excise tax for recall and at doc total enter in Tax status 3 & 1 for resale to take the TTAX off for company owned stores. Dealer can answer N to TTAX on work order screen. . That total will show 0.00 when they go to doc total.

Title: Tire Adjustment Concession Approvals
Description: CP3732 Why is my concession approval given to me by my goodyear rep, coming up invalid in gbms?
Solution:
For Tire adjustments: Only gbms location has a check digit to check the first two digits of the approval number. If given out by Akron, they start with an AN(=Alpha =A) &( N=number 0-9)  If given out by district, will be the first two digits the district is in.  to check this we can sign into location and run  >select lcdstrc from loccntl;  this will show the 2 digit district he is in and must be the first two digits of concession approval.

Tire hq location do NOT have a check digit system and will take any number they are given.

Title: Vendor Payables Reprint
Description: CP3733 I need to reprint a vendor payment I did today. How do I do this?
Solution: Go to Display Audit Trail(DAT) and scroll down to vendor payables and find the 6 digit number.  Then go to Vendor Payables and choose whether Indirect or Parts Payment,  then opt 3 reprint. It will ask if this is a parts payment: if yes answer Y if indirect answer N, then put in the 6 digit number found on DAT.

Title: Checking Credit cards after Prysm Pro Installed
Description: CP3734 When Spacenet calls and asks us to update the screen for the credit cards after the Prysm Pro is installed, what do I need to do?
Solution:
Remote onto location and answer Y.
On SMENU choose opt 10 Credit Card Menu
Then Option 13 Test  SPSLink Connectivity.  Should come back Link is UP
Then Option 14 Verify ADS/VSAT connection -Run test transaction.  Should see the test run and should come back with " Transaction test was OK using VSAT and your ADS terminal id."
Press enter and have Spacenet check with the location to see if they are working. Will only take about a minute for them to do that.   Close report unless ADS/VSAT failed.

Title: Road Hazard on New Tire Wrangler Recall
Description: CP3735 How do I handle the road hazard for the recall if customer had a road hazard on the recall tire(s)?
Solution:
Per Gary Marlin
It would be up to the retailer to decide how to handle this. We would encourage the retailer to extend the r/h warranty to the replacement tire if possible.  We are supplying a $35 per tire handling allowance to help cover such costs.

To accomplish this, after finalizing the N/C adjustment,
1.  They would have to do an invoice as minus the road hazard code on one doc and finalize.
2.  Do another doc and charge the road hazard which should show the new road hazard codes.

Title: Add Catalytic Converters
Description: CP374 How do I add Catalytic Converters to my list of catagories?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select the option for Product Administration.
2) From Product Administration select the option for Triad Maintenance.
3) From Triad Maintenance select the option for Category Setup.
4) Arrow down to highlight EXHAUST and press F4 Primary Group.
5) Arrow to Exhaust Labor and press F8- Insert. This will insert a blank line between Exhaust System Parts and Exhaust Labor.
6) Press F2 Parts. This will bring up the Parts Group Selection.
7) Arrow down to higlight Catalytic Converters and Press Enter. This will insert Catalytic Converters in the blank space in the Group Description window.
8) Press ESC four times and type a ""Y"" to save the changes.
9) ESC two more times back to the Triad Maintenance Menu and type a ""Y"" to save to Akron.
10) Advise to exit back to login to activate the changes."

Title: Update/Print Tire Package Price List
Description: CP3740 Location want to update/print Tire Package Price List.
Solution:
In GBMS Menu select Inventory Admin (INVAD) then Reports and Inquiries (RPINQ) then Tire Product List (TPL).

If the location wants to edit the sale ancillaries (Valve stem, Tire disposal fee, etc) they will go to
Inventory Admin (INVAD) then Reports and Inquiries (RPINQ) then to Tire Price Profile (TPP).

Title: Reset Service Intervals
Description: CP375 I am missing the Service Intervals with the March CD.
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select the option for Product Administration.
2) From Product Administration select the option for Triad Maintenance.
3) From Triad Maintenance select the option for Category Setup.
4) Arrow down to highlight MAJOR SERVICE INTERVALS and press F4 Primary Group. (It is possible that something unrelated will display such as steering, delete this by pressing F5)
5) Press F2 Parts. Then press F2 Labor, this will bring up the Labor Group Selection.
6) Arrow down to highlight Normal Service Interval and Press Enter.  Then arrow down to Severe Service Interval and Press Enter.
7) Press ESC four times and type a ""Y"" to save changes.
8) Press ESC two more times to return to Triad Maintenance Menu and type a ""Y"" to save to Akron.
9) Advise to exit to login and log back in to activate the changes.
10) Send open report to level 1 for files to be set to retrieve the changes, in case of any future reload required update."

Title: GBMS 4 Triad Install
Description: CP3755 GBMS 4 - Why is my system stuck so long on reading cd rom when installing the triad disk?
Solution:
For GBMS 4, the install is different.
1.  Type TINCD at main menu.
2.  Put in the first disk and press F1
     a.  It will sit at reading cd rom for about 3 min
	 b.  It will then ask if you want to download to hard drive (Y).  Just enter and it will begin reading at record speed.
3.  When 1st disk is done reading, press enter and put in the 2nd CD.  press F1
4.  Again it will say reading CDRom and stay on that screen for about 3 min then will come up and ask if want to download to hardrive (Y)
5.  After the 2nd disk is installed it will say Updating files.
6.  A message comes up saying the system does NOT have to IPL (Y) just press enter.
7.  Then a screen will come up saying clean up - please wait till this window closes. That takes about a minute.
8.  After the screen disappears, you can now use your system.

Title: GBMS 4 thin client time zone change

***Thin Client Issue***

Terminal #:

Troubleshooting:
Solution:
The new thinclients have a known bug that causes the time zone to not be retained when they run 'setup'.

As each location comes live, we update the client that night to resolve this issue.
This is probably happening on additional work stations the stores are getting that we did not know about.

If any other locations report an issue, inform them we will fix it that night, and then send ticket to infrastructure.

Title: How to take Goodyear CC Payment
Description: CP3761 How do I take a Goodyear Credit Card Payment since going on the EPX Credit Card Processing System?
Solution:
1.	Select the option for Cash Receipts.
2.	Type your employee number.
3.	Type the option number for Goodyear Credit Card Payment and press enter.
4.	Press Enter OR type the customer?s last name, press enter, select the line number, and again, press enter.
5.	If you pressed Enter, now type the name and address of the customer, and press enter.
6.	Enter the cash amount to be paid and press enter (the security feature will prompt at this point if enabled).
7.	Press F1 Swipe Credit Card and advise the customer to swipe their card.
8.	Press F3 Print.

For GBMS Dealers that process on UPOST:
This procedure does NOT include GBMS users that process credit card transactions via the VPOST method ? for VPOST users, please contact the EPX Help Desk @ 1-866-581-5239 for local Goodyear Credit Card payment processing instructions.

****UPDATE****
6/3/15 update
 At the request of Citi Bank single or multiple payments for the same Goodyear Credit Card will
    not be accepted by the system if the payments total more than $1000.00. If a location attempts to
    apply a payment that will make the total payments made on that card greater than $1000.00, the
    message INVALID AMOUNT will be displayed. Payments made to the same Goodyear Credit
    Card on different dates totaling more than $1000 will still be accepted.

     The print of the cash receipt for Goodyear Credit Card payments will now print only the
    last 4#s. Previously it printed the first 4 and the last 4.

Title: EPX Debit/Credit Over/Short
Description: CP3771 Known Issue.  If customer tries to enter Pin in once and fails, and then runs through as credit, EPX will treat it as a credit sale, GBMS tries to run it through as a debit sale.  If debit account goes to cash at EOD, will be short that amount.
Solution:
When they close out of balance it is going to move the money to their Cash Over/Short account.  (Typicall 50800, but they can change it to whatever)  All they need to do is do an AR Journal Ticket to move the money to the correct account.  Go to AR JT on account 51:
	DR 10100			Amount of Transaction
	CR 508XX					Amount of Transaction
This will move the amount to the AR account for Mastercard/Visa and they will be able to apply the payment to it when they receive it.

Solution: The EPX Customer Service phone number is  866-581-5239

Title: EPX Common Issues
Description: CP3774 Common issues with Ingenico Equipment/Service
Solution:
1.  EPX is ordering stands for the Ingenico Readers.   If any Dealers inquire about stands have them call EPX Customer Service @ 866-581-5239.   It was mentioned that they will cost approximiately $75 each

 2.  If you get any Dealers calling in concerning a letter they received from Citi Bank about a possible cancellation of their Goodyear Merchant #, they need to call Citi Bank @ 800-729-7647.

 3.   Ingenico Reader Replacements for Dealers - Any Tickets for replacement readers sent to Ingenico before 3 pm should be sent out that day for delivery.  If tickets are sent to Ingenico after 3 pm the replacement reader will not be received until the second business day.    (These tickets are sent to Ingenico by our HW/Comm section)

4.  If location getting "Error 58, service not available"  they need to call the EPX helpdesk.   They are not setup with EPX to process that Credit Card type.

5.  Dealer Ingenico serial numbers start with 201xxxxxxxxxx. Retail stores Ingenicos start with 666xxxxxxxxxx.

6.  Dealers are setup with a maximum ticket amount - if they cannot complete a large credit card sale, the issue could be because they are not setup at EPX with that large of a limit.   They can call EPX and have this limit raised.

Title: Touch screen not working on Ingenico Reader
Description:
CP3779 There is a display but the touch screen on my Ingenico Card Reader is not working.

***Ingenico***

Serial Number:
Have you reset it?
Details of issue: Ingenico does not respond to an option selected from the screen
Troubleshooting:
Solution:
Updated 2/24/2017

DEALERS - Hold down the Clear and Minus buttons. When the unit beeps, release the buttons.  Once you release the buttons DO NOT touch the screen until it has completely initialized. Log off the thinclient that the Ingenico is hooked to. Once the thinclient has finished the start up process (the homepage will automatically load) then launch POS, which should trigger the Ingenico. If touchscreen still does not work, fill in template (see note below) and open ticket to HW/Comms

RETAIL - Reboot the Ingenico by pulling the power to it. Log off the thinclient that the Ingenico is hooked to. Once the thinclient has finished the start up process (the homepage will automatically load) then launch POS, which should trigger the Ingenico. If touchscreen still does not work, fill in template (see note below) and open ticket to HW/Comms.

NOTE: Dealer Ingenico serial numbers start with 201xxxxxxxxxx. Retail stores Ingenicos start with 221xxxxxxxxxx.

Title: Dealers Obtaining Voice Authorization from EPX
Description: CP3780 How do I obtain Voice Authorizations for Visa, M/C, Discover & American Express while on EPX?
Solution:
CP 3780 -  Voice Authorization for EPX

Call 1-866-660-7065

Dealers will then be requested to enter their merchant number.
To get the merchant number, do the following:
On your phone keypad, you will enter the following:
1.  2014
2.  #
3.  000XXXXXX(xxx=Dealers nonsig # preceded by the 3 zero's.  (9 digit number)
4.  #
5.  XXXX= 4 digit GBMS terr #
6.  #
7.  01
8.  #

After entering the above, recorded voice prompt will:

1.  request you to enter the card number then the # sign.
2.  enter the expiration date of the card in MM/YY then press # sign
3.  enter dollar amount o be authorized with 2 decimal places followed by the # sign.
     Example: Authorize of $10.00 would be entered as 1000

Recorded voice will repeat your entries above and then request that you
1.  Press the # to authorized,   1 to CANCEL,  or 2 Try Again. (select your desired option)

If approved you will be given the authorization number(write it down) or a Decline.

GOODYEAR CARD voice authorizations will be obtained as follow:
Call 1-800-767-1114
Enter their Goodyear Merchant #. (Nothing has changed for the Goodyear Card Authorizations

Remember you have to start a new invoice as manual doc and void the original doc  because the manual will be given the same doc number at doc total.

Title: Errors on Ingenico Reader (DLR)
Description:
USE CP3631

CP3781 (DLR) On my Ingenico Card swipe I am getting the following error - "Encription Key Error" or getting message "Must use a workstation with an Ingenico reader (and this Workstation has the Ingenico unit hooked to it)
Solution:
1.  Unplug the Ingenico unit from power.
2.  Close all open applications on the GBMS workstation (the one the Ingenico unit is hooked to).
3.  Log off of the workstation. (If on GBMS3 - they click on start and log off gbms - If on GBMS 4 they click on start and restart)
4.  After the workstation has reset and is back to their GBMS home page (Plug the Ingenico unit back in to power.
5.  When the Ingenico unit has reset it will show the Goodyear Banner.
6.  Have them access Point of Sale on the workstation and they should see the display on the Ingenico change.
7.  They should now be ready to run a credit card.

Title: KRONOS DATABASE ERROR UPDATE
Description: CP3785 We are still aware of an issue causing a database error when working in Kronos.  There is no need to place a ticket for notification unless you need assistance with timecards or the scheduler.  The issue does lie with Kronos and does not seem to be related to the Prysm Pro at this time.  Kronos is actively working on a resolution for us and we hope to have the problem addressed as quickly as possible.  We truly appreciate your diligence with this aggravation and in signing off on the timecards and building the schedules.
Solution:
Tips to help avoid the error
    1. Try to address each timecard on a one by one basis instead of highlighting all associates
    2. Click the refresh button after every finished schedule and or timecard
    3. Waiting a few minutes after the error and logging back in could help to avoid the error
    4. Save as often as you can

Kronos Support

Title: Squirrel Mail - Common Q & A
Description: CP3786 Why can't I receive Emails from the outside.
Solution:
Answers to common questions concerning Squirrel Mail  Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/1DDFF5A5FDE4EFE5852570580042BBA1

  1. Can a GBMS 4 system (with Squirrel mail) receive emails from a normal email address?   ie.  mickeymouse@yahoo.com
	NO, GBMS (3 or 4) cannot receive any email from external email addresses, such as yahoo, aol, gmail etc.
	Only emails sent from within the goodyear network can be sent to a GBMS email system.

  2. Can a GBMS 4 system (with Squirrel mail) send emails to a normal email address?   ie.  mickeymouse@yahoo.com
	YES. GBMS(3 or 4) can send to any normal external email address, such as yahoo, aol, gmail etc. HOWEVER
	the user cannot reply back.

  3. Can a GBMS 4 location  (with Squirrel mail) send emails to one of their sub locations that are also on squirrel mail?
	YES.  Send to gbms@gXXXX.gbms.goodyear.com

  4. Can a GBMS 4 location  (with Squirrel mail) receive emails from one of their sub locations that are also on squirrel mail?
	YES.

  5. Can a GBMS 4 location  (with Squirrel mail) send an email to Goodyear?
	YES. I sent to 'charlesbrown@goodyear.com' from r465 as a test and it was received.

  6. Can a GBMS 4 location  (with Squirrel mail) receive an email from Goodyear?
	YES. I sent to gbms@gr465.gbms.goodyear.com@unixmail.goodyear.com from my Lotus account and it was received on gr465.

Title: G3X Not Able to Order tires
Description: CP3797 Location is a G3X and receiving an error "V1 Ship-to party rejects product attribute 6 for (material number)" when trying to look up price and availability on a tire in Search by size, product look up ....etc.
Solution:
G3X locations doing a search by size>Price & Availability search are receiving the following messages highlighted in red below.

Tire-HQ is indeed working as designed.

The message only shows when a G3X customer runs an Availability inquiry. . Prior to the Scheduled Delivery Date change, THQ allowed G3X to view inventory. Now, it displays the message sent back from SAP because they cannot view warehouse information. There is no need for them to see inventory since G3X dealers must purchase tires from their WD. We have always had the message "G3X products should be ordered from your WD" in the Availability area. Here's how the messages translate:

V1 Ship-to party rejects product attribute 6 for (material number):  Means that the G3X is not allowed to order Goodyear consumer tires. Attribute 6 is a G3X indicator for Goodyear consumer tires.
V1 Ship-to party rejects product attribute 7 for (material number):   Means that the G3X is not allowed to order Kelly consumer tires. Attribute 7 is a G3X indicator for Kelly consumer tires
V1 Ship-to party rejects product attribute 8 for (material number):  Means that the G3X is not allowed to order Dunlop consumer tires. Attribute 8 is a G3X indicator for Dunlop consumer tires
V1 Ship-to party rejects product attribute 9 for (material number):Means that the G3X is not allowed to order Republic, Pacemark and LTR consumer tires. Attribute 9 is a G3X indicator for these tires
V1 Ship-to party rejects product attribute 10 for (material number): Means that the G3X is not allowed to order all brands of Commercial tires. Attribute 10 is a G3X indicator for Commercial tires

Title: Print screen for triad
Description: CP380 Why doesn't print screen work on triad anymore?
Solution:
Instead of printing the screen, a list can be created that can then be printed.

** Printing a list from Triad. **

Once the vehicle has been selected and you are on the parts screen, press Ctrl + L. This will put an L at the top indicating a list has been started. Go through and select the parts (the product line numbers) to add to the list. If there is no price on file, you will be prompted to enter one. Ctrl + L will display the list and from here you can print it by pressing P or hit Esc Esc to add more items to the list.

*** Updated 2/27/2013

Title: SYMANTEC pcANYWHERE Quick Connect
Description: CP3800 Symantec's PCAnywhere software has been deployed to Goodyear associates desktops and laptops as part of a strategy to leverage dual management platforms for providing tech support remote control functionality.
Solution:
Once the Quick Connect application starts, you will need to enter either the computer name or IP address of the computer that you want to remote control.
Enter the Caller login credentials for connecting to the pcAnywhere Host.
A dialog box will appear on the remote machine asking to grant permission for the remote control session to be established. Click on Yes.
Remote into Store's Manager PC using PC Anywhere. Select Screen Scaling and check View /Edit Online options. Click Low Bandwidth and ok.
Download the stores notes ID from the Retail FTP via Internet Explorer. The store notes ID is ftp://ggw/pub/retailstores/Notes%20ID%20Files/
Save the file to C:\Program Files (x86)\Notes\Data
Cut the current webmail desktop shortcut and place it in the store's My document folder
Create a new desktop shortcut by dragging the Notes icon from the Start Menu > Notes Applications
Open up the Notes Application
Enter your name (store name for ex. GSR2444) and Domino server AHQNM005
Browse to the following directory to open up the Notes ID you downloaded. C:\Program Files (x86)\Notes\Data. Click OK
Enter in the temporary Notes ID Password. This password can be obtained from the Help Desk or anyone in Retail
Close any unneeded tabs that opened and open up the users Mail Box. Once open, go to File > Security > User Security
Click okay to sync the Lotus Notes password to the Windows system password
Enter in the temporary ID password
Click close
Have the Store Manager put in their current GSR GOPass when the prompt appears
Please email the stores that was completed to brad_paliswat@goodyear.com for tracking.

Title: GBMS4 - Logging into another Territory's homepage
Description: CP3801 GBMS4 - One location is trying to log into another location's homepage by changing the Territory number in the URL
Solution: In GBMS4, this is not possible due to security issues. Although it can be done by using a non-GBMS PC.

Title: Adjustment credit Report
Description: CP3802 Where is my Adjustment credit report? ( W4430700 )
Solution:
Starting in January, dealers who send in adjustment tires in a given month should receive this report on or shortly after the first Tuesday of the following month.  This report will contain a list of tires to be returned to the Goodyear warehouse within the next 90 days to receive adjustment credit.

If there is a delay on invoices on that Tuesday, this report will be delayed as well.

Title: GBMS COMMON OWNER NUMBERS TO CLEAR
Description: CP3807 New process to facilitate the clearing of company files from closed GBMS locations. R7518500 is a program designed to clear GBMS data from store closed two years. This process should be released monthly.
Solution:
1. This is a workfile job that creates a user0a dataset when submitted. This in turn triggers a new process, R7518550 that performs the deletes if files are found. At the end of this process the user0a dataset is deleted.

2.The process can be submitted multiple times per day

3. Sysout provides information regarding files that were deleted

4. Logic checks to make sure that all stores under a common owner are closed. If it finds any one store open, this is reported in sysout and the delete is bypassed.
Also R7518500 is program designed to clear GBMS data for store closed for two years. This process should be released monthly. It builds input to R7519000 - which in turn performs the deletes on GBMS source data for the closed locations. Because we run this monthly there would be no reason to manually build R751900M input data from Mike's list of stores to clear - it would have already been accomplished. Print out the file from the R7518500 run to keep track of the stores that are cleared.

Description: CP3808 How to bill out a Private Mail Hauler

2.  Dealers - Need to get with their DMR or Goodyear Rep, who will fill out a TPS request.

Private Mail Haulers are no longer part of Government Accounts.

Title: DMS -Stock level revision error message
Description: CP382 Cannot revise stock level, (Option 3) receive message "Cannot select this option, workfile is in use for Option 1 and 2."
Solution:
"This message appears when you have not accessed Option 2, (Enter Stocking Levels from Pad) and finalized it. To clear this message, you must go into Option 2 from Stocking Level Maint.
Type '1' to clear current levels and re-establish from work pad. OR
Type '2' retain current levels and revise from work pad. Press Enter.

Title: Down payment on credit card sale

Solution: At doc total, enter the type of card V, M, A, P or R.   Then back tab up and put in the down payment and whether it was cash or check and enter. It will then ask for the card information and should only charge the difference.

Title: Tire-HQ document popup opens and then closes
Description:
CP3828 Problems Printing Financials in Internet Explorer
using Adobe Reader 11.0.0



If you are having issues printing Financial documents in Tire-HQ recently in Internet Explorer (IE), it may be due to a recent update to Adobe Reader. If you feel comfortable with installing the most recent update for Adobe Reader please review the following steps to resolve the issue. If you do not feel comfortable doing this yourself, please consult a technician and ask them to install Adobe Reader 11.0.01 for you.
Solution:
First, Print this screen by clicking on the Printer Icon in the upper right corner of this document.

Second, logout of Tire-HQ and close any Internet Explorer browser windows that are currently open.

Third, uninstall Adobe Reader from your Windows Control Panel.

Forth, go to the following link and select the appropriate Adobe Reader version for your computer:
http://get.adobe.com/reader/otherversions/
You will need to provide the following:
Operating System
Language
Select the installer for newest version

Click on the Download Now button near the bottom of the page. (Uncheck any toolbars or Add-ons if offered)

Once the installation has completed, log back into Tire-HQ, go to Financials and print a Document as usual.


Footnotes:
Adobe PDF Reader Add-In must be Enabled in IE browser Tools>Manage Add-ons.
Toolbars CANNOT block any downloads.

Title: TC 58 - Invalid Terr #
Description: CP383 I need to process a TC 58 to another COO, Brad Ragan location or another one of my commonly owned location, receiving Terr is invalid.
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu select the option for Administration.
2) From Administration select the option for Transfer Territory Update.
3) From Transfer Territory Update select option 1 to enter the transfer territory number. Press enter.
4) Type the name, address, city, state and zip code(this is a 9 digit field) DO NOT press enter between fields, press the TAB key, after all information is typed in then press ENTER."

Title: Selection of sub location territory for A/R Statem
Description: CP3830 When the corporate location attempts to print A/R Statements for their sub-locations, they select the territory and it appears the program hangs.
Solution: Locations need to wait until the Beginning/Ending account numbers and Remit To information populates for the sub location.  Sometimes the delay for the data to display can be lengthy (should be less tha a minute) Advise them not to select another location until the data displays and they are able to print the statements. If they have already selected another location it may lock the application.  If this is the case, bounce Tomcat at both the corporate and sub-location and this should resolve the problem. There is a work request issued to address this fix but there currently is no eta.

Title: PC 138953155 on national accounts
Description:
CP3832 I'm trying to bill PC 138953155 to a national account and get the error "Unauthorized brand of merchandise for this document."

PCs with this issue:

All Kelly commercial tires
All Goodyear G149 line tires

138953155	11R225 G G395 LHS                 RP TL
138955155	11R245 G G395 LHS                 RP TL
756817155	295/75R225 G  G395 LHS             RP TL

Title: Invalid Vendor #0001 (ASC)
Description: CP3833 How do I remove the PPR with the wrong vendor #0001, Goodyear selected from invoice or delivery receipt shortage?
Solution:
If a company-owned location erroneously selects vendor #0001, Goodyear on the invoice or delivery receipt shortage screens, they are unable to open the PPR in the PROM list of pending receipts. This will be permanently fixed with the first release of GBMS updates and enhancements, scheduled for early May 2013, by disabling the ability to select vendor #0001 from those screens. In the interim, the agent receiving the call may perform the following correction, instead of sending the report to Level 3....

1.) Remote connect to the problem store
2.) Go to plus
3.) At SQL> @fixven001ppr
4.) Press enter to see PPRs for vendor 0001
5.) Press enter again to expire vendor 0001 PPRs
6.) Press enter to confirm PPRs are now purged and should display "no rows selected"
7.) Press enter to end this process
8.) exit SQL as normal

If the PPR's are extremely old, additional action may not need taken, but if the PPR's for parts are current and unpaid, then the user needs to be advised to manually enter the part into PROM for the correct vendor, so as to submit for payment from Akron. This will maintain their Parts Aid quantity on hand inventory correctly as well.

Title: Value does not match NULL
Description: CP3840 Search by size and receive error message "value does not match required pattern number null"
Solution:
They are using Internet Explorer 10.
We are not compatible with IE 10.  Please have them downgrade to IE8 or go to Mozilla.

Removing Internet Explorer 10 from Windows 7:

Click the Start button, type Programs and Features in the search box, and then select View installed updates in the left pane.
Under Uninstall an update, scroll down to the Microsoft Windows section.
Right-click Internet Explorer 10, click Uninstall, and when prompted, click Yes.
Click one of the following:
Restart now (to finish the process of uninstalling Internet Explorer 10 and restore the previous version of Internet Explorer).
Restart later

To remove Internet Explorer 10 on Windows Server 2012, follow these steps:

Open an elevated command prompt.
At the command prompt, run the following command:
dism /online /Disable-Feature /FeatureName:Internet-Explorer-Optional-amd64

Note Internet-Explorer-Optional-amd64 is case-sensitive.
When you are prompted to restart the computer, select Yes.
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/957700

Title: Reversing a Goodyear Credit Card Payment
Description: CP3841 How do I reverse a Goodyear Credit Card Payment? The system won't let me put in a negative amount.
Solution:
There is an option to reverse a Goodyear Credit Card payment found under Cash Receipts.

After selecting the option for the Goodyear Credit Card Payment Reversal the system will request the Cash Receipt Number for the Goodyear Credit
Card Payment you want to reverse. Once you enter that number (it will be available for reversal for 60 days), it will bring up a screen with the information from that Cash Receipt. You will be prompted "Do you want to reverse Goodyear Credit Card payment (Y/N)?"

The system will only allow this option on Cash Receipts issued for Goodyear Credit Card Payments. If you enter a cash receipt number that was not issued for a GYCC Payment you will receive the error message "RECEIPT NUMBER NOT ON FILE."

NOTES:
  Ability to reverse a Goodyear Credit Card Cash Receipt will be 60 days.
  The Reversal Cash Receipt will be on file for 7 days.
  Manual Credit Card entries must be entered on the Ingenico pin pad device not from the terminal keyboard.

Title: Monthly Balancing
Description: CP3844 GBMS Month End Balancing
Solution:
Balancing country wide month end financial controls is necessary to insure that the figures on the Operating Statement and Trial Balance reports are accurate and complete.  An out-of-balance condition could mean a missing B-50, financial profile error, account code omission, erroneously deleted territory, or a debit/credit inaccuracy.  Two balancing processes occur each month: the first known as the Preliminary, the second one is the Final.  The Preliminary is balanced on the 3rd workday after the end of the month; the Final by 3:30 p.m. on the 5th workday.  Between the Preliminary and Final balancing, dealers may FAX manual journal ticket entries needed to complete their month end cutoff.

To facilitate manual balancing, worksheets are used for both Preliminary and Final processes, the Preliminary being the more complex of the two.  Financial reports to be balanced are the Operating Statement, Trial Balance and Inventory.

Figures are secured from $AVRS (in TSO) job group Z7500.  The following columns must be balanced on the Operating Statement:  Sales, Gross Profit, Expenses and Net Profit (various jobs); on the Trial Balance:  Assets and Liabilities/Capital (Z750089A and Z7500890); and under Inventory: Trial Balance (Z750089A and Z7500890), Summary of Inventory Statistics, and Stock Ledger Control (Z7500600.)
