Title: Error files on desktop
Description:
CP3852 Location is trying to access the GBMS Homepage or POS or DR and the windows keep closing. In addition, error files showing up on the desktop.

***Thin Client Issue***

Serial Number:
Ping Times:
Is there a report open already?
Details of Issue:
Troubleshooting:
Solution:
This usually indicates that the Startup Process was interrupted. What needs to be done is either Log Off or Restart the terminal. Logging off is good enough if, when it comes back up, it goes through the start up process (just getting the Startup completed window does not count). It must go through the process of copying files.

BEST PRACTICE: Do not touch the terminal while it is going through the start up process until the GBMS Homepage is fully loaded. Clicking OK will not speed it up. Trying to launch the GBMS Homepage before it finishes the process (which probably caused the issue in the first place) will only cause more issues and you will have to restart the terminal again.

Title: Unauthorized errors
Description:
CP3861 I'm getting an "Unauthorized" error when entering products

Potential messages:
Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise
Unauthorized Merchandise
Unauthorized Merchandise for this billto
Unauthorized Merchandise for this document
Solution:
While these messages look very similar, each one means something specific.

Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise - this is usually an issue with the customer's brand key.  This can be checked on screen 49 in WAD, or in the Customers database for Tire-HQ.  Usually this comes up with tires, but it can come up with service as well.  In any case, direct the customer to their Goodyear field rep to fill out a CIU form.

Unauthorized Merchandise - this means that the account in question has disallowed the code from being billed to their account.  This can be checked in WAZ by typing M for merchandise edits and then the account number.  If the code is blocked, there may be a reason why on the account's account page in Financial -> National and Govt Accounts.

Unauthorized Merchandise for this billto - This means that the code in question cannot be tilled to the type of account the customer started the document under - for example service codes on a Type B Government Local Invoice or type I Military Exchange.

Unauthorized Merchandise for this document - this comes up when one of the tires blocked by National Accounts is put into Tire-HQ.  See CP3832 for more details.

Title: Missing Billto/shipto on type H documents
Description: CP3871 We're getting a number of calls with issues with roadside service calls lately.  The documents will show up without bill to (and sometimes without ship to) information.  This only appears to happen with preferred fleets (document type H).  The usual fix of putting in bill to nonsig 206000 does not help.
Solution:
We're getting a number of calls with issues with roadside service calls lately.  The documents will show up without bill to (and sometimes without ship to) information.  This only appears to happen with preferred fleets (document type H).  The usual fix of putting in bill to nonsig 206000 does not help.

After some testing, I have a workaround that appears to work every time.  If you (or the user) take the steps below exactly, the bill to and ship to areas will show up.

1. Delete the document under Financial -> Sales -> On Hold by hitting the checkbox next to the document and clicking "Remove Selected Documents"
2. Go to Commercial -> Roadside Service Call Reports and find the call again.  It will be under "New" now.
3. Enter in the roll time, roll date and document number right on the "New" screen.  DO NOT click "View Details" - entering the data in from that screen appears to lead to blank bill to/ship to information .
4. Click "Save Changes." This will move the call to "In Process."
5. Click on the document number, which will now be a link instead of a text field.  You will see the bill to and ship to areas filled out.

Title: Tire Finder (General Questions)
Description:
CP3888 General Questions regarding Tire-Finder - See Resolution Detail  for more information.
Please include question that was asked in this ticket.   See Level 2/3 if unsure of answer.
Solution:
Advise location of the FAQ's located under In Box>More Great Info>New Tire-HQ FAQ.  Also let them know that a link is available at the top of the FAQ form to email the helpdesk with further questions.

How can I get pictures of tires in Tire Finder? There was a thumbnail of the tire before.
***While the thumbnail pictures of tires have been removed from the search results, a picture of the tire is still available. Simply click "Get Details" on the right hand side of the result. This will display a picture of the tire as well as its performance and warranty information.

Will the way availability works be changing?
***While the new Tire Finder will change how you search for tires, search results such as estimated delivery date will not be changing.

Where is the option for Product Lookup?
***Manual product code entry available in the Tire Finder by clicking on "Product Lookup" on the list of options on the left, or by going to Tires and Ordering, then clicking Material - Product Lookup under the Tire Finder Section.

Where is search by size?
***This feature can be found under Tires and Ordering, under the Tire Finder heading as the item Tire Size. You can also find it inside the Tire Finder under Narrow Results as Tire Size.

Title: Navigation V2 (General Questions
Description:
CP3892 General Questions regarding Navigation for the New Tire-HQ - See Resolution Details for more information.
Please include question that was asked in this ticket.  See Level 2/3 if unsure of answer.
Solution:
Advise location of the FAQ's located under In box>More Great Info>New Tire HQ FAQ.  Also, let them know that a link is available at the top of the FAQ form to email the helpdesk with further questions.

Where can I find Fleet-HQ options (Roadside Service Call Reports, Dealer Profile, etc.)?
***These options can be found under the Goodyear Websites section found on the top of the page. From there, you can click the "Goodyear Fleet-HQ" under the "Commercial Truck" section. All Fleet-HQ options will appear on the resulting page. One exception is "Roadside Service Call Reports" - this can be found under Transactions in the Delivery Management section.

Where can I find Sales?
***All the document types and options previously found under Financial -> Sales can now be found under the Transactions section. All of the individual document types are listed under Deliveries - clicking one will start a document of that type. On Hold, Docs Sent and other features that were previously found under sales are found in Transactions under Delivery Management.

Where can I find options for TPP Integration?
***TPP Options can be found in Transactions, under the heading Point of Sale Integration (TPP). If you're looking for documentation for our integration options TPP and Web Services, you can find this information on the bottom of the page in the second column under the heading Integration Resource Center.

Where can I change my password or peform user administration tasks?
***User Administration and Change Password can be found by clicking Preferences on the upper right hand corner of the screen, to the left of the Log Out link.

Title: Credit Card Auth # invalid
Description: CP391 Billing out a credit card sale and receive message "authorization is invalid" (on a non SPS card swipe location).
Solution:
"We can verify the first digits of the credit card number and the amount of digits for the credit card. Otherwise they will have to call the credit card company back.
MASTERCARD starts w/5 -       16 digits.
VISA                 starts w/4 -  13-16 digits.
AM EXPRESS  starts w/37 -     15 digits.
DISCOVER  starts w/6011 -      16 digits.
DINERS CLUB  starts w/3 -      14 digits.
GOODYEAR starts w/7753 -     16 digits.
CARTE BLANCHE starts w/9 -  14 digits."

Title: Network outage 11-4-14
Description: CP3912 End of days were not pulled in the night of 11/4/14 due to a network outage.
Solution:
Tuesday November 4, 2014 about 8:00 pm. a network switch inthe NorthWest Data Center (Oregon) caused connectivity issues for the mainframe with other platforms including :  MQ, B2BI, SAP, GBMS, etc

This issue was resolved about  3:30 am Wednesday morning but has caused dozens of mainframe jobs to be delayed several hours and out of sync.

Whsle Billing jobs have been affected are running hours behind schedule.  In order to make up some processing time the TirehQ deliveries from Tuesday have been held from processing.

Whlse Billing is estimated to be completed by about 8:00 am Wednesday.  This has affected these other functions to also be delayed :

the GROW process in AP0
the retail billing in RP0
the invoices to TireHQ
the invoices to Intellistore & WAC
the pending docs to the WOCLAN

The TireHQ deliveries from Tuesday that have been held out will be processed with the normal deliveries from Wednesday eveni

Title: Charge Excise tax on Govt billing
Description: CP392 How do I bill Federal Excise tax on a billing code G for government billing?
Solution:
"1) Start a POS invoice as normal.
2) On the merchandise verify screen type in the product code of the tire, the units, the price, in the B/C field type the G, and type the GS#, and press enter.
3) Type the line # of the tire and press enter.
4) Tab to the Excise tax field and type the EXACT amount of the excise tax and press enter.
NOTE: If the excise tax if not exact you will receive a message ""tax is invalid""
If you do not know the exact excise tax amount, from Main Menu type in the scid of PROD and type the product code of the tire and it will display the excise tax for that tire."

Title: Change Email Capture Settings
Description: CP3921 Location is in calling asking how they can get their system to quit asking for an email in every work order and/or appointment.
Solution:
To turn the email prompts on or off you have to go to the GBMS homepage > Admin drop down > Profile.

Once that page loads go to the Electronic Communications Profile.

On page one of the profile make sure that there is an email in the company email address field (the second open box on that page) and click the
?update profile? button.

After that is confirmed click on the ?Go To Customer Email Capture Profile Page 2? button.

On page 2 select the Classes of Business that emails should be captured and click the ?Update Profile? button again.

To have the changes take effect immediately you will have to run tomcat/sethttpd and reload the appointment schedule. Before running tomcat/sethttpd make sure that there is no one in the middle of an invoice since running that command will disrupt anyone working on anything.

Title: Communications down or not stable
Description:
CP3923 Communications are down or not stable. Site is on satellite backup or completely down.

***Comm Template***

Comms Down?
Is there a report open already?
Ping times:
Modem name:
Lights on modem:
What's the last item you can ping?
What troubleshooting did you do?
Details of issue:
Solution:
Ping pry - Is it on DSL, VSAT or timing out?

	If pry on DSL speeds, ping sw
		If sw is on DSL, fill in template, open ticket and send to HW/Comms
		If sw is timing out, reseat cable in LAN1 on Prysm and Port 26 on Procurve Switch. If sw still timing out, fill in template, open ticket and send to HW/Comms

	If pry on Satellite, reboot modem and Prysm. If still on satellite after reboot, fill in template, open ticket and send to HW/Comms

	If pry is timing out, ping pryp
		If pryp is pinging at DSL, pull the power on the Prysm and leave unplugged for 1 minute. If pry still timing out after reboot, open ticket and send to HW/Comms
		If pryp is pinging at Satellite, reboot modem and Prysm. If still on satellite after reboot, fill in template, open ticket and send to HW/Comms
		If pryp is timing out, reboot modem and Prysm. If still timing out, fill in template, open ticket and send to HW/Comms


NOTE: Preferred method to reboot modem and Prysm is first pull the power on the modem, leave unplugged for 10 seconds. Plug back in and wait for the DSL or Cable light to be solid then pull the power on the Prysm for 10 seconds. If DSL or Cable light continues to blink or does not light up, fill in template and send to HW/Comms.

Title: Credit Card Compliance
Description: CP3934 Why have my customers credit card information disappeared from my GBMS?
Solution:
In an effort to keep your business Payment Card Industry (PCI) compliant, and reduce your exposure to a possible credit card breach, please adhere to the following best practices:

          Do not store any credit card information within GBMS (message fields, email address field, or any other data field).

         Do not write a customer?s credit card number on a work order, invoice, or any other document.

         Do not imprint a copy of the credit card.

In order to help support keeping your business PCI compliant, GBMS will be scanning select fields for stored credit card data, and remove it on an automated basis. This action is to assist in eliminating uncompliant practices, which you may not be aware of, that are being conducted within your organization.

Title: Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise
Description: CP3935 When entering tire code, getting message "Customer unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise"
Solution:
"""Unauthorized to deliver this brand of merchandise"" is just that ... they are not authorized by Goodyear to deliver this brand/service (per -BAK- BRD AUT KEY  listed on screen 49).
In all cases they are to get with their area managers to either confirm that they are authorized to deliver that product/service, (and the CAB key needs changed), or the CAB key is correct and they are NOT authorized by Goodyear to deliver that product/service.  In the later case ... they would bill on their books. If they need a contact at the Region level ... direct them to Info>Region News>Contact list."

Title: How to check Element(PHH) cards to see if v
Description: CP3945 How do I check and Element(PHH) card to see if it is valid and what type of card it is?
Solution:
Telnet onto location and type in this command:
select * from phhccard where phhccnum='XXXXXXXXXX'; (X=last 10 digits of card)
It will show whether it is a valid card in system and whether it is a red or blue card.

Title: Veh History override on CVMNT
Description: CP3946 Cust vehicles keeps maxing out on his account and needs to be able to manage them.
Solution:
Cust veh mnt/cust mnt/ opt 1 revise-delete cust history - Tab down to the Vehicle History Ovr and put in amount of months they want to keep which was 12 and pressed enter. They need to press F1 so as not to delete what they did. Then they can F8 out.


I ran pgm MNTVHSTD to clear the vehicles over 12 mo and then ran pgm MNTVRNUM to renumber the vehicles. Now when we pull the customer up only showing 497 vehicles. This program run every night and will delete any vehicles past the number of months they chose to save

Title: New Goodyear Wholesale Questions
Description: CP3949 A user is calling in with a question about the changes that www.goodyearwholesale.com has undergone. See Resolution Details for more information. Please include the question that was asked in this ticket.  See Level 2/3 if unsure of answer.
Solution:
The new Goodyear Wholesale is laid out in much the same way as the new Tire-HQ with a few differences.

-Goodyear Wholesale only users will only have access to Tires & Ordering functions and training.

-Goodyear Wholesale login page now has a register link, that is controled by the Wholesale Centers

-Users can now combine Tire-HQ and Goodyear Wholesale usernames using the Register link on goodyearwholesale.com

Point user to the training document for future reference of the user.

Title: Kronos Login Isssues
Description:
CP3952 User can't login to Kronos from pc or manager pc.
Getting some type of java error.
Solution:
If you or a customer is having issues logging into Kronos, do the following:

Click start, go to control panel click on java 32 icon.

Under temporary internet files, click the Delete Files button.
At the next pop up just click ok. (First 2 of three boxes will be checked)
CLICK  OK

Close out of your java control panel.

Verify from control panel  ---  Programs and settings, that you just have one version of java,  Not higher than version 7  (Java 8 does not work!)

Close all programs and reboot your pc.

Kronos should now load, if not CALL 6-HELP! To get corrupted java version uninstalled and new version installed.

Title: French Speaking Caller
Description: CP3961 French Speaking caller on the line.
Solution:
FRENCH SPEAKING CALL PROCEDURE

If you receive a call from a French speaking customer, please follow this procedure:

1.	Ask the caller to please hold while your attempt to get a translator on the line.
2.	Call 6-5140 to conference in one of our French speaking InfoLink Call Agents (hours are 8 am -5 pm, Monday-Friday). The greeting will be in French for this call split.
3.	You will be connected to one of the following InfoLink Agents.
Haymi Holt (6-4106)
Ablaye Ndour (6-1885)
Moussa Yugo (6-6117)
*Please do not contact these Call Agents directly unless otherwise advised by them
4.	Please update the call ticket to reflect that you used the French Speaking Procedure, and what Infolink Agent Assisted on the call.
5.	The InfoLink Agent will assist with gathering all of the pertinent information needed regarding the issue. Please have the InfoLink Agent drop off the call if any extended research is needed. We do not want to keep the InfoLink Agent on the line any longer than is needed.
6.	When a customer call back is required, please call the InfoLink split first, then conference in the customer.

Title: Sales Stats Reprint
Description: CP3964 Reprint of Month End Sales Stats
Solution:
After Month End EOD has been run, sales statistics clear out old month accruals to prepare for the new month and there is no recovery of those numbers on GBMS. However the GBMS Report Writer program has, in the Sales folder, the "Sales Statistics by system date" report, which will create the report from a special-capture archived file in the system. It may be printed, copied to flash drive, or emailed.

1) Click on the Start button, select All programs
2) Click on GBMS Report Writer - password = admin
3) Click on the Sales folder
4) Double-click Sales Statistics by system date
5) Click the Values button and select the date needed, then click OK
6) Report will generate - at the top Click the icon for the out put options, printer pic, tab for copy to flash drive or letter for email

Title: Order Upload error code 0
Description: CP3966 User is attempting to place an order via the Order Upload function and getting error code 0 after clicking Place Order
Solution:
This is a known issue with Tire-HQ Order Upload when a user enters an RDD (Requested Delivery Date) and not entering a DNDB (Do Not Deliver Before) date.

The work-around to the issue at the moment is to enter in a DNDB date. If they ask what date they should put in, please explain that the DNDB date allows a time frame of dates to be entered between the DNDB and the RDD. If they do not care tell them they can enter tomorrow's date.

Please advise user of work-around and close the ticket.

Title: Ameraan short paid location
Description: CP400 Received a payment check from Ameraan and it is not the full amount.
Solution: If a location processes a tire claim at a higher retail price than originally sold, (ex: original tire sold at a locked in sale price) Ameraan will only pay claim based on the 'original' price not the 'current' price.  The policy letter is misleading as it says the claim will be based on current selling price or retail market price.  Any short payments by Ameraan to Acct 67 or 68 will be written off thru a journal ticket by Retail Accounting. Questions should be directed to Retail Accounting.

Title: California Battery Tax effective 4/1/2017
Description: CP4009 California Battery Tax effective 4/1/2017
Solution:
ATTENTION ALL LOCATIONS IN CALIFORNIA:

The state of California has enacted a lead acid battery tax of $1.00, effective 04/01/2017. The required changes have been made in GBMS and will be implemented on that date. Sales of batteries will generate the $1.00 battery tax in the totals section of the invoice. The only exemptions for this new tax/fee are sales for resale and replacement of a battery under a warranty.

GBMS Support Team

03/28/17 -the message above was placed on the home page of all stores and dealers in California. You may get some additional questions regarding battery and warranty codes.

 Stores:
Stores sell batteries under 034201
Stores adjust batteries under 034001


Dealers:
Can sell batteries under codes in department 201, Dealer Product codes (39x) tied to 201/660 pilot code for batteries, or if they are on PIMS can use 034201.
Can adjust batteries under 201100000 or 034201.

Title: Tire Finder Stuck Processing
Description: CP4039 Tire-HQ or Goodyear Wholesale gets stuck on processing when trying to search for a tire.
Solution:
Clear cache and cookies for the user's browser, close the browser completely, then open a new window.

ctrl+shift+delete will bring up the window to clear browsing data in all browsers.

Internet Explorer
1. Make sure preserve favorites website data is unchecked
2. Make sure Temporary Internet Files and Website Files is checked
3. Make sure cookies and website data is checked
4. Make sure everything else is unchecked
5. Press delete and wait for the spinning wheel on the cursor to stop
6. Close all browser windows
7. Open a new window

Google Chrome
1. Make sure you choose to delete the following items from the beginning of time
2. Make sure Cached images and files is checked
3. Make sure Cookies and other site data is checked
4. Make sure everything else is unchecked
5. Press clear browsing data and wait for the spinning wheel on the cursor to stop
6. Close all browser windows
7. Open a new window

Firefox
1. Make sure Timerange to clear is set to Everything
2. Make sure Cache is checked
3. Make sure Cookies is checked
4. Make sure everything else is unchecked
5. Press Clear Now and wait for the spinning wheel on the cursor to stop
6. Close all browser windows
7. Open a new window

Title: Foreign Brand Codes and DOT Registration
Description: CP4043 FB tire codes and registration - 1) What Foreign Brand (FB) codes does the location use? 2) How do Dealers register the DOTs for FB tires?
Solution:
1) RETAIL locations will look up the appropriate 668 or 669 code for POS and DRs.

DEALERS will use 046010 (auto) and 046011 (light truck) for DRs. For POS, Dealers should use codes from the Dealer Product File (DPF) when stocking, tracking and replenishing are required. Then, non-stocking codes 347(Auto), 348(Light Truck), and 349(Med Comm)-000XXX,  (where XXX= costs within $5 increments on Auto & Light Truck, $25 increments on Med Comm) are provided for In/Out with no stocking, tracking and replenishing when not required.

2) Dealers cannot register the DR's 046010 or 046011 used via Tire Regs option, as they are "service codes", no convention to do so at all...only as additional info message in the requirements panel or adding the info in the Serial Number field on the line or adding a line in Merchandise Verify. Dealers reconcile the inventory ( INV B & S reduction + JT's to offset Sales/COS 33900/43900 to tire dept Sales/COS 309-312/40900-4120000 ) for GP in corrected $$ categories.POS docs - The DPF's when piloted to 660XXXXXX or Goodyear codes and/or the 668-669 codes allow the user to use Tire Regs option, but are not required to (no prompt) - they have to actively remember to do so themselves.

Title: Sonsio Road Hazard w/o Selling a Tire
Description: CP409 How do I bill out a road hazard without selling a tire?
Solution:
" 1. Start document on POS as CASH, AR, or CREDIT CARD.
 2. Enter new customers name or pull up name from customer history.
 3.  Select vehicle when entering the customer information screen.
 4.  On the work order or merchandise verify screens, type the code 092206, tab, type the selling price of  the road hazard,  press enter.
 5. The selling price of the road hazard is 10% of the tire to be covered by the warranty with a minimum of  $6 for a tire that sells for $60 or less.
 6.  After you have entered the mechanic number on the service screen, the system will go to the tire registration screen.
 7.  Type the registration number of the tire the road hazard warranty will cover.  The description on the tire registration screen will be  'ROAD HAZARD'.
 8.  If you are selling more than one road hazard without selling a tire, the tire registration screen will prompt for a DOT number for each tire.
 9. Go to document total screen and finalize the document."

Title: Sonsio - Billing downgraded tire
Description: CP412 Processing an Sonsio Adjustment Type W and replacing the original tire with a lesser priced tire.  How do you give the customer credit and how does this affect billing to Sonsio?
Solution:
"The charge to Sonsio is based on the replacement price of the original tire ONLY.  The document should be billed as a Corporate Issue Refund to the customer.  The store will receive credit for the original tire from Ameraan on
Acct #67."

Title: Sonsio - 092206 Error Message
Description: CP413 CANNOT TELL WHICH TIRE TO ASSOCIATE WITH ROAD HAZARD, message displays on screen.
Solution: If 092206 code is entered separately instead of entering Y in the RH field on the tire line, the screen will display this message.  To correct, bring each    tire line down on merchandise verify and type Y in the RH field so that the code will automatically generate and identify with the tire which is being sold.  Delete the 092206 code manually entered to the screen.

Title: 106 Support Account Reconciliation report
Description: CP424 Inquiries on 106 Support Account Reconciliation report.
Solution:
"1) This report reflects the difference between average cost and selling price as a debit for the dealer and the difference between acquisition cost as a credit from WOC.
2) Account 10600 may have minor differences which:
IF a CREDIT balance, could be journal ticketed to Cost of Sales as a PROFIT.
IF a DEBIT balance, could be journal ticketed to Cost of Sales as a LOSS.
3) If the debit balance is extremely large, it could mean that some tires were costed at B-300 prices before any average cost was established.  In this case there would be an average cost adjustment at month end from the stock ledger which would go to gross profit.
4) If it is a large debit balance which has accummulated over several years,
offset with reserve for inventory loss or 42800, Merchandise over and short - Cycle A."

Title: Edits for Canada National Accts
Description:
CP428 I am having a problem with a requirement edit on Canadian national accts, highlighted field is in error, call support.
TC75
Solution:
Go to WAD and type in the Canadian National Account Non-sig and choose screen 24.
Notate the 4 digit number in the BB - MAN REF NO  XXXX
Go to the WAZ screen and type in this 4 digit# in the N/A Page field and the Non-Sig #.

This should take you to the requriements for the national account.

Title: ALPHA SEARCH ACCOUNTS UNDER 100
Description: CP440 CANNOT DO AN ALPHA SEARCH ON AN ACCOUNT # THAT IS UNDER 100  (EXAMPLE  -   CAS WARRANTY)
Solution:
"TO SEARCH ON AN ACCOUNT UNDER 00100 (SUNDRIES ACCOUNTS) , IN THE SEARCH NAME PRESS THE SPACE BAR AND THEN ENTER THE NAME OR PORTION OF THE NAME.
THE TRADE STYLE FOR ANY OF THE A/R ACCOUNTS UNDER ACCT # 100 HAS ALWAYS HAD ONE SPACE IN FRONT OF THE TRADE NAME.  THIS IS INTENTIONAL AND WAS FOR THE PURPOSE OF FORCING THESE KINDS OF ACCOUNTS TO PRINT FIRST WHEN PRINTED ALPHABETICALLY."

Title: DMS - Inventory correction - screen only
Description: CP441 Inventory correction - screen only
Solution:
"ENTER IN THE DIFFERENCE.
EXAMPLE IF SALESAID SHOWS 5 AND YOU ACTUALLY HAVE 8 YOU WOULD ENTER 3.  IF SALESAID SHOWS  - 2 AND YOU ACTUALLY HAVE 5 YOU WOULD ENTER 7.  IF SALESAID IS IN A NEGATIVE STATE THAN YOUR DIFF YOU ENTER HAS TO INCLUDE COMNG UP FROM THE NEG AMT  TO 0  THAN WHAT EVER THE COUNT IS HAS TO BE ADDED TO THAT."

Title: Visa I.M.P.A.C. credit card for government accts
Description: CP442 How do I make the Visa I.M.P.A.C. credit card for government accounts tax exempt?
Solution:
"The Visa IMPAC card is a Federal Govt credit card and should be billed as a COB 4. On the document total screen press F4 (change options) and tab to the last field, tax status, and type a 3 (for exempt, which is for sales tax only, all Federal Agencies pay fed excise tax) press enter..
The tax exempt option screen will display, type in the option from the choices given, (Federal government,) press enter."

Title: Order/Receive parts from Chrysler/Toyota
Description: CP47 IMS location trying to order/receive Chrysler parts from local dealer.  System will not accept vendor number 7058 (Corporate Vendor # - Chrysler)
Solution:
"7058 is the Corporate Vendor for Chrysler in Detroit. .  A location never does anything with Chrysler in Detroit ,they order and receipt parts from a local dealer.  Prior to ordering/receipting parts from the local dealer:

1.  Go to Vendor Maintenance for the local dealer vendor #.
2.  Tab to the ""Corp Vend"" field and type in 7058 (Chrysler)   Press enter.

This will generate a ""Y"" in the ""Corp Pay"" field.  This number associates the local vendor with the corporate vendor number so that no payable lines are created when working with this vendor."

Title: SPS - END OF DAY
Description: CP473  I tried to process EOD and received message "Batch was empty - No Audit Trail printed".  Why?
Solution: The location has not processed any credit card transactions since their last End of Day that need to be sent through for processing.

Title: BILLING OUT A CREDIT  CARD
Description: CP476 How do I bill out major credit cards?
Solution:
"1.  Type employe # on POS screen, TAB to Option.
2.  Type appropriate credit card symbol: M, V, P, etc.
3.  Select customer in the usual manner.
4.  To bill out credit card on Customer Work Order Screen, type ""Y"" in the Cred Card Options Field, ENTER.
5.  F1 SWIPE CARD (if using Magtek reader, swipe either from the left or right, with magnetic bar facing you; if using Pinpad reader, swipe from left to right, with magnetic bar away from you).
6.  The screen will prompt you for the last 4 digits of credit card number. Type numbers and press ENTER.
7.  F4 KEY ENTRY will allow manual entry of credit card.
8.  F8 RETURN removes the pop-up window.  Completing any of the above options will return you to the Customer Work Order screen to complete the document.
9.  IF YOU ARE USING GOODYEAR CREDIT CARD:  You will receive additional options:  SELECT F1 CREDIT CARD ENTRY; SELECT F2 OPEN TO BUY (which will allow you to view $ open to buy).
10. Bill out merchandise and/or services.
11. Proceed to document total, PRESS F5 PRINT.
12. If you DID NOT enter credit card info on Cust Work Order screen, window will pop up for the entry. F1 SWIPE allows reduced rate; type the last 4 digits of the credit card, ENTER; F4 KEY ENTRY allows manual entry; F8 RETURN returns you to the Document Total screen.
13. After successful swipe of card, modem will dial to SPS; screen will display PROCESSING AUTHORIZATION REQUEST, PLEASE WAIT.  If approved, document will automatically print out.  If declined ""AUTHORIZATION DECLINED-SELECT (CHANGE OPTION), (SAVE), OR (VOID)"" will display."

Title: EPX - CASH BACK
Description: CP478 How do I give customer cash back?
Solution:
"1.  Bill out customer following Debit Card procedure.
2.  At Document Total, BEFORE YOU PRESS F5 PRINT, press F8 ALT KEYS.
3.  Press F1 CC OPTIONS.
4.  A pop-up window will display for DEBIT CASH BACK.
5.  Type amount of cash customer requires.
6.  Press ENTER.
7.  Debit Cash Back will appear in top field with Debit Card Total at the bottom of window.
8.  Press F8 RETURN.
9.  Document Total Screen will show $ Amount Charged and Change Due.
10. Press F5 Print.
11. Pop-up window will display ""Please Swipe Card Now"".
12. Swipe card, magnetic strip down, facing away, left to right (within ten seconds).
13. If you take more than ten seconds, you will receive a ""TIME OUT ERROR"" on the screen.
14. Answer ""Y"" to swipe card again.
15. Satellite will dial to EPX and authorization will appear on Document Total Screen.
16. Final document will print out automatically.
17. If card is rejected, must finish prompts on screen and then void or change payment type."

Title: Parts-Pending line for local Chrysler/Toyota deale
Description: CP48 PIMS location has a pending line for local Chrysler/Toyota dealer for parts that were ordered/receipted using the local vendor number instead of the Corporate vendor number (7058-Chrysler or 7064-Toyota)
Solution:
"The local vendor number should be set up with the Corporate Vendor number in the ""CORP VEND"" field on vendor maintenance.  Take the following steps to correct the locations inventory, manifest and setting up the local vendor properly.

To offset the incorrect pending line:
 1.  Select the line and press F9 (Line Detail).
 2.  Press F3 to move cursor to the write in area at the bottom of the screen.
 3.  Enter a (-) credit entry for the parts listed above so that the net of the lines is zero ($00).
 4.  Press F7 to save.
 5.  Type ""S"" to save.
The above steps has corrected the locations inventory.

To correct the manifest:
 1.  From the pending parts screen type a ""V"" at the beginning of the line to be voided (this is effective week of 1/8/95).
Lines must be voided individually, repeat this for the next line.

To correct the local parts vendor:
 1.  Go to Vendor Maintenance for the local Chrysler/Toyota Vendor.
 2.  Tab to the ""CORP VEND"" field and type in 7058 (Chrysler) or 7064 (Toyota).  Press enter.

This will generate a ""Y"" in the ""CORP PAY"" field.  This number associates the local vendor with the Corporate Vendor number so that no payable lines are created when working with this vendor."

Title: CHECK DOWN PAYMENT
Description: CP484 Check down payment ..How do I process an invoice with a check used for payment of total or as a down payment on credit card?
Solution:
"1. At Main Menu type POS or ""1"" for  Option 1, ENTER.
2. Type employee #,TAB.
3. Type number for payment type, ENTER.
4. Complete Work Order screen and bill merchandise/services as usual.
5. Go to Document Total Screen.
6. Type $ amount of check in check field (whether you are making a down payment on credit card or processing a cash invoice).
7.  Press F8 ALT KEYS.
8.  Press F1 CC OPTIONS.
9.  A pop-up window will display for CHECK VERIFICATION.
10. Question will display: do you want to authorize check?
11. Answer Y and press ENTER.
12. Type check number, TAB.
13. Type Driver's license number, TAB.
14. Type Driver's license state, ENTER.
15. Press F1 Authorize.
16. The system will dial outfor authorization and pass the authorization number to the document.
17. Press F5 PRINT and the document will finalize if cash sale or proceed to generate another pop-screen for credit card information or dial to SPS for credit card authorization if credit card sale."

Title: Finalized Parts Manifest to wrong Vendor
Description: CP49 PIMS location finalized parts payment manifest to wrong vendor.
Solution:
"If the location finalized manifest to the wrong vendor there is no way to correct this in PIMS.  They must call retail Accounts Payable in Akron (1-700-446-1937) immediately to void the check.

To correct inventory for this transaction without affecting payables again they must do a write-in entry for credit units to the corporate parts vendor:
 1.  Go to Parts-Receipt of Merchandise (PROM).
 2.  Choose option 1 (list pending receipts).  Press enter.
 3.  Type in Vendor # and press F9 (Line Detail).
 4.  In the ""SHIP #"" field, type: CORRECTPPAYS
      This identifies this entry as a correction.
 5.  Enter (-) units, the manufacturer, part#, etc.
 6.  Press F8 to save.

Now the location can do a write in entry for the part to the correct vendor."

Title: TIRE TRADE-INS
Description:
CP492 "TIRE TRADE-IN  PROF Indicator
How do I turn program on?"
Solution:
"1. Type 5 (PERS) on Main Menu screen.
    Enter.
2. Type 1 (PROF) on Administration
    screen, Enter.
3. Press F1 Next Screen.
4. Tab to Trade-in Inventory Control
    Y/N.
5. Type Y, Enter.
6. Screen will say ""File has been
    updated"".
6. Press F8 End"

Title: Tire Trade-in
Description: CP495 Tire Trade-in  Explanation of program benefits.
Solution:
"1.  You will be able to keep unit inventory control on trade-ins.
2.   Sales statistics will not be reduced by the amount of the trade.
3.   Traded merchandise, excluding casings, will NOT be average  costed - they will be standard costed.
4.   Casings and dealer product codes associated to a casing (department 256) will always be average costed."

Title: SPS - VOICE AUTHORIZATION
Description: CP506 Location has a voice authorization for a credit card purchase.  Cursor will not go to approval number field.  How to process?
Solution:
"If work order HAS NOT been printed, press F8 (Alt FKeys), then F4 (Manual).  Enter manual doc, date, & amt...cursor will then go to auth # field.
If work order HAS been printed, they will have to start a new manual invoice.
INSTRUCTIONS FOR MANUAL DOC
Advised need to start inv as manual doc (void original).  Enter emp # opt PM( P=Gdyr M=Manual) pull up the customer and billing him out as usual. On doc total will ask for original doc/date(doc voided)  Manual amt(amount to be charged to the credit card.  Enter in CC#, appproval number and tab up to downpayment and enter in the down payment & press enter. Amount to be charged is what should be in Manual amount.   Print"

Title: BOX TOP AUDIT TRAIL REPRINT
Description:
CP518 - GTRACS: Box Top Audit Trail did not print. How do I reprint?


THIS CP PERTAINS ONLY TO THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS STILL USING THE OLD OPENROAD RETREAD SYSTEM: 7353, E137, E264, E360, E658."
Solution:
"** IMPORTANT ** This procedure should only be done if instructed to do so by Support 2,  Development or Infrastructure

1. Go into Inventory Reports/Lists.

2. Choose Raw Materials.

3. Choose Option 6, Usage Report (Kardex).

4. Starting and Ending Retread Shop =1, skip over item number and tread size.

5. Select Summary Option.

6. For categories, use Selected Categories.

7. Enter ""Y"" for Tread and ""Y"" for Supply if you receipted in Cushion Gum.

8. For date, enter Range, then enter the starting and ending date for the day's report that you need to reprint.

9. Make sure the printer selection is correct.

10. Accept the form."

Title: Core value is showing a value of $.00
Description: CP52 Core value is showing a value of zero.
Solution:
"The reason a core has a value of zero is that when processing the core return, the ""RTND"" core value was entered as ""00"".  This can't be overridden on the pending payable line.

The initial entry on the pending core return screen displays an ""EXPECT"" value which is the value that the system/triad thinks the core is worth.
When the user enters a return quantity for this line, he can override the ""RTND"" field, which is the value that the vendor is giving him for the core.  This must be accurate."

Title: CHECK AUTH
Description: CP522 EPX - How do I process checks through the GBMS terminal ?
Solution:
"On ""Document Total"" screen:   (see link at bottom for EPX TeleCheck process)
01. Press  F8 key (Alt fkeys)
02. Press F1 (CC Options)
03. Type the check #, drivers lic#, state of issue(eg OHIO = OH)
04. Type other info such as a date of  birth if asked.
05. Press F1 to authorize
06. Press F5 to complete the document, if check has been approved.
If this is a company check, omit the check number that will appear in the MACRO number (at the bottom of check)
The Auth will print on the invoice on the top left side under the ""Salesman #"" line.  The location should still write whatever information on the check, that they wrote before."
Notes://AHQNA004/85256BDF004F160E/DA70DABF23CCDAA985256761006A3A10/B5F6D5CBC29EA30085257A4F004CD0AD

Title: GOODYEAR CARD
Description: CP531 - How to get an "Open to Buy" on a Goodyear Credit Card.
Solution:
Updated for EPX - 11/26/14

"01. Get into POS
02. Enter EMPL #.
03. Type P (enter)
04. Enter the Customer name
05. Type Y at the ""CRED Card Options""  (enter)
06. Press F1 to swipe card, or F4 for ""key-entry""
07. Swipe the credit card
08. go back up to cc options and make it a "Y"
09. Now you will get the option to check  the open to buy.
The system will dial out & the open to buy will appear on the screen when complete."

Title: List Price is incorrect on P/L Verify
Description: CP54 Pims location shows an incorrect list price on Parts/Labor Verify after selecting the part from the Parts/Labor Catalog.
Solution:
"The incorrect price is probably due to a pricing difference between the suggested list (CML) at the time the part was received into inventory, and the current triad price.

As long as the service code entered is CML/FR (not a pre-priced package), the price of the part can be changed on P/L Verify.  Bring the line down, and override the part price."

Title: Sonsio - Transfer Payment Discrepancy
Description:
CP540  Sonsio Transfer Payment Discrepancy..
Goodyear Store has received payment on his Sonsio  Account #67 but he does not know where to apply it, no lines match it."
Solution:
"1. Check the Account on the TPX IAC screen.
2. If you agree the transfer does not
match lines on the screen and looks like a mistake, have store call:
Chris Adams, Retail Accounting at
330-796-1308 per Dave Johnson."

Title: How to print PM from workorder
Description: CP551 How do you print the preventative maintenance from customer workorder screen?
Solution:
"1) First you must select a vehicle.
2) Then tab to the PM field and type a ""Y"" and press enter.
3) This will drive screen to Triad catalog.
4) Screen should display the Catalog look-up file - arrow down to the Major Service Intervals and press enter.
5) Answer the engine query and press enter.
6) Identify the mileage interval by line# and type the ""perform"" line # and press f12, to post it.
7) Hit the esc key twice.
8) Answer the question, to print now (Y or N) and press enter.
9) If you answer Y, the print should occur immediately, then return to workorder screen.
10) If you answer N, the system will change the ""N"" to a ""P"", flagging the document to print the selected interval advice after the workorder is printed."

Title: Did not receive month end reports
Description: CP552 Did not receive a month end report that they normaly receive in the mail
Solution:
"Go to the TPX screen and select option AKSARCRD (EXSPRESS REPORTS DISTRIBUTION)  Order copies of the missing report(s) per instructions in the desk top proceedures in lotus notes.
The reports are printed out on the lazer printer and sent to us from WOC.
When we receive the reports mail them to the dealer."

Title: Changeover condition codes
Description:
CP555 "Changeover condition codes
How do I process an employee/retiree changeover and what condition codes are used?"
Solution:
"Condition codes:
0 = First class
1 = Overage (OA)
2 = Foreign Brand (FB)
3 = Changeover (CO) - or - Customer   Owned Casing ( retread sale)
4 = Foreign Changeover (SU - Slighly  used)

Use the product code for the original tires + the appropriate condition code, minus the # of units(4) and use billing code ""E"" for the credit of tires at 25% off of B300. Then sell new tires as normal, difference in downgrade or upgrade $$$, to the customer responsibility, as debit or credit amounts."

Title: Needs Acct Code detail curr mo
Description: CP558 Needs detail of an accounting code for the current month
Solution:
"Go to the Dealer Accounting System (ZAG) on the TPX menu and hit enter.
Select option 5 General Ledger Inquiry and hit enter.  enter in the Terr number of the dealer and the current date YYMM and the 5 digit accounting code and hit enter.  Give the location the detail on the screen.  If the dealer wants a copy hit the print icon on the top of the screen to print and get their fax phone number to fax it to them."

Title: Receipt of Wheels
Description: CP559 How to receipt wheels into inventory. (eg "Prime" wheels.)
Solution: The retail location is to use code 226010000 instead of the code listed on the Goodyear document.  If wheels are NOT option costed, the system will automatically use a cost of 80% RSP.

Title: List Price is incorrect on Parts Aid
Description: CP56 PIMS Location showing incorrect List Price  on Parts Aid.
Solution:
"The incorrect price is probably due to a key entry problem at the time the part was receipted (A decimal point entered in the wrong place or the part was entered without considering the core).

To correct the pricing on Parts Aid, go to Parts Receipt of Merchandise and use the AAAD Vendor so as not to create a payable line.  Do a write-in entry to remove the part at the incorrect price and then a second entry to add the part at the correct price."

Title: F9 Cust/Veh search on Delivery Receipt (DR)
Description:
CP561 Don't have F9 Search CUS/VEH on Delivery Receipt (DR)
67, 71, 73, 74, 75, 79
Solution:
"Type DRADM from Option/Scid
Enter 1 for D/R History Admin or type DRHST from Option/Scid
Type a Y in (  ) by RETAIN HISTORY Y/N?
Press Enter to Save.
F8 exit.

Now Delivery Reciept Customer History is being captured and available for the "Search" function on TC 67,71,73,74,75,79.

Title: Questions on GDYR Billing document
Description: CP564 Questions on a Goodyear billing document
Solution: For checking on apparent errors on Goodyear billing documents Advised call the WOC Customer Relations Dept on phone number 330-796-9200 or 330-796-6640

Title: Freight Claims
Description: CP566 Procedure for handling a freight claim
Solution:
Issue a delivery receipt TC 71; complete following information on designated screen
Emp# and TC 71 (NO delivery commission)
Customer/Terr 194980 (Non-sig)
Credit Auth# B-96
Purchase Order# is the R3# which is 10 digits starting with 00 that is showing on their WDR

Customer Information  Bill to: Logistic Concepts
                                              2210 Front St
                                               Cuyahoga Falls, OH44221
Ship to: Same as above

Driver name
Phone number
Sales aid/Mdse verify enter product code,units


Telephone: 330-945-4545
Fax: 330-945-4547
2210 Front St
Cuyahoga Falls, Oh  44221"

Title: List Price is incorrect on Parts Aid
Description: CP57 PIMS location showing an incorrect price on Parts Aid.
Solution:
"The incorrect price is probably due to a key entry problem at the time the part was receipted (A decimal point entered in the wrong place or the part was entered without considering the core).

To correct the pricing on Parts Aid, go to Parts Receipt of Merchandise and use the AAAD Vendor so as not to create a payable line.  Do a write-in entry to remove the part at the incorrect price and then a second entry to add the part at the correct price."

Title: Wants copy of service cost factors
Description: CP581 Wants a copy of the service costing factors faxed to him
Solution:
"Go TPX screen ZAG option (Dealer Accounting System) chose option 2 (Service Costing Factors) .  Chose option 1 (List costing factors) type in territory number in Terr field hit enter and make a screen print.
Get locations FAX phone number and fax them their service costing factors"

Title: Print Labels
Description: CP584 How do we print labels for customers
Solution:
"Choose option 14 - CUST/VEHICLE MANAGEMENT (CVMGT) under Administration option.
Choose option 3 - CUSTOMER LISTING.
Choose the type of Customer: (    )
1  A/R Customers
2  Cash Customers
3  Both Types

Choose the CLASS OF BUSINESS  (   )
1  Dealer
2  Consumer
3  Budget
4  Commercial
7  Revolving

Choose any other options and press enter.  MEssage at bottom of screen should say Validation  Is Complete
Press F4 Print Labels
Enter Printer feed type:
F=Front Feed
P=Pin Feed
Load labels
F1 to Align Print
F3 to Print by Name
F7 to Print by Zip Code
F2 to Cancel Print"

Title: Employee A/R Pmt via payroll deduction
Description: CP585 Dealer employee has A/R debit balance on location's books and dealer wants to pay off via payroll deductions.
Solution:
When issuing payroll check to employee,
 1) deduct payment for account by crediting code 26600 Payroll Deductions,
2) issue A/R jt against employee acct, cr 10100 and cr 26600,
3) process zero cash receipt, offsetting jt cr line with appropriate dr line and print receipt.

Title: TC 56 - COO Expense code
Description: CP592 TC 56 Expense code is invalid error on DR
Solution: Should be just 12 digits starting with 111.   Do not put - ( dashes ) in.

Title: FAX month-end Jt before closing
Description: CP595  Need to FAX month end journal entries for closing.
Solution: Advised dealer of time frame in which to get Jt. FAXed into GBMS Accounting, along with the FAX phone number (330) 796-3004.

Title: CHECK AUTH
Description: CP615  Adding check authorization OR  Dealer isn't getting the "Check" window when they press F1 (CC Options)
Solution:
"Have the dealer do the following:
01. Return to the Main Menu
02. Type spsup
03. Type 3 (tab)
04. Type in the floor limit when prompted
NOTE:  $0 means the system will not automatically prompt for check authorization....location must chose appropriate option on doc total.  $1 means the system will prompt for all checks over $1; $20 means the system will prompt for all checks over $20, etc.
05. Press enter.
06. Type q (to quit) when given the option.
07. Take all terminals out of Point of Sale.
08. When they go back into Point of Sale they will now have the check guarantee feature."

IF Still not working send the report to "Support Bucket".

Title: GTRAC 'transmit condition parallel prot print erro
Description: CP617 error message 'transmit condition parallel port print error'
Solution: The system has detected a problem with the printer.  1.  If the printer is off/line, hit the green start/stop button.  If the printer is out of paper, reload paper and make sure printer is on line.  2.  If the message is still on the screen after activating the printer, hit the SHIFT/CTRL/TAB keys in that order to clear the screen.  If the printer is still having problems, the error message will return.

Title: GTRAC End of Month reports did not print
Description: CP618 GTRAC End of Month reports did not print
Solution: If the location delayed running the month end B50 until the next day, the Gtrac reports that would normally print automatically at EOD will not print.  They will have to go into GTRACS and print them manually.

Title: ERROR 'Tread can only be changed at build or final
Description: CP619 ERROR 'Tread can only be changed at build or final'
Solution: If this error is received, they must either go to the build checkpoint or the final inspection checkpoint to change the tread design for that item.

Title: How to reprint 'Employee Checkpoint Analysis'
Description: CP620 How do I reprint the 'Employee Checkpoint Analysis' report?
Solution: From the GTRACMAN main menu, choose the Shop Reporting option.  Then choose option 16 and select BY EMPLOYEE.  Select ALL employees.  Enter the date of the report needed for the starting and ending date.  Select either DETAIL or SUMMARY method and then verify that the printer selection is correct.

Title: How to reprint 'Checkpoint Productivity'
Description: CP621 How do I reprint the 'Checkpoint Productivity' report.
Solution: From the GTRACMAN main menu, choose 'Shop Reporting'.  Then choose 'By Checkpoint'.  Select ALL checkpoints.  Enter the date of the report needed for the starting and ending date.  Select either DETAIL or SUMMARY method and verify that the printer selection is correct.

Title: How to reprint 'Retread Shop Monthly Performance S
Description: CP623 How to reprint 'Retread Shop Monthly Performance Summary'.
Solution: From the GTRACMAN main menu, select Shop Reporting.  Choose the option for 'Retread Shop Monthly Performance Summary'.  Accept 'Shop 1' which will generate 'yymm'.  Enter the date and choose F4  to print.

Title: How to reprint 'Production Audit Trail'
Description: CP624 How to reprint 'Production Audit Trail'.
Solution: The 'Production Audit Trail' cannot be reprinted.  However, the next best report to use in its place would be the 'Production Summary by Tire Size'.  From the GTRACMAN menu, choose 'Shop Reporting'.  From this menu, choose 'Production Reporting' and accept the Starting and Ending Retread plant numbers that generate. Select ALL for the tire size and select a RANGE for the date.  Enter the starting and ending date that you need for the report and verify that the printer selection is correct.

Title: How to reprint the 'Daily Production Summary'
Description: CP625 How do I reprint 'Daily production Summary'
Solution: From the GTRACMAN menu, choose the option for 'Shop Reporting.  Select the option for 'Production Reports'.  Accept the Starting and Ending Store that generates.  Select the Time Period and verify the printer selection.  This will give you the weekly production summary and it will show each day also.

Title: Message/PC Generation - Deletions
Description: CP630 How do I stop service or product codes from generating on Point of sale invoices?
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu, select the option for Product Administration.
2) Select the option for Message/PC Generation.
3) Select the appropriate file that is generating the product or service code in error.
4) In that file, select the line # to delete and press enter, to bring down the line data.
5) Press the F7 Delete key.
6) Press F7 again to confirm and delete the line, or press F8 to exit & not delete the line."

Title: Curser in upper left corner
Description: CP637 My screen has cursor in upper left corner but nothing else is on the screen.
Solution:
"01. Press enter twice.
02. Type exit
03. Press enter
04. Type exit
05. Press enter
06. Ctrl \  (press ctrl key & backslash together)
If this does not solve the problem have them refer to their GTRACS manual (Hardware setup - forth page) and run thru setup for base unit."

Title: SPS - DIRECT DEPOSIT
Description: CP638 SPS - Direct Deposit Invalid COB to Old House Acct that is now SPS... I have a direct deposit to make to my old credit card account but the screen says Invalid class of business for transaction type...what is procedure?
Solution:
"The screen is giving this message because his COB of M or V or R, etc is now set up for an SPS account 51, 52, 53, etc. He is trying to reconcile the old account 21, 26, etc. He must do the following:
1. Type AR or ""10"" on Main Menu, Enter.
2. Type AROPT or ""02"", Enter.
3. Type Emp # Tab Type 7 Journal Tickets, Enter.
4. Type Account #, Enter.
5. Type Reason ""to close out invoices
on old Mastercard Acct, etc,"" Enter.
6. Type Total $ Amt (direct deposit plus any adjustments) as Credit; ie... "" -2000, etc"", Enter. Screen will show $ Amt as Credit.
7. Type Code 10000, TAB, Type Net
Amount being applied to Account,
Enter.
8. Type Code 10100, TAB, Type Adj
Amount being applied to Account,
Enter. These two amounts will show as a Debit on Screen and will equal
the credit amount.
9. Press F7 Print/End Twice."

Title: Quantity is incorrect on Tire Order
Description: CP639 How do I change the quantitys on the tire order if I havent finalized the order.
Solution:
"01. Type the line number of the product code needing altered.
02. Tab to QTY field, type correct count
03. Press enter"

Title: Add a sub accounting code
Description: CP644 Wants to add, revise or delete  an accounting sub code
Solution: Go to Main Menu and choose option DAS maintenance then choose option Chart of accounts then choose the appropriate option for the type of accounting code that the dealer wants to work with.  If they want to add a code then in the prime field type the prime account three digit number  then in the acct field type in the prime and two digit sub code ex 42985,  then enter the description then hit enter.  This sets up the new sub accounting code.  If they want to revise a code back space and put the line number of the code to revise hit enter and this pulls the code down where they can make revisions - when done hit enter, this revises the code.  If they want to delete a sub code tab back to line and put the line numbe in and then put a d in the acct dield hit enter, this will delete the code.

Title: Scheduled hours
Description: CP648 Error message "Date has to be greater than or equal to .. today's date"
Solution: Location was receiving that msg due to the fact that they had already finalized hours...the schedule should be printed before hours are finalized....therefore, locc must alter the date to the next week ending date. JP 11/03/97

Title: Wheel corrections
Description: CP650 How do I correct incorrect qtys of wheels on a G874.
Solution: Per CP 559, wheels are inventoried as 2260100000, so corrections will use this same acct number as well.

Title: Wants a check back for cash inv processed previoul
Description: CP656 Customer wants a quick check for a cash invoice processed previous day.
Solution:
Process two point of sale invoices, the first one a credit invoice canceling the original cash invoice, then process an invoice billing the cust credit card or AR.
The end of day will be over so accept the overage.
Now process a quick check to the customer and code the check 50800 the EOD over short account.
The EOD overage credits 50800 and debits cash for the overage, the quick check credits cash  debits the 50800.  the 50800 account offsetts to zero.

Title: How to print a customer list
Description: CP661 Wants to print a customer list
Solution: Adv on the menu scid type in clist and enter - this brings up the customer list screen fill in the blanks as to what the type of customers etc they want on the list and print it.

Title: Print a customers vehicle list
Description: CP679 How can we print a customers vehicle list?
Solution:
"Choose the Administration option
Choose the Customer/Vehicle Management option.
Choose option for ADD/REVISE/DELETE Vehicle.
Enter the customer number/search.
Press F5 Print Vehicles."

Title: Changing from AR to another type of payment.
Description: CP691 I don't have an authorization to put in the A/R field on the work order screen. What can I type there to get to the document total screen to finalize the document?
Solution:
Company Owned Outlets
Will need to void the document if they do NOT want it to be an AR. Retail will not allow the word CREDIT to be used anymore in the approval field.  If it truly is an AR sale, then they would call Credit Center for an approval.

DEALERS
Type in the word CREDIT in the auth field.  Change the form of payment on document total by Pressing F4 change options and tabbing to the account field and type in the word CASH,  or if changing to credit card, tab to POS and enter in the card type. (V, M etc)

Title: Print SPR (Special Price Reserve)
Description: CP695 How do we print the special price reserve?
Solution:
"From Main Menu
1.Choose option for Inventory    Administration. (INVAD)
2.Choose the option for Reports    and Inquiries. (RPINQ)
3.Choose the option for Sales    aid/Invent Rpts.(SARPT)
4.Type X in brackets (  ) by Spec Price    Reserve.
5.Press F5 to Begin Printing"

Title: Intra-Company Reconciliation
Description: CP710 How to reconcile intra-company accounts?
Solution: At EACH location, not from corporate, write off the lesser of the 2 balances of the intra-company accounts (10200-Intra-co receivables; 25100-intra-co payables,) offsetting against the larger one.  This will leave a balance only on one of the accounts at any given location.  Comparing the results after each Jt has been written, the location(s) with the payable balance owes the location(s) with the balance in the receivable account.  Dealership may let figures ride, they can payoff the balances to the receivable locations via check, or corp. can Jt funds from the cash accounts of the owing locations.

Title: Inventory Correction - book and screen
Description: CP711 Wants to do a book and screen inventory adjusting entry - and correct cost.
Solution:
"1) From Main Menu, select Inventory Administration.
2) Select Inventory Corrections.
3) Select the number of option for your correction type( Book,Screen or Both).
4) Type the Product Code to correct and tab to quantity, enter + or - units to add/subtract to back out the incorrect posting ( also enter the cost if making a book correction). Press enter.
5) Type in the corrective line, adding back to product code with correct count/costs. Press enter.
6) Press F5 Print/Final."

Title: Reserve or Inventory Loss & Obsolescence reconcili
Description: CP712 What codes to use and how to reconcile Inventory Reserve account at year end ?
Solution: Issue Std Jt., Dr 15200, Reserve for Inventory Loss & Obsolescence and Cr 42800, Merchandise Over/Short-Cycle "A."

Title: Goodyear Statement copy
Description: CP719 Needs copy of Goodyear Statement from Credit dept.
Solution: "They can contact their credit rep. in WOC with the name & phone number listed on the bottom of either their mailed statement or the one in the DL2/GBMS system.

Title: To verify EOD has finalized in GTRACS
Description:
CP725 - How can I verify that the End of Day, week or month has been run on GTRACS?


THIS CP PERTAINS ONLY TO THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS STILL USING THE OLD OPENROAD RETREAD SYSTEM: 7353, E137, E264, E360, E658."
Solution:
"** IMPORTANT ** This procedure should only be done if instructed to do so by Support 2,  Development or Infrastructure.

1.  Login into GTRACS using 'GTRACMAN' (can do this by VNC to terminal at location, select GBMS, GTRACS, GTRACMAN).

2.  Choose Opt. 5  Retread Shop Order Processing

2.  Choose Opt. 12  EOD processing

3.  Choose Opt. 1 (enter)
A dialog box appears with the following message:
'YOU ARE ABOUT TO RUN A CRITICAL PROCEDURE'

4.  Press F1 Accept

5.  The next screen that comes up is EOD PARAMETERS.  This screen will show 'LAST END OF DAY DATE'.
This is the last successful EOD.

6.  Press F5 Prev EOD (to see the last End of Month or End of Year)"

Title: REBATE - Coupon Books
Description: CP737 When will the tire rebate coupon books be shipped?
Solution: Goodyear usually sends out the rebate coupon books in January.  Store location can call in and get voice approval from Goodyear by dialing 1-800-822-7732 (Voice Response Unit) with the customers SS#.  If tires are needed by NEW employees prior to receiving coupon book, store/dealer or employee must call Tire Rebate dept 1-800-356-4484 to get new coupon number until their coupon book is recd (usually 6 - 8 weeks after hire).

Title: Issue credit cash POS invoice &issue a quick check
Description: CP741 Reverse customer billing cash POS invoice and issue the customer a quick check
Solution:
First cancel the cash invoice for this customer by issuing a credit memo on POS reversing the original invoice,
Then issue a quick check for the amout of the credit memo and use code 50800.
The reason for this is as follows:  the end of day will be over the amout of the credit memo because the dealer is not giving them the cash out of the drawer,  the dealer must accept this overage on his end of day. This creates an accounting entry debiting cash (10000) for the overage and crediting over and short (50800).  When the quick check is issued and the dealer uses 50800 the quick check debits the 50800 account and credits 10000 cash canceling the entry created by the end of day overage.  I suggest that the dealer reference his end of day with the credit memo number and the quick check number so he has an audit trail as to what he did.

Title: Order Tires from another Warehouse
Description: CP748 Need to order tires from a warehouse other than my Primary Warehouse.
Solution: You cannot change the primary warehouse in Tire-HQ.  User needs to contact Infolink @ 1.800.755.2772 to get the tires from another warehouse.

Title: Delete Tires from Tire Dolly
Description: CP752 How do I delete item from the Tire Dolly without clearing the entire Tire Dolly?
Solution: Enter a zero (0) in the quantity field

Title: REBATE - Phone Number
Description: CP761 What is phone number for rebate dept?

"Akron rebate number is 800-356-4484.
Canada rebate handler - ADCHECK 905-940-0556 (or Lucy Gore at 905-940-0556)"

Title: Clear Entry on Manual Entry Form
Description: CP762 How do I clear a code from a manual entry box but not the entire manual entry form?
Solution:
"Highlight the field to be deleted by dragging over it with mouse and press delete
or
Go to the end of the line and press back space until everything is erased."

Title: DLRS: ACT HRS ESCAPE
Description: CP783 Dealers EOD is requiring Actual Hours Print.  Dealer does not use Actual hours, just wants to complete EOD.
Solution:
"The following is the escape route so that dealers can finalize B50's without finalizing hours:

1. Check Prof to ensure option not set up (can do so by VNC to term user is currently using).  If so, instruct user to make appropriate changes to turn off hours.

2. Next, go to SMENU, opt. 2 (plus)

3. Type:  update loccntl set lcsundy = '999999'; (enter)
You should see msg ""1 row updated""

5. Type: exit (enter)

6. SMENU, Opt. 1 (exit)

7. Advise user to run EOD now.

8. Make a note in work history as to steps followed to resolve (if all steps followed, type ""ALL STEPS FOLLOWED"" and whether or not user okay).  Forward to Support 2 for review."

Title: FREON price correction
Description: CP786 How to change from one price  to another , when freon prices change.
Solution:
"Have the location pull all freon off of invoices/DR's, paid outs and Vendor Payables.
01. Print the parts Aid for MFC = .FR (from POS) F9
02. Type PROM from the MMenu
03. Type 1 (List Pending Receipts) press enter
04. Press F9 (List Line Detail)
05. Type AAAD (vendor # 7XXX)
06. Press F9 (Line Detail)
07. Type CORRECTION (in SHIP #), press enter
08. Tab to ""QTY""
09. Type the negative qty , press tab
10. Type .FR (in MFC field), press tab
11. Type in the part # needing to change,(per Parts Aid Print), press enter (to display the line)
12. Type the positive qty , press tab
13. Type .FR (in MFC), press tab
14. Type in the part # needing to change,(per Parts Aid Print),
15. Tab to PGROUP
16. Type FREON , press tab twice
17. Type new list price, press tab
18. Type new cost, press enter
This will display a second line, reposting stock at correct cost/price.
19. Press F6 (FINAL), press enter
20. Type P (PRINT/FINAL), press enter
[end]"

Title: DMS A/R Journal Ticket
Description: CP795 Dealer needs to get account 10100 on G/L to match end of month balance on GBMS system (sub ledger.)
Solution: Dealer must FAX manual Jt to DAS Accounting Dr or Cr G/L account 10100, offsetting the account of his choice.  The journal will be entered in Akron (not in the store machine.)

Title: D/R Customer History
Description: CP805 D/R Customer History: How do I pull it?
Solution:
"01. Option 5 on Main Menu = Administration (ADM).
02. Option 7 on Admin Menu = DR Administration (DRADM).
03. Option 4 on DR Administration Menu = D/R Customer History (DRCH).
04. Option 1 Bill-to Search OR Option 2 Ship-to Search.
05. Type Name of Customer or beginning alpha character, Enter. (If you use alpha character, place cursor next to line and press enter).
06. Press function key for desired history."

Title: Needs copy of K docs.
Description: CP806 Needs copies of "K" documents FAXed to the store for verification with Goodyear statement.
Solution:
"Advised store to contact Goodyear Credit Dept. Rep.

Call WOC 888-727-5249 press option 3 for copies of
invoices"

Title: Manifest missing vendors
Description: CP812 Manifest missing vendors
Solution: THERE ARE NO RESTRICTIONS AS TO HOW MANY VENDORS YOU CAN HAVE IN PENDING.  THE FINALIZATION PROCESS THAT BUILDS THE VPAY MFST IS LIMITED TO 100 VENDOR BILLS PER MANIFEST. THIS IS DUE TO HOST INTERFACE LIMITATIONS.  IF YOU HAVE 120 PENDING VENDORS THE FINAL MFST WOULD HAVE TO BE DONE IN TWO WAVES.  THE FIRST MFST WOULD HAVE 100 VENDORS AND THE SECOND MFST WOULD HAVE THE REMAINING 20 VENDORS.

Title: Dealer Locator Website
Description: CP817 have my own website through Goodyear (dealer locator or RV dealer locator) and need to make a change to the page.  Who can I contact?
Solution:
"As of 9/17/03, per Mary Schoeler:
Dealer is to contact their consumer account manager (CAM). If user does not know the phone number, they can find it under ""Region News"" in Tire-HQ."

Title: Sign Up for Dealer Website
Description: CP818 I would like to sign up for my own website to be linked through www.goodyear.com.
Solution:
"Geckobyte: Goodyear Website Program  1-866-400-8106
Goodyear contacts are Kevin Choo, Renee Radabaugh and Pam Cole."

Title: Returned Checks
Description: CP827 Dealer receives customer's returned check from bank for insufficient funds.
Solution:
"1)  If an A/R customer, issue A/R Jt debiting customer's account and crediting cash (10000.)  Issue a cash receipt against the A/R account when the customer pays off the check.
2)  Or the store may establish a single A/R account for All Returned Checks, no matter whether a CASH or A/R customer.  (process same as #1.))
3)  Create a sub account under accounting code 107 (example 10701 Returned Checks.)  In this case, the store can issue a Std Jt cr cash 10000 and debit 10701.  When the customer pays off the check with cash, process negative Paid Out and code the credit to 10701."

Title: Print DPF codes that show GOODYEAR related code
Description: CP828 How do we print a list of all DPF codes that show the related GOODYEAR codes?
Solution:
"1.From Main Menu select option for Product Administration.(PRADM)
2.From Product Administration select option for Dealer Product File. (DPF)
3.Press F5 PRINT from the Dealer Product Code Inquiry screen.
4.Press Enter from the Dealer Product Code Print screen."

Title: Needs copy of daily or monthly reports
Description: CP838 They need copy of daily or monthly report
Solution: Go to Express Reports (AKSARCRD)and make copys of daily reports needed.  The daily reports are S & E, Sales and Gross Profit, Employee Score Card, Misc Debit Credit reports.  Either fax or mail to the dealer.

Title: Pilot Codes
Description: CP839 Needs to have Pilot Codes faxed to dealer location.
Solution: Faxed copy of Pilot Codes to FAX number provided by customer.

Title: Misc Debits/Credits
Description: CP847 Needs explanation of Misc Dr/Cr Detail report.
Solution: This detail support the Misc Dr/Cr line on the Sales & Expense Analysis, is printed each time entries are generated for that line.  The report includes all 300/400 Sales/Cost-of-Sales codes that are not generated by a store invoice, excluding General Ledger codes (344xx, 446xx, 448xx). This would include any other document (Jt, Paid Out, Quick Check, Payable Input, book inventory corrections, or most commonly "K" document gross profit credit on national account service deliveries) other than store sales invoices.  This is done to preserve the actual gross profit on store sales.

The address is:
SmarTire,USA
566C White Pond dr
PO Box 309
Akron,OH 44320

Reference RSI letter # 98-27a for part#`s, mfc`s info. and service code for billing."

Title: Condition Codes
Description: CP898 ROM cc 1 vs DAS Stock ledger cc 0.
Solution: Issue "book only" inventory correction, taking tires out of condition code "0" and re-entering under condition code "1" at the desired each cost right after printing the ROM.
